When a player puts one of his pieces on an opponent’s piece, he has to play again.
The game is over when one of the players has no more pieces, or when it is not possible to place piece any more.
The player who has most pieces on the top of the axes (piles) is the winner.

name: Alsace (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Alsace.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Sabel
description:
SABEL, a adventure game

Became a hero, fight soldiers and wolfs. Enter to the castle and find the the book that will help on your destiny. Fight the boss and then escape before everything blow up.

This is a role and dice game. Each time that you fight an enemy, you can pick a card to get a power or the key to enter to the castle.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: World of Motor Racing: The British Touring Car Championship
description:
A module for Lambourne's "World of Motor Racing".

This statistical replay game recreates the British Touring Car Championship. It uses the same basic rules as the base game, but adds specific rules unique to touring car races.

As in the basic game, everything you do is handled by a roll of two dice and different tables for each driver, car and track section. The outcome of this roll and a number of modifiers tell you how many spaces you are allowed to move.

name: SingStar: Das Brettspiel
description:
SingStar: Das Brettspiel is an adaptation of the SingStar video game series, in which players sing existing songs and are scored based on how well they do.

Experience real SingStar fun, without electronics! Players simply sing the songs that come to mind. The only requirement: the song must contain predetermined words. No problem with "love", but what about "green" or "train"? Whether duet or duel, whether pop or punk: the path from starlet to SingStar is guaranteed to be a lot of fun!

Contents: 76 song cards, 24 jury cards, 4 overview cards, 1 variable game board, 4 play figures with stands, 1 play microphones, 1 hourglass
categories: Music, Party Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Strike Legion: Combined Arms Combat – Main Rulebook
description:
Strike Legion is a SciFi tabletop miniatures game dedicated to ground combat in the near and far future. The game uses a unique Electronic Warfare system that allows players to alter their units' attack and defense ratings each game turn.

The main rulebook is divided into Basic, Advanced, and optional rules, and teaches the rules through the use of 'programmed instruction' scenarios, wherein players learn to apply new rules through playing these scenarios.

A section dedicated to creating units is included, allowing players to create any troop or vehicle types form their favorite science fiction or alternate history backgrounds.

Combat is scaled at 1 piece = 1 tank, flier, gun, or infantry team; 1" on the tabletop = 250 meters. Miniatures from any manufacturer can be used, and the game is supporteed by dozens of army lists available for free download from the publisher's website.

Recommended miniatures scales range from 6mm to 15mm; the game can be played with smaller (2-3mm) scales, but is not recommended for figures larger than 15mm.

Rules and support for solitaire play are included in the Strike Legion: Skunk Works rules module.
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Aberrant Apothecary
description:
The Aberrant Apothecary is a quick party-style card game focusing on set collection and bartering, using real world items from the room around you as resources. Play the role of an alchemist bartering over ingredients as you try to concoct the strongest potion.

3 Potions are placed on the table, common goal cards for all players. Each turn ingredients are flipped, simply point to indicate which you want to draft. If there are no disputes, you get the card, if there are disputes you must barter over it.

Bartering combines the cost on the card (small, large, near or far) with any descriptive word the current shopkeeper chooses (eg. "hairy"). All players involved call out objects back and forth, each with 5 seconds to visually locate an item in the room that matches the criteria, last one standing wins the disputed card.

Complete the game by linking up your ingredients in an unbroken chain, following all tubes that connect left and right across the cards. Choose one of the three potions, then score points for matching colours, matching shapes and the best alchemical process.

name: La Boîte à énigmes junior
description:
Junior version with fantasy theme

Players or teams compete in puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Trivia

name: Footprints
description: By answering environmental questions players move through a spiral of environmental challenges towards the centre of the board causing as little damage to the environment as possible. The player who causes the least damage wins the game.

name: Ablaze!: Feel the Heat!
description:
Set Up: Each player starts the game with a lake tile.

Gameplay: One your turn, before you draw a tile, you can place your lake tile over any number on an unmanned hex tile to heat up or cool down an area. This can cause the hot spot to shift. Once your lake tile is placed it cannot be removed.

name: Talia Demo 51. Stanu
description:
A free promotional demonstration version of 51st State. This mini-version is distributed free in Poland.

The world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States have collapsed. And now, thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control over the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new State: the 51st State.

In standard 51st State there are 110 cards and many tokens. In this free demo version, there are only 40 cards. The game is playable for two players and presents the mechanics of the full version.

In this version players control one of the two powers (New York or Mutants Union) and try to build their very own new country. Players put new locations into the game, they hire leaders, and send people to work in buildings to gain resources and new skills.

Every card can be put into play in three different ways. You can invade a location to gain many resources once, or you can sign a contract with this location to gain one resource every turn, or you can attach the location to your State so you can use its skill. One card, three possibilities. Lots of decisions and choices that matter.

Talia Demo 51. Stanu debuted in issue 25 of the Polish boardgame magazine Świat Gier Planszowych.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: ego²
description:
The board game ego² is all about the ego of the players: their preferences, opinions and interests — and as one of the players you want to do the best job you can deciphering the ego of others.

Each player starts with ten chips, and the bank has ten chips, too. Each round, a player reads a question listed on the card as well as the three possible answers. He secretly selects one of them, then the other players simultaneous try to guess it, betting 1-2 chips on their guess. If they answer correctly, they double their bet; otherwise they lose the chips. When the bank runs out of chips, the game ends and whoever has the most chips wins.

A sequel to ego and a standalone game, ego² contains 480 new questions.

name: Challenge Sudoku / Kakuro Challenge
description:
Challenge Sudoku and Kakuro Challenge in one box.

Sudoku is a game of placing numbers in a grid so that each number appears only once in each row or column. Challenge Sudoku offers three different ways to play: Standard, Challenge and Solitaire Sudoku.

In Kakuro Challenge, 2-4 players make rows on a board, on which they try to place their numbers in a way that the sum of those numbers is the same as a predetermined number.

name: 10 by 10
description:
10 by 10 is a 2-player game. They alternate by placing a numbered chip (from 1 to 4) on the board which is a 5x5 grid. If a player can create a row with a total of 10, he captures the chips of that row. The first player to capture 10 chips is the winner.

The board and rules were published March 14th 2014 in the newspaper "9 NOU". Readers had to supply their own chips.


De 10 en 10 es un juego de 2 jugadores, los cuales van alternando el turno colocando una ficha numerada (de 1 a 4) en el tablero. Si un jugador puede crear una línea que sume 10, captura las fichas de esa línea. El primer jugador que consiga 10 fichas es el ganador.

Publicado el 14 de marzo del 2014 en el periódico "9 NOU".


De 10 en 10 és un joc de 2 jugadors, els quals van alternant el torn col·locant una fitxa numerada (de 1 a 4) en el taulell. Si un jugador pot crear una línia que sumi 10, captura les fitxes d'aquesta línia. El primer jugador que consegueixi 10 fitxes és el guanyador.

Publicat el 14 de març del 2014 en el diari "9 NOU".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Philippines Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Philippine Insurrection (1899-1902)
description:
BACKGROUND: Philippines Ablaze is semi-historical simulation of the United States war in the Philippines to put down the insurrection of General Aguinaldo. The Game begins shortly after the Insurrectionist Leader, General Emilio Aguinaldo, declares independence from the United States controlled government of the Philippines.

OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the United States Forces in the Philippines. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to capture four of the five Key Insurrecto Controlled Settlements (San Fernando, Tuao, San Jose, Puerto Galera, Cagayan) before the last Campaign Card is played, the Insurrectionists Win.

GAME FEATURES: The game features a fun and simplistic method for resolving solitaire combat tactically, rules for Heroes that can make an impact on the outcome of battles, and lots of colorful game counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Autumn Leaves
description:
Autumn Leaves is a type of Solitaire: a single player card game. It is easy to learn and very satisfying to play. Take one deck, shuffle, then deal out 22 cards[.]

The aim of the game is to sort out the four suits and get them each into order. There are only six rules that you need to know [...]:

Rule 1: You can move any card from the top of one pile onto the top of another pile if the suits match and the card being moved is of a lower number (Aces are low).

Rule 2: When there are no more face-up cards on a pile, turn the topmost face-down card face-up.

Rule 3: Any card can be placed in an empty pile.

Rule 4: A descending run of cards in the same suit can be moved as a block.

Rule 5: At any time you may deal out the next 6 of the left-over cards:
one onto each pile.

Rule 6: The game is won if each of the four suits is gathered together into a run from King down to Ace. If such a position cannot be reached, then the game is lost.

"Finally, you may wonder why the game is called Autumn Leaves. It is because of the way that the cards flutter back and forth between the piles during play. For me, this adds a sense of peace to the game. I find it strategically and tactically interesting, and yet at the same time I find it rather peaceful and meditative. I hope you do too."

name: Moscow to Paris: Essen & Happy Train promo cards
description:
The Essen card adds the city of Essen. The card features Zollverein (yeah, it is THAT massive alien building you can see in Essen!)

The Happy Train adds a wildcard wagon - it can be played in place of any color.

name: Archchess
description:
This early Chess variant was proposed by Italian Chess scholar Francesco Piacenza in his book I Campeggiamenti negli Scacchi as Arciscacchiere, and then given its English name Archchess by John Gollon in an unpublished book on Chess variants.

The game is played on a board of 10x10 squares. In addition to the usual Chess pieces and two more pawns, each player also has one centurion, starting in the fourth column, and one decurion, starting in the seventh. The centurion jumps to any square two squares distant, either in a straight line or changing direction like a knight. The decurion moves a single square in any diagonal direction, like the fers of Shatranj.

The options and restrictions regarding promotion, castling and en passant are slightly different from regular Chess and/or slightly ambiguous. For instance, pawns are promoted when reaching the last row and always promote to queens.

name: Relic Knights: Star Nebula Corsairs Battle Box
description:
The chaos and anarchy caused by the Darkspace Calamity has created the perfect environment for piracy. Yet as the Star Nebula Corsairs plunder and grow wealthy off of the fleeing refugees, even they cannot help but wonder if the Calamity is boon or bane. Captain Harker has made it his life's work to discover the cause of the calamity, but when he discovers it will it be to stop it or merely to profit?

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Achtung! Cthulhu: The Secret War
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Europe is ablaze with the final conflicts of World War Two. As the Allies are caught unaware by a German assault in the misty Ardennes forests, the Black Sun unleashes mythos evil from ancient sites, hoping to overwhelm the Allies forces, whilst the Nachtwolfe attempt to power up a vast war machine that will bring about a thousand-year Reich. All the while the dreams of Cthulhu inspire cultists to rise up in preparation for his return!

As the heroes of Section M and Majestic in Achtung! Cthulhu: The Secret War, you must race across Europe on vital missions facing ancient terrors, recovering strange artifacts, and learning unspeakable knowledge to help defeat the forces of the Third Reich and the Cultists of the Old Gods. To aid the heroes' desperate endeavors, the players must learn to command the powerful but over-extended Allied forces to help halt the tide of evil!

name: Dream Cakes
description:
From the publisher:

From sprinkles and swirls to ribbons and roses, there’s something for everyone in this super-sweet bakery-inspired game – winning is just the icing on the cake! Players work on multiple cakes at a time – spinning the wheel to determine their pieces, stacking luscious layers and toppers to complete their cakes, and judging finished creations for points. With thousands of possible designs, the game is deliciously different every time you play!

How to Play:
1. Players take turns spinning the wheel to determine the number and type of pieces they may pick from the pile.
2. After each turn, players place the pieces they can on one of many cakes they are creating, following the specific order outlined on the package.
3. Upon completion of a cake, players use the measuring stick to determine how many ribbon cards their cakes have earned.
4. Play continues until all ribbon cards have been distributed. The player with the most cards wins!

name: Kinga
description:
Kinga is a solitaire game of patience meets deck building, set in a medieval or renaissance fantasy world. You need only a standard 54-card deck of playing cards to play.

You play the role of the Usurper, a cunning and skillful silver-tongued devil attempting to wrest control from the four kings of the countryside. You do this by climbing the social ladder in each of the four kingdoms, but beware... too many missteps and your machinations will become all too evident, and then it's off with your head!

Playing a game of Kinga involves taking turns purchasing cards from the center tableaux (sort of a reverse-tableau building mechanic), in order to reveal the kings at the bottom of the stacks, or exiling cards from your hand. The game is won if you reveal all four kings -- however, if you are unable to purchase or exile a card on your turn, you must turn one of the kings sideways, raising suspicion of your plan. If all four kings are turned sideways and you need to raise suspicion again, the kings have caught on to your game, and have ordered your execution!

Kinga contains a novel chaining mechanic for purchasing cards -- You first play a 'base' card that determines your value, then any number of other cards from your hand that match either the value or the suit of the previously played card. Each card beyond the first adds 1 to the total value of your currency, and the suits used determine the cards you may purchase. Playing 3 of a kind in a chain lets you draw 1 additional card immediately, and playing all four suits in a chain allows you to draw 2 additional cards immediately.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Song-Froggy
description:
Get a lil' hillbilly on the lily! Draw tiles to make Froggy bands!

Howdy, Y'all. M'buddy SeaBass calls me “Song-Froggy”, and so can you's all, if'n ya like. I'm wit ya today to do some splainin' on dis here game ya got yer eyeballs on. Now, you're gonna need some scratch paper and a crayon to keep score, just so's ya know. The whole durn point of the game is to get you the most points, and the simplest of folks ought to be able earn at least some, jes' needs a little learnin' is all. What ya gotta do is get you some frogs, what might have the best sound together. Once you done that, you set them up as a band, and now nobody can be a copy-cat and go makin' a band wit dat same sound. It ain't hard, and I'm gunna be here every step to walk ya through it.

Now, ya got two choices every time it's your turn; y'all can pick up a frog and maybe get you some points, or ya can set you up a band and get ye couple more points. The rulebook's the place to get filled in on the par-tic-u-lars, but we ain't in the rulebook right now, is we? (Y'all can go ahead and download dem right now.)

So some of these froggies is 'specially talented, and don't need no backup in they band. You just give'm a washboard or a gutbucket, and they'll be bustin' out a tune in no time. Most frogs, though, they got specific idears on who it is they wanna play with. They'll tell ya, easy enough, just by checkin' out the background on the picture. W'chever frog you choose to lead your band, he's the one you need to mind on that. Check out dem der Action Shots for a peek at what ya got comin' to ya here.

Game's simple enough, folks, but ya can get still get to strategizin' if'n you put yer mind to it. Uncle Cletus might ought like it on account of it being so simple, and ya know you mama gonna like it, cuz all dem cute lil' froggies. I 'spect you'll be pickin' dis'n up fore too long.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Button Bashers Turbo
description:
Choose your Character...Ready...FIGHT!

Button Bashers Turbo is a 2-6 player, fast-paced, tabletop dueling card game modeled after popular arcade style fighting games.

Players choose from 2 of 12 possible characters, each with a personalized list of attacks to help you pummel your opponent into the ground! Be the first to reduce your opponents life-points from 20 to 0 to win the game!

Button Bashers Turbo features multiple modes of play, including Versus Mode (1v1),Tag Team Mode (2v2, 3v3), FFA (Free for All), and Possibly Boss Mode (all versus one).

With easy to learn combos, stylized strategic gameplay, and a little luck of the cards, you will send your friends running to the change machine.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Piñata party: Essen promo
description:
Gift promotion for the Piñata party.
Additional moving mechanism card to the base game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: 神道 (Shintoh)
description: In 神道 (Shintoh), players are Shinto priests who participate in auctions.

name: Fly Away Jack & Jill
description:
EQUIPMENT: a 48-card deck consisting of four suits: Fly Away Jill, Fly Away Jack, Come Back Jill, Come Back Jack. Each contains 12 cards ranked (lowest to highest) 1-9 plus A, B, C.

SET UP: shuffle the cards and deal evenly to all players. Person to left of dealer goes first.

PLAY: The first player lays down a card and the other players must follow suit-the highest card played (of the leading suit) wins the 'trick' (all played cards) and leads the next card. When all cards have been played scores are tallied. ONLY Fly Away Jacks are counted.

GOAL: To be the person with the LOWEST score after three rounds-meaning, having taken the FEWEST Fly Away Jacks.

name: Pixel Tactics: Princess / Princess Annette
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card.

Card text: Draw a card at the start of each of your Turns. At the end of each Turn after Ceasfire, discard until you have one card in Hand. The first time you Recruit, play an Order, place a Trap, or play an Operation each Turn is a Free Action.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: You're Fired: Bonus Pack
description: 5 Kickstarter stretch goal cards for You're Fired!. Includes 2 alternate Bosses, 2 additional Consultants, and a very special Company President card that comes in and fires everyone in sight.

name: Monicipio, todo por el Poder
description:
A ruthless struggle for power in a small Spanish village. Accusations will fly as knives, impossible projects will come true and the sickening stench of corruption will be clearly noticed. The meanest face of politics in a card game for three to six players. A self-published free print and play game.

The goal of this game is prevail in the struggle for power in a small village. The winner will be the one who win the mayoralty in two elections.

The village is represented by seven scene's cards, different in every match. They represent activities and places that give votes to players. Sometimes, they will have the chance of change them by their own projects for strenghten their own voting base and weaken his opponents at the same time. When it happens, players must negotiate which of the scene cards will be substituted by the new project. If necessary, they vote if each project is accepted or rejected.

Players take cards of a deck and use them by turns for attacking, defend themselves and take new votes and cards. If they obtain the Opportunity card they will have the chance to execute one of their projects. If they have (and decide to use) the Temptation card, they will choose one of the corruption cards, which purpose is to buy votes or councilors.

After the third round, it's time to elections. Players count their votes and assign to each one the members of the town hall. If a player is elected for second time, wins the match.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Voting

name: Sea Turtle Scurry
description:
Your egg cracks, and you emerge into the world, sniffing the air. Around you are your brothers and sisters, catching their bearings and, after a pause, rushing headlong after the leading baby turtle! You'll need to hurry to not get left behind!

In Sea Turtle Scurry, you are a baby turtle scurrying towards the ocean. Manage your hand, lay tiles, and try to end up in the ocean with the most Scurry left over. You can even use the other turtles to hitch a ride!

Now on Kickstarter!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/thisandthatgames/sea-tu...
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Epic Roll: Veteran Pack
description:
Introduces Veteran game rules and Hero Cards to Epic Roll. Consists of Veteran Rulebook and three Hero Cards (Dara, Greff, and Orric).

Each Hero gains a unique Passive Ability and an Activated Ability which can be used during opponents' turns. Each player's maximum hand size is increased to three cards, and defeating the toughest monsters (Skeleton and Banshee) reward players with an additional treasure card. Players also gain the ability to play treasure cards in pairs to achieve 'Focused Effects'.

Packs are included with game purchases, and available for free at shows/events. The components are also available for download from EpicRoll.com

name: The World at War: Europe
description:
The World at War: Europe covers WWII in the European theatre.
The game works for 1 to 3 players. Each game turn takes around three months of real time.

The players doesn't move counters over the map, but they move wooden cubes. The only one counters present in the game are the air fleets, fortifications and other markers used to manage countries resources, research, diplomacy, factories, convoys or certain actions in the game.

The game is a medium complexity game covering much of the interesting aspects of this campaign. The game map is divided in areas and sea zones. Most of the countries can enter in play, except Sweden and Switzerland. There are major powers (Germany, Italy, USSR, USA, UK and France) and minor powers.

Most of the game mechanics are centered on actions. Many game mechanics are solved with d3 dice. The number of actions that a major power has represent it's capability to perform operations or investment in technological advances or industrial improvements.

Other aspects in the game are important like the hidden Diplomacy which adds a lot of strategical options to players and adds lot of replayability.

The rules are short and easy to learn.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Das Katastrophenspiel
description:
Das Katastrophenspiel is a quick card game for 2 to 5 players.

In Das Katastrophenspiel players are taking up the roles of heroic helpers of an unspecified European disaster relief organization. The objective is to provide world-wide aid, but only one group within the organization can attain the highest decoration. Who saves mankind?
Source: Publisher's website

The players have a start team, with people and equipment; using the abilities for the team the players travels to one a catastrophe in the world and manage them; these could be fires, earthquakes, refugees, droughts, floods, and more.
The players gain money for a successful mission, which can be used to buy better equipment or team members. The harder the mission is the more money and/or Victory Points the player gets.

Most VP after eight rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Cards Against Humanity: Please do not buy this product.
description:
A 69” box called the Please do not buy this product box. It costs $100 and you actually shouldn’t buy it.

69 inches long.
No returns.

Includes 1 card ("The even biggest, blackester d**k").
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Monster Wanted!
description: Two monsters have escaped from the monster party! Let's go searching for them in Monster Wanted! If you can remember who vanished and who's still at the party, you could win the game.

name: Ninja All-Stars: Jorogumo
description:
Jorogumo is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

A horror, a cautionary tale, and a powerful opponent, the spider women called Jorogumo are useful, if questionable, allies. They descend from a witch of Kagejima that rescued the unwary or unfortunate from drowning in lakes and rivers. Claiming to rehabilitate them, she actually slowly poisoned and paralyzed them for use in dark and terrible spells. As her magics grew too much, Kagejima itself cursed her with a shape that evoked her horrid nature. This terrible judgment carried to her offspring who came to bear her form and her name. None trust the Joromugo, but a few unscrupulous warriors will employ them for their speed, strength, and enticing song.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Speedy, Spidery Mercenary Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Backyard Builders Treehouse: Achievement Expansion
description:
5 additional Achievement cards for Crash Games version of Backyard Builders Treehouse.

Selfish
Generous
Hark What Light
Rule of Plum
Best Ever

name: Rocca Monster
description:
A snowbound small village. It quietly approaches and sneaks into the innermost part of a villager's heart. When the night has come and everyone else is sleeping, it quietly wakes up. The brutal murderer wanders around the village and preys on honest villagers. Who is the heinous monster?

Rocca Monster is a hidden role/social deduction game for 3-6 players. Each player is dealt three villagers which are placed on the table in front of them. One of the villagers in the game is secretly the monster. All players close their eyes and count to ten, during which time the player with the monster card places a six sided die on a villager of their choice. After the count is finished all players open their eyes and see who was attacked in the night. That player rolls the die, and on a roll of 1-4, the villager on whom the die was placed is killed. On a roll of 5 or 6, the villager survives the attack. After the murder (or attempted murder) the players discuss who they think the monster is, and then use their voting cards to vote for which villager they want to accuse of being the monster. Once a single villager has the majority of votes their card is turned over and it is revealed whether they were the monster or not. If they were the monster then the other players win! If they were not the monster then their card is removed from the game and play continues. Another night attack occurs, followed by another round of discussion and voting. This cycle continues until either the monster successfully kills half the villagers (at which point the monster player wins the game), or until the players successfully identify the monster (at which point the monster player loses and everyone else wins).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: DEFCON 1: Cuban Missile Crisis 1962
description:
Description from the designer:

The time is October 1962. The players, representing Kennedy , Khrushchev, and Castro, must try to survive each of the 5 Rounds of the Cuban Missile Crisis while gaining more prestige than your opponents. The game consists of three phases in each of the five Rounds: Decision Phase, Conflict Phase, and Resolution Phase. The US and Soviet players will use “brinkmanship” as they commit resources during the Decision Phase, in which they try to gain an advantage without resulting in a confrontation (referred to in the rules as a Deadlock or Stalemate). During the Conflict Phase, there is a danger that DEFCON 1 might be reached which means imminent nuclear war in which all sides will lose prestige (victory points). Only if the contestants can work their way successfully through the Conflict phase, without triggering a nuclear war, will they score victory points (prestige) in the Round.

During each Round, each player is required to make one major decision. Then, through the use of tactical cards, the Kennedy and Khrushchev players may make a few further crucial decisions to best implement their chosen strategy for the Round. ANY of these Decisions have the capacity to trigger the disaster of Nuclear War, which results in the loss of prestige or victory points (not to mention human life). Be careful! Who is willing to push the envelope to the brink of disaster in an effort to emerge from the crisis as the world’s dominant power?
Decision Phase:

Each player secretly decides what their “bid” will be by choosing any number of their cubes.
When the bids are revealed, the player with the most bid cubes, in this pool, is declared the “initial bid winner", which will increase his chances of ultimate victory in the Round, but also increase the chances of nuclear war if his bid is greatly higher than his opponent. So each side must push the envelope, but must be restrained as well, so as not to trigger global nuclear war.
If the bids are the same amount, the Round immediately ends with neither side gaining any prestige.


Conflict Phase:

If the players survive the Decision phase they will enter the Conflict phase, where their bids will be resolved to see how much each side earns in prestige (victory points) During this phase Tactic cards can be played in order to better position themselves in determining the outcome of the conflict. It is also during this phase that there is a greater chance of pushing your opponent into a "DEFCON 1" mode which will automatically result in the loss of most of the accumulated victory points from the previous Rounds, and may end the game in full nuclear war, where everyone loses!


The tactics cards represent actual historical events of the period. This micro-game is designed to accurately reflect a brief history of the Cuban Missile Crisis. The entire game can be played within 15 to 20 minutes.
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Schinderhannes: Der Strafprozess
description: Schinderhannes: Der Strafprozess, the third expansion for Schinderhannes, consists of 24 wooden tokens in four colors, one set of Schinderhannes playing cards, a note pad, and rules.

name: Prinzessin Mix-Max
description:
In Prinzessin Mix-Max, the four princesses want to have a birthday party. They have arranged to meet in the castle garden for a picnic, but somehow things have gotten mixed up. Before the celebration can begin, Charlie the little dog needs to search in the garden for the princesses and everything they need for their party. Who will be able to put together the nine pieces of a complete princess puzzle first?


roll the die
move Charlie
collect pieces for your princess puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Get the MacGuffin: Fist Bump
description:
Promotional Action card originally handed out as individual cards with no packaging on Table Top Day 2018.

Text says:
"Fist bump another player when you play this."
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Flash Word
description:
Flash Word consists of a deck of double-sided cards. One side of the cards show a number from 2 to 7, the other side shows a Japanese hiragana character.

There are several modes of play. All of them require the players to find words quickly in order to earn points.

In one mode, the deck is shuffled and placed in the middle of the table. Then, one player flips the top card and places it besides the deck. All players then try to find a word starting with the character just revealed containing exactly the number of characters indicated by the card on the top of the deck. The first player to say a correct word takes the character card as a point and another card is flipped until there is only one card left in the deck.

At the end, whoever collected the most points wins the game.

name: Army of Darkness: The Board Game
description:
Army of Darkness: The Board Game is a co-operative game for 1 to 4 players that can be played in 60 to 90 minutes. In this action-assignment area-control game, you play as Ash and his allies, and work together to fight off swarms of Deadites commanded by Evil Ash and Evil Shiela. Upgrade your defenses with modern technology from the trunk of Ash's car, and stop the Deadites from overtaking the castle. Each turn, players have a limited time to simultaneously play move, attack, action, and special cards in order to defend the various sections of the castle. After time is up, resolve your chosen cards and play out your programmed actions, rolling dice to attack Deadites. Survive long enough to use the necronomicon to save Shiela, and take down Evil Ash to win the game!

—description from publisher
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Masada: Epic Last Stand in the Desert
description:
Masada: Epic Last Stand in the Desert is a simple solitaire simulation covering the historic siege of Masada by the Romans in 73 A.D. Its purpose is to show the dynamics and characteristics of the original siege, allowing one to see events unfold in a realistic manner, and thus, understand them better. The game system replicates the siege with the gamer watching events unfold toward resolution as the giant Roman ramp grows ever closer to the fortress plateau...and destiny.

GAME PLAY
Masada is a game on the epic siege of Masada in 73 A.D. You as the Roman are trying to win as timely as possible. The game system replays the siege. The sequence of play is simple as it has an events phase and an action phase. Both these phases involve rolling dice to see what the Roman accomplished or how game events up to that point impact the turns die rolls.

In the Action Phase, the Roman is hoping that they get to place a ramp. Placing a ramp means the X Legion is getting closer to the plateau where they can assault the redoubt. What can also happen is the result ends up with you rolling on the Defenders Response Table. It's a series of simple calculations - add together the current Supply Index and the sum of 2 dice, comparing it to the current number of ramps placed. If the Defenders total is higher the result is simply no effect. HOWEVER if it is lower - urk...roll another die and compare that to the current Defender's morale Index to get your results.Upon conclusion of the action phase, you end that turn.

It is interesting to note there is no turn limit in the game as historically the Romans were committed to destroying this last resistance. Upon placing the 16th Ramp, the siege ramp is now completed and combat now happens.

First though you roll to see if the defenders commit mass suicide (the historic result) or if there is a fight to the death. The combat phase can last up to 19 combat rounds. Each Roman roll of 6 eliminates a defender, and Romans roll first. There is no simultaneous combat where each side gets a chance to roll before results are implemented.

The system neatly handles the increasing Roman legionnaire presence on the plateau as each turn the Roman combat value increases by one to a maximum of 19. This means the Roman would roll 19 combat rolls for the final combat round. The surviving defenders roll with each die roll of 6 moves the Combat rounds forward. Each 6 combat rounds the defenders survive results in the Roman Victory Points being lowered by 1.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wizards of Roygbiv
description:
Roygbiv is a tavern at the end of the rainbow. As it is hard to reach, only wizards generally gather there. Whenever there is a dispute among wizards, there is - of course - only one way to resolve this: a magical fight to the death.

Team up with friends (or don't) and cast spells at each other until the first offending wizard has perished. Choose from 7 archetypes with each 12 unique and themed spells. Build your initial deck, and pick up new spells to stop enemy strategies or expand on your own, as you play.

Cast magic missiles, boost your allies' spells and suppress those of your opponents. Summon lightning totems, goats or obese wisps. Swamp your foes in dark magic or drain them from their life force. Gain spell power to increase your strength, or cower behind a barrier.

Start the game by choosing a wizard (this gives you a unique ability, and choice from a specific set of cards at the start). Then, pick your spell cards to assemble your deck. Take turns to gain mana, cast spells (paying that mana) and pick up new spells (unrestricted) to add to your deck. The first wizard to remove the last white "life" mana from another wizard's pool (effectively killing them), is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Savanimo
description:
How can you keep from going crazy when you have to either catch the animal that's represented or the one that isn't?? A game of deduction and speed for the very young.
—description from the publisher

Comment ne pas perdre la tête quand il faut, soit attraper l'animal représenté, soit celui qui ne l'est pas ? Un jeu de déduction et de rapidité pour les plus jeunes.
—description from the publisher (French)

name: Grecia, Imperios del Pasado
description:
Grecia Imperios del Pasado is a print and play strategy game of 2 to 4 players on Ancient Greece recreating scenarios such as the Trojan War or the expansion of Alexander the Great. It is based on units that go up in level to gain experience and the objective is to conquer the rival's strengths. The rules of the game are simple and the game is fast, so it works for non-insiders, but expert wargamers will like it too.

—description from the designer

Grecia Imperios del Pasado es un juego de estrategia sobre la Antigua Grecia recreando escenarios como la guerra de Troya o la expansión de Alejandro Magno. Se basa en unidades que van subiendo de nivel al adquirir experiencia y el objetivo consiste en conquistar las fortalezas del rival. Las reglas de juego son sencillas y el juego es rápido, así que sirve para no iniciados, pero a los wargamers expertos también les gustará.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Muse: Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 4 Clue Cards and 1 Art Card (Factory).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 2 – Magnifying Glass
description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 2: Someone who asks what you are playing, or anyone you assist during a Serendipity.
Reward: place in deck as extra discovered treasure.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 3 – Dice Tower
description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 3: Show someone the Maiden's Quest game.
Reward: place in deck as extra discovered treasure.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 4 – Baby Gem Dragon
description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 4: when you assist during a Serendipity and they win the encounter.
Reward: use back of the card when setting up your deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: 死盤遊戯 (Boardgame of Death)
description:
Challenge the tower where death waits with a fist!

You are a novice in martial arts.
By challenging a number of fighters over the tower of death, your fighting skills will be sharpened. The ultimate goal is to defeat the boss awaiting at the summit, and earn the reputation as the strongest fighter.

However, you are still weak when you first visit the tower.
In order to challenge the boss, you have to gain experience while fighting the rival fighters encountered in the middle of the tower.

Boardgame of Death is a card game with deck building as the major mechanism. Through the use of "Combo" which connects different martial arts skills, damage will be given to rival fighters. The game system allows players to acquire martial arts skills by knocking down enemies.

Let's train your fighter to become the strongest one through repeating scenes of victory and defeat.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Robots & Rockets: Lightspeed
description:
Welcome to the Lightspeed Space Station! As a skilled builder, help the station mark rockets capable of reaching the speed of light. Compete with others, earn the respect of Master Builders and become the best builder in the galaxy!

Robots & Rockets: Lightspeed is a competitive rocket-building card game for 2 to 4 players. The goal is to build and launch rockets to collect the greatest number of rocket parts by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: 1987: On To Kaliningrad!
description:
A few months [before June 2021,] we announced that we would be discontinuing both 1968 & 1987.

These games were designed when I first started the company and frankly, I was in a rush to put out a catalog. Unfortunately I don't think either of these games are up to the quality I want to maintain with CSL so both will no longer be available on our catalog.

If you purchased 1968 and/or 1987, I will provide you with a 20$ discount toward your next purchase.

Finally, I apologize that these games ended up being broken.

—description from the designer

1987 is the second Procedural Combat Series game covering a hypothetical low-intensity WW3 based on the original objectives of the 1914 invasion of East Prussia, on the 70th anniversary of the Soviet Union. The order of battle for both sides is drawn from records from the 80s and the tactical situation is nuanced given the absence of major NATO ground forces such as the US, France, England etc. 1987 uses the same rules as 1950 with several changes in both scale and mechanics to reflect the tactical situation.

1987 includes rules for tactical nuclear strikes, refugees, political objectives airmobile units and more. Admittedly, there is little historical basis for this tactical situation given Kaliningrad came under Soviet control after WW2 and the major players in NATO were ready at moments to notice to cooperate as they were during the Balkan wars of the 90s. This situation is only possible if we assume that the major member nations of NATO have isolated themselves and are reluctant to commit.

Note that this is a completely fictional account that is meant to bear no relation to history other than the forces included in the Order of Battle. It assumes that Hitler was successfully assassinated in 1943 allowing Admiral Canaris of the Abwehr to stage a defensive campaign and negotiate a truce with the western allies. As related in Bodyguard of Lies, Canaris had been working towards a rapprochement with the western allies throughout the war. The assassination of Hitler provided the Wehrmacht to activate Beck’s plans to take over the government under Canaris’ guidance and attempt to enlist the West in a crusade against Bolshevism. While this attempt failed it did result in the immediate removal of any Germans who were in the Nazi Party. Canaris, Beck et al were violent anti-Nazis. Not that they were nice guys but they weren’t racist, paranoid criminals.
While England and the United States were happy to end the war on a status quo ante basis and turn their attention to crushing the Japanese, they were less willing to attempt to force such a result on the Germans on the Eastern Front. Stalin, facing the likelihood of the full weight of the German war machine (with the SS units rationalized, raising the quality of the entire army), sought and obtained an armistice on the lines established by the Nazi-Soviet pact.
Under pressure from the United States and the Commonwealth, Canaris permitted an independent Poland which slid into the Soviet orbit due to lingering distrust over the German invasion of 1939 (Katyn’s grisly harvest would not be discovered in this timeline.) and the return of the eastern provinces absorbed by the Soviets as a result of the Pact.
An early end to the war resulted in a slowing of war technology and the development of nuclear weapons in smaller packages, suitable for tactical (artillery fired) weaponry first. Rocketry remains rudimentary, jets do dominate the skies but the equipment remained 15-20 years behind what developed in our 1987. As a result while there is a possibility of true strategic level nuclear war, the delivery of such weapons is by large jet bombers and not by ICBMs.
The years leading up to 1987 had been bleak for the west. NATO had been developed as a potential counterbalance to an eastern European defensive alliance with the Soviets resulting from the fear of economic vassalage to the western powers. With the Soviets relatively impoverished due to World War II and the despair of having fought so hard with only an armistice to end things. The lack of a significant threat from the Soviet/Eastern European bloc caused the NATO powers to reconsider their commitment to the alliance, with many seeking to make their joint security pledges contingent on their own interests. This came to a head in early 1987 as Article 5 pledges were made voluntary and many parties to the alliance indicated that their choice to respond would be made on a case by case basis. The active components of NATO who would clearly respond to the call of the victim or aggression were reduced to Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, aspects of US airpower and Canada.
Meanwhile in the Soviet Union significant unrest grew as frustration over a permanent state of war with Germany caused continued economic sanctions (remember, no peace was signed, merely an armistice). Army morale sagged, citizens demonstrated and it seemed that the Soviet Union would come undone from internal centripetal forces. Something had to be done and the Politburo grabbed at the straw that always seemed to bring Russia together – a war. After all, they were already at war and the unwillingness of the Germans to end it was strangling the Soviet Union. The Poles would help as they wanted revenge.
The goal was simple. Cause NATO a loss. Show that the Eastern bloc retained its vitality while NATO was losing its. No one wanted a full-fledged war, just enough of a spat to move from armistice to peace…

WEIGHT: 7/10
SOLITAIRE: 9/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the publisher

name: Ninjas!!: The Stealth Assassin Showdown
description:
The deadliest martial arts experts have gathered in a secret arena to engage the ultimate stealth assassin showdown. As each is evenly matched in strength, skill, and speed, only cunning and courage will tell who will be the last one standing.

Ninjas!! The Stealth Assassin Showdown is a battle royale board game for 2 to 4 players, who use deduction to find and strike moving opponents while trying to evade attacks themselves.

The game is played on a 10-by-10 grid, and involves playable Move and Attack cards, as well as Ninja Star and Footprint tokens. Each player begins with the same hand of 12 cards--the 12 Styles of Ninja, which depict and describe the strategies in the ninja's toolbox, and which can be used to help find, hit, or dodge opponents. Turns alternate between Moves and Attacks, in which all players plan secretly, and then reveal and resolve simultaneously. Players record their own turns and track evidence of their opponents' movements in writing on a Notepad.

Although the in-game goals remain the same for every game of Ninjas!!, players can change the end-game conditions to allow for different game times and styles of gameplay. The standard game involved 3 wounds and player elimination, other options include Sudden Death matches as well as point-based games in which players count the number of successful attacks against the number of times they were wounded. Each game of Ninjas!! can also be played on a differently laid out board and with different starting positions.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dust in the Wings: Inuit Promo Card
description:
This promo was available in the Inuit: The Snow Folk box.

Promo consists of 1 Gathering card.

To fulfill it, you must end your move on a space that contains 5 butterflies: 1 red, 1 blue, and 1 yellow butterfly, as well as two other butterflies of any color (as long as they both are of the same color).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Buried Treasure: An Open World Pirate Game
description:
You’ve settled into the new world. There are countless islands to explore and treasures to seek in these uncharted waters. Go out there and make your fortune, but beware, you’re not the only one out there seeking their fortune. Pirates are scouring the waters looking to claim what you’ve found, sea creatures lurk in the deep ready to devour you, and your fellow privateers could either help you, or steal your booty for their own purpose. These are lawless and dangerous waters, and you must be prepared for anything. Will you find the treasure you seek, or will you meet your doom? Adventure awaits!

Each player takes a turn to explore into new tiles, sail through existing tiles, or remain on their current tile and try to get as much treasure as they can. They can find treasure on islands, while diving, after defeating pirates or sea creatures, or even by attacking other players! When players draw a tile while exploring, they place it in any free space adjacent to their ship and move there immediately. There are five special types of tiles that can be drawn: Islands (where you'll find the majority of your treasure), Diving Locations (you need a diving bell to access them), Pirates (the scourge of the seven seas), Sea Creatures (mythical beasts wanting to destroy your ship and eat your crew), and Shops (places to upgrade your ship and crew). The first player to get to 100 treasure in their stash wins the game!

Buried Treasure is a world building, open world sandbox game that is built as the players take their turn. Instead of using a standard playing board, players build the game board by drawing tiles when they explore the world. If the tiles are ever used up, players can still sail throughout the map trying to find more treasure on islands, by diving, and attacking pirates/sea creatures/other players. Outfitting your ship and crew allows you to specialize your ship to be better at attacking, exploring, defense, or speed. We've also added in storms which can rip parts off of your ship and throw you and other players in range of the storm off course. You never know what to expect when you play this game!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Na łące
description:
Na łące is a small memo, bluffing game, where you collect animals living on meadow. Each turn every player collects two tiles and without showing them to other players he declares if they have the same animal on it or they are different. If they are different, he puts them on the table, leaving one visible to other players. If he says they are the same—other players can check if he is not bluffing. If he does he must give one of his tiles back to the box, if not he collects tiles and the one checking him returns one of his tiles to the box.
At the end of the game you score points for ducks (3 points each) and animals (1 point for each).

—description from the publisher

name: The Utah Beach Landings
description: Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the first of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

name: Game of Thrones: Oathbreaker – Jon Snow/Sansa Stark Character Board
description:
This is an additional character board including Jon Snow on one side and Sansa Stark on the other, given as a pre-order bonus from the publisher's website.

Jon’s ability to “Rally the North” allows his player and two allies to act twice in a round.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mountain Master
description:
Mountain Master is a game where instead of going deep into a dungeon, we make the opposite, we try to reach the summit of a mountain, with less goblins but a lot of climbing. But don't worry, it's still a RogueClimberLike, so you'll have your HP, your Strengh, Agility and Endurance Checks and your XP to Level Up. You can even find equipment on your way to the top!

You'll have to cross four areas. In each area, you'll need to ration your remaining VIT during the climbing sections, being smart about your chances of success.

The game have very few dice modification. Is more based on rerolling, and knowing when to continue spending more VIT with another try and when to pass because you could compromise the whole climb spending too much VIT in a section. And A LOT of planning.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Doughnut Dash
description:
You are the boss of a small-time gang of doughnut thieves. The best pickings are found at the world-famous Holesome Indoughstries factory, winner of the prestigious Jammy Fingers Award. But with a recent sprinkling of thievery, Holesome Indoughstries have made some changes to the factory floor in an attempt to frostrate would-be thieves. Now, you’ve hacked into the surveillance system and put your two finest pilferers on the ground. Help them snatch the cream of the crop while avoiding the sticky fingers of rival gangs.

Manoeuvre your gang of two thieves to steal doughnuts from the factory floor and from other thieves. The player who has the most valuable stack of doughnuts at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Programmed Movement

name: To Catch a Spy
description:
As a secret agent, you've been assigned to catch an elusive spy before they get away. Search for clues and find evidence while you track the spy, but watch out for dangerous explosives!

To Catch a Spy is a 1-2 player game of espionage. To set up, place nine location cards in a 3x3 grid, then place discovery cards under each location. Place three file cards near the locations, then place case cards under each file. Place decks for arrow cards and additional discovery cards nearby, along with two agent tool cards. The spy and agent cards start in different locations.

In the solo game, you are the agent and go first, moving to an adjacent location and revealing a discovery card, which could be an item, clue, or bomb; item and clue cards go in hand, while bombs force you to discard. You can use a location's special ability and clues to reveal case cards under files. You might be able to place a tracking bug on the spy.

For the spy's turn, the arrow cards move the spy to an adjacent location, where a new discovery card is placed at random. If the spy moves to your location, discard a card. If you can't discard a card or discover you've discarded an item matching a case card, you lose immediately.

When the discovery deck is empty, the spy attempts to escape. You must have placed a tracking bug on the spy, have the three item cards in hand matching the case cards, and make it to the spy's current location before the spy escapes.

In the two-player game, one player is the spy while the other is the agent. At the start of a round, each player chooses and reveals an arrow card, then the agent takes their turn, followed by the spy. Gameplay takes place as described above, with the spy needing to place all cards in the discovery deck before trying to escape, while the agent needs to collect the three items matching the case, bug the spy, then reach the spy's location.

Awards:

From the 2020 54-Card Game Design Contest.
-Best Solo Game: 1st place!
-Best Overall Game: 2nd place!
-Best 2 Player Game: 2nd place!
-Best Graphic Design: 3rd place!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pieces as Map, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Agarra Dino
description: Agarra Dino ("Grab the Dino") consists of dinosaur cards, color dice, a diet die and six colored dino meeples. There are four game modes with varying difficulty levels. In each of them, one card from the deck is revealed and one or more dice are rolled. Player must find matches between the cards and the dice, and grab one of the dinos in a corresponding color to receive a point token. When the deck is exhausted, the player with most tokens wins.

name: Rollit
description:
An early British Gambling / Party game.
Coloured discs are rolled onto the game board using an inclined wooden "Roller" device. Dependent on where the disc lands on the board, the Banker either awards credit to the player or retains the disc. Double credit is achieved when a disc lands on a space of the same colour.
In addition to coloured discs and rolling device, the game also includes a cast metal croupier's rake.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: Belgique – Pays de la Bière
description:
1800 questions about Belgian Beers.

Categories:

Geography
Types of Beer
History
Culture & Gastronomy
Manufacturing
Surprise
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: WheelVille
description:
How would our little-big planet look like without us, its inhabitants?
And what happens here and now, when the responsibility for its well-being rests with us more than ever?
WheelVille is not just another board game. It has its own philosophy: when you take something from your environment, you need to replace it with an equally valuable thing. You need to regenerate.
Give it all you’ve got to realize the full potential of the small village of WheelVille. Don’t be a mere player; be an entrepreneur!
However, the resources at your disposal are not infinite. And this is the challenge of the game – maintaining the balance. Developing your business in harmony with nature’s well-being.
Play your part in the big game of saving our planet. Be inspired, contemplate, innovate!
Welcome to WheelVille!

name: EQUILIBRIX Combact
description: This package of black-and-white puzzle pieces brings completely new dimension into EQULIBRIX series. Every puzzle piece is unique in terms of its shape and ability to create the connections with other puzzle pieces. This time you will experience a very close duel on the Connect game board (the box does not contain the game board). How the duel will look like? It depends largely on the game option you choose.

name: Apples to Apples: Marvel
description:
The Apples to Apples game ventures into the dazzling domain of the Marvel Universe with a wide array of Marvel Super Heroes and Villains!

As in the classic game, each player takes turns playing the judge. The round starts by the judge playing a Green Apple card. Everyone else plays a Red Apple card from their hand. These cards, with titles like “Black Widow, ” “Web-shooters, ” and “Hulk’s Pants, ” are brought to life with dynamic Marvel comic book images! Amazing combinations are inevitable, but the judge decides the best match-up for each round.

Watch out for the unique “Thanos Snaps” card; it’s a game-changing wild card removing half of players’ Red Apple cards!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bull's Eye
description: Fast reaction game! The player who picks up the correct cards first wins.

name: Zjedz mnie
description:
It has been known for a long time that in nature everything has its own order. The fox will eat a hen, and the hen will eat good grain or worm. Each animal just needs to eat its dinner. But a hungry wolf is a very bad wolf that can eat someone else's grandma. Sometimes you have to hunt for dinner, sometimes it is enough to put the muzzle to the ground, and sometimes you can eat up… waste.

What would the world look like backwards and what can a freak eat? Check it out by playing "Eat Me!"

"Eat me!" is a card game which, thanks to its funny convention, will familiarize the youngest players with the rules of consumption in force in nature. The players arrange the "food chains" from the cards in accordance with the rules of nature - predators eat herbivores, and those, as vegetarians, eat plant food. The game is enriched by action cards, which, for example, undo the player's movement, or the order of placing cards. The person who gets rid of all cards in their hand wins. The manual includes two additional gameplay variants: "Menu for the whole week" and "Everyone is very hungry".

name: Saudi Deal Card game
description:
Saudi deal is a set collocation / Take that card game that was inspired by Monopoly deal. The game includes many Arabic culture references which made the game loveable by the Arabic community.

you play the game as a Real Estate Marchant who tries to buy land and expand his wealth.



لعبة مونبولي ديل بنسخه سعوديه عيش جو الهوامير شبك أراضي وملايين وسع صدرك مع الشلة خل الدعوة فله⛳
مواصفات اللعبة :(( الإصدار الجديد + الكروت كاملة 150 كرت + كروت اكشن جديدة ))

سعودى ديل هى لعبة تقوم فيها بجمع اكبر عدد من الاراضى لتكوين مجموعة واللاعب الذى يكون 3 الى 5 مجموعات اولا هو الفائز لعبة مسلية جدا لعبة المنوبولي الشهيرة بمدن سعودية وكلمات عامية وريالات سعودية

انطلق مع عالم الهوامير مع لعبة عالمية بلهجة محلية ودراهم سعودية عيش الجو ، شبك الأراضي ، وعمرها بيوت وفنادق ، ولم الدلة ، وسع صدرك مع الشلة ، وخل الدعوة فله .

عبارة عن كروت اكشن كارد وكروت اراضي فكرتها انك تحاول تجمع فلوس عشان اذا احد طلبك ايجار تقدر تسدده وانك تشتري الأراضي أو تسرقها بكروت اكشن كارد خاصه
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Ping Pong Literario
description:
A creative game to talk about books, literature and much more.
Ideal to play it at all times in homes, schools, libraries and desktops.

Three ways to play. The conversation is the protagonist and these cards know it. It is not a trivia game. We all have an answer for these letters.


Game modes

Ping Pong: A game to generate and share conversations about your reading journey.

InversaMente: Score points by guessing the other players' answers.

Tell me what you answer is... and I'll tell you what you read: To win you must discover the questions with the clues they give you.

The Winner is the one who reach the total points agreed upon at the start of the game or is winning after the session is over.

name: Under the Leaves
description:
Have you ever heard of the Untouchable Lake? Even the bravest wind dare not raise waves on its dark surface. You have to sail through this strange, mysterious water to reach the Summer Island where you are going to spend the winter. A proper boat should be built, which floats above the water by the means of magic. Use all treasures of the forest to succeed! Where are these treasures? Right there, where this story begins: Under the Leaves.

Players move their figure around the board to collect different materials and spend them to build boat parts during the game. Each player must build their boat consisting of three different parts: front, back, and a fairy dust container. The completed boat earns stars (=victory points) just like the spyglasses and passengers. The player with the most stars wins the game.

When a player stops at the harbour, owning a complete boat and at least one spyglass, receives the Summer Island card, announcing the end of the game. The other players have to complete their last turn and then start the final scoring. The player who owns more victory points wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Pumpkin Express
description:
Pumpkin Express, part of Roll and Write Revolution, is a train game of developing routes from one pumpkin patch to the next. While doing so, players will be placing stations, which then allow them to help ghostly passengers get on board 1 of 3 train cars. Ghost passengers have particular likes of other ghosts within the car.

Players will have to carefully plan the order they place passengers in the queue as those passengers are placed in the cars in the order that they are placed in the queue. The dice are also used to create the tracks.

—description from the designer
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Argy Bargey
description:
Argy Bargey is a new board game where you compete to create your own canal empire.

Each player must complete routes between towns and cities, competing against each other. Using tiles, you'll want your waterway to take the fastest possible route across the board.

Just like real canals, you'll need to use locks and tunnels to tackle hills. Junctions will be needed to connect other canals and create an efficient network.

With an approximate playing time of 45 minutes, 2 to 6 people can gather to do battle - canal style! Can you become the greatest canal tycoon of the 21st century?

name: Hush
description:
On the other side of Earthshine, the evil spirits come out at night. They'll ravage anything in sight, as they feed on chaos and destruction. But you thrive for survival. Survival of yourself, your people, and your property, and ultimately, protecting the sacred creatures that you share the land with. You work hard to survive and you will not let the undead get in the way.

In Hush, 1+ players will work together to manage a group of commoners that are trying to survive the dangers of each passing night, and ultimately, protect the nocturnal creatures that live on the land. By day they will build resources, shelter, and develop techniques, and by night they will protect each other from the evil spirits that pass through. The goal is survival. How many nights can you make it before the spirits bring you down?

—description from the publisher


Starter Kit released for Board Game of the Month Club in March 2022.

6 monthly episodes released from March to August 2022 packages, that includes:

Map postcard
Character card
Nocturnal Creature card
Spirit card
Structure card (every other month)

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Skinchangers
description:
Skinchangers have the rare ability to project their consciousness into nearby creatures, altering their behavior. This can be used simply, perhaps having them perform tricks. But it can also be used in combat. It’s bad enough when an enemy unit is advancing on your position. It’s worse when that unit is flanked by giant wolves or bears.

The Skinchangers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders a new option for their armies. The Skinchanger Unit Attachment can be placed in any unit, ignoring usual Unit Attachment rules (so they can join a unit with another attachment already in it). When being added, the player can also add their animal unit to the table. When the Skinchanger’s unit activates, the accompanying animal can activate immediately afterward, creating perfect “one-two punch” combinations. Just be sure that the two are never further than Long Range from one-another, or the Skinchanger is killed. Either situation will cause the animal to also be destroyed.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Builders of Blankenburg: Foundations Mini-Expansion
description:
Description: Add another twist to your adventures in Blankenburg. Foundations includes new foundation cards that allow you to reserve space in the town, along with some special structures and a new character.

Note: Cards are printed on same stock as Fields & Flocks.

Includes:
- 6 Foundation cards

- 3 Structure cards
-- Manor
-- Guild Hall
-- Shrine

- 1 Character card
-- Reeve

- 1 Rules aid card

At this time, this exclusive mini-expansion is only available through the publisher at the Cobblestone website.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Variable Player Powers

name: Nak Makan Apa
description:
What’s the hardest question for a group to answer when they’re out? Nak makan apa? - “What do you want to eat?”

Nak Makan Apa is a bilingual (Bahasa Melayu and English) card game, where you take it in turns to play flavours you want to eat, with the aim of finding a meal that matches the collective taste.

There’s also a bit of take that as you can play ‘songeh’ cards to frustrate the other players and cancel some of their meals.

First to make four meals wins.

name: ギルドビルド (Guild Build)
description:
In ギルドビルド (Guild Build), players work to build an adventuring party in a fantasy world of anthropomorphic bird people. Characters include familiar roles such as Mage, Warrior, Cleric, and Crafter. Having the right party members allows you to score victory points through quests, events, and special achievements.

On a player's turn, they select one of five quest cards: Conquer, Defend, Gather, Explore, and Recruit. Conquer, Defend, and Gather allow you to score points on different score tracks, which allow you to earn Feat Cards. Explore let you draw an Event Card, which causes players to gain or lose resources based on their party members. Recruit allows you to hire party members with coins from the current market.

Players can earn victory points from advancing on the score tracks to earn Feat Cards, from all of their party members, and from Legendary Cards earned from collecting certain party members or fifteen coins.

The game ends when a player gains a certain number of party members, which varies based on the number of players. The player with the most victory points at that time is the winner.
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 5th Booster Pack: Conductor
description: This Conductor pack introduces us to a new car type; Styles! Just like how a conductor influences the way every musician in the orchestra plays the music, Style cards influences the way every player plays the game! But unlike conductors, Style cards will never get angry when you are out of tune. Never.

name: Пруд императора
description:
In this game you rule one fish from Emperor of Japan pond.

Each turn you move your fish (Koi) on hexagonal field, eat and collect food and upgrade your tablet.

•••

В этой игре вам предстоит взять под управление одну из рыбок кои в императорском пруду и довести её первой до вознесения дракона. Рассчитывайте свои возможности, чтобы каждый ход совершать с максимальной выгодой и не забывайте следить за игроками, чтобы вовремя помешать им вырвать победу из ваших плавников. В ходе игры вы будете перемещаться по игровому полю, собирать еду для своей рыбки и прокачивать свой планшет, чтобы каждый новых ход становился всё более эффективным.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Turn Order: Random

name: Jungle Panic
description:
POSITIONING, OBSERVATION AND SPEED GAME

Panic in the jungle: hippopotamuses, snakes and cheetahs
are out of control and threatening nature’s tranquillity!
Let’s help them calm down by creating spaces specially
for each species.

Everybody plays at once in this game of speed, where each
player is trying to grab the tile they need in order to gather
6 animals from the same species. At the end of the game,
the player with the most points wins.

-description from publisher

name: Sokker
description:
In this game, the players are football coaches trying to outsmart each other on the pitch. Just like in real life, the winner is the player who manages to score more goals than their opponent.

Players alternate taking turns and during their turn they may move one of their footballers. After that, if the ball is controlled by one of their footballers, player draws a card from the deck and resolves it. As a result of it the ball is being kicked and (if that footballer is in a correct position) a goal may be scored. The player who managed to score more goals than their opponent wins the game.

name: Star Realms: Warlord Promo Card
description:
Name: Warlord
Type: Scavenger Ship
Cost: 8
10 Attack.

Scavenger Ally bonus: 2 Attack

When you acquire this card, you may scrap up to two cards in your hand and/or discard pile.

Promotional card from Gen Con 2022.

name: Philosophy: Amber Expansion
description: This expansion adds an amber-colored set of tiles to enable Philosophy to be played with three players.

name: Expo 58
description:
The 1958 World Expo, an international exhibition, took place in Brussels from April 17 to October 19, 1958. It was the first World Expo since World War II. As many as 42 million visitors were able to discover pavilions from 44 countries. The Atomium was constructed especially for the occasion, and today still represents one of Belgium's most recognizable symbols.

Expo 58 is a management game in which players are visitors of the World Expo. During the game, players try to co-ordinate their visit to the exhibition by optimizing the use of their Expo cards and Pavilion tiles.

Travel across the exhibition grounds, stroll through the gardens, enjoy fancy food in the restaurants, and vote for your favorite exhibitors. By carrying out all of these actions, you're trying to achieve goals that will score you victory points and bonuses.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards, Tile Placement

name: MACOCO
description:
In Macoco, you're trying to grab cards as quickly as possible.

Each player takes an even part of the shuffled deck face down in front of them, and on a turn, the next player reveals their top card face up in the center of the table.
