If more monkeys appear than any fruit or other animal on the card, yell "Macoco!" If a fruit or non-monkey animal appears most frequently, yell the name of that object. If nothing has a majority, yell "Nada!" The one exception: If a giant coconut appears in the center of the card, say nothing and slap the card.

If you are the first to correctly say the right thing or slap the card, you win it. If you're wrong, you suffer no penalty, but are out for the round. If everyone is wrong or multiple people do the right thing at the same time, no one wins the card. Leave it in the middle of the table, and whoever wins next takes all cards piled up.

Once all the cards have been played, whoever has collected the most cards wins.
publishers: Drei Hasen in der Abendsonne, Playte, Popcorn Games

name: Dice & Divination
description:
Dice & Divination is a print and play, roll and write set of games. Each player may pick the same or different divination method as another player. Each game lasts around 25 minutes. Each player will compete to give the best reading to the client by applying the three rolled numbers to their sheet at the beginning of each of 6 rounds.

Each of the 5 games in the set plays completely different from each other and caters to a different play style for different gamers. Currently the games in the set are Astrology, Bone Casting, Tea Leaf Reading, and Palm Reading. There is a fifth that will be announced as part of the kickstarter campaign.

—description from the designer

name: A game about setting scenarios that people would do for different lengths of time.
description:
Wacky scenarios and empathy. Mad-lib-style cards with which you may combine a purpose, task, companion, and up to 2 modifiers.

Eg. "For all the money in the world pretend to be best friends with a chihuahua who is covered with bees, whilst your parents stare at you."

How long would you do that for? How long would everyone else do that for?

Take turns to set a scenario, using 3-5 cards. Other players vote how long they would be willing to do that scenario for.
The scenario-setter gets pts for each unique vote. Try to confuse everyone!
Other players get pts for each identical vote. Try to vote like everyone else!

After everyone has had a turn, whoever has the most points wins!

-description from designer

name: Bohnaparte: Liberté! Egalité! Bohnité!
description:
Note: Not to be confused with Bohnaparte, the Lookout Games version of the same game which has less cards and markers as well as other minor differences.

The Bohnanza base game is needed. Using new cards in Bohnaparte, the Bohnreich is laid out; each player receives counters of his own color; and play then loosely follows that of normal Bohnanza, with a small difference: earned bean coins are not saved but are used to finance your conquests throughout the Bohnreich. At the end it matters only who has the largest part of the Bohnreich under control. Battling is accomplished using the numbers on the bean cards, which gives new significance to the formerly "weaker" bean types. Designer Hanno Girke describes the expansion set as "Bohnanza meets Risk".

The AMIGO-Edition of Bohnaparte includes 50 Cards, 72 game markers and rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Napoleonic, Negotiation, Territory Building
publishers: AMIGO, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Rio Grande Games

name: Twin Raiders
description:
Twin raiders is a Print and Play game in which you will have to explore and find the best path to reach the idols hidden in the lost temple.
In this strategy game you will compete with another player to be the first to find all the idols. You will have to find the best path and be fast to exploit all the opportunities as they arise during the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units

name: Pitmaster
description:
Players are contestants on a barbecue cooking reality show. Assign your assistants to various work stations to prepare the best feast by the end of four rounds.

A worker placement game with dice for workers. You roll your dice at the beginning of each round, and most worker placement spaces let you manipulate the values of your unplaced dice. You need to tune your workers correctly to perfectly cook your meat.

Score points for perfectly cooked meat and special sets of dishes at the end of the game.

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Gnarlwood – Beastbound Assault Rivals Deck
description:
The root-halls under the Gnarlwood are uncharted territory, where lurking horrors prey on the unwary. Yet even these savage denizens can be bound – whether through magical means or impressive feats of animal handling – and trained to fight alongside warriors with the willpower to command them. Such a warband can charge into battle alongside a terrifying menagerie of beasts which tear into their enemies with vicious stingers, gnashing teeth, and rending claws in a true Beastbound Assault.

Get stuck into Warhammer Underworlds or mix up your game with the complete Beastbound Assault Rivals deck, usable by any warband – including those from past seasons. These cards can be used as a standalone deck in Rivals games, mixed with a warband's unique cards for Nemesis games, or used to build a deck from the ground-up in Relic games. This deck doesn’t include any spells, so warbands from any season can put it to good use.

Each card is brand new to the game, focused on making aggressive plays that can flex into a control style thanks to unique Denizen upgrades. Warbands containing a number of Minions and Beasts, such as Hexbanes's Hunters, the Gnarlspirit Pack, the Exiled Dead, and Blackpowder's Buccaneers will do especially well with this deck.

This deck contains a 32-card universal Rivals deck, consisting of:

12x objective cards
10x gambit cards
10x upgrade cards


1x background card containing a deck list of the Beastbound Assault cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: AWS BuilderCards
description:
AWS BuilderCards - AWS Game Tech edition is a fun and educational trading card deck building game designed to teach how different AWS services work together to build well-architected workloads.

By starting out with old school servers parts in your hand. You can exchange value of old parts for new cloud based parts. When you have enough of the correct parts you can build a solution as described on the cards. You need to complete those cloud parts in a full architecture. With the orange point you then buy Well architected cards (points)

Who has the most points wins the game.

name: Mush Smash
description:
Toss the dwarf chip, harvest mushrooms, and build buildings to earn points. Players can build depending on colour and number of mushrooms. So watch the building cards on the field and the forest conditions for mushrooms to be harvested. The player who has the highest total of 10 points on his or her building cards wins the game. However, beware of poisonous mushrooms, which give players negative points when harvested.

—description from the publisher

name: First in Flight: Clement Ader Promo Card
description:
Originally available through Tantrum House Season 9 Kickstarter.

1 double sided card pilot card

Blue side: You may not use skill cards until you are famous.

Ability: Instead of your turn, other players ignore your pawn for the next 2 actions, then resume play as normal.

name: Arctic Ignited
description:
In Arctic Ignited, immerse yourself in a dieselpunk saga set in the frozen expanse of 1921. Navigate the frigid battlegrounds where every move shapes the destiny of the icy continent. Construct a formidable unit deck featuring Infantry, rivet Mechs, and Artillery cards. Handpick your starting deck and units, aligning them with your strategic vision for the Arctic.

Engage in strategic Actions—attack, move, conquer, and purchase units—against the relentless Arctic storms. Roll the dice to determine the outcome, shift units strategically, and convert the base of the opponent to your faction's control. Optimize your deck's composition, thinning it at strategic intervals to ensure a finely tuned draw deck for the challenges that lie ahead.

Arctic Ignited promises a riveting blend of strategy, chance, and deck-building finesse in a dieselpunk dystopia. Will you conquer the territories and emerge as the master tactician of the frozen battlefield? Your destiny awaits amidst the howling winds and icy landscapes of Arctic Ignited!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Zone of Control

name: Die verdrehte Spuknacht
description: The three magicians stand in amazement in front of the huge gates of the old castle, which have just opened as if by magic. “Shall we dare to go in and see if this place is really haunted?” Conrad asks a little frightened. “Yes, together as a team we can do it!” answer Vicky and Mila in unison. But again the gates are creaking ... Will the three of them be able to explore the ancient rooms and find their way out in time before the haunted castle closes its gates again until the next full moon? For one thing is certain: If ghosts are really up to mischief here, they will do anything to stop our three curious magicians!

name: Chip 'N' Dale: Christmas Treasures – Collector's Edition
description:
Chip 'n' Dale have found their way into the Christmas tree! Help them collect treasures and treats for their winter stockpile, and avoid getting caught by Pluto! Flip over cards to discover the hidden treasures in the tree, then collect cards to score points. Make the best collection to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Debate
description:
Description from the designer:

Debate (formerly known as Discussion) is a 18 cards microgame in which you try to create a coherent speech using your resources at hand and your memory, and forcing your opponent to flip its ideas.

Debate is being played with an 18 cards deck with different symbols on them. It is very important to differentiate between the front and back of each card. The backs contain only two symbols, 9 corresponding to one player (red) and 9 for the other (green). The hand of each player is always held with the backs facing the opposite player. The cards are played next to others on the table showing their back sides and triggering some effects. You win by forming a group of connected cards of your color greater than your opponent’s.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Print & Play

name: Choiss
description: This a a chess game at heart. The components are made up on 64 individual interlocking squares and large, beautiful chess figures. The squares are half white and half green. Components are well made and sturdy. The game board shape and size is created by the players. Once the board is set up, normal rules of chess apply.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Square Grid

name: Racing Hedgehogs
description: Racing Hedgehogs is a strategic family game that requires prediction skills and a touch of cunning in order to win... Each player on their turn plays a card from their hand, which determines which hedgehog to move and how many steps to take. The race ends when the first hedgehog reaches the end of the track.

name: Brilliant Or BS? Trivia Party Game
description:
Brilliant Or BS? is a 4-6 player party game for know-it-alls and big fat liars! Players read multiple choice trivia questions and earn points by predicting which of the other players guessed correctly before answers are revealed. Can you tell when your friends are BSing? Play this hilarious party game and find out.

There are six different categories of trivia including Sports, Entertainment, Food & Drink, Science & Technology, Geography and History.

Players take turns being the Judge by reading one yellow question card and the three multiple choice answers.

The other players have 10 seconds to respond by placing one of their A-B-C answer cards face down.

Starting with the player to the Judge’s left and going clockwise, each player tries to convince the Judge that they got the question right without saying the answer. They must come up with a convincing explanation as to how or why they know the correct answer...even if they don’t.

After everyone pleads their case, the Judge grabs the two black cards and gives the Brilliant card to the person they think got the question right and the BS card to the person they think got it wrong.

The player that receives the Brilliant card automatically earns 2 points and the player who receives the BS card earns 0 points.

The Judge announces the correct answer (highlighted in bold) before asking the other players to reveal their cards. The players who did NOT receive a Brilliant or BS card go first, followed by the player who received the BS card. The person who received the Brilliant card reveals their answer last. Each player that gets the question right earns 1 point.

The Judge receives 1 point for each correct Brilliant prediction and 1 point for each correct BS prediction. But beware. For each wrong prediction, the Judge loses 1 point.

Play continues until each person has had the chance to be the Judge the same number of times. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. (Suggested length of game play is 1 hour.)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Communication Limits, Player Judge

name: Ronda
description: This is the most popular card game in Morocco. It is a fishing card game. It is played with 2 players (or 2 teams of 2 players). The play goes around the table counter clockwise. The player to the right of the dealer starts by putting a card from his/her hand on the table. Play continues around the table until the cards are exhausted. If a player has a card in his/her hand that matches a card on the table, he/she may play that card and pick up both his/her card and the one that matches. If there is a card on the table with a number 1 higher than the card played, he/she can pick up that card, too. He/she can continue picking up cards from the table with succeedingly higher numbers until the run is broken. If, during play, a player matches a card just played by the player to his/her left, the player earns 1 point.

name: CHem-eO
description:
A new game from the makers of Booleo, this time covering organic Chemistry.

CHem-eO is a fun card game for two or more players, which demonstrates basic organic chemistry fundamentals. Players compete to build complex and simple compounds from individual atoms. Points are scored upon completing each molecule. Players may choose to play to any score they wish - a suggested goal is 92, which is the atomic number of Uranium (the heaviest naturally occurring element). If the player would like a longer game then an alternate goal could be the atomic number of the heaviest element currently discovered. Players scores are kept on the periodic table of element. Play as Carbon(Solid), Oxygen(liquid), Helium(Gas), or Nitrogen(Unknown).

The points scored as players finish building compounds come in two varieties: simple and complex. Simple compounds are common compounds which are made up of relatively few atoms. Complex compound are designated as such; either because they consist of more atoms and bonds, or because they are less well known. Complex compounds have the added difficulty of requiring the recipe card to complete. This also earns the player bonus points.

Once a compound is started it can be completed by any player which means a compound you start out to be Methane (a simple compound) may be turned into Acetic Acid (a complex compound) requiring a recipe.

Cards include single, double and triple bonds, elements, and recipes for compounds. Play is fast paced and allows the players to learn about organic chemistry while they play this fun interactive game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Trick-taking

name: Scrabble: Cooking Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Serve up some fun with America's favorite word game.
The Cooking Edition of Scrabble includes classic Scrabble fun with a cooking twist allowing players to earn bonus points for words related to everyone’s favorite past time. Recipe cards are the perfect mix as players double and triple their scores with directives for all new custom game play. Become the master chef as you spell your way to victory with tasty abbreviations and names of your favorite celebrity chefs.
Can you spell D-E-L-I-S-H?

name: Sherlock & Picasso
description:
What can be easier than drawing a ladder or a Christmas tree? A few lines on a piece of paper will be enough. But what if another person will come and turn your sketch into something completely different? And right in front of your eyes, the ladder turns into tracks with a train at full speed, and the Christmas tree becomes a toothy monster...

Each round in Sherlock & Picasso, there is a pairing of the artist and the rascal. The first has 40 seconds to sketch up to eight objects, and the second then spoils each picture, so other players can't guess the initial object. If they do, they and the artist gain victory points; if they don't, the rascal has managed to fool them and gets points for that!

—description from the publisher

name: Foutrak
description:
Foutrak is a speedy pattern-recognition game from Cocktail Games in which players duel to claim cards.

On a turn, the active player challenges one of the other players. They then turn over the top card of the deck. Each card has 1-4 numbered illustrations on it, and each illustration is either yellow, blue or green. If an illustration is yellow, the players must make an action appropriate for the image; if blue, the player must make an appropriate sound; and if green (i.e., blue + yellow), the player must make both sound and action.

Whichever player first makes the appropriate combination of sounds and actions in the right order claims the card. (The other players can serve as judge to determine the winner.) Whoever claims the most cards wins the game.

• Texte de Cocktail games pour présenter le jeu.

"Alors, quand ma carte a un fond jaune, je dois faire des gestes… et quand j’ai une carte bleue, je paye l’addition, c’est ça ?". Pas de panique, reprenons au début ! Foutrak est un jeu d’observation et de rapidité complètement farfelu qui vous propose de faire des bruitages et des mimes. À chaque tour a lieu un duel entre 2 joueurs. Le joueur actif choisit un adversaire puis retourne une carte. Il s’agit alors de réaliser ce qui est indiqué sur les illustrations de la carte avant son camarade. C’est là que les choses se compliquent. Toute illustration sur fond jaune invite les joueurs à mimer ce qui y est représenté (un lapin, un accordéon, etc.). Si un dessin sur fond bleu apparaît, vous devrez faire le bruit correspondant (miauler si c’est un chat, par exemple). Enfin, le fond vert invite à mimer et bruiter l’image (ah, le singe…). Les cartes de jeu contiennent de une à quatre illustrations numérotées. Les joueurs sont ainsi informés de l’ordre dans lequel ils doivent effectuer les actions de chaque carte. Mais attention : une image comprenant un élément rose doit être ignorée, et il faut crier "Foutrak" si le bonhomme zinzin est présent sur la carte retournée ! Vous remportez une carte à chaque bonne réponse, plus un bonus avec les cartes Foutrak. Pour l’emporter, soyez le joueur ayant glané le plus de cartes !

name: Defenders of the Realm: Battlefields – Elf Lord
description:
The Elf Lord is a Kickstarter bonus tile, which replaces the Druid in the Hero Deck and and adds some different strategic choices for the Hero player.

Setup: Players shuffle and play their deck as normal. If the Hero player wants to include their KS Elf Lord tiles, they take these 4 tiles and shuffle them, placing them face down next to their draw deck.

Game Play: When the Hero player is playing one of their Wild cards, they may discard the Wild card rather than using the ability and draw one of the face down Elf Lord Wild tiles playing it instead. This is an optional action enabling the player to play the original Wild card or choose to play the Elf Lord. They make this decision prior to seeing the Elf Lord card.

Optional Rule: If the Dark Lord player is more experienced and wished to handicap themselves, they may allow the Hero player to have the KS ELf Lord Wild tiles face up and choose which one to play each time rather than the cards being random.

The Aloof ELf Lord: After the Battlefield that the Elf Lord Tile was played on, the Tile is returned to the box and not shuffled back into the other tiles. Therefore, the Elf Lord will only only appear on the Battlefields 4 times, being discarded to the box when the respective battlefields are resolved.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval

name: Naval Battle
description:
Naval Battle in a fantasy world!

Especially for the youngest fairy tales and adventures admirers we present 'Naval Battle'. 2-sided map of fantastic marine world + color models of the ships = Real Sea Chess for your Kids!

Players engage in a struggle for supremacy over the sea. Each player has four ships:
1) the mighty Battleship,
2) multi-gun Galleon,
3) fast Frigate and
4) nimble small Brig.

Ships can move around the playing board and shoot. To win the game, the player must either drown the opponent’s Flagship (Battleship), or capture the enemy base.

Ships miniatures in the Naval battle are equivalent for the Admiral game miniatures.

2 sided board increases variety of the game.

name: Ifrito
description:
From the lands of sunrise to the lands of sunset, the world rings with the fame of Suleiman the Great, the man whose wisdom has no equal! He was granted many talents at birth, and he learned all kinds of secret knowledge during his long life. He became so powerful that he was even able to rule over the heavenly genies. They built cities and moved mountains at his command, for fear of his angry gas!

But man is mortal, and even the life of Suleiman must come to its end. Powerful genies scatter — some go to the Netherworld of Order, others to the Netherworld of Chaos — but the disciples of the great master remain, and they hope to subjugate the servants of their master again. Each of them has created carpets filled with secret magic and sent them out to gather the scattered genies.

Your goal in Ifrito is to be the first player to capture nine of his opponent's genies or three of his opponent's carpets. During your turn, a player must take one of the following actions: bring a new carpet into play, move one of your carpets on the game board space, or capture an opponent's carpet along with all the genies sitting on it.

name: ANTIQUE OR GHOST?
description:
In ANTIQUE OR GHOST?, you're an antique dealer who is trying to finagle the most valuable collection of goods, both by claiming valuable items and by manipulating the market to increase the value of what you own.

At the start of the game, each player receives a random fate card (the "GHOST" in the title) that indicates one type of artifact that won't be worth anything at game's end. Each player starts with a mystery face-down artifact in their collection as well as a hand of artifact cards and two artifact cards in their window as products that can be acquired. A market card for each of the six types of artifacts is laid out, with the order of these cards determining their value at the end of the game.

On a turn, you refill your hand and refill your window, then you pick a product that someone has displayed in their window. The owner of that product has two choices:


Let you take that product into your permanent collection, while they use the power on that card, or
Take the card into their own collection, while you then get to use that card's power.


Each type of artifact has a different power, such as increasing your hand size, changing the order of cards on the market, and locking a card's value on the market.

Once you have five cards in your collection, you receive one of the completion chips and are now out of the game. Once all players have completed their collections, you reveal fate cards to see which items are worthless, then sum the value of your collection based on the antiques' value on the market.

name: Stuff You Should Know
description:
Prove you know your stuff as you take turns answering trivia, each question from a different episode of Stuff You Should Know. The first player to fill their board with one of each category of tokens wins.

Presented by Trivial Pursuit, this game is a collaboration with the hit podcast Stuff You Should Know (SYSK) and their hosts Josh and Chuck.

Plays similar to Trivial Pursuit but without a board, as competitors race to be the first to answer a question correctly in all 6 categories (History; Pop Culture; Myths, Legends, and Conspiracies; Science & Tech; Humans; SYSK Selects)

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Impossible Mode Ghosts
description:
Alternate models, ghost cards, and rules for the three classes of ghost (and two of the bosses) included in the core game - offered as a Kickstarter exclusive add-on during the initial campaign.

Offered through a number of bundles:


10 IM Galloping Ghouls
10 IM Gruesome Twosomes
4 IM Boogoalloo Manifestations
Impossible Mode Bundle (5 x Galloping Ghoul, 3 x Gruesome Twosome, 1 x Boogaloo Manifestation)
IM Bosses (Slimer and Idulnas)

name: Shopping
description:
This is a "Roll & Move" game from 1973, published by John Ladell Co Inc., Canton, Mississippi 39046.

There are 60 Item cards showing things that can be found at a few of the shops around the board.

Each player is dealt 10 cards which they must get rid of by landing on the shops where their items can be purchased.

Additionally, each player "owns" three of the shops round the board, and can force players to draw on of their shopping cards as a kind of "rent".

Also, players may have to pay for parking permits at the Police Station, can get loans at the Loan Companies and the Pawn Shop, and get extra cash at the Bank and the Welfare Office.

The first player to get rid of their 10 shopping cards (their "shopping list") will win the game, as long as they don't have an outstanding loan.

name: 5 Second Rule: Disney Edition
description: It should be easy to name 3 Disney dogs - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time's not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It's all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to "Just Spit It Out!"
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Eye to Eye Junior
description:
How closely do you see Eye to Eye with your friends? Draw a category card and write down three items, trying to match at least one other person for each item you write down. The person who matches the most answers with other players wins!

This version of the SimplyFun classic, is great for everyone in your family Ages 8 and up

Note: To play Eye to Eye Junior, you will need the original version of Eye to Eye.

Expands

Eye to Eye
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Teeko
description:
The game Teko was first released in 1945. Teko is played on a 4x4 grid. The name was changed to Teeko (and the board grid changed to 5x5) for the 1952 release by John Scarne Games.

Each player has four pieces. Players start by alternately placing pieces on a 5x5 grid, then alternate moves (moving one piece each turn to an adjacent point on the grid). Object is to get four pieces in a row, or to form a square with your four pieces.

Teko Junior rules do not allow diagonal moves. A player can win with the same patterns, but can also win by blocking his opponent's 4 pieces from moving (on a 4x4 grid).

In 1998 Guy Steele solved standard Teeko, as well as all variants proposed by the original inventor. The solution was brute force. Standard Teeko (only win with 4 in a row or a 2x2 square) is a draw with perfect play. Advanced Teeko (win with 4 in a row or a square of any size) is a win for the first player.

Reimplementations or successors:

A fully independently developed successor of the game with similar material and quite close winning conditions is Mondrago. Anyway instead of starting from a clean board Mondrago uses a fixed setup of the player's pawns. Besides winning with squares being parallel to board edges Mondrago uses diagonally and obliquely aligned perfect squares as well.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement
publishers: John Scarne Games, Inc., Musto Bros., Inc.

name: Carcassonne Demo
description:
A free promotional demonstration version of Carcassonne. This print and play (PnP) mini-version is distributed free in Poland. Asmodee also released it as part of the PnP series during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic.

In standard Carcassonne, there are 72 tiles and 40 meeples. In this free demo version, there are 48 tiles (that have to be cut out from a sheet) and no meeples (the players have to use some substitutes). Each player needs only 4 meeples.

Generally, most rules are the same. Players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight or on the road as a robber. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

However, there are some exceptions from the basic rules in editions released before 2019:
1) A player cannot place a meeple on the grass as a farmer.
2) The are no cloister tiles.

In the edition released during 2020, 4 cloister tiles are included.
categories: City Building, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Tile Placement
publishers: Bard Centrum Gier, Hans im Glück, Z-Man Games

name: Psychometer
description:
Translated from the box:

Am I ambitious, spontaneous, shy, or even gut-centric? Of course I am! ...somehow ...

But do the others think similar about me?

Psychometer has the final answers for these questions.

Choose from 560 attributes. Three randomly drawn cards are placed side by side. Arrows on the outer cards will point on two attributes on the center card. The player whose turn it is chooses one of these attributes and asks the other players how they rate himself in regard of this attribute (like: "I am funny" or "I make friends easily"). All players (including the active player) secretly rate how much they think that the chosen attribute is correct. The players have numbered cards from 1 to 3 (4, 5 - depending on the number of players) which they play face-down. All cards are then flipped face-up. The numbers are added up, the sum is looked up in a table which will tell which number will grant its player a point. The more the player's ratings are off, the fewer players (if any) will score points. Then it is the next player's turn. Whoever scores eight/ten/twelve points first (depending on the number of players) is the winner.

28 attribute cards (560 attributes)
30 scoring cards
2 cards with scoring tables (depending on the number of players)
30 scoring tokens
Rules

name: Matryoshka
description:
Description from the publisher:

Matryoshka is a colourful game for the whole family. It is simple and easy even for younger kids and grown ups also have fun playing it.

What is the game about?

Here are cute and colourful matryoshka dolls. None of them is the same! And they all have different moves! The dealer has a deck of cards with different colour combinations. Each colour combination card matches the outfit of only one matryoshka doll. The dealer opens the cards one by one and the players search for the matching matryoshka to copy her move. The first one to do this will receive the open card. And then the dealer opens another card…

Does this game develop attentiveness and quick response?

Yes. This game is perfect for younger kids as the players don’t need to take turns – all the players are looking for a matryoshka at the same time. It’s also very important for the kids that a short period of concentration turns to activity.

name: AlakaSLAM
description:
Any sorcerer worth their hat can cast a few spells in the privacy of their home; what sets the pros apart is their skill on the court. AlakasSLAM is a micro card game in which you play a sorcerer competing in the most important tennis match of all: the AlakaSLAM!

Players start with an eight-card hand and use up to three cards per turn to aim, hit, and enchant shots or get extra movement. Careful hand management is key as the cards you use to aim also determine if your ball snags in the net, flies out of bounds, or sets your opponent scrambling. Conserve cards to cautiously build up your mobility, or strike aggressively with powerful enchantments. A well-made shot could spell success — but miscalculate and forfeit the point!

The two-player variant focuses on strategic decisions while the four-player variant is more of a short party game of trusting your partner.

name: We Shall Fight on the Marne: A Simulation of the First Battle of the Marne, 1914
description:
We Shall Fight on the Marne (PnP) is an operational level simulation of the battle of the First Marne, 1914. Having invaded Belgium and north eastern France, the German army had reached within 30 miles of Paris. With victory seemingly near, the German First Army was instructed to encircle Paris from the east. Thus began the battle of the First Marne.

Can the Germans end the war quickly? Or will the Allies push them back? Game features include destroying bridges and building pontoons bridges, cavalry screening and breaking corps units into divisions.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Punto
description:
Punto (Point) is a special bonus for "sweeping the table" as players compete for the most cards, golds, and sevens in this easy-to-learn game.

Punto also comes with rules for Briscola (Trump).

Both are light trick-taking games using a deck of 40 cards- 4 suits (Cups, Gold, Swords and Clubs) numbered 1-10.

Re-implements:

Scopa

name: Space Opera
description:
This board game from Italy is one of exploration, development, war and conquest set in the far future. The players begin fairly far apart and can conquer neutral systems before running into each other.

An interesting aspect of the game is the technology. You keep track of when ships were built on a ship record sheet. Newer ships have better technology and gain a bonus in combat against older ships. You can pick a specific area to develop every few turns: offense, defense, movement, etc. Ships range from transports to fighters to large battlecruisers. Lots of planets to discover and develop - some produce energy, others food, others spaceships, etc.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Castello del Drago
description:
The castle dwellers are in a state of panic. Six dragons are prowling around the area, waiting for the opportunity to conquer the castle. Luckily, though, the valiant knights are on hand to help. By closing ranks and uniting forces, they battle to drive away the dragons.

A very fun game with a dexterity element to knock down the dragons by using a ramp like a cannon.

Castello del Drago is for ages 5 and up.

name: Bacchanalia
description:
Bacchanalia is a narrative game for 3-6 people. Following the rules, each player creates a fictional character – a person accused (justly or not) of a crime against the empire and on the run with her lover. The game starts when the protagonists find themselves passing through Bertinoro, a settlement on the hills of Romagna by the Via Aemilia and close to the Ravenna port.

Unfortunately for them, in that torrid summer, Bacchus and his followers came down to this village surrounded by vineyards. Attracted by the excesses brought forth by intoxication, other gods manifest themselves; cruel Pluto, severe Minerva and the sensuous Venus will play with the destiny of mortals with all the thoughtlessness only gods can have. The player's objective is to reunite with her beloved and run away. Each player in turn draws a hand of cards and, based on the results of the draw, describes a scene from the story for her protagonists. Elements of the scene vary according to which god was more present in the draw. For instance, a scene dominated by Pluto will feature a violent crime in which the protagonist ends up somehow involved. Benevolent Venus reunites lovers. Bacchus brings thrill and excitement, and so on. There is a clear winning condition – reuniting with the beloved and running away before your accuser catches you – but one player reaching it doesn't prevent other players from doing the same; multiple winners are possible.

In the chaos of the bacchanal, will the fugitives be able to reunite with their beloved and get to safety? Or will they meet a harsher end? Will they be caught by their accuser – or will they be lost forever in the rapture of the bacchanal?
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game

name: The Pirate Deck
description:
"The Pirate Deck" is a card game for 2-4 players. Players take turns strategically using pirate cards to board a ship and steal treasure by matching card icons.

Games take only 10-25 minutes to play. The games are quick and lead you to want to play a second round. While this is a light game, there is strategy involved in order to make the best use of the cards in your hand and complete as many coin icons as possible.

Gameplay begins with setting up 5 "Starting Cards" in front of the players in the shape of a shared pirate ship, along with a pile of 25 treasure coins. Players start their turn with three cards in their hand, and take turns playing cards to try to match up coin icons on the ship. Pirate cards can be added to the ship in specific locations, replace other pirates, or be removed from the ship entirely (with adjacent cards being pushed together to close the gap). A variety of other cards add another layer of interest and player interaction to the game. For each silver coin icon matched on the ship, one actual coin is taken from the treasure pile. Two coins are taken for matching a gold coin icon. When the pile runs out, the player with the most treasure coins wins.

name: トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY)
description:
User summary
トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY) is a Japanese card game based on the traditional matching game Karuta.

Topolomemory is a concentration game in which you have to match shapes using the principles of Topology. In it's basic form, topology shows us that a doughnut is the same as a coffee mug.

Lay out the tiles with various images on them and whoever most quickly identifies pairs that match topologically gets to collect the pair. The player with the most pairs wins the game. The game game be played by more than five players, especially in teams.

Publisher's summary
トポロジーを利用して行う、図形の神経衰弱ゲームです。
場に図形が描かれたカードを並べていき、トポロジー的に同じ形のペアを探し、早いもの勝ちで取り合います。
最も多くのペアを集めたプレイヤーが勝利です。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Party Game
publishers: Bandai, Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ), Daiso (ダイソー)

name: Flower Pit
description:
Flower Pit is a game for 2-4 players in which each player tries to earn the most points.

The game uses a stack of "seed" cards and "flower cards". Each square card shows a 2x2 grid of colored fields, with some of the cards having holes cut into the fields. Seed cards have the smallest size holes, and flower cards have larger holes is various shapes.

On their turn, a player chooses either a face up seed or flower card and places it on a communal field following various rules. If the player places a seed card, they'll earn points based upon contiguous groupings of a single color; if they've placed a flower card, they'll earn points based upon the number of levels to the flower.

Play continues until all seed and flower cards have been placed. Each player then reveals and scores a hidden "lucky" card, which will earn that player points for a certain color of field. The player with the most points wins.

name: Snowblind
description:
How do you win a game if you have more control over your opponents’ pieces than your own? Figure out the answer in Snowblind, a quasi-strategic Icehouse game for 4 players.

Object: To maximize your score and minimize your opponents’ scores by putting pieces in taller and smaller stacks, respectively.

You Need:

* Four Icehouse stashes of different colors.
* An opaque bag (or other opaque container).
* A 4×3 grid. A Volcano board or chess board with some squares blocked off works just fine.
* Some paper and a pencil for tallying scores at the end of the game.

On your turn, take a piece out of the bag and put it on the board. When you put a piece on the board, it must point upward. Pieces are played by these rules:

* Any piece may be placed in a vacant space.
* A smaller piece may be 'engulfed' by a larger piece if the smaller piece is resting directly on the board.
* A piece of smaller or equal size may be placed on another piece of equal or greater size.

Once you have placed a piece, play passes to the left. The game ends when all pieces have been played. After this, all the stacks are scored. Stacks have a value equal to the point value of the pieces in the stack, multiplied by the number of pieces in the stack. Points are tallied separately by color. A piece that is 'engulfed' is scored by the color that’s engulfing it, not by the 'owner' of the engulfed piece. Engulfed pieces do not count for being in a stack.

The player with the highest total at the end of the game wins.

Several variants to the rules are also available on the website.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/174/snowblind

name: Math Cat
description:
Meow… meow… Aww, there are so many cute kittens that need to be adopted in Math Cat! But they are only interested to a person who bring their favorite stuff and number (yeah because it's a game of math of course). As a cat lover, you can attract their attention with different kind of lures that you have. Just be cautious that you are not the only one who interested in adopting these cats! So, are you ready to adopt these adorable creatures...with math?

The gameplay is simple. You, as a cat lover, want to adopt a cat by giving them a lure card that has a number on it. When the lure card(s) in play can be calculated equal to the number on the cat card, you deserve to adopt that adorable cat. The game ends when no lure card or no cat card can be acquired. The player who has collected the most cats wins.

There's also a speed mode in which your speed of counting is tested among your peers...but be careful, you must maintain your manner if you don't want those adorable cats run off from you.

name: The 24 Card Game
description: This is similar to 24 Game but public domain and using a standard deck of playing cards. The cards are shuffled and divided equally between four players. The cards become each player's draw deck. Every player simultaneously flip open their top card. Then they try to reach "24" using (+,-,*,/) with the four open cards. J,Q,K count as ten. If any player thinks they have got it, they slam their hand on the table. One can also slam the table to bluff other players into thinking they have the solution. After three players have slammed their hands, the remaining player must choose one of the three players to give the solution. If the chosen player answers correctly, the remaining player takes the four cards and put them at the bottom of his draw deck. If the chosen player has no solution or answers wrongly, he/she must take the four cards and put them at the bottom of his/her draw deck. Game ends when one player exhausts his/her draw deck. If no player can think up a solution (some card combinations cannot form 24), they can all agree to put back their respective cards, reshuffle, and draw a new card from their draw deck. Game ends when one player exhausts his/her draw deck.

name: The Godfather: Last Family Standing
description:
It’s the adult card game you can’t refuse. Based on the original 1972 The Godfather Italian movie starring Marlon Brando and Al Pacino, Last Family Standing is the ultimate adult game. Just when you thought you were out… they pull you back in. Will your family have power over them all?

Play from a hand of cards that allow you to form strategic alliances with the exchange of a rose. Perform actions that have you diving behind cars for cove or take aim at your opponents to gain power and take on other players’ Dons. The last player standing in this fun game will be in charge.

This adult board game is easy to get the hang of and only takes 30 minutes to play. For adults and teens ages 14 and up, get a group of 3-6 people together to play this family game for kids and adults. Play from a hand of cards that will allow you to bump off other players, duck behind a car, make alliances, and run off to Las Vegas or Italy. The player who is the last standing (still has at least 1 orange) wins! Remember, it’s not personal. It’s strictly business.
categories: Card Game, Mafia, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Alliances, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Starship Duel II
description:
This game features combat between the USS Reliant and a Klingon L-9 frigate.

Combat is conducted through the use of navigation wheels that determine the relative heading of each ship as they move. Damage and ship status is kept track of on a ship statistics card. The first player to reduce his opponent's superstructure points to zero wins.

There are also rules for a solitaire target practice game where the player is fighting a drone.

Sequel to Starship Duel I
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Relative Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 13 Doctors
description:
13 Doctors is a stand-alone microgame for 2 players, set in the same settings as Rush M.D.

In 13 Doctors your goal is to guess your opponent's secret Character card before they guess yours. On your turn, you either play a card face-up to perform its ability, or play it face-down and guess at your opponent's Character.

The first player to win 3 rounds wins the game!

name: UNO: The Nightmare Before Christmas
description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Disney movie, "The Nightmare Before Christmas." This version of Uno has an additional card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Oogie-Boogie" card.

name: Transportation Tricks
description:
Transportation Tricks is a trick taking card game wherein the suits and values are separated into two different decks. Players bid to set the value of tricks in the various suits, and then play out the hand as in any typical trick taking game.

Transportation Tricks has been self published (at prototype quality) in an edition of 13 copies. All information on the status of the print run (including information on acquiring copies for however so long they remain available) will solely be available in the Announcements forum for the game here on BGG.

name: Triangular
description:
From the publisher:

"This ingenious new geometric strategy game combines spatial visualization and free form play to give you a rich, complex gaming experience. Points are scored by forming the corners of equilateral triangles, but just seeing the possibilities may strain your eyes! Who knew triangles could be so much fun?"

Content: 1 red triangle, 48 triangles in two colors

The goal of the game is to build major equilateral triangles out of the own smaller triangles.
The player with the most triangles wins the game.
publishers: EKOS, Spektrum der Wissenschaft, Temple Games, Inc.

name: Myth: Shamblers Minion Pack
description:
From the publisher's website:

Undead have always plagued the land, but in recent years they have grown more prevalent. Shamblers are slow moving, mindless foes that react to enemies on an instinctual basis. Killing blows on these abominations are sometimes ignored if their masters are present on the battlefield.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Corner Lot
description: A small economic auction game loosely themed around property investing, but focused on set-collecting and reminiscent of the private auction in many 18xx games.

name: The Forest Dragon
description:
Designed by Rory, aged 9, The Forest Dragon is a fun game of testing your luck and risking everything on the turn of a card.

Dare you explore the forest? It's full of things you need, and there is treasure to be found. But beware! The forest is also full of monsters!

In The Forest Dragon you will create a fantasy world from cards, and then explore it. In a round of the game players lay out rows of cards that make up the world they are going to explore. They take it in turns to reveal one card at a time, and follow instructions on the card: Resources are collected in your backpack. Adventure items also go in the backpack, but help with the adventure. Monsters will end your expedition, sometimes taking items you've collected! You can chose to head home at any time and bank your finds. Or keep going, risking it all! Pushing your luck and knowing when to stop are key.

With amazing art from Rory and his little brother Ben, and with just a little help from their dad, games-industry veteran Jon Hodgson, The Forest Dragon is a fast and exciting game for the whole family!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: Asterix: Zank um den Trank
description: Miraculix brewed potion again. Gauls and Romans are simultaneously at the potion. The players must try to distribute as much potion as possible to the Gauls and not at all to the Romans. Depending on success, there are points. But beware: Obelix also tries to get hold of a sip - and he is not allowed to drink a potion. Who has collected the most Gauling points at the end of the game, wins!

name: AdVenture Capitalist The Card Game
description:
Based on the hit mobile game AdVenture Capitalist!
Have you always dreamed of owning your own business? Being the master of your own destiny? Forming your own multi-national conglomerate to create a world-wide, monopolistic economy? Then AdVenture Capitalist is the game for YOU!

AdVenture Capitalist is played in 4 simple steps:
1) Over 3 rounds, Be the player who has gained the most income from your businesses!
2) At the start of each round you are dealt a Manager which you keep hidden until the end of the round. Managers provide secret boosts to your drafted businesses at the end of the round.
3) Draft businesses to get the best card combo's.
4) Profit.

Choose the right cards and you can dominate the market! The only way to go is UP UP UP!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: Death Charades
description:
Death Charades is a party game that pokes fun at life’s inevitable demise. In timed rounds players draw cards and wordlessly act out the multitude of ways one might meet their maker, seeing how many cards their team can guess before time runs out. If you can play charades you can play Death Charades: Make teams, act out the cards in timed rounds, keep score, don’t actually die. Death Charades is the game where death is the life of the party! We're all going to die someday, so why not have fun while we're all still alive?

Players will split into two teams as evenly as possible. In timed rounds, each player takes 45 seconds drawing one card at a time acting out a cause of death, trying to get their team to guess what is written on the card. No words allowed, and teams alternate until each team member has acted one or two rounds. At the end of two rounds whoever has the most cards guessed correctly wins!

Each copy of Death Charades comes with the game box, 205 death cards, 10 gameplay cards and 4 blanks to write your own deaths.

-description from publisher
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Ancient Empires
description: The game models the growth and interaction of ancient Civilizations. Each player manages the military, political and economic aspects of their state, competing to create the greatest empire in the world. Disasters such as rebellion, invasion or civil war may occur at any time -- players must seek an optimal balance between growth and stability to succeed. Although military affairs play an important part in Ancient Empires, the game is designed so that this aspect does not dominate game play. Movement and combat are abstracted to a strategic level, and players will find that timing is just as important as brute strength to avoid counterproductive warfare. Players must pay equal attention to trade, diplomacy and internal affairs in order to remain strong enough to discourage aggression. Victory Points are awarded for the size of an empire, and the level of development it achieves relative to its peers. Destroyed players retain their Victory Points and may re-enter the game to carve out a new empire.

name: Winchester
description:
Winchester is a race game where the players score points by getting their pawns around a rectangular track the fastest. Each player gets 3 to 5 pawns (based on the number of players) which are placed on a 4 by 4 starting grid. The track is four squares wide. During the setup, the players randomly cover some of these squares with wooden blocks to provide obstacles that prevent movement. The location of the blocks is determined by several die rolls. This random setup provides for a different track each race.

Movement of the players' pawns is controlled by a special six sided chess die. The die contains the six basic chess pieces: King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, Knight and Pawn. Each turn a player will roll the chess die to determine everyone's move for that turn. Once all players have moved, the next player on the left rolls the die for the next round. When moving, the player must move one of his pieces based on the indicated chess piece. Like chess, the player may not move off the edge of the board or over one of the obstacles, except for the knight move. If the player captures one of the piece of another player, the two pieces exchange positions.

The first piece to cross the finish line scores 15 points with each successive piece scoring one less (14, 13, 12, etc). There are small bonuses for certain finishing conditions (first to have all pieces finish, three positions in a row, etc).

The game comes with a rolled up, laminated board, 25 pawns, 24 wooden blocks for obstacles, one normal die and one chess die.

name: Lucky Cat
description:
Lucky Cat is a highly interactive, cozy dice game.

Once upon a time, there was an evil king who only loved one thing — science. He destroyed everything superstitious in his kingdom. All the lucky cat statues were smashed — except one! Shortly after, everyone became cursed and a giant fire ravaged everyone’s homes.

In Lucky Cat, 1-5 friends play as ambitious merchant cats competing to lead the once-thriving kingdom.
Take turns rolling chunky dice that can help or hinder the whole table. Will you play it safe, pay taxes, and carefully reconstruct the lost pieces of ancient lucky cat statues? Or will you take calculated risks, amass hidden wealth, and outsmart your rivals? The people need a new leader. Are you the one?

To win:
Be the first player to have 10 gold.
OR
Be the first player to have 2 sets of lucky cat tiles.

The dice have three faces that give you different resources: coins, broken cat tiles, and reroll cubes. The other faces give money to other players, levy taxes, or let you invest your money in your store (hiding it from the government). The more taxes everyone pays, the more dice everyone gets to roll as the city is rebuilt. The reroll cubes work on yourself as well as other players rolls.

Optional Dexterity rules: In the center of the table, a lucky cat plushie beckons. If any player rolls two cat or two crown symbols, be the first to hit the plushie and you get the broken cat tiles or avoid the heavy tax! Move Fast!

Advanced variable power tiles allow you to manipulate the dice, your cash, and your luck. Take-that advanced powers are entirely optional to include or not. Variable starting conditions allow experienced players to draft different starting resources.

Lucky Cat was designed for big or small groups of diverse friends. There are many paths to victory: strategy, speed, luck, bluffing, and even negotiation. How will you win?

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Demono
description:
A very curious game from Switzerland, designed by "PM" from its novel 'Tripura Transfer' published in Switzerland and Germany. A 2 player tile placement game in which one player represents the Coloured world of the Demons, whilst the other represents the Grey world of Concrete! The tiles have a grey side showing workers, police (baton raised!), managers, houses, schools, factories, offices and computers. The other colourful side shows creatures like penguins, spiders, octopii, cats, mice and more fantastic creatures like chimera, sphinx, dragon, and concepts like death, explosion, ruin, nature, puppet-theater, dice, maze, TV and free-public-radio! The Colour tiles have values, multipliers and different abilities, such as removing tiles, affecting distant tiles and so on. These are not obvious, so constantly refering to the rules will slow the game.
Grey has a starting fund and must buy and place or move tiles to generate income. Colour must turn Grey tiles over to disrupt the boring real world and prevent Grey from finishing with a profit. The game can be made harder for Colour by giving Grey more starting money. A totally weird and original game, very nice production, with lovely tiles painted in a naive style. Rules in German, French and English.

name: G7 Conquest
description:
The ancient legends speaks about the mythical area G7, which will give the absolute dominance to the Empire will conquer it. For thousands of years, two opposing Empires try desperately to find the area. Effortless, because Gods have hidden this mythic area well. Until one day, the scouts bring good news to Emperors: the area G7 is finally revealed.
The Empires are preparing, the armies are gathering around the mythic area for the battle will judge the supreme conqueror...

G7 Conquest is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.
Every player has under their command different martial and Empire units. This can be done by conquering the G7 square or its surrounding squares or by capturing the enemy throne. The game-play has some similarities with the classic chess but it has many prototype elements, such as statistics of strength and dexterity depicted in any unit, powerful cannons which can turn 360o and fire at all directions.
The strength and dexterity attributes of every unit can be changed by the Emperors of each side, with their magic auras when they sit on their thrones.

The designer of the game says that G7 Conquest will be called as the next generation Chess game.

The game box contains:
1 game board
30 martial units
4 cannons
6 Emperors
6 markers for the Emperor's auras
2 player aids
1 manual

name: Battle of Vittoria
description:
Grand tactical Napoleonic game of Wellington's 1813 Offensive.


(from the back of the box:)

Battle of Vittoria features the combination of innovative command control rules and detailed formational rules with an effective morale and organiazation system to produce the tactical detail of a maxi game in a playable format.


22" x 25" three color map, 240 backprinted counters
Game Parameters: brigade level; one hour turns, 500 yard hexes
Revolutionary command control system, employing corps, divisional and brigade movement
Detailed formation rules: six infantry and three cavalry formations
Fire and Melee combat system
Realistic portrayal of morale and organizational effects of combat

name: Fanhunter Freak Trivia
description:
It's a Trivia game with geek categories. The questions are about five categories: Cinema, TV, Comics, Games and Fantasy/Ci-Fi Literature.

The players move around a round board answering geek questions and when they have answered on "Big Question" in each category they proceed to the inner board, where they advance without rolling dice, one space per turn, answering one question for turn. if they keep answering they proceed to the next space. When they get the final space, they have to answer a question of a category chosen for the other players before seeing the card.

The game has a very humoristic look and the rulebook is also written in a humorous way (they provide some rules for playing with teams to a maximum of 25 players, and some rules also to play while drinking).

name: Jenga Pass Challenge
description:
Jenga, but under the tower you have a base with two handles. On your turn you will hold the base while doing the usual Jenga stuff, and at the end of the turn you pass the tower to the next player.

The game also comes with ten more or less silly extra challenges.

—user summary

name: Underleague
description:
Underleague is a fantasy card game set in the smoke-filled city of Helgarten. Players take on the role of breeders assembling a stable of fantastical creatures and mechanical monstrosities, and entering them into illegal pit fights against each other - while also betting on the outcome of these bouts.

In Underleague, each player has a 30 card creature deck. During the game, 3 of these cards will be in play as that player's current stable. Each creature has a unique effect, and a value which contributes to a player's over-all victory points. Each round, players use these creatures to challenge their opponents', while betting on which creatures will win and lose fights. Winning fights results in additional victory points.

There is an additional shared 250 card strategy deck, from which players will draw scheme cards and equipment cards, which can be used to impact the results of fights and the flow of the game. The more correct bets a player makes during a round, the more strategy cards they will be able to draw in the next. The first player to achieve a total of 20 victory points wins the game.

Underleague contains a total of 30 unique creature cards and 40 unique strategy cards. In addition to the basic game mode, it also contains rules for 'constructed' and 'draft' play.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Quiz-It
description:
A Bible trivia game translated from the Dutch game Kwistet. 396 questions about people, places, and events of the Bible.
Answering questions correctly allows players to move their pieces around a Pachisi-like board; the winner is the one to get both playing pieces 'home' first.

Two decks of cards provide different difficulty levels; a third deck (for children) is available separately.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jeu de rébus
description:
Jeu de rébus is a French game. Images are shown on a board and you must match them to create as much rebus as you can before the time runs out. A rebus containing 2 syllables counts for 2 points, 3 or more syllables counts for 5 points.

While the game only provides 5 tokens for five players, you may play as much as you want as long as you provide additional tokens. Great party game for everyone!

Official description from Ludik Québec :

20 images sont placées sur une planche de jeu et le sablier est retourné.

Tu dois inscrire le plus de mots possible en te servant des sons représentés par les images retournées.

Plus tu utilises d’images, plus les points marqués seront nombreux.

name: The Orcfather
description:
"First, there was law and apparent order. But law's reach was limited. In those untouched corners, there was chaos. Chaos can be exploited, can give unimaginable rewards for those with enough courage and ability. Now rival families struggle for supremacy on the streets. I advice you to step aside, or you could find yourself in a shallow grave. You know, family matters belongs to family..."

The Orcfather is a card game based on a fantasy-themed mafia in which a player's characters can be orcs, elves, ogres, undead, dwarves and more. The players form two mafia families that are confronting one another, and each of the families elects its own "godfather" at the start of the game; the goal of the game is to eliminate the head of the rival family.

Each round starts with a planning phase in which players must secretly prepare the actions they plan to take — attack, defend, or business — but players cannot speak to one another during this phase. They must use their intuition to develop plans as a team, predicting the actions of both allies and enemies. Once all players have decided, they act in order.

While the attack and defend actions are somewhat obvious, for the business action players draw from the business deck, gaining cards that enhance their attacks, potentially save allies from complicated situations, and more.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Proch i Stal
description:
"Proch i Stal" (Gunpowder and Steel) is a cooperative board game based on events that took place in 1771-1772 in and around a benedictine monastery located near Cracow (Tyniec). A group of confederates (rebelling against Russian influence in Poland) gained control of the monastery and turned it into fortress. Attacked both by Russian armies they managed to hold Tyniec and to organize numerous attacks on nearby areas. Probably the most amazing of those is conquest of Wawel castle (confederates managed to enter it via old sewer tunnel and took its Russian garrison by surprise).

In the game players take on the roles of officers of confederate forces. Their task is to hold the fortress for specified number of turns (based on difficulty level). They need to organize food for soldiers, support the garrison of Wawel castle, try to keep decent morale among the confederates and most of all prevent casualties among their units. If at any point during the game Tyniec will be left without units to defend it the fortress falls and players loose. Cooperation, planing and a bit of luck is what it takes to win the game.

Player's turn consist of two things. First you draw an event card that will have two effects - one it will control the movement of the Russian forces (reinforcements, advance or press attack on Wawel), second will be actual positive or negative event (that often will give a players choice whether to accept consequences like loosing units, food, morale or discard action cards as a group). Next the player will have a chance to act by playing action card - actions include organizing reinforcement for Wawel, bringing food to the fortress, fighting with Russian units etc. After 4 players turns an upkeep phase occurs - food is needed for soldiers, moral is checked and Russians forces strom the Tyniec.

name: Schafe scheuchen
description: Four "flocks" of sheep (two sheep per player) move onto a meadow, trying to find the juiciest grass. There is also a shepherd dog which influences the moves. A sun disk moves around the game board; when the day is over, the sheep which ate the juiciest grass are the winners.

name: TactDecks
description:
TactDecks - A portable, expandable, easy to learn tactical combat game combining the best elements of card games and miniature-based wargames.

Build a heroic, customized fantasy party out of the included 10 Character cards, or feed your creativity by supplementing with the Series 1 TactDecks Boosters. All Characters have different sets of statistics and powers - find your own unique combination and lay waste to your opponent!

TactDecks is a two-player competitive game where the objective is to eliminate your opponent through a tactical combination of spells, troop movement, and light board manipulation. All components of the game - board, troops, terrain, mechanics - are represented by pocket-sized cards, making TactDecks highly portable and affordable.

Like many traditional miniature based wargames, TactDecks troops are selected based on a total army point value agreed upon prior to the start of the game. In addition to selecting troops, terrain is also chosen from this common point pool. Initial troop selection and terrain placement is considered a tactical component of the game, since some troops may not be fielded by both players.

Combat mechanics are based on Near (adjacent) and Far (ranged) attacks, modified by individual troop prowess. Degrees of attack success are determined by an "event deck."

In addition to physical attacks, TactDecks also features varying spell mechanics, trap placement (with expansion booster cards), and a light melee dueling system incorporating a feature called "Reserves," which also help determine initiative.

TactDecks is easy to learn and scales in complexity based on whatever additional booster sets the players bring to the table.

A single TactDecks Basic Set may be used as a competitive starter deck or split and used by two players with the included optional rules.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Quirkies
description:
Quirkies is a fast-paced game that mixes art, visual perception and reasoning skills. Players stack matching creature cards in order to create sequences and win Quirkies tokens.

The player to the left of the dealer goes first and places one card from their hand onto the matching creature on the Quirkies Board Card. As long as the creature type matches, the card may have any color and any pattern.

If a player succeeds in creating a winning sequence, they may collect a token of their choice and must then play one more card from their hand. Their turn ends after they played that second card, even if they manage to create another winning sequence.
After placing their card(s), the player replenishes their hand back to 6 cards and the turn moves clockwise to the next player.

—description from the publisher

name: Animals Friend
description:
All players are Zoo directors. In order to enhance the communications of different animals, everyone bring his/her own animals and communicate with other animals. Now, bring your animals and start communications...

Animals Friend is a party card game of guessing other's thinking.

Game play:
Place the 11 different master animals as well as the round marker in the center of the table for reference for all players. Every player will get 11 different animals, 1 scoring card and 1 reference card. Every animal has a different scoring condition and provides different scores depending on how easily you can get it successfully. Every round, each player will send out one animal. After all players have sent out one animal, the scoring conditions of every animal are checked.

Game end conditions:
1. 10 rounds is completed
2. At least one player successfully got five animals scored.

name: Xtronaut 2.0
description:
Xtronaut 2.0 captures the real-world thrill and challenges of planetary exploration. This Game of Solar System Exploration gives players ages 8 and up the chance to develop space missions and explore the solar system. The game is a sequel to Xtronaut, our hit board-game launched in 2015. We added new actions, new spacecraft, improved game mechanics, updated missions, and support for six players. It is based on real planetary missions and rocket science. It contains elements of politics and strategy that are inspired by the real situations that space missions face.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Miura
description:
3-player only card game that is a mixture of trick-taking, bidding, bluffing, and melding. The leader can lead, single, pair, 3-of-the-kind, 4-of-the-kind, 5-of-the-kind or full-house. Other player must play the same number of cards face down but do not have to match the hand of the leader.

Then, from the leader, reveal the hand. You only reveal it if you can beat the previous player. Winner takes the point equal to the number of the cards.

Very unique game that requires good hand management.

name: Eager Elephants
description:
In a turn of Vollifanten the active player receives two transparent foils, each with three tree leaves on a 4×4 grid - one of which was drafted by the previous player, the other coming from the draw pile. Of these two, he chooses one to place in his elephant, rotated and flipped as desired, on top of the previously selected foils. The other he drafts on to the next player.

The object of the game is to cover all 16 squares of the 4×4 grid covered with tree leaves.

name: Auction House
description:
Auction House is a game for 2-6 players played over 2-3 turns where 6 lots are bid for each turn. For each lot players submit a secret value token that collectively equals the value for that lot. Players then bid in turn until all but one player have passed. The value is then revealed. If the value is greater than the bid, the winner moves the difference forward on the track. If the value is less he moves back. The winner collects the item token.

After six lots have been auctioned a new turn is commenced with players taking back their value tokens and lots returned for new bids. At the end of the agreed number of turns, the player furthest in profit wins.

The game is hand made from wood and comes in its own self contained hinged box with the board carved onto the lid.

name: Pro Playoff: Professional Football
description:
Pro Playoff - Professional Football lets you be the quarterback in this statistically accurate game that captures, in a unique and uncomplicated form, all the realism, action, and excitement of professional football. Game play involves Offensive play cards which are overlayed on defensive play cards and then a die is rolled to determine the outcome.

Contents:

Playing board
Play diagram cards (12 offensive; 10 defensive)
2 6 sided dice
2 player pieces (1 red; 1 white)
Kicking spinner
Play recorder
2 ball markers
1 yardage marker
Score & statistics pad
Instructions

name: Main Event Wrestling
description:
Main Event Wrestling is mainly a card game that simulates the action at a professional wrestling match. Players maintain a hand of seven cards that when played, allow them to make attacks on their opponents or to defend against such maneuvers.

Each turn, players play "rock-scissors-paper" (called "strike-kick-grab" in this game) to establish who has the right to attack (momentum). Cards are played, with titles straight from pro wrestling moves (Figure Four Leg Lock, Atomic Drops) and quips (Did you see that?!). The cards have different costs and effects, adjusting the wrestler's fatigue markers as the fighters stun, knock down, and try to pin each other. Some allow the wrestlers to seize the momentum and attack. When the players have played all the cards they want, they determine the injuries inflicted onto their wrestlers and refill their hand of cards. When the deck has ran out of cards, the cards that have been played are reshuffled to form a new deck.

The game ends when a player wins the match by having their opponent's wrestler pinned, knocked out, or disqualified. The game also ends when the card deck has been reshuffled as many times as the number of players in the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Set-up

name: Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign
description:
Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign is an operational simulation of the great struggle in 1813 for mastery in Europe. The game allows players to assume the role of Napoleon or the Prussian, Austrian, and Russian monarchs who led the coalition determined to eliminate the Napoleonic hegemony.

Napoleon's Leipzig Campaign recreates the salient features of military operations of this period in an easy to learn, playable, challenging and evenly balanced simulation.

Features:
-Army headquarters rated for span of command, tactical abilities and independent command

-Corps units rated for span of command, tactical abilities, independent command, troop morale, and training

-A combat system that integrates leadership, troop quality and morale, employment of reserves and cavalry, demoralization, rout and pursuit

-The ability to use cavalry in historical roles such as screening, pursuit, and raids

-An operational maneuver map that historically recreates troop marching abilities, restricted lines of communication, the role of fortresses, and the impact of weather

-Careful integration of weather, logistics, movement, and attrition into a playable game system

-Realistic command control restrictions that simulate handicaps and advantages of the respective opponents

-Introductory and Campaign scenarios

-Suitability for use as a campaign game for miniatures players

-Enjoyable solitaire playability

name: Feds 'N' Heads
description:
Feds 'n' Heads is a fairly basic roll and move game based on the designer's own famous comic strip, The Fabulous Furry Freak Brothers. The game bears more than a passing resemblance to Monopoly (collect money for passing go, roll a double to get out of jail or pay $50, etc.) but the board is more sprawling and includes several junctions and special squares. Roll dice and move around the board trying to collect a kilo (35 lids) of grass by landing on specific locations and buying as much as they can afford. When players pass the Home square, $50 is collected from the banker and grass can be stashed at home, protecting the grass from being taken from you by any means. Red squares require you to draw a Burns, Busts, Bummers & Rip-Offs card, while green squares require you to draw a Weird Trips card. Players can also wind up in Jail (roll a double, pay $50 or 5 lid to get out) or at the free clinic (pay $15... Hey, it says FREE clinic!) The winner is the player who, moving his token the number shown on the dice, manages to score 35 ounces and get back Home with it.

Originally published as a fold-out board in Playboy Magazine.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Duel Master 3: The Shattered Realm
description:
Similar in some regards to the Ace of Aces book series, Duel Master takes 2 players, each with their own book, into competition with one another. Play is paragraph based, with each player making their own choices about what they want their character to do.

In The Shattered Realm the gods have decreed that war is inevitable between two of The Ten Kingdoms on the magic world of Orb. Each player assumes the role of leader of one of these two kingdoms. Players must send out their emissaries to surrounding lands to try to gain allies for the final apocalyptic battle.
