An alternate winning strategy is to cause your opponent to have no legal move and even if you do not accomplish this, a large part of the game consists of maximizing your own mobility at the expense of your opponent. As with many Kadon games, multiple variations are provided.

name: Overdrive Arena
description:
Overdrive Arena © is Testors exciting new automobile gladiatorial game. It's pure Motor Mayhem™!
This starter set features everything you need to get started playing Overdrive Arena. Customize one of the included 1/43rd-scale vehicles with armor, missiles or machine guns. Race and battle as a member of one the Motor Mayhem League teams or create your own and struggle to the top of the MML.

name: Crazy Connections
description: Each player gets 10 cards and has to "place his cards on the table by matching up their edges in such a way that all the tubes, pipes and hoses of different colors and sizes are continuous across the edge(s) being matched." If a player cannot match his card, he must draw from the pile. The first player to connect all his cards is the winner.

name: Leap Frogs!
description:
Throw the frogs onto the trampoline so they bounce onto a numbered lily-pad and score you points.

Fast, silly fun for adults and kids.
publishers: Early Learning Centre, International Playthings, Inc.

name: Pardon?
description: This game has some of the mechanisms and goals of backgammon, but is played on a 3 by 15 grid. Like backgammon, the challenge is to move all your gemstone pieces to the opposite side of the board according to the throw of two wood dice, while attacking and avoiding attack by your opponent. Players have to keep two pieces on a square otherwise they can be captured by the opponent and returned to the start, however unlike Backgammon, players miss a turn if they throw doubles with the dice and cannot place more than two pieces on a square. Pieces can be moved sideways, but each square moved is counted, so beware. This game requires strategy and the player who sends their opponent back to the start the most is more than likely to win. Editions are available with gold and silver plated aircraft playing pieces and wooden dice.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Double Exposure
description:
Based on the obscure 1961 game show, each player has a separate but identical picture to identify, both of which are covered with a different twelve-piece (numbered) jigsaw puzzle. A player chooses a number from 1-12 and activates a special spinner. The spinner will tell the player to choose a prize or take up to $50. The round is won by identifying the picture before accumulating $100.

The player with the most cash and prizes after three rounds wins.

name: Im Tropfsteinlabyrinth
description:
Dice driven game about treasure hunting in a labyrinth of caves with a fantasy theme. The game board is more like a book where the pages are cut in four parts with holes in it like in the children's book "The Very Hungry Caterpillar". You can turn them over separately to discover the deeper caves.

Very small print run, the game was published by the author himself.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Par-Golf
description:
"A game which simulates with uncanny accuracy a round of golf over a full 18-hole golf course.

"Par-Golf is a first class family entertainment as well as a challenging diversion for the keen golfer, whether "rabbit" or scratchman."

Those taking part decide whether they wish to play as professional golfers for the par score of 73, or ordinary club amateurs taking between 80 and 100 strokes for a round.

Depending on their situation and the course of play, players draw from either the 52 card pack of Fairway cards, or the 40 card pack of Hazard cards.

Types of games to play include Match Play, Playing to beat "par", Stroke Play, and The Stableford Game.

name: Loco-Motion Memory
description: In this game, players perform an ever increasing number of "Loco-motions". On your turn you draw a card, look at it, place it in your rack so that you can't see it (but the other players can), and then perform the action on the card (such as: snap your fingers, stick out your tongue, or blow a kiss). On your next turn, you do the same thing, but you place the second card after the first and perform both actions in sequence. This ever growing sequence continues until a player makes a pattern mistake and is eliminated. The last player remaining wins the game.
publishers: IRWIN Games, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley, Schaper

name: Patton
description:
This is a Japanese tank tactical wargame set during Korean War, the Arab-Israeli wars and Vietnam War of the 50s to 70s.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies, this wargame features several scenarios.

name: The Battle for the Philippines: Bataan
description: Simulation of the Japanese campaign to capture the peninsula of Bataan with 5 optional scenarios.

name: Nebula 19
description:
Nebula 19 is a combat-oriented space game which features a three-dimensional map and simultaneous movement and combat.

The map has a square grid with numbers along the X and Y axes, and each star and nebula has a number (numbers in the case of nebulae) which gives its position on the Z axis. Many numbered counters are provided to place with ships to show their Z-axis positions.

Two copies of the map are provided, allowing players in a two-player or team game to move their ship counters on the map simultaneously. After movement players compare their maps to determine which enemy ships are in range, and then write down firing and shield usage orders, which are again resolved simultaneously. Using weapons and shields costs energy, which must eventually be replenished at a home base or by borrowing from another ship.

Several levels of play are provided. The basic game is as described. The standard game adds several features - tracking (ships are placed face-down on the map and only revealed when successfully probed), hyperspace movement (conducted off-map), carrier ships, etc. The advanced game adds a few more features, notably supply points, and more importantly allows players to create their own ship designs (ships in the advanced game have 21 different components, allowing for considerably customization).

There are a few optional scenarios, including one which allows for up to four individual players (this requires either additional copies of the map, or some players to write down their moves). Four players can also play the standard and advanced game scenarios in teams, as the forces each contain two different groups of ships.

The original version of the game was published in 1971. A second, presumably revised version was published in 1977.

Nebula 19 was rated "Best SF Space Tactical Game" by The Space Gamer magazine's 1979 Game Survey.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Zatch Bell!
description:
Based on the hit Anime series premiering on the Cartoon Network. Implementing an innovative spell book game system, players in the World of Zatch Bell! conjure powerful spells and unleash magical creatures against their opponents in their quest for supremacy. The starter includes a 32 card deck, special coin and a unique spell book and play mat. Additional cards can be obtained in booster packs.

The spell book is a device where players build their decks in the small book and then turn the pages to cast spells, make attacks and unleash monsters on their enemy.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Think Twice
description:
Think Twice is played on two 6x6 grids each filled with the numbers 1-36 - each player fills one grid as they wish before the game starts.

On a turn a player selects one of the numbers and fills in the corresponding space on each grid. This continues until all the spaces are filled.

Players score for lines of four, five, and six in any direction. In addition, bonus points are awarded on each grid for the player with the largest connected group of spaces: they score the difference in size between this and the other player's largest group on that grid.

name: Polemos: English Civil War
description:
From the publisher's website:

During the middle years of the seventeenth century, the British Isles underwent a period of huge change, catastrophic wars and campaigns, political revolution, social upheaval political experimentation and religious ferment. It was a period when the famous and the infamous made their entries into the history books leaving their legacy and their legends. Names such as Ralph Hopton, William Waller, Prince Rupert, Thomas Fairfax, the Earl of Essex, the Earl of Newcastle, Owen Roe O’Neill, The Earl of Montrose and Duke of Argyll can still evoke fierce loyalties and harsh criticism even today. The characters of those chief protagonists, King Charles I and Oliver Cromwell, are still considered, analyzed and argued over by successive generations of historians.

There is little surprise therefore that the English Civil War has always been a firm favorite for wargamers.

Polemos: English Civil War is unashamedly aimed at large scale actions. It is quite possible to stage, play and complete actions the size of Edgehill, Marston Moor and Naseby in an evening.

The basic playing piece in Polemos is the Base. An army is comprised of a number of Bases and can be built either using historical orders of battle or on Army Lists. Bases are generally grouped into Brigades. Armies can vary in size from around 15 to 50 Bases.

Polemos:ECW is designed to allow the player to represent an English Civil War army using a limited number of bases, each of which represents a tactical element that may act individually. Each base is designed to have enough figures on it to look like a real unit. The design focus eliminates fiddly lining up, precise numbers of figures of musketeers and pikemen etc in favour of a broader approach.
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Hochkirch: 14 Octobre 1758
description: Extremely simple simulation of the Seven Years War battle between the Prussians and Austrians at the Saxon village of Hochkirch. Two pages of rules in French include movement, combat, artillery and morale. Fought on a small but handsome colour map (40x30cm) with 92 counters (incl. 16 markers) which need to be mounted. Published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 39 - Aug 1987).

name: was is'es?
description:
Main part of this game are 507 cards with rebus-puzzles. In their turn, players roll a die to get near the goal. If there are spezial signs on the landing field, they get a riddle-card and an hourglass-time to solve it. Success leads to advancement on the plan. First player in goal solving a "master-puzzle" wins.

The puzzles are all in German and therefore not language-independent.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nuclear Destruction
description:
A number of major (player) countries and minor (non-player) countries fight it out to the death. In order to win, a player must destroy all opposing populations while retaining at least 1 million in population.

Originally designed as a play-by-mail game, this version came packed with turn build sheets, missile and factory counters, and money.

Also sold at some point as Negotiate or Die!
mechanics: Negotiation, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Everest
description: Each player guides his team of 3 small climbers up the two foot tall, steep mountain. They place spikes which, along with ledges, are used by climbers to keep hold and scale the mountain. The team's climbers are joined to each other by "rope" (string). Dexterity is important, as players use a rod to hook and lift climbers, one at a time, onto the spikes and ledges. The winner is the first player to get one climber to reach the summit.

name: Regatta
description: Command a colorful fleet in this dazzling game of pattern recognition. With 55 different races and two levels of exciting game play, Regatta is the ultimate single-player game for all ages. Pick a card, and place your crew in their boats and columns according to color and size of each boat, with the captain at the bow. Now, as fast as you can, rearrange your crew and boats to match the colors in each column-but never move the captain or sail a boat to another row. once all crew members are rearranged into solid color vertical columns, you've won the race. Includes 55 cards, 22 boats, 80 colorful crew members and an ocean-blue game board with built-in card holder and boat trays. Grades 1+ Ages 6+

name: Victory at Sea
description:
Victory at Sea is a set of privately published miniatures rules from 1971. The rules simulate ship-to-ship tactical combat from 1898 to about 1970. Compared to more recent rules sets, these rules are almost just an outline. The heart of the rules are several sets of charts for gunnery, torpedoes and movement.
The to-hit system uses a 2D6 roll compared to a chart that gives "chances per 36" for a hit.
There are three scenarios included: Coronel, 1914; River Plate, 1939 and Denmark Straits, 1941. A photocopy sheet has 1:1200 ship plans to cut out for those who don't have miniatures.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Holding: The Financial Game of Chinese Boxes
description:
The financial game of Chinese boxes.
The target of the game is to acquire the absolute majority (160)of the shares. You must go around the board collecting shares and creating new societies and holding companies. Four circuits around four countries give different risk features and you have to manage black funds, bankruptcy, transfers of capital, purchase of shares and the majority of companies. The movement on the board is made by dice rolling.

Note: it is strongly suspected that this game is identical to Capital Power: The Financial Game of Chinese Boxes. But until someone can compare the two boxes and their contents, we should keep two entries in the database.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Montjuic 1641
description:
Game found in Alea Magazine #25 along with Las Dunas 1658. Uses the Thirty Years War Quad rules to simulate the battle fought out near Montjuich castle in Barcelona pitting the Spanish Tercios against a Catalan Rebel force supported by some French units.

Expands

Thirty Years War

name: Fridolin Fuchs
description:
There is unrest on the farm! Fridolin Fox is on the prowl. All animals run and hide in the bushes. Save the animals by bringing them into the safety of the stable. Who will save the most animals before the fox finds them?

There are 7 tiles with bushes placed on the table. Upon these bushes there are placed six sound devices. So one bush isn't occupied. When a player pushes on the devices it makes the sound of an animal. (dog, cat, duck, frog, rooster, pig). Then the 30 cards are shuffled and placed, face down, around the bushes.

In a players turn, the player turns around a card and must find the correct animal sound. When the player has turned on a device, the device is moved to the empty bush. If the sound and the card are matching, the player keeps the card and plays again.
If Fridolin Fox is the turn end. The player places the fox on the foxholes. The game ends when all six the foxes are found.

The player with the most cards wins the game.

name: Four Lane Road Racing Game on the Sebring Track
description: Road racing game using safety spinner, black marker signals, road condition cards and mechanical defect cards to affect play.

name: Transet
description:
Transet is a chess variant played on a 5x5 grid using 5 pieces: rook, bishop, king, bishop and rook. The goal of the game is to reach the opposite side of the board with one of your pieces. The rook can only move one step straight forward, the bishop one step diagonally forward and the king combines the power of the rook and the bishop.

The game only has 5 rules. A small change in rule 1 or 5 (which determine begin & end conditions) makes that the game can be played with 1, 3, 4 or 5 players. The game is published in different versions, only changing color and artwork.

name: Matchbox Crash Game
description: Crash is a fairly basic roll and move car racing game by Matchbox, a company better known for making model cars. It had two points of interest: the racing circuit was a figure of eight, and the playing pieces were actual metal model cars.

name: Cripple Mr. Onion
description:
Cripple Mr Onion was originally a fictional card game played by characters in Terry Pratchett's novels Wyrd Sisters and Witches Abroad. This was used by Dr Andrew Millard and Prof. Terry Tao as the basis for an actual card game. The complete rules and design of this game were posted on USENET around 1993. It contains elements of blackjack and poker.

The rules as posted on USENET were approved by Pratchett himself.

The most notable aspect of the game is that it requires an eight-suited card deck: a deck using the normal suits (clubs, hearts, spades, and diamonds) must be shuffled together with a deck using the Spanish (and Tarot) suits (staves, swords, cups, and coins) yielding a complete deck with eight suits.

Each player receives a hand of ten cards: five cards are dealt face-down to each player, and the player may then discard up to four of them, receiving new cards to replace them. Then a further five cards are dealt face-up to each player except the dealer, who receives his face-down. The first player begins by assembling his or her cards into one of the winning groupings described below, and displaying them. The next player must then create a more valuable grouping or fold. If the player is successful in creating a more valuable grouping, the original first player may try again to create an even more valuable grouping for themselves, or fold. This process passes left around the table until only one player remains, who then wins the hand.
publishers: (Web published), The Fat Pack Playing Cards Company

name: Über Stadt und Land: Der Fliegende Musketier
description:
("Cross-country - The Flying Musketeer")

Game published by the German Pilsener beer brewery Wicküler in 1973. Theme is an Airship race across North Rhine Westfalia, one of the largest federal states of Germany (the theme is hardly surprising, as NRW was the brewery's location - and is, after an owner change - and their main means of advertising in the 1970s was a large blimp, named the Flying Musketeer, with their logo on it - three musketeers - cruising around the state).

The players move their dice- and action cards-driven silver plastic airships and plastic player tokens around a large map, reaching several cities in a predetermined order, while completing different tasks. Their tokens (plus same tokens in other colors representing items such as beer barrels and tow ropes) can be stacked below the airships in order to raise them above ground, which gives a good indication of who is on the winning path.

The game had extremely good manufactured components, oversized dice and playing cards printed on thick game board stock. Probably manufactured by Schmidt-Spiele.

name: Professor Noggin's Freshwater Life in North America
description:
Everything young naturalists need to know about life in the ponds, lakes and rivers of North America. Learn about River Otter, Wood Ducks, Mosquitoes, and Snapping Turtles.

Card topics include:
Alligators
Amphibians
Beaver Pond
Birds
Birds of Prey
Bogs
Crustaceans
Dragonflies and Damselflies
Ducks
Everglades
Fish
Frogs
Giant Water Bug
Herons
Insects
Leeches
Mississippi River
Mollusks
Mosquitoes
Nesting Birds
Pond Fish
Pond Mammals
Pond Plants
River Otters
The Surface of a Pond
Turtles
Under a Microscope
Wetland_Conservation
What is a Wetland?
Whirligigs
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Truffle Shuffle
description: Just because all the players share the same chocolate factory, it doesn't mean that they aren't out to gain their own sweet rewards. The factory produces six different chocolaty products. Players bid for shares to control the sales of the different goods. Then, they take turns placing workers along the production line to determine what goods will be produced. Once four products are ready to ship, the sale is made, and the players see who has earned the biggest chunk of change.

name: Panasonic European Open Golf
description:
Played over 18 scale plans of the famous Sunningdale course, this golf simulation allows Stroke play or Match play.

Unlike normal golf sims where a square grid is superimposed over a map, this game involves a clear plastic cursor to be targeted and positioned anywhere. Club accuracy and resulting ball position is assessed by card draw and ball position is plotted with a fine pen (wipes clear).

In this way infinite possibilities can result in what must be the most realistic golf themed board game developed.

name: LOST The Card Game
description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit ABC TV show LOST. You will attempt to play crucial event cards whilst avoiding the 'Others', wild boars and Polar Bears...

To get this game for free, go to the address below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

SPOILER WARNING: This game contains information and pictures from LOST episodes which may not have been screened in some countries; enter at your own risk.

LOST is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Team Work: Fußball 2
description:
How's this supposed to work again? What happens when a team of two explainers are supposed to describe a concept but can only say the sentences together? But it gets better: the players can't discuss what they want to say ahead of time and must build the sentence while alternating words! A good time is guaranteed because the rest all try to figure out what the concept is at the same time. Who will have the most points?

This set of Team Work "Fußball 2" covers the topic soccer.

Expands:

Team Work Original

name: HeroCard Champion of New Olympia: Talon Expansion Deck
description:
From the back of the box:

TALON EXPANSION DECK
Talon hunts his prey using his uncanny instincts and his deadly arsenal.

Talon is a HeroCard Expansion Deck for HeroCard Champion of New Olympia, the ultimate fight for glory. Talon can compete in any HeroCard game or be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

CONTENTS
33 Character Cards
1 Figure

Expands

HeroCard Champion of New Olympia
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Steam and Steel: Quick Play Rules for Naval Warfare 1880-1906
description:
Steam And Steel 1880-1906 - Quick Play Rules for Naval Wargames

48-page booklet.

Steam and Steel is a simulation of naval warfare from the development of the pre-dreadnought battleship in about 1880 to the launch of HMS Dreadnought in 1906. The rules may be used to simulate actions involving ships built before 1880 with some loss of realism, but the gunnery tables are not intended to simulate either the centralized fire control of the large main armament of dreadnought battleships or battlecruisers.

Also available (but not necessary for play):

Steam and Steel Ship Lists

52-page spiral bound booklet, published 1992. Originally published in Brassey's Naval Annual 1905.

This companion volume to the Quick-Play rules contains almost the complete list of every nations warships, armored ships, cruising ships, torpedo boats and submarines. Details are provided of displacement, dimensions, H.P., where built, makers of engines, launch and completion date, cost, amour (including location), armament, speed, coal capacity and complement.

name: Napoleon
description:
The game "Napoleon" was included in Spielbox 6/86 as part of the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series.

Thought as an introduction to Cosim games, this game has simplified wargame rules. Anyway, the Allied and French forces enter play according to a detailed time plan.

The hex board is somehow exchangeable for Napoleonic battles, because no village names are marked on it and the victory conditions are not different for the 2 players (like in most Napoleonic games).

The game ends after 20 rounds and the object of the game is to score the most points, which are won by capturing opposing forces or occupying certain map points at the end of the game.

name: El Juego de los Ciclistas
description:
This Spanish cycling game has beautiful luxurious miniatures cyclists made out of lead (15 of them, 3 for each player). There are also 12 pieces that form the board (either an oval or another track that can be assembled with the pieces). When the oval is formed it measures 90x60cms. The rules are relatively simple. Each player rolls dice for his cyclists, cyclist who are in the wheel of another cyclist may follow without rolling a die, each time a cyclist stays in the slipstream he wins a chip. The maximum number of chips a player can win is 5. These chips can be used at any time to alter the result of a dice roll.

There are 2 different editions of this game that circulate around, the difference is in the colors of the cyclist's jerseys.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Tripoley: Criss Cross Poker
description:
From the publishers website:

Tripoley® Criss Cross Poker
The fastest poker game you will ever play! Criss Cross Poker allows players to play 10 hands of poker at the same time using Cadaco's uniquely designed card stands. No more shuffling between hands or waiting for cards to be dealt. Includes 4 card stands, 1 betting mat, 2 card decks, and 200 poker chips.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Card Game
description: Scooby Doo Mystery Card Game, capture a villain but don't get caught. Features, Scooby and the gang and of course the villains. For ages 4 and up.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: The Gamers Constellation
description:
At the beginning of the game only the "Moon" tile is on the "night sky" board, and players will progressively add "Stars" tiles to the board. There are 3 different kind of Stars (4, 5 or 6 branches).

Each player has his own secret goal telling the shape of the Constellation he must realize on the board. To be valid, a Constellation must be made of only 1 type of Stars, and must include the Moon tile.

The winner is the first player who has his own Constellation appears on the board.

The Gamers Constellation uses the same game mechanics as Xochintlan and 6x5.

This game is available for free download on the author's website.

Note from the author: After having inserted this game in the BGG database, I realized there's another game named Constellation, from Hans van Halteren and published in 2003. The two games look very similar in many aspects... This is only pure coincidence !
Mine is derived from the original "Fountain of the King" that I originally designed in 1995, which transformed into Xochintlan, then 6x5, and now the Gamers Constellation. I thought this was a great and original idea ... well, my bad !

name: Think: Cocktail
description:
Players try to find the right ingredients that are specified on a given cocktail card by simultaneously collecting tokens.
All players act in real-time in this game. The tokens for ingredients must be collected in a specific sequence.
The player that can finish a cocktail card first collects the card for points.

name: Les Pierres d'Ica
description:
The game set in Peru were ancestral stones have been found. The stones could call into question the foundations of man… or they could be a trick to gain tourist. Your archaeologist and scientist have to decide on the truth by taking their discoveries to the laboratory.

The object the game is to find different kinds of tiles and earn the most points.

This game is a free print and play game.

Home Page: http://www.neuroludic.com/ica/ica.html

name: Battles for Empire
description:
Battles for Empires is a Napoleonic miniatures system that is designed to move more quickly than many systems. It is focused primarily on small unit tactics and historical accuracy. Each turn represents 10 minutes, and each inch represents 50 yards. The system is simple and centered on tactics. The effect of individual leaders is also strong in the game.

The rules are well illustrated with photo examples throughout, with over 100 photos total. The rules are 40 pages long and 6 two-sided charts are included with the book.

Optional rules include rules for a variety of artillery and weather.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nocturno
description:
Winner of the 2006 Italian game design contest Mysteria, Nocturno is a fast paced board game for 3/4 players.

Night falls over De Mortis Plaza and incautious human beings find themselves involved in the eternal struggle between supernatural creatures. Blood-thirsted vampires, putrid Zombies and werewolves will be the actors of a terrible dance of death. Who will survive this full moon night?

UPDATE: Nocturno is now free in its english edition! Feel free to download the files from the "Files" section of this page. Enjoy!

name: Charge!
description:
Charge is a wargame set in the 1800's pitting the French Empire versus the British.

Description from the box :

LIKE MARSHALS OF THE FRENCH EMPIRE

The players align their armies before sunrise of a great battle day. In each camp the troops are drawn up for combat :

12 units of infantry
6 units of cavalry
6 units of artillery
3 units of pontooneers
1 quarter master


and finally the General Staff, the principal piece of the game.

Assaults of hills, crossing of rivers, taking of fortresses, turning movements. Thanks to more than a hundred beautifully finished pieces, representing the army corps, and thanks to the super-giant battlefield of more then 2.000 squares, "Charge" becomes the most exciting of all strategy games.

name: Firefly Card Game
description: Play events and actions on each other while trying to do the job, get paid. First one to amass 1000 credits, wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Climb On!
description: Score more points than your opponent by climbing your largest dice as far up the mountain as you can before the game ends.

name: Millennium 3D Chess
description:
Over the years, there have been numerous attempts to develop rules for three dimensional (3D) chess using three standard 8 by 8 chess boards (3x8x8), however, many of these games suffered from major problems that distracted the players from the essential characteristics of traditional chess. Some of these 3D chess variations created new chess pieces while other 3D rules imposed mandatory or unusual moves. In addition, many of these "rules" were generally incomplete causing inconsistent interpretations. None of these game variations offered a truly playable chess game.

Because of the lack of playable rules, the Millennium 3D Chess rules were written with the objective of extending the traditional chess game into a multilevel environment without distorting the basic game. To this end, Millennium 3D Chess has not "created" new chess rules, but instead extended the traditional rules to allow for multi-board play. Other than the concept of moving between chess boards (levels), all traditional two (2D) chess rules apply.

name: Das große GEO-Quiz
description:
This is a trivia game with over 1000 questions divided into five categories: Humanity, Earth, History, Technology, and Nature. Players move around the board trying to correctly answer questions so that they can earn chips from each area. The chips are used to surpass obstacles along the way, and players can rearrange the obstacles on the game board. The first player to reach the last square on the board wins.

There are several aspects of the game that make it family-friendly. The first is that questions can be answered in multiple-choice style so that players can try to deduce the answer rather than having to know the fact directly. The second is that there is a catch-up mechanism which boosts the player in last place so that they can compete more effectively.

name: Monopoly: Hard Rock Cafe
description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the restaurant chain of Hard Rock Cafes. The game includes 6 Custom Pewter Tokens (Hurricane Glass, Motorcycle, Hamburger, Guitar, Guitar Pick, and Saxaphone)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cat and Mouse
description:
A simple roll and move game in which mice grab the cheese race to finish before being caught by the cats.

Contents:
1 Built-in-the-Box Game Board
8 Cat Catchers
1 6-Sided Die
4 Red Mice
4 Blue Mice
4 Green Mice
4 Yellow Mice

name: Leatherneck II
description:
This is a sequel to Leatherneck which was developed by SS-Bar but distributed by Critical Hit. Leatherneck II was developed and published by Critical Hit. Originally published in 1998, a second edition was released in March 2005 which included tweaked scenarios, improved artwork and also incorporated the errata which had risen.

8 scenarios featuring the US Marines and the Japanese in the Pacific Theater during WWII.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Connecto
description:
(Translated from the box in Norwegian)

A different trivia game!

What is missing in the statement?

You will be presented song lyrics, titles, rankings, quotes, sayings and abbreviations where one, two or three words are missing, depending on level of difficulty.
You do not pick categories, so general knowledge is gold.
You may win 250 000 quite fast by gambling at difficulty level 3, but arrogance might bring you down, and you may fast descent to bankruptcy if the gambler in you takes the upper hand.
You have to position yourself on the board, use tactical maneuvers and be on guard, so your opponents do not bluff when they say they want to help you. Logic is a handy tool, but will not help if you are totally blank on song lyrics. Your opponents are ready to help, but can you trust them?

The game Connecto gives you a chance to shine with knowledge you did not even know you possessed. Let yourself get carried away with song lyrics and do deep dives into logical rows of numbers.
Place countries correctly by area and refresh the sayings you thought you had forgotten.
Will you be the first player to reach 250 000?

name: Capt'n Gold Tooth
description:
The players try to count quickly and correctly certain
characteristics on their pirates' cards. Only the quickest gets a pi-rates' card. Whoever at the end of the game has the most cards in front of them, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Number, Pirates

name: Käfer Kunterbunt
description:
(From the box):

Ladybug is dressing up for the spring party: she flies from child to child to collect white, blue, yellow, and green dots. Who will the ladybug be with when the last color dot is placed?

name: Nosies im Kinoland
description:
The little "nosies" are all over movieland - seemingly hundreds of them in various movie costumes all over various movie sets.

Kids take turns drawing image disks out of a bag and try to locate the image on 3 large "Where-is-Waldo?"-like boards. Once a player finds the image he/she will slam their magnifying glass onto it. If it's correct, the player gets to keep the image disk as a token. Many images are tricky to find because all the little "nosies" slightly differ in body position, nose color, costume color, etc. If the player pointed out the wrong image, he/she will have to pay one of their tokens. At the end of the game, the player with the most tokens wins.

The game comes with 4 games boards, 7 plastic magnifying glasses, 1 bag, 138 image disks, 1 rule book.

name: Fayles
description: A game played in England and Spain beginning in the thirteenth century. The game was played using the board and components from a Backgammon set, however three six-sided dice were required. All fifteen checkers were used, except the starting position is different than in backgammon - each player places two checkers on their first point and thirteen checkers on the sixth point from the opponent's side of the board. The object of the game is to be the first player to move all of your pieces off the board. However, there is a sudden death rule: if a player throws a number on a die which cannot be played, that player immediately loses. The three dice could be combined for a single move or used separately for three different moves.

name: Puppy-opoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Players adopt puppies as they make their way around the board. Woof! Woof! Little kid game play includes barking the number of treats owed when landing on a space, “high pawing” other players, balancing treats on noses. This is a younger version of a property trading game where FUN is the rule and silliness is a must! Flip the deeds over and learn a fun fact about each breed and a puppy training tip too!

For ages 5 to 8.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Cinemasters
description:
From the publisher:
...the "reel" fan's trivia game.
A movie trivia game for fans of almost all ages.

After watching thousands of movies, you decide that it's time you appeared on screen. You study films. You audition roles. You succeed. You fail. Finally, you get the part you've been after! Will you get your name in lights and become immortal on the screen?

Move along the game board on your road to fame and fortune by answering questions about all those movies you loved and you hated. What makes the Cinemasters game unique is it contains over 120 different categories of questions with over 2,000 questions.

name: Kubus Fidibus
description:
from the rules:
"Bobby Butterfingers pulls at his wizard’s coat. This time he must not spoil his magician’s exam. Slowly and carefully, he takes the big magic cube from the pedestal. 'Now, how did that correct spell go?'. Then he remembers. With a firm voice he shouts 'Butterfingers Cube', takes his magic ring and lets it skillfully fall into the cube. The other apprentices hold their breath - if nothing falls out of the cube, Bobby will pass the test.

Whoever can hold the magic cube with a steady hand and skillfully let the objects fall inside, will be left at the end of the game with the fewest objects in front of them."

name: Dragon Checkers
description: Variant rules adding card play to Chinese Checkers. The variant uses a deck of 40 custom cards. There are three types of cards in the deck: Move Cards, Destiny Cards, and Special Cards. Move Cards are used to make one or more pieces move in ways they don’t normally move. Destiny Cards affect other cards, the deck, your hand, or your opponent’s hand of cards. Special Cards have various “special” effects.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Reels & Deals: The Movie-Making Card Game
description:
Reels & Deals: The Movie-Making Card Game is an ideal game for a mixed level gaming group. The game is suitable for ages 10 and up and has wide conceptual appeal.

Players start with script cards from the Comedy, Drama, and Action genres - these function like "recipes". Then they raise funds and compete in Bidding Wars to assemble their casts. Players choose from over 60 unique Actor, Actress, and Director cards. Each character is a parody on a pop culture figure and has its own full-color illustration.

Children and casual gamers will enjoy the art and parodies, while more serious gamers will appreciate the game's smooth operation and strategic elements.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Phantoms of the Ice Sonderspieler
description:
This is a mini expansion for Phantoms of the Ice containing two cards Chameleon and Hydra, both of whom are forwards, and the special rules applying to them.

Expands:

Phantoms of the Ice
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Opulent Chess
description:
Opulent Chess is a chess variant similar to Christian Freeling's Grand Chess, but with an improved Knight, and two new jumping pieces (the Lion, and the Wizard.) The game is played on a 10×10 board

The Knight moves like a standard Chess Knight, with the added ability to step a single space horizontally or vertically. The Knight is still forced to move to a square of the opposite color with each move.

The Wizard piece is a color-bound leaper invented for Omega Chess. It can make a (1, 3) leap, or move a single space diagonally. Like a Bishop, the Wizard remains on squares of the same color throughout the game.

The Lion is a piece invented by Ralph Betza, which he called a Half-Duck. It has been used recently with the name 'Lion' in games by David Paulowich. This piece may leap either 2 or 3 squares horizontally or vertically, or may step a single space diagonally. This piece stays on squares of the same color except when it makes the somewhat awkward (0, 3) leap.

The Chancellor is a compound piece combining the moves of the Rook and the Orthodox Chess Knight. The Archbishop is a compound piece combining the moves of the Bishop and the Orthodox Chess Knight .

This material was gleaned from www.chessvariants.com

name: Duality
description:
From the box: Duality is an easy to learn two player strategic card game. Be the first to build an unbroken path to your opponent's side. Add or replace cards to improve your path, but be careful, your moves may help your opponent as well.

The goal of Duality is to be the first to form a connected path of your color (black or white) from your side of the table to your opponent's side.

- 1 metal game box
- 1 double-sided instruction sheet
- 43 Duality cards

name: Großwildjagd in Afrika
description: A game about hunting animals in Africa. Players roll dice and move their meeples. On many spots on the gameboard they can take a chance and shoot at elephants, lions, ... For each "killed" animal they get counters worth from 1 point for a jackal up to 80 points for an elephant. Animals, which give many points are harder to kill than animals which give less points. All in all there are 29 different animals. During some actions the hunters also can die. When the surviving hunters are back in the native village, the one with the most points wins.

name: Dawn of the Rising Sun: Ship Forms
description: 56 page booklet which includes a form for every ship class, including the Royal Navy ships, found in the data annex. All forms include both profile and deck plan. As a bonus, a CD will be provided with the information in PDF format so that it can be printed with ease.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Easy Slider
description:
Easy Slider is the first game in a new Piecepack genre: the "B.Y.O.P.", or "Bring Your Own Piecepack" game. It can be played solitaire, or with as many players as there are Piecepacks available. It can even be played over the phone or via online chat.

Players agree on how many rounds of the game they will play. (Three is a good number for beginners.) On each round, a Caller is chosen. (Callers need not rotate.) The Caller creates a random layout of tiles and randomly designates a strict order in which the tiles must be placed. All players then try to slide the tiles on their boards one at a time into the proper positions. The player who does so the fastest over the specified number of rounds is the winner.

name: IceFrogs
description:
IceFrogs is an abstract strategy game for 2-3 players. Players jump their pyramids across the board in an attempt to get a piece into their opponent's start space. Two Icehouse stashes and 37 poker chips (or other round discs) are required.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: Lion In A Net: Saratoga 1777
description:
General Burgoyne has to get his army of 8,000 British and Prussian troops to Albany to join forces with General Howe before his supplies run out. But blocking his way is a force of Americans under Horatio Gates and Benedict Arnold. Will he break through or will he be a lion caught in a net?

Lion in a Net: Saratoga 1777 is a simulation of historical events of September-October 1777 near Saratoga, New York intended to give a feeling for the historical decisions required by the two army commanders in a mini-game format.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Robotics: Die neuen Robotics-Marken
description: Additional tiles for Robotics included in Spielbox issue 2/2008

name: Sweet Teeth
description:
Sweet Teeth is Small Box Games' first dedicated game for young children.

The Gobbins are great candy makers, but, making candy makes them sleepy, and they are notorious sleep eaters! Players play Gobbin cards to try to keep their Gobbins awake and put the other player's Gobbins to sleep. Players can place Candy cards on their awake Gobbins, but if a Gobbin goes to sleep, all of the candy gets eaten!

name: Civcards
description:
In Civicards players must manage their civilization effort to try to achieve more progress and maintain the stability of its people. To do this, along 4 different eras, they must fight their opponents to achieve the greatest possible number of civilization´s cards, progress in the development of its civilization and achieve victory points. At the end of the game a player with the highest number of victory points wins

Components:
100 effort´s cards
108 civilization´s card
8 cubes of each players´ colors
3 6-sided dice
Gold coins
5 leadership marker
12 civilization bonus
Board
Rules

2008 Winner Concurso de diseño Granollers - Fira JugarxJugar

The game is complete in spanish language

name: Bill Nye the Science Guy WAY COOL GAME O' SCIENCE
description:
Bill Nye’s Way Cool Game O’ Science is the most fun you can have in a lab. This game is fast and the science is hip. Your objective is to get security clearance into NYE LABS and become the Resident Scientist in as many labs as possible.

You’ll be challenged for these labs by other scientists, so you’ve got to know your stuff. As if that isn’t enough, you may have to face Bill in the NYE “Q” TEST. This game is so intense, it makes Bill’s head spin!

Explore the Universe in the Vastly Hugely Big Space Lab…Get wise to what makes you tick in the Hip Happenin’ Human Lab…Discover cool facts and information about this rock we live on in the Exceptionally Excellent Earth Lab…The Big Bubblin’ Bio Lab tells you all about the critters in the world…Freaky Fun Physics and Kooky Cool Chemistry will amaze you…Put on your lab coat and let’s have some fun with science!
categories: Animals, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: Baranarab Innovations, Inc., Northern Games Co. Ltd., Walt Disney Productions (Disney)

name: Pi-Rats
description:
From the back of the box:

"Shiver me timbers! Salty sea-rats are everywhere and they are carting off cheesy booty by the barrelful! Protect your cheese while you try to steal other players' treasure. The bucktoothed buccaneer with the most cheese wins!"

name: Universo
description: In the year 4051 man is now master of the universe: the discovery of ultra-light travel has allowed the colonization of space. But human nature has not changed at all and even new rich people live in colonies where populations continue a silent struggle for ultimate power. In Universo, players build galactic civilizations by exploiting the ways of politics, the strength of armies, the simplicity of religion and the inevitability of the economy. By using action cards of 4 powers each player can conquer the inhabited planets and interact with other players to gain the absolute control of the known systems.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Black Hole: Escape
description:
This game is a two player game. Game is played on a 5x5 board. The middle square of the board is accepted as a black hole.
The aim of the game is to land firs two of game pieces on this center hole.
Each player has four space ships in his/her own color. At the beginning of the game players places their pieces on the board as seen in the game picture. Each piece can move horizontally or vertically. Diagonal moves are not allowed. The ships are in a weird dimension and their brake motors are not working. For this reason if a piece is moved, must move until stopped by an other piece or by the borders of the board. Players try to land their ships on the black hole. The ship landed on this square pass to another dimension and removed from the board.The ships can pass over the black hole, but for removing it must land on this square. The player who rescue first his/her two ships from this dimension win the game.

name: Galapagos
description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. The game consists of three phases as follows:

1. Melds. In Phase 1 you both try to improve your hands by bidding for new cards from the stock. When none remain in stock, you score for any melds (card combinations) contained in your revised hands. This phase is rather like Gops.

2. Tricks. In Phase 2 you play out your revised hands to 13 tricks, aiming especially to win an odd number of tricks (1, 3, 5 etc). This phase is rather like Piquet.

3. Play-off. Finally, you each pick up as a new hand the 13 cards you used for bidding in the first phase, and aim to be the first to play out all the cards from your hand. This phase is rather like Arsehole / President / Trouduc.

name: Ximaera
description:
Ximaera is played on a 3x3 hexagonal board.
There are,off board,sets of three stones for four different types(a total of 12 stones).The stones of one type are called pivots.All stones are neutral and can be used by either player.
On each turn,each player must drop or move one stone.
Pivots may also jump over an adjacent stone.
A player wins by:
1.Connecting three stones of the same kind.
2.If he has no valid move.
3.Opponent repeats a board position for the third time.

name: Battle of Lake Erie, September 1813
description:
"The Battle of Lake Erie, sometimes referred to as the Battle of Put-In-Bay, was fought on September 10, 1813 on Lake Erie off the coast of Ohio during the War of 1812."

"Under light and variable winds, nine American vessels under the command of Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry challenged the British Commander Robert Barclay’s squadron of six vessels for control of the lake. Whoever controls the lake controls the movement of troops and supplies along the border between British Canada and the United States. Victory goes to the side disabling or sinking the most enemy vessels."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using miniature ships. Free print-and-play paper miniatures designed to accommodate the unusual combat resolution system are available on the Junior General site.

The British Royal Navy order of battle consists of two ships, a brig, two schooners, and a sloop. The United States Navy has three brigs, five schooners, and a sloop. Each class of ship is rated for hull strength, sail points, and salvo size.

The game uses an unusual method to resolve fire combat - the players roll pennies from atop the miniature ships.

name: Chicken out!
description:
Back of box: "Match and collect the pairs of friendly animals in this fun farmyard card game. You'll have to keep your eyes peeled and watch out for the wily fox that gobbles up your chickens, or you might lose them all!"

Players are farmers that have 4 chickens each. The goal is to collect as many pairs of animals as possible before losing all your chickens.

A fun educational game for children.

name: Piro
description:
This card game is played mainly in Afganistan and Iran. It was mentioned in an article in GAMES magazine, sometime in the 2000s. It is similar to, but differs a fair bit (scoring and key cards), from the card game known as Casino and another called "Bazra".

The game uses a standard 52-card deck, without jokers. After an initial deal of five cards to each person (2-player only), two cards are turned up in the middle of the table. After playing one card at a time from the hand, another 5 cards are dealt to the players once their current hand is empty. Thus, each game segment lasts 5 rounds (10 cards per round + the initial 2 card outlay).

Points (always 5 per game segment) are given at the end of the deck for the following:
Most cards = 2
Most clubs = 1
2 of clubs = 1
10 of diamonds = 1

See the A new 2-player card game (for most of you) for a visual explanation of rules and scoring basics.

name: Anzio The Bloodiest Beachhead
description:
On 22nd January 1944, Allied forces landed at Anzio, a small coastal town just 30 miles south of Rome. This attack behind enemy lines, was intended to unhinge the German fortified Gustav Line.

The Germans responded quickly, containing the beachhead. The fighting was bitter, with both sides suffering high casualties. Intense artillery bombardments, water filled trenches and muddy conditions, made this battlefield a wretched place. The Allies would be on their beachhead for four long months before they were able to breakout and meet up with the rest of U.S. 5th Army.

The game represents the first six weeks of this campaign. It was a period when both sides attacked each other vigorously, looking for opportunities to break through the enemy defences, while desperately resisting enemy advances. By the beginning of March, both sides had fought each other to a standstill.

The Anzio rules bring differential based combat, single stacks attacking single stacks, Random Events, random strength Allied bombardments, historically based special abilities for some formations, anti tank values, bog checks for off road movement and disengagement tests when attempting to leave an enemy ZOC.

The presentation includes Large hexes and large counters to enhance the playing experience. The counters are provided on self adhesive paper and require the user to mount them onto card prior to cutting.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Aadu Puli Attam
description:
Aadu Puli Attam (goat and tiger game) is a strategic, two-player board game. It is a traditional game that has been popular for ages in the southern states of India. In the state of Karnataka it's called Huli gatta and in Andhra Pradesh it is known as Puli Joodam or Puli-Meka.

The game is asymmetric - one player controls three tigers and the other player controls up to 15 goats. The tigers try to capture all goats, while the goats attempt to encircle the tigers and win.

The game starts with the goats off the board, and the tigers positioned at the apex and the two inner intersections closest to the apex.

Players take turns and move along the lines.

The player controlling the goats makes the first move by placing a goat in a free intersection. (Goats cannot move until all 15 have been placed on the board.)

The tiger can either move to an adjacent intersection along a line, or capture a goat by jumping over it just as in Checkers/Draughts. (Unlike goats, tigers can move right from the first turn.)

The game ends when all goats have been captured, or when none of the tigers can move.

NOTE:
Only one goat can be captured at a time. The captured goat leaves the board.
A tiger cannot be captured.
Turns alternate between players, with the goats starting off the game.

Equipment:
Goat: 15 small pieces.
Tiger: 3 big pieces.
Board with lines and 23 Spots for moving Aadu and Pulis.
publishers: Adrenaline Brush Ltd, Kreeda, NewVenture Games, Ramsons

name: Können Schweine fliegen? Das Kartenspiel
description: In this card game you have to know animals attributes. There are 5 animal cards (out of 40 in total) on the desk. You have to choose one of your 3 (out of 32 in total) attribute cards. It is good if it matches to many animals (of those 5) as possible. Than you turn round one of the animal cards you guess your attribute is matching (attributes of this animal on the back side). If this is the case you have the chance to get this animal. If you stop turning animal cards by choice, you can keep the animals. If you turn a wrong animal card (attribute not matching), you get no animal cards this turn. There is the chance to get 3 animals by making a "Schweinestarker Sonder-Spielzug" (special turn). Therefor your attribute card have to match none of the 5 animals.

name: Wildebeest Chess
description:
Wildebeest Chess is a large chess variant.

The chess variant attempts to bring balance between leapers and riders in the game.

The game is played on a board of ten rows and eleven columns. Each player has eleven pawns, two rooks, two knights, two bishops, two camels, one queen, one wildebeest, and one king.

A camel has an extended knight jump: it goes one square in one direction and three in the other. Camels may jump (like knights) over occupied squares.

A wildebeest has the combined moves of a camel and knight.

name: Guildes
description:
200 years ago, the world of Cosmo was shocked by the appearance of a gigantic continent off Shores, south of the Ocean Sea. The Shores native embarked on the conquest of this continent to exploit its resources, including the "Loom", and trace routes of exploration.
To this end they created guilds, companies specialized in adventurous war, politics, knowledge and "loom", led by the Guild Masters .
Today, competition is raging on the continent and guilds vie for profit from lands unknown.

Every player is a master of Guild. The goal is to double his personal treasure of 10 Guilders (game currency), that is to say, come to possess 20 Guilders in his personal treasure.
There are 6 houses, so there are 6 types of different basic games (one per house), each player choosing one of the houses to play.
Early in the game, each player has 15 guilders: 10 in his personal treasure and 5 in the bank.

There are several types of cards:
1. Territories (Land and premises)
These maps provide resources: The Loom (magic), War, Politics and Knowledge. Each card provides 1 or 2 resources, each being either red or green, or white (neutral). Resources are used to bring into play other cards.
2. The Auguries
These are cards that are played at the beginning of the round (during the Winter phase) They have an effect that extends to all Guild Masters. These are external events.
3. The Machinations which include:
• Troops: armies belonging to various houses.
• Creatures: the troops who live on the Continent.
• Actions: they have off effects in the game
• Reactions: they can be played anytime.
• The Locus: magical places situated on the Continent.
• Constructions: linked to Territories.
• Equipment: benefit the troops and creatures.

Round :
It is divided into four phases: winter, spring, summer and autumn

Winter: passive phase where one put in place guidelines for the round of play
Spring: territories, settlement construction.
Summer: is the phase during which the fighting takes place.
Autumn: crop production, collapse and discovery phase.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Territory Building

name: Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass
description:
Publisher's BlurbMunchkin is not a drinking game. Really.

But don't let that stop you from showing your love of Munchkin with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass. These 1.5 oz glasses are black with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary logo in gold. It's a treasure that any munchkin would be happy to find in his dungeon haul... especially since they come with a special rule.

Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass Rule

The Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass may be used in any Munchkin game or its sequels.

When fighting a monster on your turn, you may take one complete shot of Strength Potion* from the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass to get a +10 combat bonus. You may do this as many times as you like during a game, but every drink of Strength Potion after the first costs you a level. You may only benefit from one Strength Potion per combat.


The owner of the Shot Glass is the sole judge of what liquid(s) will make up the Strength Potion.




OtherPart of the Munchkin series

name: Verish' Ne Verish'
description:
Russian bluffing game using standard deck of cards, similar to Cheat; the main difference is that the called rank stays the same during a round, rather than changing from player to player, forcing people to start bluffing almost immediately.

Play with a full deck for 4+ players, thin the deck to 36 cards (remove 2s through 5s) for fewer players.

The goal of the game is for a player to get rid of all cards they have. Start by removing one random card from the deck (so that there is one rank that cannot form four-of-a-kind) and deal the remaining deck out between the players. On their turn, a player must discard 1-3 cards face down and announce those cards' rank (the same rank being called for the entire round, and players may lie about what they are discarding), or call the bluff of the previous player. When a bluff is called, the played cards are revealed and the loser of the challenge draws the entire discard pile without showing the cards to anyone. After drawing the discard pile, a player may choose to discard sets of four-of-a-kind from their hand (in some versions of the game all must be discarded; in others, only a single set). The player to the left of the challenge loser starts the next round, naming a rank of their choice.

name: Palio Espansione
description:
The only expansion for Palio.

Contains 10 new tiles, 34 stickers, 34 plastic miniatures, 2 "faster" dice than the base game and new rules.

name: Tercio: Wargames Rules for the Period 1480 to 1700
description: Tabletop miniature rules for the period 1480-1700 including army lists. The ruleset allows you to recreate any battle from the pike and shot era and is designed for 15mm or 25mm figures, but the rules could be adapted for any scale. The army lists allow you to dive straight in to your chosen period with an army representing a standard formation from the period.
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Pocket Kung Fu
description:
The Original Kung Fu Fighting Microgame. Become Master of the Arena. Choose a Kung Fu Fighting style and leap into multiplayer combat utilizing your Fighter's innate abilities, your sensei's training and the legendary weapons of Kung Fu. By mastering your surroundings and the elite techniques of a Kung Fu warrior no one will stand in your way!

Pocket Kung Fu is a 30 minute card game for 2-4 players which simulates a spontaneous fight between Kung Fu Masters representing different styles of Kung Fu. The Goal of the game is to reduce your opponent's Chi to zero or knock their card off the playing surface.

Unique Spacial Tactics
There are no rails or limitations to how your Fighter can move around the arena. Should you pivot or leap your fighter card into an attack, or flip to a defensive stance? Use your surroundings to surprise attack your opponents.

Endless Replayability
Special Attacks allow you to personalize your fighting style. Training cards add the element of surprise. No two players will use a fighter the same way. Make your mark. Is your Kung Fu the best?

Varied Fighting Styles
Choose from 8 different fighters and begin your journey to Master of the Arena!
publishers: Epic Endeavor Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: 8 Seconds from Glory
description:
From the game Introduction:
"A game about Bull Riding? Really? Yep.
8 Seconds from Glory is a fun little game that's made for having a good time with friends, family and everyone in between. It's a game with a little luck (drawing the "right" Bull) and a little skill (knowing when to use your Ride Dice). But it's mostly about fun!

Will you play it week in and week out? Probably not but you'll be able to pull it out occasionally and play without learning how to play all over again. It's simple. It's fun. You remember fun right? That's why you play games"

8 Seconds from Glory is a very little and easy game that uses the simple throw of 2 dices to adjudicate the many situations the bull rider will face during his brief cavalcade. The result of the dice is confronted with compiled tables that will tell players the outcome of the phases, the dice is no way a blind roll. Every rider (and even the bulls!) have their characteristic and their traits, so a sparkle of role-playing game is gladly implemented, as are rules to make your rider or bull progress during rodeo seasons.

Very fun to play!

name: Magellan: Complementary Cards
description:
New cards for use with Magellan. There are 38 new geography cards and 100 new history cards. The geography cards should presumably be added to the originals. The history cards come in two groups - there are two sets of 10 cards for each of the categories - so you can replace the original cards with one of these groups or mix them together.

(If someone has the rules for exactly how to use the cards, please update this.)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ufology
description:
Aliens, UFOs – are they real? After years of research, Ufologists have answered this question, and the answer is...maybe. This is where you come in. Gather evidence, get your Doctorate, hack your opponent's computer, then – perhaps – you will solve one of the World's greatest mysteries: Are we alone in the universe?

Ufology is a card game based on the fringe scientific field of the same name. In Ufology, players use Research cards to collect Evidence cards from a 3x3 card grid (3x4 in 5-6 player games) called the Field of Research. Those Evidence cards, ranging in value from 0 to 6 points, are placed with Case cards that have corresponding icons. When a Case has the indicated pieces of evidence, it is considered Closed. The game ends as soon as a player closes three Cases, and the player with the most points wins.

Action cards allow players to, for instance, take cards from an opponents hands, move cards from Case to another, etc. There are also Credentials cards that increase the number of cards a player may use on there turn or their hand size, and Culture cards which change the game play for all players.

name: Haunted House Game
description:
You who were shut in in the Haunted house which a ghost wanders must escape from this place.
I sometimes cooperate and sometimes escape than anyone else earlier from this house.
Finally I wait for the confrontation with the god of death who is the guard of this house.

This game moves the piece with a card. The confrontation with the ghost depends on each room in the way. The player confronts it using an item tip on hand and must beat a ghost.

name: Top Spin Table Soccer
description:
This is a Subbuteo replica using the HW miniatures of the 70s.

The box contains everything you need to play the good old Subbuteo, two teams with "moulded-type" miniatures (blue team and red team), two goals, two white balls and a cotton made soccer pitch.

As the Subbuteo, the rules here are alla about the flicking with your fingers of miniatures depicting actual football players. Any miniature can touch the ball no more than 3 times, after that you have to use another miniature. If another your miniature touches the ball, the previous miniature regains the maximum touches avalaibility. If you miss the ball, or this touches any of the other side's players, the ball possession passes to the adversary. Other rules include details to address situations like penalties, off-sides, free-kicks and such. This is after all a total Subbuteo-clone even in the popular ruleset that, from the 70s, has seen little or no change at all.

Anyone not happy with the new Subbuteo 2012 edition can still buy this one then!
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Ice3
description:
Ice3 is a game played with ice cubes!

Each player starts with some cards and an ice cube, which is placed on a plastic stand. The cards are placed on the table to create the path on which the ice cubes will progress. Some cards make it possible to attack another player's ice cube – dipping it in a glass of cold water, warming it with your hand, blowing on it, putting a pinch of salt on it, etc. – to make it melt a little. Other cards allow you to defend yourself – well, your ice cube anyway – by preventing an attack. If your ice cube melts completely before the end of the game, you're eliminated.

The first player to bring his cube to the 25th card wins.

name: Blackie's Maze
description:
You are the Red Joker. Find and kill your evil twin, the Black Joker.

Players layout number cards to represent Rooms, Doors, and Levels, battle Jacks, Kings, and Queens with hit points,search for the Black Joker through up to ten levels in an ever changing maze dealt with a simple deck of standard playing cards. A Quick reference book lays out the mechanisms for movement, combat, Hand-management, and for finding and fighting the Black Joker.

“All my life I’ve known my brother was the evil twin. I’ve always felt that one of us shouldn’t have been born. Today, one of us dies in Blackie’s Maze.”

name: Carousel
description:
Carousel is the overarching name for a series of prototypes that played around with the same core mechanic. The concept is simple: There is no good or bad card in the game.

Every card has every action on it, shuffled around a series of slots. On the center of the table there are several places, each with a number which matches one of the slots. The place in which your characters is defines the slot you can use on all your cards. You'll want to control that character to use your cards as best you can.

Once the base mechanics were set, the game went through several themes: Time travel, gangsters robbing a bank, delivering mail, delivering pizzas. It immediately made the game easier to learn since the players had a train of thought they could follow. The game adapted to each of the themes, and grew with it.

Its latest iteration is called Multiuniversum and is going to be published by Board & Dice later this year!

name: Thirteen Cards
description:
A simple game playing with just one suit of standard deck of playing cards, for instance all thirteen cards of Spades suit. This is a game for 2,3,4 or 6 players.

Game begins by dealing the 13 cards to the players, face down. The remaining one card will be placed face up on the table for all players to see.
Each card has exactly the same points as its face value. King card has 13 points, Queen card 12, Jack card 11 and Ace card 1 point.

Players take turns exchanging any card from their hand with the one in the table to achieve the exact amount of points known as Target Points. Target Points for the game is calculated by multiplying cards in hand per player with 7.
For example, for a 3 player game, cards per player will be 4. So Target Points to achieve will be 7 * 4 = 28.

A player with his total card value equal to Target Points wins the game immediately and is removed from the game. (A player cannot win if he exceeds the Target Points.) The game continues till one player remains.

name: Aquarius Rising
description:
A mashup of two Looney Labs products: the tiling card game Aquarius and the Components: Looney Pyramid Games game system. In Aquarius Rising, the players match pyramids to the elements on the cards, and build upwards by placing cards on the pyramids. Players compete to be the one with the goal reflected by the highest elemental pyramid in the structure.

The game can be played with the original Aquarius deck or with Aquarius 2.0. Variants include Aquarius Rising Sky High and Aquarius Rising to the Clouds, each of which introduce different sorts of "wild" pyramids.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Östergötland in the 1930's (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Östergötland in the 1930's is an unofficial expansion to Alan R Moon’s and Days of Wonder's Ticket to Ride series. The map covers the Swedish county of Östergötland and can be played by 2-3 players.

The goal for this game is to collect points by claiming routes, completing destination tickets, and completing more tickets than the opponents.


NOTE: "Ticket to Ride" and "Days of Wonder" are registered trademarks of Days of Wonder, Inc. This fan-created expansion map is not a Days of Wonder product, but has been created with permission of Days of Wonder, Inc, solely for unpaid, non-commercial use. Some of the text and illustrations used herein may be Copyright © 2004-2012, Days of Wonder, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Bern
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bern, in Switzerland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: LightSpeed
description:
LightSpeed is a game of ruthless blocking and isolation, inspired by Amazons, Hey, That's My Fish!, Carcassonne, and, of course, TRON. Lure and trap your opponent, avoid his traps, isolate him, isolate yourself, and keep him away from your points!

This game is comprised of 46 two-inch cards (which make up the playing board) and six playing pieces, all of which fit easily into a tin. It consists of two phases: placing the tiles and taking the tiles. The first phase is where you try to set up your strategy, and the second phase is where you use your tactics to try to maximize your points.

name: Het grote Pardoes Spring-en-spaarspel
description:
An official Pardoes game

The game consists of two games in one. On the back you can play memory, on the front you'll find the Pardoes game, a trivia game about Pardoes and themepark De Efteling.

Goal of the trivia game (also known as the horse jump game) is to finish your puzzle and collect three cards by crossing the gridded board in a chess knight like way and correctly answering questions. How far you can move in the chess knight like way is determined by two dice.

You can download more questions for the game from De Efteling website.

For the memory game you have to collect pairs of the same picture. The one with the most pairs wins

Contents:
- 1 double-sided game board
- 2 dice
- 8 puzzles
- 48 cards (24 pairs)
- Rules
- The original 8 cardboard game pieces could be replaced by 8 miniatures you could collect from the local supermarket in 2001.

name: Thinkaboxin
description:
CONTENTS
• 6 dice cups
• 24 dice
• 120 game pieces or snake parts / nuggets in red, blue, yellow, green, black and white colours
• Score notepad
• Game rules
• Game board Rattlesnakes

NUMBER OF PLAYERS
All games can be played from 2 players up to 6 players at a time.

1. GOAL
The goal of the game is to be the first one to play all dice away from your cup.

2. GAME TERMS
Value: the value of the numbers on a die from low to high is 2-3-4-5-6-1.
Joker: number 1 on the die is the joker and can be considered to be any number from 1 to 6. A thrown number 1 can also be played as a 1, in which case it is valued higher than a 6. This applies to all game modes of THINKABOXIN.
Bid: a gamble or bluff on the total amount of dice of a certain value that are underneath all players’ dice cups (including one’s own cup).
Raise: raising a bid means that EITHER the amount of dice is raised (e.g. raising four twos to five twos, etc.) OR that the value of the aforementioned amount of dice is raised (raising three fives to three sixes or three ones) OR that both are raised (raising five fours to seven sixes, etc.).
Lift: the player who calls a bid into question, lifts his own dice cup. Afterwards, all players (including the player whose bid had been called into question) lift their cups in order to check who is right through counting the amount of dice with the value named in the last bid.
Won dice: after each round all players – except the player who was not right – can get one die out of their dice cups and put it away. The amount of dice put away is called won dice. Only the dice that can be put away from one’s own cup count as won dice.
Round: one played round (ends when the winning players have been able to put away one die).
Set: all played and counted rounds.

3. GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN
• Before the start of the game, each player always receives a personal dice cup containing 4 dice.
• All players simultaneously shake their cups with dice, and each player looks underneath his own cup to see what he has thrown himself.
• Players may not ever see one another’s dice (except for when cups are lifted).
• The youngest player starts the very first round. The rounds after that, the loser of the previous round or set begins bidding.
• Whoever starts a round always determines the playing direction. The player determines this through making a bid to either the player to the left or right of him.
• A bid that has been placed cannot be withdrawn or changed.
• Once a bid has been placed, the turn of whoever placed the bid is over, and the next player’s turn is at hand.
• The next player either raises this bid in the given playing direction or lifts his cup if he takes the current bid into question.
• Raise: raising a bid means that EITHER the amount of dice is raised (e.g. raising four twos to five twos, etc.) OR that the value of the aforementioned amount of dice is raised (raising three fives to three sixes or three ones) OR that both are raised (raising five fours to seven sixes, etc.).
• Raising a bid has to be done in the given playing direction.
• In case of a raise, the previous bid no longer needs to be kept in mind.
• When someone lifts the cup to indicate that he takes the previous player’s bid into question, this action is final and cannot be undone.
• When the bid has been taken into question and one cup has been lifted, all players should then lift their cups, and the dice with the values named in the last bid will be counted.
• When more than or precisely the amount of dice named in the bid are present, the bidder is right and the lifter is not right.
