• When fewer than the amount of dice named in the bid are present, the bidder is not right and the lifter is right.
• Whoever is not right is not allowed to get any die out of his cup, all other players are allowed to get one die out of their cups.
• The won dice that have been put away from the cups have to be placed in front of the dice cups on the table in a way that is visible for all players.
• The player who was not right starts the next round and can determine once again the playing direction through placing a bid in the desired direction.
• The player(s) who manages to be the first to place all the dice from his cup in front of him on the table wins the set.
• If dice roll out of one or more players’ cups or dice end up lying on top of one another, then these players are The Donkey. This means that all other players can get one die out of their cups. Afterwards, all players shake their cups and the bidding can be started anew by the one (or those) that is (or are) The Donkey.
GAME TERM: KNOCK-OUT RACE
Unlike stated under the GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN, a knock-out race does not stop when one or more players have played away all their dice from their cups. During a knock-out race, a round will continue until there is one loser left. This loser will be eliminated from the game and barred from further participation to this part. The next set will continue with the remaining players, and the last but one loser starts the round. This will go on until one winner remains.

4. GENERAL TIPS AND TRICKS THINKABOXIN
• At all times, keep an eye on how many dice are in the game at the start of each round. At the start of a 4-player game, 4 x 4 dice = 16 dice are lying underneath the cups. The lowest possible bid is in this case 1 die with value 2 (one two) and the highest possible bid 16 dice with value 1 (sixteen ones).
• It could be useful for the player whose turn is at hand to base his bid on his own dice. True bluffers do not do this. They do not care about which dice they have, and wildly undertake hit-or-miss bids. These unpredictable players give the game an extra dimension.
• Determining the playing direction upon doing the first bid of a round can create a tactical advantage when placing a calculated and sharp bid towards the player who is ahead of the rest of the players.
• When there are 2 dice remaining in the game and these are both ones, the player who at that moment would bid ‘two ones’ wins, rather than the player who would bid ‘two sixes’. The joker is namely also the highest value on a die. In this specific case, both players should of course both have a 1 underneath their dice cups.

5. GAME MODES
Nuggets

• The GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN apply to NUGGETS.
• Each player receives 10 nuggets before the start of the game.
• Each player shakes his dice in the cup, and the first player of each set can, after checking the dice underneath his cup, determine what the stake for each player will be for this set.
• This stake is either 2 or 4 nuggets.
• All other players will then place the same amount of nuggets as their stake.
• If one or more players do not have any remaining nuggets and are out of the game, the stake for the other remaining players will always be the total amount of nuggets of the player with the lowest supply of nuggets. In that case, the stake could be more than 4 nuggets.
• When a player has no remaining nuggets to put in as stake, the game is over for this player and he can no longer play.
• The pool of nuggets will only be distributed when one or more players have played away all their dice from their cups.
• When there are multiple winners, the pool of nuggets is to be distributed fairly between them.
• Any possible remainder of nuggets will stay in the pool for the next set. When two players win with an uneven amount of nuggets in the pool, the remainder will stay in the pool for the next set.
• The player who has won all nuggets is the winner of NUGGETS.

Goldrush

• The GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN apply to GOLDRUSH.
• One player (the secretary) fills in the players’ names (in sitting order) and keeps the score for each round on the score notepad.
• 10 rounds are played in total.
1st set = 1 round, everyone starts with 1 die in their cups.
2nd and 3rd set = 2 sets, everyone starts with 2 dice in their cups.
4th until 6th set = 3 sets, everyone starts with 3 dice in their cups.
7th until 10th set = 4 sets, everyone starts with 4 dice in their cups.
• A set is won when one or more players have played away all of their dice from their cups. At that point, all won dice for each player are counted and noted under the players’ names for the relevant set.
• The running scores are continually counted by the secretary and announced to the other players.
• The final score is announced by the secretary, declaring who the (tied) player numbers 1 and 2 are.
• The (tied) player numbers 1 and 2 are pitted against one another in a final knock-out-race.
• The winner of this final is the winner of GOLDRUSH.

The Next Sheriff

• The GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN apply to THE NEXT SHERIFF.
• During the entire game one-on-one duels are played. Each player duels one another once, until one of the players has played away all of his dice.
• One player (the secretary) fills in the players’ names from left to right and, in the same order, from top to bottom. The secretary also keeps the score for each duel (the amount of won dice per player) on the score notepad.
• The secretary determines at what time which player plays against which player.
• The amount of dice that have been put away from the cup is the amount of scored points. This result is noted directly after each duel by the secretary.
• After all players have played against one another once, the total amount of won dice is counted and noted in the totals column on the right-hand side (Total amount of won dice).
• The score from the totals column is filled in at the lower section (in case two players have a tied score, the winner is defined as that player who beat the other player in a duel). The resulting tournament schedule works in the following way:
With 3 players: no. 1 directly granted place in finals. No. 2 plays against no. 3 for place in finals.
With 4 players: no. 1 plays against no. 4 for place in finals. No. 2 plays against no. 3 for place in finals.
With 5 players: no. 1 directly granted place in finals. Winner of no. 2 against no. 5 plays against winner of no. 3 against no. 4 for place in finals.
With 6 players: no. 1 plays against no. 6 for place in finals. Winner of no. 2 against no. 5 plays against winner of no. 3 against no. 4 for place in finals.
• The winner of the last finals is the winner of THE NEXT SHERIFF.

Last Man Standing

• The GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN apply to LAST MAN STANDING.
• A knock-out race is being played during the entire game (see explanation KNOCK-OUT RACE).
• One player (the secretary) fills in the players’ names and notes during each set which player has been eliminated and crosses that player’s name out on the score notepad.
• The winner of the knock-out race is the Last Man Standing.

Rattlesnakes

• The goal of this game is to be the first to place all your snake parts (20) on the game board.
• RATTLESNAKES is played on the RATTLESNAKES game board with 20 snake parts per player.
• The GENERAL GAME RULES THINKABOXIN apply to RATTLESNAKES.
• Each player receives 20 snake parts before the start of RATTLESNAKES.
• The amount of snake parts that can be placed on the board per set is determined by the amount of dice won by the player per set.
• After a played set, the player with the fewest won dice is the first to start placing his snake. In case of an equal amount of won dice, the player who was the last to lose can start placing. He also determines in which direction the other players are allowed to place their snake parts.
• If a player, for example, has won 3 dice in a set, he can then place 3 snake parts on the game board. Afterwards, it is the next player’s turn to place his snake parts.
• A snake always begins from one of six snake head squares on the game board, which can be freely chosen by the players.
• Only the first snake part placed by the player can be put on a ‘snake head’ square. Afterwards, no snake parts can be put on a ‘snake head’ square.
• Each square on the game board can be used only once.
• The snake parts that have not been placed yet must be placed in front of you in a way that is visible to all players, so that it is at all times clear which player is ahead or behind on the rest (this can influence the tactics of placing snake parts).
• Placing snake parts on the game board can be done in any desired direction via an adjacent square.
• The final snake part that is placed (the head) in a set is placed (temporarily) upright, so that it is clear from which square the snake slithers onwards into the next set.
• When crossing your own snake (through removing one snake part after winning a set with 4 won dice), the crossed part becomes the head (no extra snake part is therefore placed).
• When snake parts can be placed anew, the snake head is laid flat and it is from this square that new parts must be placed.
• The next round will be started by the player who was allowed to place his snake parts the first in the previous set. He once again determines the playing direction through placing his bid to either the left or right (note: a tactical advantage can be gained through this action).
• Once a player has chosen to go into a snake pit by having a snake part stand on an orange square, that player is then obliged to let his next snake part appear at another snake pit on an orange square.
• It is forbidden to immediately re-use an already used snake pit. When going out of a snake pit, the snake has to slither ahead on the regular squares. Players can, however, use multiple different snake pits within one game.
• NO snake parts are placed on a snake pit, as snake pits only serve as a passage to and from another snake pit.
• When winning a set (all dice are out of the dice cup) the player (or players) has the following options:
EITHER place 4 snake parts,
OR remove 1 snake part of your own,
OR remove 1 adjacent snake part of your opponent (this snake part is then given back to the player in question). However, this cannot be done to a snake belonging to a player who has also won this set with 4 dice.
• The player who is the first to put his entire snake on the board wins RATTLESNAKES!
• Should multiple players manage to put their entire snakes on the board within one set, a final round is organised for these players in the form of a knock-out race (see explanation KNOCK-OUT RACE).

name: Lights, Camera, Action!
description:
Lights, Camera, Action! is the hip and hilarious game that brings friends and family together for entertaining and comical fun! During each scene, players are challenged to read the short scripts while acting out their outrageous "TWIST Cards"! (ex: you are a sumo wrestler or you are a ballerina)

Try not to burst out laughing or miss your lines so you don't get "CUT" by the director! The player who gets the least amount of cuts wins the game! For ages 8 and up.

Includes:
1 Authentic Movie Clapboard
2 Script Books with 100 Original Skits
100 Outrageous Twist Cards
100 Script Pick Cards
Board Game with 8 Pawns

name: Temptation: The New Sale of The Century
description:
From the box:

Now viewers can be players. It's fast, bright, educational, competitive and fun.

-with Electronic lights and buzzers.

Players are ask general knowledge questions as they race to come up with the right answer. correct answers earns cash, incorrect answers gets no cash. After several points throughout the game, players are offered the chance to buy discounted merchandise using the cash they have won from previous rounds, The catch is that no player knows just how valuable the item is, only that it is offered at less than full value. after 15 questions, the player with the most cash can either buy a much more expensive prize with their winnings or keep their money in the hopes of winning again in order to be able to buy something better. After each person had a chance to emcee the game, the player who has the most cash and merchandise is the winner.
categories: Electronic, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: PLYT
description:
Plyt is a great new family board game for players of ALL ages and abilities to play together in a fun, competitive and challenging way and, even better, it improves your numeracy skills!

The game is easy to play and works around multiplying a number of 12 sided dice together within the agreed time, negotiating the Plyt squares and racing against each other to be the first to reach the winner square. But there’s a balance of risk and reward. Plyters decide how many dice to throw to try and get ahead, and when it comes to it, who they will push back or help. It starts off gently to let you get the feel of it but as the play gets closer to the end, positions can change quickly and the result isn’t certain until the very last throw!

But Plyt isn’t just about beating your opponents – it’s also about challenging yourself – pushing yourself out of your comfort zone and feeling the buzz of getting it right!
There are lots of different playing options you can choose (all described in the rules and on the website) – it all depends how competitive you want the game to be and how long you want it to last. The basic game normally lasts between 25-45 minutes but you can make this shorter or longer – it’s up to you!

Come Forth and Multiply!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: Cars: Cool Twists Starter Game Set
description:
The Cars Game System combines gaming and modeling: Players first assemble their favorite characters from the Disney/Pixar movie Cars, then they race them head-to-head on a customizable race track! Players must maneuver their cars for the best position and collect special bonus tokens that give them an extra boost during the race.

The Cars: Cool Twists Starter Game Set includes two character models (1:43 scale, some assembly required) complete with stickers: McQueen and Francesco. Also included are modular track tiles, special ability tokens, character cards, and dice.

The game can be expanded by adding additional cars from other model kits (sold separately), allowing up to 6 players total.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Of Dungeons Deep!
description:
The creators of numerous successful Kickstarters, including Four Tribes and Dig Down Dwarf, bring you a new blind bidding and deck-building dungeon delving card game. Of Dungeons Deep! is a fusion of many mechanics and was inspired by such games as Smash Up!, Dungeon Raiders, Cutthroat Caverns, and Friday and is set in an amazingly illustrated world that is whimsical, with just a touch of darkness. Of Dungeons Deep! takes a brave new look at a classic theme, is easy to learn, and employs simultaneous play which equates to almost zero downtime for players!

We are proud to announce that ALL the artwork for Of Dungeons Deep! has been commissioned by the fabulous Derek Bacon. Mr. Bacon has worked on such titles as Tower, Baldrick's Tomb, and Smash Monster Rampage. His style is both playful and edgy, and we feel it is the perfect match for the game. Plus his name is BACON so.....

Bluffing and Blind Bidding. Players are attempting to destroy the nasty creatures below in the dungeon to gain fame by playing cards face down and revealing simultaneously. Each enemy has a set number of hit points based on the number of players. There are three enemies to deal with in each level of the dungeon, so strategy, tactics, and bluffing are a must. There is also two rounds of bidding so players gain insight into what other players are up to.

Deck Building. When a player defeats an enemy, that card is rotated 180 degrees and then added to the player's discard pile. The bottom of each monster card indicates what item the enemy is carrying. These items add power to your character in future rounds, and act as an organic and thematic way to show that your characters are advancing.

Draft Your Unique Party. Before play begins, players complete a draft in order to create their starting hand of twelve cards. Each player gets one Hero and one Henchman. All characters are very unique and play quite differently from one another. This sets the bar high for replay value!

No Down Time! Since all play is done simultaneously, no players are ever waiting on others for very long. This makes Of Dungeons Deep! one of the fastest dungeon delvers out there.

name: Stak Bots: Backer Bot
description:
A Kickstarter exclusive promo card for Stak Bots.

It has a moderately high power value, and allows you to play a card on an opponent's stack when it comes into play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Zen Garden: Raked Sand
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion is included on a tile sheet titled: Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #8

The two tiles allow a player to remove and replace a previously
played tile - except a feature tile with a cube on it already.

name: Zieh Leine, Flynn!
description:
Flynn, the pirate owl is a real mischief-maker. Very secretly he has pinched anything and everything that he could fi nd on deck and has stashed it away in the look-out – the crow‘s nest: the gold drinking cups of the crew, the captain‘s sword, the treasure chest, the jewellery for the lady pirates and a few mice – just in case. You can never know how long you‘re going to be left sitting high and dry. Cheekily, he‘s throned high up in the crow‘s nest and is smirking joyfully over so many riches. It‘s no surprise that the ship‘s crew is fuming and want their belongings back!

Find the objects that Flynn has stashed away in the crow‘s nest. A die shows you what you have to look for. Like in the trick with the table cloth you have to pull a cord stick to a card and hope that the Flynn stays in his nest and that the nest is not toppling over.

name: Ragnaroll
description:
Ragnaroll is a game of glory, death and dice. A great winter has descended upon the land, the sun has disappeared, the sea has frozen over, there's no more crops or cattle and all you have left is a few winter stores and, of course, your fluid Viking sense of ownership.

In Ragnaroll, you control a band of Viking warriors, each represented by a custom die, struggling to survive. Your band consists of a unique hero, 2 soldiers, 1 shieldmaiden and a loyal, but slightly unreliable, dog. You'll need to fight to protect your precious food stores, as well as raid your opponents for glory and more food. It's a harsh winter wasteland, and the last Viking alive wins, unless of course Ragnaroll happens first.

A round of Ragnaroll starts by revealing an event card, which will provide some incentives and rewards for your Vikings to leave their comfy halls. Next, players secretly separate their warriors into their defenders and their raiders. Players reveal their selection simultaneously and the boldest and bravest player, the one with the smallest raiding party, seizes the Initiative, gaining control of raid order for the round. If there's any ties, you'll need to literally seize the initiative by grabbing the initiative token from the centre of the table.

In the order of the Initiative holders choice, each player conducts a little bit of Norse business, pitting your raiders against your opponents defenders and using your defenders to protect your stores from your enemy’s raiders. Battle is resolved through rolling dice and using special battle abilities fuelled by glory. Each hero has a unique set of powers that will enable them to turn luck into fate. Each player, starting with the raider, will use a battle ability, and then the winner will be determined. Whoever has the most axes win, but you'll be able to block axes with shields and appeal to Odin to reroll results. The winner of the battle will get to steal stores or slay his opponent's warriors, but each player will also gain glory. In addition to glory provided through the event for the round, every hero has a different path to glory, some will delight in crushing their enemies, while others will be satisfied with survival and some may even gain glory through defeat.

After all players have raided, they will return to their falls and feed their warriors, but with stores running low, not all mouths are worth feeding. You can send any of your Vikings out into the snow for a long walk, saving precious resources, and if you get really desperate, you can even eat the dog. After you’ve fed, you’ll draw a new event card and start all over again. The game will end in one of 3 ways, each of which show the gods that one band of warriors is fit to fight alongside them in Ragnaroll. When there’s only one player with Vikings left, that player wins, demonstrating they have the strength and cunning to fight with the gods, but if all players run out of stores at the same time, you will all conduct one last glorious battle and the player with the most axes will emerge victorious. However, if any player is able to demonstrate they are truly worthy of the god’s favour by gaining 15 glory, they will immediately win and take their rightful place in Valhalla.

Ragnarol is a game where your choices matter. You’ll need to balance risk and rewards, and manage your precious, dwindling resources, making hard decisions for the survival of your clan. The dice-based combat doesn’t simply mean that your fate into the hands of the gods, as you’ll be able to influence the outcome of the battle using your glory-fueled powers, but you’ll need to choose the battles that are worth the cost.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Her mit dem Schatz!
description:
The game is played with 12 treasure tiles and a six-sided die. The front of the tiles show various treasures: crown, genie lamp, or goblet. Each tile has one, two, or three treasures of the same type. To start the game, all twelve tiles are placed face down in the playing area.

Three faces of the die show a crown, lamp, and goblet; the other three show the numbers one, two, and three. Players take turns rolling the die, then must turn over a tile with either the same type of treasure (if a treasure was rolled) or the matching number of treasures (if a number was rolled). If the treasure matches, the player keeps it and places it face down in front of her.

Instead of turning over a tile in the center of the playing area, the active player may turn over a tile belonging to an opponent. If the tile matches, the player may steal it and take it into her own area.

name: Amnesia
description:
Help, I don’t know who I am!

Amnesia is the fun new card game of lost identities and wacky faces. Players use a mix of memory and deduction to rediscover their identities. The first player to do so is the winner!



Gameplay OverviewPlayers each hold 4-5 cards in their hand. However, 1 of these cards is only visible to their opponents. The aim of the game is to successfully guess your hidden card (1 of 16 characters).

On their turn, players may ask any 1 opponent how many cards they hold of a particular type (hair colour or face type). Players must answer truthfully and out loud for everyone to hear. As information comes out, players can begin to deduce which character they are (or are not).

Once a player thinks they know which character they are, they can make a guess. If they are correct, they win! If they are wrong, they are knocked out of the game.

name: Dudab: Irány a dzsungel!
description:
Promo expansion for game Dudab.

The 8 cards give you additional tension and possibilities during the game.

name: Devil's Playground
description: What happens when you and your friends have to survive a weekend in the world's most diabolical city while trying to be the one with the most money when it's over? Prepare to use money, wits, people, and a dash of good, old-fashioned luck as you swindle, bribe, steal, and kill your way to the top! With an endless number of strategies to employ, pitfalls to avoid, and ways to make money, Devil's Playground ensures that you'll have every opportunity to be the worst person you can be! This game is intended for mature individuals only! The rules and strategy guides are available to read and print on manufacturer's website.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Memory, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Trans Bielefeld: Eine Spur schneller
description:
Localized version of TransAmerica, settled in the city of Bielefeld, Germany.

Players work together building a tram railway network, but this time it is across Bielefeld instead of the United States. The first to have their five stations connected wins the round - the others lose points for being too slow! After 3-4 rounds, the player with the most points wins the game!

According to the description on the box, Trans Bielefeld+includes Vexation, but it doesn´t.

name: Wordox
description:
The objective of the game is to be the first to reach the score of 25 points by forming words on set with 6 letters drawn at random.

One player has pink letters other player orange letters.
Player has 6 letter tiles before his turns and he places them on the board to form a words and score points. Each letter gives him 1 point. If he is using opponents´ letters he also takes the points from him and opponent decrease his points accordingly.

Player who first reaches to 25 points is the winner.

name: Chopstick Challenge: Smiley Faces
description:
A game for 1 or more players who take it in turns to use the chopsticks to pick up pieces.

Take it in turns to throw the dice, whichever colour it lands on, use the chopsticks to pick up that coloured smiley face wooden block and place it on top of your opponents block to create a tower. Whoever knocks the tower over loses.
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck

name: Oh nein! Die Schnackelstein!
description:
Countess Rubina von Schnackelstein has buried her gemstones. Instead of the lush diamond plants though, which she had hoped for, mole hills have started to pop up all over her lawn.
You decide where the cuddly bgurrowers get busy digging in search for the precious gems. If you manage to unearth the most jewels, you will be crowned king of the moles. Be wary of the beetles though: they work for the countess and try to steal the gemstones back from you!

name: Doug, Doug, Goose, Caboose
description:
Doug, Doug, Goose, Caboose is a quick party game inspired by the children's playground game "Duck, Duck, Goose". The game supports 3-8 players, and plays in about 10 minutes.

The dealer shuffles the deck of cards (one per player in the game), and deals one, in turn, to each player, calling out the card each time. Once both the "Goose" and "Caboose" cards are in play, these player race to call out the other players names, going clockwise around the table. The winner scores a point. The cards are shuffled and the game continues until someone scores three points.

But wait! There's more! The "Goose" and "Caboose" players can get tripped up and have to start over if they don't say the names right, or if they don't call the other racing player "Doug". Everyone else is in charge with keeping the racing players honest.

name: RALLYE PAŘÍŽ-DAKAR
description:
All around him, as far as you can look, you see huge sand dunes and arid country with only here and there as if randomly strewn around rocks and scrubby bushes. From the clear blue sky of September and burning sun,shadows here and there is a unbearably hot. But you do not have time to devote to watching these natural phenomena, because You must quickly navigate the terrain and to keep in mind only one thing: to be first in line! As it has many times proved Karel Loprais and his Tatra. Take care not to straying or not fit in the sand and go forward as quickly as possible.

Players throw the dice and move their pieces around the board. Along the way they must cope with fields having different kinds of effects (malfunction, ford ...). Crowned the winner is the player who first reach the finish with everyone figures.

name: Wicked Pizza
description:
In the modern world of edible witchcraft, pizzas have replaced the standard brews as the food of choice. In this tile laying style card game, players race to collect the 20 pizza scoring tokens by completing as many pizzas as possible. But beware the ingredients’ “wicked” special abilities and spell cards that will create havoc if they become activated. When the final scoring token is taken, the game ends and the scores are tallied.

On your turn, you will play either a pizza or spell card from your hand and then draw back up to 3 cards at the end of your turn. The 55 pizza cards have a variety of different layouts with quarter and half slices on them. In order to play a pizza card, it must be laid adjacent to another card already in play and must connect crusts with another card in play if possible. When 4 sections of pizza come together to complete a pizza, 1 or 2 points are scored depending on the number of ingredients that make up that pizza; pizza scoring tokens tokens are immediately claimed. If the pizza is made up of 3 or 4 of the same ingredient, that ingredient's special ability is activated. There are three copies of 4 different spell cards that allow for additional cards to be drawn, pizza cards to be played from the discard pile, add scoring to a non-ability activating pizza, and play a half pizza section of your choice.

There are also 4 bonus scoring cards, each showing 1 ingredient, that have two abilities: 1) worth 3 points if in possession of a player at the end of the game 2) have a half pizza slice on one side that can be played onto the board instead of playing a card from a player's hand. In order to claim these cards, a player must create a pizza that is made up entirely of 1 ingredient. When that happens, that player takes the card and places it in front of them. The card stays there until either the player uses the half pizza or the game ends. However, if another player creates the same type of pizza, they steal it from whoever has it.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Tile Placement

name: DragonFlame: Fury of the Dragon Promo Card
description:
The Fury of the Dragon card was a stretch goal in the DragonFlame Kickstarter campaign.

The card is worth 3 Glory Points and reads:
"When you place the last fire token onto a village, take this card and place it in your hoard."

The card starts out in play, off to the side, or near the villages. When any player fills the last available spot of a village (ensuring it will score at the end of the game), then they take the card into their hoard. If another player fills the last available spot of a village, they will take the Fury of the Dragon from the player who currently controls it. The player with the Fury in their hoard at the end of the game will score the 3 points for controlling it.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Azati Prime Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Zhijiang Campaign, 1945
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #124

Zhijiang Campaign, 1945 is a two-player operational game of Imperial Japanese Army's last offensive in China in April 1945.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_West_Hunan

name: Pocket N30N City RUMBLE
description:
Dynamite comes in a very small package in this super-deformed, gem-infused fighting card game.

Pocket N30N City RUMBLE is a dueling card game that simulates colossal battle between teams of tiny street fighters. Players use 3 Fighters to perform a wide array of attacks, combos, counters, and super moves to beat the living gems out of the opponent(s).

Discover your power team by playing solo at the "Dojo" and surprise your friends with newfound skills during your next Tag Team match!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Pirates Attack
description:
Description from the publisher:

Pirates Attack is a collaborative strategy game in which two players face the pirates together. The first player to neutralize the pirate threat is the winner.

Pirates will attack your ship, which means that you must be on your guard to obtain the best possible results as you play.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tactics Resource
description:
The Tactics Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in The Void Episode OP Event. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using this Resource, place 2 Evade, 2 Scan and 2 Battle Stations Tokens on the Resource to start the game. Each round, one ship in your fleet may take one of these tokens and place it beside it as if it had performed that Action as a free Action. If the ship does not have the given Action on its Action Bar, it may still place the token, but it is considered a Standard (not free) Action and the ship also receives an Auxiliary Power Token.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Creative Differences: The Video Game Development Card Game
description:
Take the role of a Video Games development Studio. Employ designers, artists and programmers to make the best game you can.

2-4 Players hire staff, give them ideas, then get those ideas into the game - whilst avoiding industrial espionage from your opponents.

Also, use the free app after the game to see how your game comes out.

Gameplay: The game uses multi-use cards so that all of the staff that are available to hire can also be used as money - to pay for the staff - or as ideas - to increase the likelyhood that they will be able to add something to your game design.

On a player's turn they use their 2 actions to either draw new cards, put an employee into play (paying with cards,) add an idea, or roll the dice to get that employees idea into the game.

This is augmented by a wide variety of action cards that will help or hinder your and your opponent's progress respectively. For instance, hire an employee into a rival player's company to employ some corporate espionage!

You can also gain benefits from reaching communal and private milestones / achievements as the game progresses.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Monopoly Junior: Dragons
description: Join Hiccup and his friends on a new journey with Monopoly Junior to become the best Dragon Trainer in Berk! Collect dragons using sheep and build your Dragon Training Arenas as you go. Don't forget to look out for the Dragon Training Tips on the way!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Condition Alert Resource
description:
The Condition Alert Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in "The Corbomite Maneuver" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.

When using this Resource, you receive 6 Mission tokens on the Resource at the start of the game. If one of your ships still has a single Evade or Battle Stations Token beside it at the end of the round, you may spend one of the Mission tokens to retain that action token into the next round, instead of removing it during clean-up.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Kenjin: Battlefield Promo
description: This is a promotional battlefield for Kenjin. To win this battlefield, you must have a lower strength than your opponent.

name: Top Dance! Just Dance
description:
In Top Dance! Just Dance, based on the Just Dance videogame series, one player each round secretly looks at one of the choreography cards, then everyone else races to find the matching card on the table. If someone finds it in time, then both the dancer and the guesser keep those cards.

When the deck runs out, whoever has collected the most cards wins!

name: BrainBox: Cities of the World
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Do you know which people founded Copenhagen? Or what the former name of New York was? BrainBox Cities of the world contains 71 beautifully-illustrated cards showing famous cities of the world!
The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!
publishers: Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest
description:
Ctrl+Alt+Del has quite a history. It was a pioneer in web comics with 14 years of regular updates. It was an animated series. It has spawned a generation of memes that will forever grace the internet. And now... It's a tabletop game. Oh snap!


Working together with Tim Buckley, Killer Robot Games is proud to present Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest.

You don't need to be familiar with Ctrl+Alt+Del to enjoy Legendary Showdown.

In Legendary Showdown: Gamer's Quest each player uses strategy, sabotage, and one-upmanship to develop a secret battle plan.

In Legendary Showdown, each player controls a line of characters. At the end of the round, the characters at the front of each line fight. Players use cards to rearrange their line and the lines of other players to change which characters will compete. Characters can be strengthened (or sabotaged) with special bonuses, weapons, and secret facedown cards. Action cards can be used to employ numerous strategies and keep your opponents guessing. The round suddenly ends when enough players pass, and the strongest front character wins the round! All of the other front characters are discarded, and the last player standing wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Cloud Control
description:
Cloud Control is a fun and fast paced game of creative imagination where you try to score the most points by shaping clouds into recognizable objects before time runs out.

Let your imagination run free as you turn, twist, overlap and animate cloud cards in unlimited creative ways of communication.

The sky is your canvas!

The game is simple to play and fun for all ages. On your turn:
1) Draw a word card and flip the timer
2) Use cloud cards to craft shapes for the words on your card
3) Other players try to guess the word and if they do, both of you earn points!

Components:
300 Shape Cards
64 Cloud Cards
50 Point Tokens
1 90 Second Timer
1 Card Holder
Rulebook

name: Panzer Vor Ausf. 2
description:
A wargame based off the anime "Girls und Panzer der Film". This game use same the tank units as the earlier game Panzer Vor!, but uses alternate character units and new game engine because focus to more larger tankery battle,

Each player has 30 tanks and some leaders. In the set-up, players organize their platoons from 1 to 4 tanks.
In the game, players alternate resolve an action, movement, attack, re-organize, card play or pass.

Victory conditions are defined for each scenario, the basic purpose is to destroy opponent tanks.

The game include 2 scenarios for first part and second part of Oarai vs University team. These two scenarios can be play continuously as a campaign game.
And also include 2 scenarios for "Panzer Vor!" based off first part of "Girls und Panzer der Film".

name: Labyrint 2.0
description:
A new version of the popular Labyrinth game! The game includes 4 new challenges:
Collect "livspuckar" in the labyrinth
Find the correct path through the sewer
Outsmart the Minus robot and pass the slime-tunnel
Be the first one to solve the gear-puzzle.

The game is either stand-alone, or it can be used together with either the first Labyrint game or the Labyrint-Flip.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Daisy Chain
description:
Basic idea: In Daisy Chain, players conduct a "Battle of the Garden Paths." Players aim to place paving stones of their color into a garden courtyard in order to construct a path leading to more flowers than any of their opponent's garden paths.

Daisy Chain is played on a hexagonal grid surrounded by flowers. On a player's turn, the player rolls "bug dice," which determine what cells on the grid are eligible for a stone placement. A player then places a single stone of his/her color into one of these cells; once placed, stones never move.

When the board is full or both players pass, chains of stones in each color will have been made. Players count how many flowers each chain of theirs touches. The player with the chain that touches the most flowers wins. In case of a tie, players compare their second-highest-scoring chains, and so on, until the tie is broken. Draws are impossible.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Farming, Print & Play

name: The Journey: Istanbul
description:
In this board game, you play as a Syrian, Iraqi or Afghan migrant traveling towards Europe.

Finding yourself in Istanbul as an undocumented traveler you need to navigate a world of smugglers, police and unscrupulous employers. Piece together the fragments of information you get to plan your own Journey!

The objective of the game is to leave Istanbul. The players take turn to move around different neighborhoods of Istanbul. They have to be at the right place at the right times to earn money, avoid police raids and finally find a smuggler to take them out of the city. The events that takes place each round is determined by event cards which the players may gain information about as the game progress. Special circumstance cards provides each player with a personal quest that need to be solved before leaving Istanbul.

name: Enredados
description:
This is a game of balance and group interaction with different levels of difficulty.

The cards indicate different positions. If you take them, you and your friends will be RAVELLED.

The game advances, you hold cards on your head and they are stepping on you; But he resists ... the first unraveling loses!

It includes the games: Ravelled and The Equilibrist.

CONTENT

A deck of "Ravelled" cards, a deck of "Equilibrist" cards, 30 "R" cards, instructions and variants of game.

---

Las cartas indican diferentes posiciones, al cumplirlas, tú y tus amigos quedan ENREDADOS.

El juego avanza, sostienes tarjetas sobre tu cabeza y te están pisando; pero resiste… ¡el primero que se desenreda pierde!

Incluye los juegos: Enredados y El Equilibrista.

Juegos de equilibrio e interacción grupal.
Distintos niveles de dificultad.

CONTENIDO

Un mazo de cartas “Enredados”, uno de “El Equilibrista”, 30 tarjetas E, instrucciones y variantes de juego.

name: Blank Marry Kill: #?&! Marry Kill
description:
Description from the publisher:

#?&! Marry Kill is an expansion to Blank Marry Kill, and will add all kinds of explicit R-rated references to your decisions. We're not going to lie; there's some bad stuff in here. So if you want to make your Blank Marry Kill decisions even more horrible, this is the deck for you.

name: Gumball Words
description:
Description from the rulebook:

How many points are your "Words" worth?

Players move around the gameboard by following the directions found on the letter tiles, and collect those tiles as they go. The player who uses those letter tiles to build the best words wins! (From Publisher's Website)

Collect as many letter titles as you can before you must remove your coin pawn from the gameboard. Use the instructions on the title to plan where you will move to next. At the end of the game, the player who can build the highest-scoring words will win.

name: Brooke
description:
In the middle of the 19th century, in Sarawak, in the north of Borneo, two fierce opponents are facing each other. The Iban-People, known and feared for their head hunting and piracy, and James Brooke, an English adventurer and vassal of the sultan of Brunei, who recently became the ruler of Sarawak.

In this strategy game 2 players wrangle with their dice for the predominance in different areas, which are represented by cards. In 4 battles are fought three areas each.

Alternately, the counterparties put dice with different values on the cards. But the waters off the coast are treacherous, so the dice change their positions and valence again and again. Anyone who holds the majority on one card after the betting of all the dices, assures the supremacy in this area.

Only those who are planning ahead, take advantage of the water's vagaries, and use their limited resources clever, will claim the rule in Sarawak.

name: Karrewiet
description:
A Karrewiet champion! A board game full of questions and funny facts about animals, showbizz, sports, school, the world and nature & science. Surprise your opponent with your knowledge about stuff that's happening on our planet. Gather all the pieces of the different categories while moving around on the board using direction stones. While collecting your pieces, you build a small cube. When the cube is complete, rush to the finish to be the first one to enter and win the game.

Karrewiet is named after the Belgium television program about the news. The game can be played with 2 to 4 players and is recommended for kids older than 8 years old.

name: Ars Combinatoria
description:
Ars Combinatoria is a collection of five games designed around the themes of time and human interaction.


時の祭壇 (Toki no Saidan)
Altar Of Time - manipulate your schedule to keep it 24 hours long, and increase your hand value to win.

幸せな時間 (Shiawase na Jikan)
Time Of Happiness - think of good or very good things in your past, present and future, according to cards you hold. The other players question you and win if they choose the correct cards you hold.

再会の約束 (Saikai no Yakusoku)
Promise Of Reunion - seal a promise to meet again at a time and place. The players that keep the promise are the winners.

運命の人 (Unmei no Hito)
Soulmates Destiny - Get to 4 of a kind in your hand by using another player's revealed hand.

秘密のサイン (Himitsu no Sain)
Secret Signs - a partnership game with players using secret signals to alter their hand value to be 30.

name: Fruit Ninja: Card Master
description:
Fruit Ninja: Card Master is a fast-paced deck building game that allows 2 to 4 players to compete and prove their wit and dexterity. As ninja apprentices, they need to master their arts and prove to Sensei who is the most worthy trainee.

The game takes place over four rounds in which each player has to play their 15-card deck in a real-time match-making showdown. After each battle, players have a chance to upgrade their cards and improve their deck!

—description from the publisher

A Kickstarter campaign was initiated for a series of 3 games based on the popular app game. Having not met the expected goals, the campaign was terminated. From the 3 games announced, only 1 made it to print: Fruit Ninja: Combo Party.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Jackal Archipelago: Ben Gunn's Island
description: Jackal Archipelago: Ben Gunn's Island is a new island that supplements the four islands included in the Jackal: Archipelago base game, allowing for larger islands to be created. Unique tiles of this set include the meeting with Ben Gunn and Spy Glass Hill.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Ghost Court
description:
In a small claims court full of plaintiffs and defendants, testy judges, overworked clerks, and peace-keeping bailiffs - all of whom might be living or dead - you and your friends will see that spectral justice is done, one absurd case at a time!

Cases last a few minutes and are ridiculous. Will you be an over-the-top landlord, aggrieved at a scheduled haunting gone off the rails? Will you be a sad poltergeist who only wants to make a bad smell? In Ghost Court, you might get to be both!

name: Wheel of Fortune Bingo Game
description:
Combine two household favorites with this Wheel of Fortune Bingo Game by Mattel!

PRODUCT FEATURES

​Just like on the show, the wheel has wedges, but in this game, most of them have three letters and just like in Bingo, you’re trying to complete a card.​​​

​After one player completes three puzzle cards, the player with the most points wins!​​
​
There are good and bad places to land on the Wheel, and when it’s your spin, you’re in control of what happens. . .​​
​
. . . unless you land on “Bankrupt” because then you’ll have to wipe your card clean! ​​

—description from the publisher

name: Noir
description:
Noir is a ‘denouement’ game for 3 – 6 Detectives that lasts only a few minutes per round. The ‘denouement mechanic’ is a special type of storytelling game, where the key elements of the stories events are determined by the game, then the players must weave them together in the most inventive of ways.
In Noir the game’s Judge sets a Victim and a Killer. Then players must select a Means, Motive and Opportunity from cards in their hand. They then use these elements to tell the story of how the killer did the deed. Preferably this is delivered in the style of a Detective in the third act, revealing to the audience and assembled cast just how clever they were to figure it out. The stories are cross examined and picked for holes by the other players, before the Judge settles on the best, using whatever criteria they prefer.
Noir is packed with a grim cast of Femme Fatales, gum shoe P.I.s, mean Mobsters and hardened Hit Men. The play throws up stories which are by turns dark, hilarious, inventive and always, always memorable.
At the bitter end the best denouement of the game wins!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Pytagora
description: The idea behind Pytagora is to have, instead of puzzle pieces with words, "arithmetic pieces": the ten digits from 0 to 9 and the four signs of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, in addition to the sign of equality. The pieces are used to compose equalities and the game rewards you with more points for better combinations (numbers with more digits, using division or multiplication, using a piece already on the table).

name: Brabble
description:
Brabble is a simple but interesting word game that includes bluffing, based on traditional student word games.

The players consecutively add letters (from a small selection) to one of three frames, creating words that include the framed letters in the same order...or do they? Because you can add a letter without knowing a word that actually contains the created fragment. As long as the next player doesn't challenge the fragment, you are safe. Players score a point for successfully adding the last letter that fits into a frame and for winning a challenge.

The challenge: Choose one of the frames and ask the previous player to name a word that contains the respective fragment (in the exact order of the letters). If they can, they win a point; if not, you do.

The game ends in a "best of three", which means that whoever scores the second point wins.

name: Zone à Défendre
description:
Zone à Défendre is a board game, cooperative, strategic, political (but not boring), from 1 to 6 players, from 14 years, duration of a game from 1h to 1h30.

You play as occupants of the ZAD of Notre-Dame-des-Landes in fight against a destructive and harmful airport project. To win you will have to build, sow, communicate, while preventing the progress of the police.

Play as a "ZADist" and defend these agricultural and wild lands and, beyond, the ideal of a world of simplicity and sharing. To stop bulldozers ransacking the hedgerows, you will have to acquire many skills: Cultivate your crops, learn the techniques of clown activism or of sabotage...or soirées around the fire to sustain the morale of activists! Multiply the building of cabins to slow down the progress of the bulldozers, place barricades to protect you from mobile gendarmes, mobilize external support and do not forget to harass the forces of order to demoralize them as much as possible...but beware the blows of their batons, the repression is ruthless...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Weak Defeat Strong
description:
Weak Defeat Strong is a territory control party game for 4-8 players ages 13 and up. Runtime is approximately 30-45 minutes.

There are two factions: the Cyborgs led by Commander Felix and the Human Resistance Army led by a man only known as Johnson.

In Weak Defeat Strong deception is a powerful tool. With only the villainous Commander Felix revealed in the game, players must use their skills to survey the battlefield, discover who can be trusted and destroy those that cannot. Players must use their skills and hand of cards to battle and claim the most territories. The Faction with the most territories after 13 rounds wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Territory Building

name: Strait of All Saints
description:
In Strait of All Saints, a single player controls Magellan's fleet as it tries to find its way from the Atlantic to the Pacific, during the first circumnavigation of the globe. The player has to manage ships, crew and supplies, while discovering the then unknown strait as various events conspire to thwart the player at every turn. The player wins if the Pacific is discovered and reached by any one Ship.

Combining exploration (tile laying), resource management (food, crew, wood, weapons) and dice rolling, Strait of All Saints conveys the sense of adventure and anticipation felt by the original expedition. However, hardship was a large part of the passage as well, and the player is beset throughout by foul weather and unruly crews.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Yōkai Quest: Epic Boss o-Goryo Sama
description:
A new epic boss o-Goryo Sama brings a new challenge to your games.
More miniatures! More enemies! More gameplay!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Treta do Anzol
description:
In the card game Treta do Anzol, you enter a family fishing contest. Unfortunately, fish is not the only thing that you are pulling up, there are also monsters, mermaids and other strangenesses. If you manage to get some fishes, you need to protect them from cats, and, of course, from your jealous relatives.

A player turn consists of two phases: The fishing phase, in which the player draws a card from the "pond" pile and puts it on their character card. The fish card a character holds shows a number which determines how many cards they can play in the second phase, the action phase. In this phase, players try to cheat the other players out of their catch. Over the course of the game, players try to protect their catch and cheat others out of theirs. At some point, a "final player" card appears in the pile that triggers the game end. Whoever holds most points from their catch in the end is the winner.

—user summary

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Skaven
description:
Warhammer: Skaven is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Skaven faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bioviva Junior
description:
3 challenges, all using images, inspired by the original Bioviva game and adapted for ages 5 and upward. Through miming, challenges, and location tests, younger children will have fun while also learning about the animals that live on the Earth’s many iconic regions! 2 to 4 players. From age 5. Made in France.

-publisher description

Environmental trivia for kids ages 5 and up. Through mimes, challenges, and localization tests, the youngest will discover the Earth, its emblematic places, and its animals. Parents will lead their children to learn how to read a map and better know their favorite animals, earning points with every good answer.

—user summary

name: Rory's Story Cubes: Atomic
description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on it's own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling
publishers: Asmodee, Rebel Sp. z o.o., The Creativity Hub

name: KOBE
description:
KOBE is a game where you sell various goods and collect money.
The player who succeeded in building the best relations with the various other players will be crowned best merchant.

—description from the publisher (translated)

ＫＯＢＥは様々な商品を売買し、お金を稼ぐカードゲームです。
様々なプレイヤーと良い関係を築けた人だけが優れた商人となれるのです。

—description from the publisher

name: Dopeman
description:
Dopeman is a not-so-family-friendly board game. Play as a power-hungry drug dealer trying to get rich quick. Deliver goods to your customers but watch out for the cops and rival dealers. They’ll try to take you down as you negotiate, bribe, and scheme your way to the top. Make the most money before time’s up, and you win!

The board is your block. To move forward, you’ll move your game piece around the sidewalk clockwise. You’ll also find a road that the cops drive on, a jail in the middle of the board, and apartments where you will deliver drugs. Your game piece moves based on the white die and the Cop Car moves based on the black die. The person who most recently did drugs goes first.

There are four drugs in the game: Weed, Molly, Coke, and Shrooms. Before the game begins, you’ll select one type of drug. There are four Suppliers on the board — one for each type of drug. Suppliers sell you drugs, which you’ll then sell at a higher price to your Clients for a profit. Each player has one Supplier from which they buy their designated drug exclusively. You can buy baggies of your designated drug for $10 each from your Supplier every time you land on, or pass over, your Supplier’s tile. You may buy as much as you can afford.

You’ll receive a Text Message card every time you land on or pass over, a notification tile. There are two types - those from Clients who would like to buy drugs (this will include which drugs they want, how many baggies, and which apartment to deliver them to), and those from Informants who give you advantages throughout the game.

To sell drugs:

Pass over, or land on, your Client’s apartment (indicated by their Text Message).
Burn Text Message card.
Discard sold drugs to the box.
Pick up $50 per drug sold from the box.


There is a Cop Car that travels around the board trying to bust dealers. If at any point, you have possession of drugs and the Cop Car lands on the adjacent tile to your game piece, you’ll go to Jail. (You will only be arrested if you’re in possession of drugs.)

There are two ways to avoid being arrested:

Bribe the Cops with $50. (The money should be put back into the box.)
Blackmail the cops with an appropriate Text Message from an Informant.


If you go to Jail, you must discard all of your drugs and weapons. To get out, you must complete a loop around the Jail with your game piece.

If on your turn, you land on a tile shared by another dealer’s game piece, you have the option to rob your friend, potentially stealing their drugs. Both players roll one die (the number you roll represents your Attack Strength), and the highest Attack Strength wins.

On your turn, you may buy weapons - Brass Knuckles, a Switchblade, and/or a Pistol. Weapons increase your Attack Strength during a robbery. You can continue to use your weapons until they’re confiscated by the police.

You can also buy an Associate. Associates follow you around the board, allowing you to increase your attack strength during a robbery and increase your movement around the board by +1.

On their respective turns, players may trade Text Messages, drugs, weapons, or cash. There are no rules around trading — all is fair in love and drugs. If, at any point, you run out of cash, you’re out.

When time is up, each player is given one last turn, starting with the first player of the game. When the last player completes their turn, each dealer should count how much cash they have. If you have a weapon, or unsold drug baggies, you may liquidate them for the price you paid. Once each player has tallied their liquidated assets and cash, the player with the highest total wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Black Stories Junior: School Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior". The colors represent the locations where the junior mystery stories play.

Black Stories Junior: School Stories are tricky riddles for clever pupils. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Black Stories Junior: School Stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

name: Chain Mail: The Goblin King – Adventure Kit
description:
The caves around you shake with the rumble of an encroaching horde.

The hundreds of goblins below ground answer to only one power. The Goblin King. And every moment you delay out of fear he grows ever stronger.

The Goblin King is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Repel the Goblin Horde.

This expansion includes the following:

Quest: The Goblin King
Character: Celynia, Shepherd
Map: Shifting Sands
Monsters: Ancient Ooze / Plague Rats
Treasure: Iron Shield



Released in the February 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Kurierzy
description:
In this game you play roles of couriers during World War II, attempting to deliver as many messages as possible to various cities in Europe. At the same time you have to avoid German patrols both on land and sea.

You are one of the real historical figures, like Jan Nowak-Jeziorański, the famous "Courier from Warsaw", Jan Karski or Elżbieta Zawacka.

Your deck of cards enables you to travel via land and sea routes or to hide safely in certain cities. You can pick up one message at a time and if you manage to deliver it safely, you are rewarded with points and a new card to improve your deck by allowing for more effective movements. Sometimes you can also influence movements of German agents to clear your way or block it for the opponent.

The game ends when certain number of messages has been delivered, and the courier with most valuable accomplished missions wins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Śladami Phileasa Fogga
description:
Join the Reform Club, take the challenge to set the world around!
Reforma Club, inspired by the English gentleman Phileas Fogg, decides to play the bet, in which each member will have to travel around the world before the expiration of eighty days. To travel almost 24,000 miles in such a short time, you need to prepare yourself: buy a train ticket, hire an elephant, and sometimes walk a few hundred miles on foot. It is not easy, because you can spend only £135 pounds for your trip. This is not the end of surprises! You also have to watch out for the other members of the Club because they do not always play fair; dangerous pirates or locals can prevent you from traveling, and the derailment of the train will significantly delay your journey.
Win a race by planning a trip and anticipating the moves of your rivals!
Board game inspired by J. Verne's novel "Around The World In Eighty Days".

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dołącz do Klubu Reforma, podejmij wyzwanie i wyrusz w podróż dookoła świata!

Klub Reforma, zainspirowany wyczynami angielskiego dżentelmena Phileasa Fogga, postanawia odtworzyć zakład, w którym każdy z członków będzie musiał odbyć podróż dookoła świata przed upływem osiemdziesięciu dni. Aby przebyć prawie 24 tysiące mil w tak krótkim czasie, należy odpowiednio się przygotować: kupić bilet na pociąg, wynająć słonia, a czasami przejść kilkaset mil pieszo. Nie jest łatwo, bo na początku swojej podróży masz w kieszeni tylko 135 funtów oraz bilet na lot balonem. To nie koniec niespodzianek! Musisz także uważać na pozostałych członków Klubu, ponieważ nie zawsze grają fair; groźni piraci lub tubylcy mogą przeszkodzić Ci w podróży, a wykolejenie pociągu znacznie opóźni Twoją wyprawę.

Wygraj wyścig, planując podróż i przewidując ruchy swoich rywali!

Gra planszowa inspirowana powieścią J. Verne’a „W 80 dni dookoła świata”.

—description from the publisher

name: UNO: Toy Story 4
description:
It's the classic card game you know, now with an exciting Disney Pixar Toy Story 4 theme! Based on the highly anticipated family film, this UNO deck features cards with images of your favorite Toy Story 4 characters, plus the Duke Caboom Wild Card! When played, Duke will “crash” into two other players of your choice. Pick two players, mix their cards together and deal them back out equally to each player.

Like classic UNO, players take turns matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck either by color or number. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!"

—from the publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Zázraky přírody
description:
Do you feel that the offspring have asked you for a thousand answers? Give it back to them with the fun family game Miracles of Nature inspired by the TV show of the same name. A dynamic game with a thousand questions combines education with playfulness and will entertain anyone who joins it. You will move around the game board for the correct answers and go to your destination. In addition, your opponents will choose the final question. In addition to learning a lot of new things, you will also try a number of home attempts!

—description from a publisher (translated)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Epic Card Game: Knight of the Dawn Promo Card
description:
Epic Card Game Promo Card Knight of the Dawn

This is a Good Human Knight Champion
Blitz
Tribute --> You may banish target evil token champion.

This card comes in WWG1602E Tournament Kit
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Dead Man's Cabal: Undeading Pack
description:
Package of 10 ritual promo cards that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign and given for free at all backers.

The 10 cards are:
- Raptor
- Triceratops
- Philosopher
- Cantina
- Hamilton
- Childhood
- Dead Party Members
- Dunkleosteus
- Explorer
- Mittens

name: Au feu les pompiers
description:
Race to save the most animals from the flames!

This 2-player game revisits the card game War (aka Battle in the UK) and uses it as a mechanism to determine who gets to pick a card from the building in flames.

The building is a 4 x 4 grid of face-down cards, mostly animals (1 point per animal at the end of the game), but also 2 other types of cards, fire hydrants (2 cards) which give you an extra turn (pick another card from the building) or the "Cantinier/Cantinière" card (2 cards) which gives negative points at the end of the game (-1 per card).

Moreover, the value of the winning card for each battle will decide up to which floor a building card can be picked. For example, a value of 3 for the winning card will let the player choose any card from the first 3 floors, but not the 4th.

When the last building card is taken, players tally their points and the one with the most points wins the game.

—user summmary

name: Cicera Bigia
description:
Cicera bigia or Ciccia or even Ciccera, is a card game closely related to the more common card game of "scopa" (broom). Cicera is played mainly in the province of Brescia (northern Italy). Cicera is a traditional game, with many local variants and an unspecific origin, so there isn't a standard set of rules, but there are many local or familiar differences, though the core rules are always the same.
To be able to play this game the specific deck of cards of brescia, which consist of 52 card (and not 40, as its common in other italian decks). The available cards are king, knight, knave, 10, 9,8,7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, ace(1). It's also possible to play with a standard french/international deck (taking out the jokers).

Preparation and goal:
You play with four players (but there is also a 2 player variant), in pairs, two against two, each sitting in front of his partner. Every player has an hand of 12 cards, the remaining 4 cards are put face up on the middle of the table. The dealer is initially chosen at random, but after each hand, the dealer turn passes to the person who is at his left hand (clockwise).
The first pair that reaches 51 (sometimes 41, 31 or 21) or more points at the end of the game wins. If both pairs reach 51 in the same hand the highest score wins.

The game:
The player to dealer's left plays first, and continue until you play all the cards in the players's hands.
A turn consists of playing one card from their hand on the table, face-up, and clearly visible, which can take (or not take) one or more cards placed on the table itself.
If the value of the card played matches that of a card (or a sum of cards) placed on the table, the cards on the table can be taken and put face down in front of you, to be scored at the end of the game.
The numeric cards from 1 to 10 have a value equal to the value of the card itself and can take 1 card of the same value or more than 1 card, but the sum of these cards must have a value equal to the played card.
The faces (king, knight, knave) can take only another card of the same face.
You can choose freely the card to play, you are also free to choose to take card(s) or not, and you can also choose which cards to take, as long as the values match.
After playing all the cards, the last player who has taken cards also takes all the cards remaining on the table.

The scoring system:
At the end of the game the players of a couple put together their own cards.
There are 6 points that are always assigned, each to one or the other player or pair, regardless of the conduct of the game (the so-called "Honours").
All the other points may or may not be assigned depending on the progress of the game.
Cards (2 points): The pair that takes more than half of the cards gets 2 points, in case of a tie (26 to 26) every pair gets one point.
Swords (1 point): The pair that takes more than half (7) of the cards of the swords gain 1 point.
Good cards (1 point for card): The 2 of swords, the knave of cups and the ten of coins are worth 1 point each.
Neapolitan(or Naples): If a couple takes the ace, two and three of swords, they get a number of points equal to the highest card of the swords captured which is present in an unbroken sequence of cards of swords: for example, if you made the following outlets: A-2-3-4-5 and 7 of swords, the score will be 5 because 5 is the highest card of the sequence uninterrupted.

You can also score points during the rounds (traditionally you keep track of this point by placing a face up card in front of you, while the card taken are normally face down):

Scopa (Broom): You realize 1 point when you leave the middle of the table empty of cards.
Picchiata (Hit) or Surprise: You realize 1 point for Hit if you play a card of the same value just played by the previous player (and take the two cards of the same value).
Similar: It produces 1 point if the card played and taken are all of the same suit and if their number is more than 3.
Quadrille: You realize 1 point for a quadrille if you play a card that takes a group of three or more cards (not necessarily of the same suit) from the table.

—user summary

name: 空中都市アーレア (The Sky City of ALEA)
description:
Several hundreds years have passed since the skycity of ALEA, a place that used to be known as "the center of Civilization", perished with countless hidden treasures and booby traps. Seeking unknown treasures, many reckless adventurers still make attempts to visit ALEA these days.

In 空中都市アーレア (The Sky City of ALEA), each player is an adventurer who throws dice, hoping to avoid triggering booby traps. The game ends when someone reaches a certain number of points, and the person with the most points wins.

空中都市、アーレア。
かつて文明の中心として栄え、そして滅びた都。
滅びの刻から数百年経った今でも、数多の財宝、そしてトラップが眠る場所。
まだ見ぬ秘宝を求め、今日も幾人かの探索者がアーレアに挑戦するのであった。

このゲームは、各プレイヤーが探索者となり、トラップを発動させないようにダイ
スを振るゲームです。ラウンドを繰り返し、誰かが特定の点数に到達した後最終ラ
ウンドを行います。最終的に一番点数が高かった人の勝利です。
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: L'osti d'jeu des régions
description:
This box regroup all the 18 mini-expansion of the regions:
Bas-Saint-Laurent (01), Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean (02), Capitale-Nationale (Québec) (03), Mauricie (04), Estrie (05), Montréal (06), Outaouais (07), Abitibi-Témiscamingue (08), Côte-Nord (09), Nord-du-Québec (10), Gaspésie-Îles-de-la-Madeleine (11), Chaudière-Appalaches (12), Laval (13), Lanaudière (14), Laurentides (15), Montérégie (16), Centre-du-Québec (17) and the Acadie.

Find places, peoples and expressions reported by the people, for the people.

432 cards total (108 black and 324 red) : 6 black + 18 red for every regions.

Authors from all over the Quebec and the Acadie.


Cette boîte regroupe les 18 mini-extensions des régions :
Bas-Saint-Laurent (01), Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean (02), Capitale-Nationale (Québec) (03), Mauricie (04), Estrie (05), Montréal (06), Outaouais (07), Abitibi-Témiscamingue (08), Côte-Nord (09), Nord-du-Québec (10), Gaspésie-Îles-de-la-Madeleine (11), Chaudière-Appalaches (12), Laval (13), Lanaudière (14), Laurentides (15), Montérégie (16), Centre-du-Québec (17) et l’Acadie.

Retrouvez des lieux, personnages et expressions rapportés par le peuple, pour le peuple.

432 cartes au total (108 noires et 324 rouges) : 6 noires + 18 rouges pour chaque région
Auteurs provenant des quatre coins du Québec et de l’Acadie
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: San Jose
description:
San Jose, California.
There is a mansion which had been extended for 38 years.
This bizarre building which has over thousand rooms and ten-thousand windows is called after a lady who owned it, "Winchester Mystery House".

The theme of this co-operative game is Winchester Mystery House. Evil spirits which intend to curse and kill the lady will intrude into the house, but lady cannot move to elude them. Using employees of the mansion, who are in six types of job that each has unique ability, and by extending the house, the players must protect lady from the threat of these evils.

Can you protect the lady to the end...? It requires your wisdom, teamwork, and a bit of luck.

屋敷の婦人を悪霊から守る協力ゲーム。迫り来る悪霊からうまく逃げられるように各役職の能力を結集して「屋敷を広げ」「婦人を逃がし」「悪霊を牽制」しよう。屋敷が拡張が完了した時、婦人が生きていれば私たちの勝利
publisher's summary

The 2018 edition has some small revisions to the first edition:

+ size of the box and rulebook

+ artworks of some of room tiles

+ shape of evil spirit tokens (disk to cube)

+ material of lady token (plastic to wood)

Components of the game
Room tile x 70
Job tile x 6
Evil Spirit tile x 5
Setup tile x 4
Tokens x 13
Evil Spirit token x 5 (each 1 for red, blue, green, yellow, and black)
Lady token x 1
Dice x 2
Rulebook x 1
Summary Sheet x 1
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wer krabbelt da?
description:
﻿Bashful Bugs

Which bashful bug is hiding under which flower? Once they’re covered up, players need to remember which bug is where. Try and remember which bug is under the flower the die shows. The player who collects the most bugs wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Only Word Igneous
description:
Find the Only Word clue for several words of your card.
Be the first to guess the clues, hit the targets and avoid hazardous trapwords!
2–5 players or teams, 1200+ words, 2 modes and 100+ hours of play.

Mode SPECIFIC TARGETS

Players get 9 cards. First player (Clue Giver) shifts his 1st card right to see the side bar of the 2nd card. This secret key indicates 2 target words on the 1st card, that must be bridged with one-word association, and 1 optional target word. The Clue Giver says the one-word clue and how many words he has bridged (2 or 3), then shows his card. Other players try to be the first to solve the clue. The fastest player covers the card and says his version. If all 2/3 words are correct, the Clue Giver and the Clue Solver each discard one card. If not - the Clue Giver says how many words were guessed right (but not which ones) and other players attempt to guess them. The player who is the first to get rid of his cards wins the game.

Mode HAZARDOUS TRAPS

Opposite to the previous rules, the secret key shows the 3 trap words, that should be avoided. The Clue Giver shows his words, says his one-word clue, trying to bridge as many words (except the traps) as he can. Then he announces the challenge level: 2,3 or 4 points. Players have their player pads and erasable markers, and simultaneously try to choose and mark words on their pads, that look associated with the clue – as many as the chosen challenge level (2/3/4). Then all the players show their pads, and Clue Giver shows his secret key. Players who avoided all the traps are Solvers, others – Non-solvers.
