Scoring: 1) The Clue Giver gets challenge points for every Solver. 2) Every Solver gets challenge points + 1 point for every Non-solver. 3) The first Solver gets 1 additional point.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Bacon Project
description:
Bacon Project is an expandable card game destined for devoted fans of Player Versus Player type games (PvP). The game pits two criminals renowned for their destructive capabilities in an underground arena.
With access to a variety of skills and abilities provided by their selected character, each of the players are charged with accomplishing one objective: To slay their opponent’s character in order to achieve victory. By managing those abilities, players are put to the test of finding most effective strategies and combos to achieve said victory.
Bacon Project uses a SINGLE standard 54-card deck of playing cards.
Each of the players must be in the possession of a Character Profile, which can be found here on the official website.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Robby One
description:
Communicate with your right and left neighbours simultaneously ! You're being driven by one and are driving the other ! Without any oral communication, only with your feet, arms and eyes ! Will you be able to manage emission and reception to build robots correctly ?
A party game with coop or competitive mode, up to 12 players.

In cooperative mode, you need to build your robots as fast as you can since you're limited by the time. Any error at the end of the timer will destroy your robot, hence giving you no points, so be carreful not to be too hasty.
In competitive mode, the first two robots completed ends the round. The builder and the planner both gain points for each robots completed. At the end of the second round, the winner is decided by most points.

--

Communiquez avec vos voisins de droite et de gauche en même temps ! Vous êtes piloté par l’un, pendant que vous pilotez l’autre ! Sans parler, juste avec vos pieds, vos bras et vos yeux. Saurez-vous gérer l’émission et la réception pour fabriquer vos robots correctement ?
Un jeu d’animation en mode coopératif ou compétitif, jusqu’à 12 joueurs.

En coopératif, vous êtes limités en temps. Vous devez construire vos robots respectifs le plus vite possible mais sans erreur. Si à la fin du chronomètre, votre robot contient une erreur, il est considéré détruit et ne rapporte aucun point.
En compétitif, dès que deux robots sont déclarés finis, le round s'arrête. A l'issue du round, on regarde les robots finis. Si ces derniers sont corrects, le contructeur et le donneur d'ordre de chaque robot gagne des points. Sinon, ce sont les autres joueurs qui gagnent des points. A l'issue du deuxième round, on compte les points et celui qui en a le plus gagne

name: Gierki Małżeńskie: Wiem Wszystko
description:
Gierki Małżeńskie: Wiem Wszystko ("Marriage Games: I Know Everything") is a part of Gierki Małżeńskie ("Marriage Games") series. It is a stand-alone game, but the cards can also be used in the base Gierki Małżeńskie game.

Gierki Małżeńskie: Wiem Wszystko is a general knowledge quiz. Players play in pairs (2-4 couples) and answer the questions on the cards. There are three types of questions: "True/False", "A/B/C" or "List a few" (e.g. list two phobias). In the basic variant, couples compete with each other. There is also a one couple variant in which partners compete against each other.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: Polska
description: In Trivial Pursuit Polska you will face questions from categories such as History and Geography, but you'll also find out how well you know the Tastes of Poland and whether you are up to date with the world of Popculture.

name: 3 Lands or King
description:
A little game of conquest.
Two Houses against each other, one kingdom to conquer!

In this 8 card microgame, 2 players each vie to conquer three of the five lands, or become king (by conquering 2 lands with a total value of 18 or more). The first to do so wins.

Each land battle takes place as players add one of 5 army types to the land, then maneuvers them using their unique movement abilities to attempt to be first to get 3 armies in a row.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement, Tug of War

name: Before the Invasions
description: Extra units, cards, and scenarios covering the very first invasions that failed to be decisive such as those at the time of Marcus-Aurelius, Diocletian, or Constantine.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: RPG Battles: The Card Game
description:
Kill Monsters. Snag Treasure. Survive If You Can.

RPG Battles: The Card Game, is a cards, dice, and strategy roleplaying game that is Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible.

Players select a Character to play: Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Rogue, Ranger, or Sorceress. To start the game, each Player receives five random cards from the deck. Use these cards to configure your Character with additional weapons, armor, magic, or special events.

Gameplay consists of three phases:


Play cards: you may play as many cards from your hand as you wish.
Draw a card: you must draw a card before you end your turn. If you draw a Monster or a trap, resolve combat.
Discard: you may not hold more than five cards in your hand by the end of your turn.


Players take damage to their Character from battling Monsters or by encountering traps. Playing cards allows you to buff up for battle, avoid dangerous situations, or heal lost health.

Players take turns playing cards and fighting Monsters, while strategizing for best advantage. The last player standing wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: Yakatabune
description:
In Yakatabune, a.k.a. 屋形船, an area-majority puzzle game, you and another player are rival pyrotechnicians who are competing to prove your mastery in the summer's most anticipated fireworks festival. To do so, you need to place fireworks cards on your side of the river to complete your program cards while attempting to earn the applause of each "yakatabune" — that is, "houseboat" — card by having a majority in that column.

In more detail, to set up lay out the seven yakatabune cards in a row; place three starter fireworks (value 1) on the starting player's side of the board and four starters on the other side in alternating columns. You start with two cards in hand from your deck of 13 cards, and you choose two program cards from the three you're dealt.

On a turn, play a fireworks card on your side of the board in the closest empty space next to a yakatabune on your choice. Your opponent may then use the effect of that fireworks card — swapping two cards, shifting a card to an adjacent space, or flipping a card — on either their cards, your cards, or the yakatabune, depending on the icons depicted on the associated yakatabune. Alternatively, your opponent may decline to use the effect and instead draw a program card.

After you play a card, if you have a program card in hand that matches the pattern of fireworks on your side of the board, you can play that card, take the bonus actions on it to shift one or more of your cards, then play another program card if you now have that pattern.

Next, if the number of cards surrounding a yakatabune equals or exceeds that boat's limit, you sum the fireworks on each side to see who has captured the awe of the viewers on that boat. Mark this boat with an applause token, then turn all of the winning player's fireworks face down. (Face-down cards can still be used to complete many pattern cards.) End your turn by drawing a fireworks card from your deck.

When the game ends after five applause tokens have been placed or the fireworks or program cards run out, players tally their collected awe to see who wins.

•••

YAKATABUNEは、2人用のパズルとマジョリティのゲームです。
プレイヤーは花火師となり、注目を集めている花火大会でライバルとどちらが優れた花火師かを競います。
自分のエリアに花火カードを配置し、演目カードに描かれたレイアウトを達成しながら
屋形船カードのマジョリティを競います。

name: Воображарий: Россия
description:
Воображарий: Россия ("Imagination: Russia") is a special edition of a Russian party superhit. Each card contains typical Russian things to be described and the active player will be trying to do that in 1 minute by speaking, drawing, or performing. Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game wins!

Сможете ли вы напеть русскую народную песню или нарисовать выражение «в Тулу со своим самоваром»? А помните ли, чем знаменит Алёша Попович, — и, что важнее, удастся ли вам это изобразить?
«Воображарий: Россия» — особая версия разговорного хита для весёлой и находчивой компании. На каждой карте вы найдёте задания, связанные с культурой, географией и историей нашей страны. Каждый ход игрока-ведущего ждёт вызов: всего за 1 минуту ему придётся объяснить другим участникам задание с карты при помощи сказа складного, представления молчаливого или рисунка дивного. Проявите изобретательность, смекалку и чувство юмора — и победа у вас в кармане!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Racing, Trivia, Word Game

name: Welcher Dino leuchtet da?
description: Welcher Dino leuchtet da? is a children's game that in English is named Which Dinosaur Shines Here?

name: 花嫁が多すぎる(Too Many Brides)
description:
Based on the Quintessential Quintuplets manga: Players vie to influence which of the quintuplets will marry Futaro Uesugi.

In each round, players are dealt 5 cards. They play one card at a time until everyone has only 2 cards left.

On your turn, you can either discard a card to change the order of the candidates, or "whisper": play a card to cause a trait to be undesirable. Immediately after a whisper, there is a simultaneous vote. Anyone who wants to challenge the whisper discards a card to do so.

At the end of the round, players score their highest-ranked candidate card that isn't cancelled by a previously unchallenged whisper.

The game ends after a set number of rounds:

3 player - 6 rounds
4 player - 4 rounds
5 player - 5 rounds.

Then the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Bank or Bust
description:
You headed west to make your fortune, but the situation is volatile. You’ve got to keep pushing your luck to improve your advantage and claim the bounty. But go too far and you may end up with nothing! Will you play it safe or risk it all on a big win?

Play is simultaneous. The game occurs over several rounds. On each round, one player rolls a single die multiple times. Players track the numbers rolled on the path around the edge of their scoresheet. Each time the die is rolled, the number thrown is added to the previous total.

If a 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 is thrown: After each throw, independently each player must decide whether to bank OR spend OR continue.

If a 6 is thrown: Any player still in the round busts. When you bust, cross off a bust box. You may not bank or spend any money. If you run out of bust boxes, you are out of the game.

Points in the bank will count towards your end game score. Points spent will give you benefits later in the game. Maybe you'll start higher up the track each turn, or score double on fives... The higher up the track you push, the greater the potential rewards, but the further you have to fall...

The winner is the player who banks the most by the end of the game.

Any number of players can play the game. Bank or Bust is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the designer

name: Lockdown!: The Game
description:
Lockdown!: The Game is a comedy game created by James Veitch during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic in which players try to trade cards to collect sets and loo rolls before COVID-19 ends the game. The trading mechanisms are supported by a bluffing mechanism in which players can lie about the cards they are trading.

Each player starts with seven cards from the twelve types in the game. Each turn, a player draws two additional cards, then tries to negotiate trades, e.g., "I can trade Day drinking and Online, for company and distraction." After a successful deal, players trade the cards secretly. When trading, players can lie about the cards they are offering, except the first card that they offer. Players can additionally add Loo rolls as sweeteners for the trade. If a player collects three cards in the same category, they must play this set for points.

The game ends when six COVID-19 cards are drawn, then all played sets are scored. Black cards in your sets (good events) are worth 2 points, loo rolls are 1 point, and red cards and unplayed cards are 0 points.

name: Swearmints
description:
Overview

Swearmints is a quick party game about making up new slang and defining it for your friends! Earn Mints by coming up with the best definitions!

Set Up

Start by choosing one person to be the Mint Master (or dealer) for the round.
Remove the cards from the tin and shuffle them lightly, but keep the mint cubes inside.
The Game

The Mint Master starts by dealing out 2 cards to all other players. Each card has 4 silly words on each side, so each player will have 16 words to play with.
All players must combine one word on each of their cards to form a new slang phrase and arrange it face up in front of them. (They cannot combine two words on the same card).
Once everyone is ready, each player must introduce their new slang phrase and tell the Mint Master what it means.
Scoring

After each player has defined their word, the Mint Master awards 1 Mint to their favorite new slang phrase, plus:

1 bonus Mint if that player used alliteration (two words with the same first letter, such as Boof Bucket) AND
1 bonus Mint if that player used a rhyme (such as Poot Boot).
The winner of the round may win anywhere from 1-3 mints based on their slang phrase.

Round End

Once the winner is chosen, all of the used cards are discarded, the Mint Master passes the tin clockwise, and you go back to the start. Re-shuffle as needed.
Play continues until the tin runs out of mints, and the person with the most mints wins. (If the tin has less mints then the last winner is owed, that winner gets ‘em all).
Try to incorporate your new favorite slang phrases into your everyday life!

—description from the publisher

name: Flock of Seagulls
description:
Flock of Seagulls was created as we wanted a game to slap down on seagulls, they are chip thieves.
Flock of Seagulls is a 2-5 playing card game, in which players must try and win all the cards in the deck. Cards are shuffled and dealt evenly to all players.

You win the centre pile by slapping down on the following scenarios - Good Food Card – Trio of Seagulls in a Row – Two Ice Cream Seagulls. However, there are various Bad Food Cards and special cards in the pack to which if slapped on, that player must forfeit 3 cards to the centre pile.
Special cards like the Pirate Seagull have been added, whereby once lain, all players must shout Parlay and the last player to do so, forfeits 3 cards to the centre pile.

If the Mob Card is lain, that player can shout mob before the next player lays their card and claim 5 cards from any player.
This game can be played for 1 minute or 15 minutes, it all depends on how good you are at spotting the difference between the cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Ilustres Ignorantes "El Juego"
description:
Test your wit and intelligence with the game of the Movistar+ program. An original idea by Javier Coronas, Pepe Colubi and a little more by Javier Cansado, developed by David Vaquero. A game of cards and dice in which you take on the role of the program's host and guests in a fight to be the most illustrious. Knowledge and stupidity are guaranteed in equal parts.

—description from the designer

Pon a prueba tu ingenio y tu inteligencia con el juego del programa de Movistar+. Una idea original de Javier Coronas, Pepe Colubi y un poquito más de Javier Cansado, desarrollada por David Vaquero. Un juego de cartas y dados en el que tomarás el rol de presentador e invitados del programa en una lucha por ser el más Ilustre. Conocimiento y estupidez están garantizadas a partes iguales.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Dice, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling, Voting

name: Hey, Corona! USA
description:
Born out of the odd experiences that hit the nation over the last few months, Hey Corona! is an outrageously fun card game where you try to stockpile as much toilet paper as you possibly can, while keeping yourself virus free by playing various action cards! Simple yet strategic, this game is great for all ages and perfect for socially distanced groups and families.

Save as much toilet paper as you possibly can in your "stockpile" of six face-down cards. Use action cards to switch out what you are hoarding and try to get rid of any cards with the virus.

At the end of each round, Toilet Paper Cards add points and Corona Cards take points away. Player with the most points at the end of 4 rounds wins.

From the Kickstarter and website descriptions.

name: Biblios: Quill and Parchment – Chapel Cards
description:
Use your abbot influence to choose tasks and earn more piety points with this 8-card pack.

Introduces Step 4: Compline where players bid on how much influence they would spend to gain the chapel card's benefit.

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Action Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Fair Isle 40
description:
A knitting card game for 1-2 players in which players compete to knit the best FAIR ISLE PATTERN. Players earn points by completing rows, matching motifs and unlocking bonuses.

The Fair Isle deck is made of cards that display simple two-colour knitting motifs (diamonds, crosses, etc). Players build hands of motif cards which are then played in rows to create a knitting pattern. Each row is just 3 cards long, and a completed Fair Isle pattern is just 4 rows high (12 cards in tital).

There are also 8 pattern bonus cards (yellow) that provide certain conditions to score bonuses on that row (for instance, knitting a ‘green row’ at the right time can earn you an extra 20 points).

Players score points for :

knitting a complete row
repeating patterns in a row
finishing 4 rows first
alternating stripes of colour
unlocking row Pattern Bonuses


SETUP

Each player is dealt 3 cards. The remaining deck forms a Draw Pile between the players, with the top two cards placed face up by the draw pile.

4 Pattern Bonus cards are also chosen and placed face up, one above the other, in a column between the players. The bottom card is ‘row 1’ - the top card is ‘row 4’.

PLAY

On their turn, a player can take ONE of the following FOUR actions:


PICK UP - either: 1 x face up Fair Isle card or: 2 x face down cards (Draw Pile)
KNIT - Place ANY NUMBER of cards from your hand into your pattern.
UNRAVEL - Take any number of ‘knitted’ cards back to your hand.
DISCARD - Discard your entire hand.


END OF TURN

At the end of their turn, a player will either DRAW BACK UP to 3 (if less than 3 cards are in their hand) or DISCARD DOWN to 5 (if they have more than 5 cards left in hand:)

GAME END

The game ends when one player completes their Fair Isle pattern first, receiving a bonus 40 points. The other player can take one more turn before the final scores are then tallied up.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Master Hunter
description:
Face your own friends in a merciless battle to decide who will be the next Master Hunter, creatures and traps await you in this quick card game where only one can survive!

Each player will have their own character cards that they must keep alive. On each turn, the player decides which threat card on the board to explore, he will use the dice to overcome the creatures or traps he finds. All players will compete for the same goal: to survive and become a master hunter. During the game, everyone will be able to hinder the hunt of others by means of cards from the deck. The player who survives the threats and his friends will be the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Black Stories: Tödliche Party
description:
It's party time - and anything can happen: Whether it's a night of drinking in a club, a graduation party, a New Year's Eve party, a bachelor party, a girls' night out, Father's Day or the infamous "Dorffest" - we love to celebrate wildly! And a lot can go wrong in the process: Highly embarrassing mishaps and crazy ideas that might end fatally...

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Seeds of Disaster
description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

The Seeds of Disaster is a game about how events of the 1930s affected World War II, most especially the German invasion
of the West in 1940. This game connects a war campaign with the military preparations, intelligence developments, and diplomacy that preceded it. It is an attempt to represent a piece of history as interconnected with other historical developments. This is a two-player game in which one player takes the Germans and the other the Western Allies, including
France, Great Britain, Belgium, and Holland. Victory is determined by control of Mobilization Center and Objective Areas at the end of the last turn of play.

In broad outline, what you see here is a game that is multi-dimensional and coupled. The initial phase of play creates a game history of the 1930s to generate the concrete situation for the German invasion of the West in 1940. By intertwining fresh dimensions of Intelligence and Command, the game creates new ways in which the 1940 situation can be distinctive from
one play of the game to the next. The invasion campaign is the culmination of the game. With this partially scripted history,
how does the war progress? The geography will be the same, the deployment of the forces may be similar, but the details of
the forces and their Intelligence and Command postures can be very different.

name: Liar Liar: The Game of Truths and Lies
description:
A Hilarious Party Game for all ages. Who's the best LIAR in your friend group?

Each round players share a short, personal statement relating to one of their topic cards. If you get the secret role of LIAR, you have to lie! Everybody else has to tell the truth. You win by identifying the liar, and by tricking your friends into thinking YOU are the liar.

The player who wins the most rounds, wins the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Voting

name: Bardo
description:
Bardo ("Flame War") is a real-life app where we will talk about EVERYTHING! The chat got heated. Display the menu of viral topics: everyone has their opinion and the fight is starting. We can make a big deal, make a mess or talk nonsense, know what we are talking about or not have a clue. All's fair in this game. Get ready for trolling in the group by playing your best cards.

Objective: Follow the conversation and discard the most Bardo cards throughout the game rounds. The winner is whoever runs out of cards first, or who has the least amount at the end of 3 rounds.

Deal 7 Bardo cards to each player. Put cellphone camera spots (Bardo cards background) on the table according to the number of players, to mark how many Bardo cards will be played each round. Choose a viral theme to talk about, from the menu or select one yourself.

A player starts playing one of their cards on a Bardo spot, and talking about the theme relating it to the Bardo card (by theme, feelings, or any way is valid). Words in the table cannot be mentioned, and a card would be taken as penalization if done. The player can be interrupted by other after 5 seconds or when they finish the idea. The interrupting player plays a new Bardo card, and has to answer or discuss the previous speech.

When all spots are covered, the round ends. The played cards are shuffled in the deck, and a vote is made (except on the last round) to penalize the most incongruent player on the round, with each player receiving an additional card for each vote they received against them.

The winner is whoever runs out of cards first, or who has the least amount at the end of 3 rounds.

name: Qloxx: AstroSnipe
description:
In 2107, two planets are on the verge of an interstellar war. As the vanguard commander of AstroSnipe, your mission is to navigate through black holes and chaotic asteroids between the planets and snipe at the enemy's planet to make the first strike!

Qloxx: AstroSnipe is a 2-player abstract strategy game about connections and obstructions in the size of a matchbox! By laying down and replacing the 9 Pathway tiles on the board, you control your troops' laser to shoot down enemy fleets and establish safe encampments for back-ups. The side that first strikes the enemy Home Planet will claim victory!

Players place place or remove tiles on the centre board, or exchange one for another from hand.

The game ends and you win when the enemy Planet Tile (like the King in chess) is removed from the board. The game may also ends in a draw if both players are exchanging the same 3 tiles on the same spot for over a full cycle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Βαλκανικοί Πόλεμοι 1912-1913
description:
Four players compete to keep/gain cities of the Ottoman Empire in Europe. The player with most cities under his control after 7 rounds is the winner. The game introduces a 4-outcome mechanism to conclude the result of each attack on a city using a fortune wheel. No dices used at all. Other game mechanisms include cards, pick of advantages from a table, etc.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Events, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Age of Flora
description:
The passion for flowers in the colonial period among the European powers, especially the Dutch and the British, is somewhat forgotten today. In Britain in particular, 'plant hunters' brought back bulbs, seeds and sometimes even seedlings of native species from Asia, Africa and the Americas, which were then propagated, crossbred and adapted to the cold climate by gardeners back home. This seemingly impossible project was supported by a flood of funding from patrons, mainly royalty, aristocrats and wealthy families.

In Age of Flora, flowers are everything. You are a flower buyer, so you need to collect as many flowers as possible before your competitors do. The sooner you reach seven flowers in your possession, the sooner you will receive a contract to deliver them to the noblemen's mansions - which will naturally have magnificent gardens. However, you cannot buy all the flowers. The market is limited in size and the varieties that should be delivered to the 'Royal Gardens' are not easily accessible!

In Age of Flora, players aim to collect 7 different flower saplings the fastest! However, if you wait too long for flowers to accumulate, the market may fill up go bust! Or the Royal family may swoop in an buy the flowers from under your nose.
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Discipline ～ジェレミア魔法学校の3年間～
description:
Discipline: 3 Years at Jeremiah School of Magic is a cooperative game where players take on the role of new instructors at the prestigious Jeremiah School of Magic. Over the course of three years, they work to balance each student's needs, provide encouragement, and help them graduate. Should one instructor ever find themselves a bit overwhelmed, they can call on their co-workers for a helping hand.

After choosing from one of the four classes, players receive the corresponding event chart, seat number deck, and student cards. The students are shuffled and randomly placed in a 3x4 grid, which forms the seating chart for the room. Then seat number cards are drawn to determine the initial placement of power and negative markers.

Play proceeds through a series of lesson rounds, both group and individual ones. Instructors try to balance encouragement and enthusiasm via the movement of power markers while slowing or outright eliminating the stress and frustration from the negative markers. Should a student ever accumulate enough stress, they can spread it to others around them or even become absent.

At the close of three years, students are subject to a final exam. After that, those that are absent or lack at least one power marker fail to graduate. Teachers are then provided with a title and evaluation based on their work. If too many students fail to pass, all the instructors are also seen as failures and lose.

name: #inconversible: Dawn erasing you
description:
It's a collaborative reasoning game where two or more players can play.

It is divided into one owner of SNS and other players, but everyone has the same goal.

In the quiet dawn, the main character(owner) who just broke up with his lover is trying to delete an SNS photo album containing memories with him/her.

I deleted it by leaving a hashtag, but I couldn't erase the most precious memory.

Other players follow the adjective hashtag left by the owner of SNS, and flip picture tiles that are the most distant from the feeling the hashtag gives. If the last picture tile after the fifth round was the most precious memory, everyone won. If you overturned the most precious memory during the round, everyone lost immediately.

Leave only one precious memory.

name: Play & Repeat
description: The games uses six coloured dice which are rolled to try scoring the most “money” (points), by crossing off tetris shapes on a player sheet to fill lines, fill coulours and cross off bonus squares.

name: Leviathans: The Great War
description:
Leviathans is a tabletop miniatures game that uses the innovative modular dice system of color-coded dice and easy-to-read physical record-keeping cards that allow for quick and easy play while retaining the depth of strategy that will encourage repeat play.

This expands on the original edition, adding new abilities, ships and factions past what was in the original edition, while advancing the timeline directly into the The Great War era.

Each game centers around moving our pre-painted miniatures across a hex board, trying to out-maneuver your opponent. Players will fire various weapons at each other's ships until either an objective is completed or the enemy falls from the sky. The base game comes with German and French fleets, additional Fleets are planned.

Leviathans prides itself as a game that is easy-to-learn, while having a large amount of tactics and replayability.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Simulation

name: Magic: The Gathering – Throne of Eldraine Brawl Deck: Knights' Charge
description:
Brawl Decks are 60-card ready-to-play decks, all Standard-legal, and designed specifically for the Brawl format. Each has seven Standard-legal cards not available in Throne of Eldraine Draft booster packs.

The Knights' Charge deck is an aggressive creature deck focused on Knights and equipment and has Syr Gwyn, Hero of Ashvale as its commander.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Pirate Cove
description:
solo/cooperative deck builder in a mint tin. Play cards to complete quests before you and the other pirates run out of morale in Pirate Cove.

Players will plan to either attempt a quest solo, together, or not at all and stay at Pirate Cove. When attempting a quest, play cards to meet the quest requirements. If players take damage while questing, they will become stranded and lose morale.

Any quests not completed in a turn, will have rumors of cursed quests by your crew. If you do not pay them off with the gold you earn from completing quests, you will lose morale.

Lose all your morale and you lose the game.

During the game you will earn gold from quests to spend on upgrades to your ship and hiring crew member cards. Upgrades to your ship give you a permanent ability while adding cards to your deck. Crew member cards go right into your deck and have abilities you can use when you draw them.

Become the pirate legend by completing all the quests, maintaining the morale of your crew, and managing your gold correctly.

name: (Nie)Powinieneś 2
description:
(Nie)Powinieneś 2, which means "You Should(n’t) 2" in English, is a card game for awful adults (18+) who like to laugh. It comes with two decks of cards. It is similar to Cards Against Humanity or and can be explained in two minutes. All players (from 3 to 15 people) draw 10 cards from orange deck at the start and then first main player draws one card from black deck.

Main player read black cards with some funny phrase and other participants have to choose on of their orange cards with other funny phrases that in their opinion are a best match for the phrase in the drawn black card. Cards are given to the main player in secret, whom then reads them aloud and chooses the best one and owner of this card scores the point.

After that all players that used orange cards draws new ones (so they have 10 again) and the next player become the main player and the cycle continues. After one of the decks become empty players stop the game, they count their score (1 black cards = 1 point) and the winner is a player with the higher score.

All cards have phrases printed in english and polish language both.

Decks from (Nie)Powinieneś 2 can be merged with ones from (Nie)Powinieneś.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Pop It! Battle Game:  Yoda vs. Darth Vader
description: Roll the character die and whoever rolls higher gets to "pop" the bubbles on the opposing pop it. If both players roll the same result then the dice are up for grabs and whoever grabs them first gets to pop the sum of the dice. The player who completely pops the opposing character is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Coin Drop
description: Players roll the die and place one of their chips in the resulting slot, while sixes allow them to drop a chip directly in the box. The active player can choose to roll again or pass the die. If a player rolls a number that already has a chip in that slot, they must take the chips from all filled slots. Whoever runs out of chips first wins (along with any prize players may have placed inside the box at the start of the game).

name: Black Market Auction House
description:
Welcome to the black market auction house!
A place of bluffing bargaining risk taking and bidding against your friends. Buy and sell extraordinary goods at the most unconventional of auctions.
Acumulate the most wealth by buying and selling unique items from the most fascinating of characters.
As an insider,anonymous buyers have given you purchase lists to buy from four unique sellers at the upcoming auction. Purchase liss don't specify the items you need to buy, but who to buy them from.
Each purchase list specifies the quantity of items you need from each seller.
Each of the four sellers is associated with a color red, green, purple and blue on a purchase list card. This will help you decide which color and contraband items to bid on.
The end of the game is triggered when the first player has sold eight purchase list cards. The winner is the player with the most coins!

name: Timber!
description:
Timber! is a nice and smooth building game, the rules of which are so simple that you don't even have to explain them.

Everyone first selects blocks according to a draft system. And then the building begins. Always give a block of the same color or shape as the top one to your left neighbor, who will place it on the tower.

If you manage to pass a block that causes the tower to fall over, you score a drop of sweat. Whoever gets 3 first wins.

The beauty of Timber! is that the challenge is exclusively in building, and everyone really likes that. You probably recognize the hilarity of shaking hands and the (just not) falling over of a tower.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Selfish: Shipwrecked Edition
description:
How far would you go to save yourself? Totally selfish behaviour and utter ruthlessness will be needed to stay alive in this game!

Only one castaway can get home on the remaining ration supplies and you must battle against riptides, waves, sharks and most dangerous of all, each other, to win!

Full of clever puns, this ruthless strategy card game includes 5 player cards, 1 raft card, 42 action cards, 48 ration cards, 30 ocean cards, a play mat and instructions.

—description from the publisher

Each cast away starts with a hand of 5 Game Cards which contain a mixture of Ration and Action Cards.
On your turn, pick up a card from the Game card pile which is formed of Action cards and rations. Action cards allow you to attack other players by stealing precious Rations, moving them back a space or shielding yourself from other players attacks! You can then use your ration cards to move forward through the dangerous ocean. Each time you move forward you reveal an ocean card which can help or harm you!
Get back to the raft first to win, but remember to keep enough Rations or you'll die...

name: Vitreum
description:
Vitreum is roll and write print at home game for unlimited number of players. You and your fellow players become stained glass glaziers. Your job is to create the most beautiful piece of art from glass.
During the game you will try to create the best stained glass for your benefactor. He will give you twelve guidelines, upon which he will judge you. It's up to you, how well you will follow these guidelines. Good luck!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Time Jumpers
description:
Go back in time to witness some of the greatest achievements, discoveries, and events of the 20th century. Players take turns moving around the category portal to collect cards and fill their dashboards with cards in chronological order to meet certain goals like collecting a card from each category or having the largest time span between two years. Players earn points based on these goals and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins! Time Jumpers can be played by 2-5 players ages 8+ in 30 minutes.

-description from publisher

name: Der Pott: Mit Hüftgold kannste keen Häusken kaufen!
description:
The Pott – this game is named after the Ruhr area (Germany).

The term stands for a region of land that is lower than its surroundings, based on the interior of a pot, which is also colloquially known as a pot.

With regard to the Ruhr area, the region was an immigration area, a melting pot, for over 200 years. The coal pot, a bucket for transporting coal, is also used to explain the name.

But one thing is certain: everything revolves around mining and no other region in Germany is as typical, as diverse and as colorful as the Ruhr area.

Let's do a quick brainstorming session. What comes to mind? Mines, allotment gardens, dovecotes, drinking halls, mixed bags, football, bratwurst, beer, Grönemeyer, Schimanski, Opel Manta, culture and multiculturalism. Who can add more terms?

Of course, there are also many tensions and problems: the change in the pot is far from complete. But no matter which corner you come from, the Pott is home.

What could be better than winning the pot playfully in a friendly atmosphere? The main thing here is not to leave the playing field as the richest, but rather to have fun!

Let's quickly go to the drinking hall and get a mixed bag for a snack. Tackle? A tacken was the ten pfennig piece and in return you got sweet treats. Don't you know anything anymore? The grandparents can certainly tell a few anecdotes.

The game is reminiscent of Monopoly. However, the cards to be purchased do not have a fixed price but must be purchased using a bidding mechanism. There is also the possibility of shortening half the game board using a special route that runs across the board (the A40 motorway).

Mining history, traditions, people born on coal and with steel in their veins!
Who invests with the right instinct and relies on the fastest carrier pigeon? Good luck!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Millennial Loteria
description: Hilarious and insightful parody of the classic "Mexican Bingo" game Loteria. Each player is given a bingo card with a set of images (e.g. "El Hipster" and "Las Bitcoins") organized in a 4x4 grid. A card deck containing each image is shuffled and revealed one by one with each player covering the matching images on their own card. The first player to cover four images in a row wins!

name: Huat's Up!
description:
Have you ever experienced a Singaporean New Year Salad? Everything is tossible in this frantic card game about Lo Hei (New Year salad). You'll need speed and accuracy to find and assemble your salad before all the other players!

In this real time game, use your chopstick cards to push cards around to locate pairs of ingredients in your colour. Are the cards not in your colour? Use your chopstick cards to flip the cards around, because all cards have different colours on each side!

You don't need to know anything about Chinese New Year to have instant fun for the whole family in Huat's Up!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Banana Blitz
description:
Banana Blitz is a trick-taking game similar to Hearts. There are four fruit-based suits numbered 1-12 plus four Fruit Salad cards. The deck is dealt out as evenly as possible and remaining cards are added to the first trick.

Players must generally follow suit and the high card of the suit led wins the trick. However, the Fruit Salad cards are numbered 13-16 and can always be played, even when a player could follow suit. They always count as the led suit.

Players start with 25 points and gain points after each hand for the banana and Fruit Salad cards. However, a player winning at least 12 of the possible 16 cards instead loses points for them. There are two special cards which double and halve the banana scoring if they are won.

The game continues until a player has either 0 or 50 points, at which point the player with the lowest score wins.

There are special rules for two or three players.

name: Forest Shuffle: Cannes Promo Card
description:
Specifically designed for the Festival des Jeux Cannes, this promo card adds another tree species to Forest Shuffle (Forêt Mixte in France):

The palm tree (palmier in French) allows you to play a bird for free and adds one point for any bird in this players forest.

The high value of this card is symbolized with a golden tree icon for this card.

name: Pipeline
description:
Simple rules, quick fun - from successful game author Reiner Knizia. Compete against each other or go it alone on the hunt for record points? The tactical dice game for 1-6 players aged 8 and over. One player rolls the dice and everyone has a turn at the same time! But who connects the dice with the most victory points and wins the game?

—description from the publisher

name: Mafia
description: In the 1920s and 30s, many cities in the US witnessed gang wars in the streets. This game simulates the struggle for the control of the city. The objective is to own the most businesses, either by buying them or by stealing them from another player.
publishers: Factor Games, Falomir Juegos, Nike and Cooper Española, S.A.

name: Scratch Wars
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scratch Wars is close to a collectible game, but in certain game modes it's closer to a board game and can be also played online through a phone application for iOS and Android.

In more detail, to start playing Scratch Wars you need only two cards: one hero and one weapon. The cards are unique in several aspects. You can scratch them like lottery tickets, but by doing so you are not destroying or devaluing them. Each hero card is unique; each hero has a unique name and value generated. No one else in the world will have the same card! Slowly uncover the card by scratching it and in combination with unique values, it is pleasantly thrilling. Cards can even be bought individually. (Would you rather have a hero or a weapon?)

With an increasing number of weapon cards, you can try a sophisticated one-on-one duel in which you equip your hero with up to five weapons, then think strategically to find out which one to use when. The duel itself is very interesting; you spin a special circular weapon: turntable paper on a stick. The hero has certain levels of energy which you spend using various weapons. Heroes can change weapons during the turn and their proper use is the focus of the game. The game is risk management; you are trying to spend the hero's energy for the best possible effects. According to the composition of effects, you choose weapon, strategy and risk. You can attack the opponent's weapon, his permanent effects, or the hero directly. You have to decide when to repair a weapon, when to save energy for the hit with more powerful weapons, etc.

Once you get into the basic game, you can try a more comprehensive and strategic mode in which teams of heroes compete against each other. Then you can move to the top mode where entire armies of heroes collide. With more than two players, it is possible to play in teams or each player plays by themselves with modified rules. The game is perfect for tournaments.

If you want to play with just one player, simply scan the card into your phone and you can play online. There is a varied range of options at your disposal, from tournaments and hero trainings to territorial fights. The goal is to level your hero up and obtain spells for him. As the first game in the world, Scratch Wars presents digital ownership so that what you have physically, you also have digitally. If you later want to replace or sell any of your heroes, you can change them digitally with all that is recorded on the card, i.e., with all the spells and experiences.

If you would rather play the game more as a board game and add more strategic options, you will be able to expand the game with "trade" cards or hero's "abilities".
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Balloons
description:
All are playing with the purpose to take all the balloons to the sun before it is obscured by the cloud.
Place the sky tiles one after the other to form a path from the children to the sun. Place all the balloons on the starting tile. Place the cloud on the first sky tile.
The current player rolls the rainbow dice:
-Balloon face, the balloon with the corresponding colour moves forward to the following free sky tile;
-Wind face, you can choose which balloon to move;
-Cloud face, the cloud moves forward a tile.
If all the balloons arrive at the tile with the sun before the cloud, all players have won together!

name: Caesar's Game
description:
An original game of pure strategy.

Roman "coins" (representing wealth) move diagonally, whilst metal columns (representing empire) jump over coins, of either color, in order to form a square formation on four adjacent circles to be victorious.

Rules are very simple; a double-sided A4 sheet provides ample explanation, but the strategy is deep, and developing the ability to assess the state of play at any given time requires considerable application in order to play the game well. A winning situation may be engineered very quickly from a seemingly hopeless one.

name: Get Paul That Promotion
description:
From the B&W Games Site:

The Background
Everyone's a stressed out, underpaid "sloganeer" working for The Name Game. Then there's this guy named Paul whose wife left him and he's neck deep in debt from the shrink bills for him and the kids. He's so low he hasn't come up with a decent product name or slogan in months. Then one morning, in a rare-for-the-workplace personal moment near the coffee pot, Paul opens up to everyone.

"Yeah, the boss, he's saying I'm up for a promotion this month...if I can just turn out some good work. You know I've been a little off lately. But I think the therapy is helping...a little. And, uh, well, anyway, would you guys please not try so hard for the next couple weeks?"

You get the picture.

The Game
Get Paul That Promotion is a hilarious game where everyone tries hard to be uncreative, but not so uncreative they get fired. It's for 4-6 players, Ages 12 and up.

name: Timestreams
description:
"Humans thought they were alone in the universe.
They were right!"

Timestreams takes place in a possible future, where the human race has made two very intriguing discoveries: 1) We are alone in our universe. 2) There are universes in which other races exist and function in a totally different time frame than ours. The problem is that now that we know, the other races know as well. Thus, the beginning of the timestreams invasion is now taking place, during which entire races invade the parallel timestreams. These invasions cause temporal distortions, causing a dimensional vortex that may cause one race or more to be so distorted that it will be impossible to interact with anything from a three dimensional universe.

Timestreams is a game where players alternate turns and try to wreak havoc for their opponents. All players start with their player card next to a timestream, and during the game they try to avoid being in the same timestream with another players.

Sometimes, a player must calculate a temporal distortion, and all players that are on the same timestream as another must lose an amount of this distortion by counting on their vortex resonator. The winner is the last race standing, after everyone else's race has reached its critical point. There is no player elimination. Players will continue to play until the end of the game and take their vengeance on the opponents that took them out.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Roll Character
description:
The kind-hearted housecleaner, cook and all-around friend to Mega Man, Roll! Now she’s able to help fight the Robot Masters of Dr. Wily in Mega Man The Board Game!

Contents:
1 Roll Figure + Character Card
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Double Sens 3
description:
135 pictures are on the table. The clue you are given matches none of the pictres... Two pictures has a word sounding like the clue word you are looking for... And that's the answer!
So think quickly and find the two matching pictures before everyone else!

The goal of the game is to name the word by pointing two pictures. To win a point you must be the first to point the good pictures.

name: Grand Prix
description:
It's a simulation of F1 race based on increased risk with increased speed.
The player predetermines the speed and the risk depends on a die roll and on the squares of the circuit the car (represented by a counter) is going to pass through.
It's possible to control the car by brakes, change of speed, but is very risky to go fast in dangerous point of the circuit because the damages can stop you.

name: Family Charades
description:
One person acts. Everyone else guesses. Score points for acting and guessing correctly. Switch it up with Switch Charades too! Its a team game! The group acts together with just one guesser. The team that earns the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Evolution Earth: Cataclysm
description:
Evolution Earth: Cataclysm is a fast paced strategic deck/world building game about species evolution, cataclysms and extinction. Build your world continent by continent as they rise above Ocean and conquer them with your evolving species.

Evolution Earth: Cataclysm is very easy to learn yet it has strategical and tactical depth which makes it challenging, fun and addictive. The game has tons of replayability value since it can be played with so many styles, ideas and with deep strategical planning.

Evolution Earth: Cataclysm is a deck building game - yet it has a strong and exciting interaction between players. Try to defeat your opponents with skillful deck building decisions, clever population/resource management, right timing of cataclysms, and countless strategical and tactical choices. Use your resources, and your population to defend your species from extinction, as your opponents start planning their ice-age, climate change, asteroid impact or a numerous other cataclysmic attacks against your precious species that try to survive and evolve into a more victorious species.

Harness the primeval forces of nature for your victory. The prosperity of your species rests on your hands.

The game also includes an advanced play option called Blue Pearl, which makes the playing a 100% pure strategy and tactics. No luck or randomness involved on that playing version.
• Build up your Proto-Earth World as you play from Precambrian era into the era of Mammals
• Inhabitate your World with your Species and evolve them into higher species while you play
• Collect Victory Points from Critters, Insects, Fishes, Reptiles, Birds and Mammals
• 208 exciting prehistoric themed cards.
• 7 Continents and Ocean cards for each player
• 14 different types of Cataclysm cards from tornados to asteroid impacts to attack your opponents World and Species
• 60 Population/Resource cards
• 4 Shuffle cards
• Advanced play is 100% strategy/tactics without randomness/luck factor for hardcore strategic gamers
• Easy to learn
• 3 levels of play

Re-implemented by:

Terra Evolution
categories: Animals, Card Game, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Salad Master
description:
You are what you eat. But...
Do you know what exactly you have been eating?
Play the food card that best meets the objective of each round to score points. But you are guaranteed to be surprised!
publishers: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ), Homosapiens Lab

name: Equate Advanced Tile Set
description: This is an alternate tile set for the game Equate. It includes a complete set of 197 tiles to replace the original tile set, including exponents and negative numbers. The tiles come in an opaque plastic bag with a sliding lock.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: Misty Ruins
description: This is a dungeon crawl with an original twist. You don't know who you are. All characters are listed on a summary sheet with their attributes. As they encounter monsters, locked chests, and locked doors, their skills are tested. By process of elimination the the players find out who they are and where they are from. There is combat, buying and selling items, and building the dungeon maze with cards. Gold and defeated monsters combine for victory points with a bonus for knowing your character's identity. Play can range from half an hour to an hour--sometimes a little longer with 5 players.

name: TOKYO GAME SHOW
description:
In TOKYO GAME SHOW you will host 5 rounds of a Japanese game show, inviting up to 5 of your friends to put on colorful wrist bands and compete in your mini games! With over 50 included games from 10 categories, plus the option to use any of the other TOKYO SERIES titles as game show games, this party hit is perfect for any player count or skill level!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Negotiation, Number, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Max.X
description:
extrapolated from translation

Contents:
15 colored dice
1 special die (grey)
1 board
1 set of rules

Aim of the game
To fill zones of 2 or 3 spaces with dice showing the same number, and if possible of the same color. More points are gained if these are also in the same circle.
How the game is played:
This player will throw the dice 5 times in order to place all the dice on the board.
1.The player throws one die of each color along with the special die.
2.The player checks the special die in order to see what possibilities are open to him for changing the outcome of his throw and improving the position. The value of the numbers of the dice does not affect the result.

Explanation of the symbols of the special die:
The side which has two dice drawn on it permits the player to change the number on 1 or 2 of the the 3 dice thrown to match the number showing one of the other die.

The side which has one die drawn on it permits the player to change the number of one of the dice thrown to match the number on one of the other two dice thrown.

The symbol of the 2 half circles with arrow heads allows the user to interchange the position of two dice already placed by him on the board with a view to ending up with a group of dice with the same numbers and, even better, of the same color as well.

The symbol of the 3 small squares with a divided arrow coming from middle one allows the player to change the number on a die which has already been placed on the board or which the player is about to place on the board, to any other number.

The Flying Turtle is the super bonus. It allows the player to do all the moves which are permitted by the other symbols on the special die. Further more, when placed in the center of the board it increases the players points considerably.


3. Once the player's throw has been adjusted to take into account the special die, the player places his dice in the zone or zones of his choice. He will in so doing try to fill the empty spaces in a circle with dice with the same numbers and if possible, of the same color.

End of the game:
The player who has the highest score after 5 turns wins.

name: Edson's Ridge
description:
Edson's Ridge was the inserted game in issue 10 of Competitive Edge Magazine (formally known as Game Fix.)

The game is a tactical level game that recreates Japan's first major counter-offensive on Guadalcanal Island in mid-September of 1942.

The game takes place on a portion of the Marine perimeter south of Henderson Field, centered around Edson's Ridge.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Rise and Fall of the Magic Empire
description:
Alternate title: Mahou Teikoku no Koubou

An ambitious mix of the simulation and role-playing styles of games. The game is for 1-6 players, depending on the scenario chosen.

The game uses a map separated into 36 land areas and 6 sea areas. Each player controls a hero, and travels over the land gaining followers and hiring bodyguards and employing armies.

There are dungeons constantly appearing on the map, and parties of adventurers can explore them. The armies are used for battle with each other over land (not in dungeons).

The game includes 6 sheets of counters and 200 cards for a wide variety. There are stacks of spell cards, item cards, monster cards, and quest cards. There is also a random event chart in the rulebook, and your heroes can even get married. Monsters are not always simply a set of attack/defense numbers, they can have special abilities, such as magic use, charm, and the like.

There are dozens of scenarios, with different goals and many with some modifications to the rules (whether or not armies are used, for example). Most involve getting victory points by completing quests.

name: Picco Giraffo
description:
Picco Giraffo is a simple tile placement game for children age 3 and up.
The game components consist of 40 nicely drawn card tiles which show body parts of giraffes in different colors: head, neck, body, legs and hooves. Each player receives 5 tiles. Players alternately play their tiles building a giraffe according to certain rules. While a giraffe must always contain exactly one head, a body and hooves tile there is no limit to the amount of neck and leg pieces. The objective of the game is to get rid of your tiles as fast as possible.

name: Dork Frag
description: A free game given away in Dork Tower #25 and in the Dork Tower game. It's Frag with characters (Ken, Carson, Igor, Matt, Kayleigh and Gilly) from Dork Tower. The board is the Pegasus Games store. The board, pieces and cards are paper and should probably be laminated before using.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: Terrapin
description:
Terrapin is a family of Decktet betting games based in which you try to avoid getting every suit. It has been described by some players as Blackjack meets Texas Hold 'em - you want to get a better hand, but every card you add increases the chance you'll get Turtle Butt.

An earlier version of Terrapin was known simply as Turtle Butt. That's still the name for a hand which has one of every suit, a hand which has gone bust.

There are several Terrapin games that use the same rules for ranking hands but different rules for betting.


Rules at the Decktet Homepage
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Monstersnack
description: A monster wants to eat. The players take turns placing food cards on a stack - but the monster only wants so much of each kind of food (similar to a nutrition pyramid). When a player thinks that the previous card extended the limit, he or she can challenge it - if correct, he or she gets a carrot, if false, the player who played the card gets the carrot. The first player to collect four carrots is the winner.

name: Zlaté Česko, otázky a odpovědi
description:
Fanmade translation:
How well do you know actually the Czech Republic?
In this game you will find 2400 interesting questions concerning the Czech Republic and its people. This game follows the great success of the game "Česko, otázky a odpovědi" that many of you enjoyed. In "Golden Czech" you will find brand new category, which examines your knowledge more thoroughly! The questions are divided into 6 areas: persons, culture, at school, homeland study, Czech BEST and various .

Two-sided game board allows you to play a conquest version of this game in which you conquer castle Karlštejn. During the siege of the castle you will acquire gold for your knowledge. The most successful of you at the end of the game conquers famous castle. During the game you not enjoy great fun but also learn a lot of interesting information about Czech republic. To win the game you might need a little luck except the knowledge.


From the publisher:
Zlaté Česko, otázky a odpovědi
Zábavná hra pro zvídavé Čechy

Jak dobře vlastně znáte Českou republiku?
V této vědomostní hře najdete 2 400 zajímavých otázek týkajících se České republiky a jejích obyvatel. Tato hra navazuje na velký úspěch vědomostní hry Česko Otázky a odpovědi, kterou si mnozí z Vás velmi oblíbili. Ve Zlatém Česku ale najdete zbrusu nové kategorie, které vaše znalosti prověří ještě důkladněji! Otázky jsou rozděleny do 6 okruhů: osobnosti, kultura, ze školních lavic, vlastivěda, česká NEJ a různé.

Oboustranný herní plán umožňuje hrát i dobyvatelskou verzi této hry, ve které budete dobývat hrad Karlštejn. Během obléhání hradu budete za svoje znalosti získávat zlaťáky. Ten nejúspěšnější z vás na konci hry dobude tento slavný hrad. Během hry si nejen užijete spoustu zábavy, ale také se o své vlasti dozvíte mnoho zajímavých informací. K tomu, abyste ve hře zvítězili, budete kromě znalostí potřebovat i trochu štěstí.

name: Cubo Queenie 2: Combinations
description:
6 Task Tiles out of 12 will be drawn at the beginning of a game. 1 will be flipped over at the beginning of each round.

At the end of the round, after each player scored his "Cubo", every Cubo is checked again to see if a player has met the task. If so he will score the extra points depicted on the tile.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Back & 4th
description:
A party game where players divide into 2 teams and give clues to help their teammates guess the categories on the cards, similar to the game show $25,000 Pyramid.

Each team starts with 1 minute on its timer. Players give clues to their teammates to help them guess the category.

Sample categories are "Things people do while sleeping" or "Ice cream toppings". For example, clues such as "Fire Engine", "Apple", and "Stop Sign" would lead to the category, "Things that are red".

Play continues until a team's time runs out. Then the next team takes its turn. The team that successfully guessed more categories in a round moves its game piece one space on the game board. The first team to win 4 rounds wins the game.

Includes:
280 Cards/560 Categories
2 Game Pieces
Game Board
2 Sand Timers/Free App Timer
Rules

name: Die Maulwurf Company Mitbringspiel
description:
Each turn in Die Maulwurf Company, players move their moles, who are on a quest to dig underground and find The Golden Shovel.

The game board is actually made of four boards laid on top of one another, with the topmost board having many holes in it, the second board down having fewer holes, etc. The players start with their moles outside of holes on the top board. On a turn, a player reveals a movement token, then moves one of their moles that many spaces. Once all of the holes are occupied, the top board (and any moles on it who aren't sitting in holes) are removed from play, and now players try to get into the newly revealed holes on the second board so that they can travel to the third board.

The final level has only one hole in it leading to The Golden Shovel. Which mole will claim this prize?

name: Twisted Fate: Cowboys VS Aliens
description:
Draw cards from the deck to assemble your posse of wild west characters in the hopes of defeating one of the many different monsters slowly advancing upon the town. Use equipment cards and skill cards to hold back the monster as, turn by turn, it creeps closer to town. You will see reinforcements arrive (and sadly depart) as the game wears on, and the dice determine the advancing movement of the towering monster upon your peaceful town. If the monster reaches town, you lose!

Strange tracks have been been popping up near the town, and one thing’s for sure... whatever made ‘em ain’t from around these parts!

Twisted Fate: Cowboys VS Aliens is a deck and dice adventure game that builds a story as you play. Assemble your posse of cowboys and hunt down the alien menace threatening the town. Arm yourself with the tools for the job, and adapt your strategy for each unique threat. If the creature reaches town or grows too powerful all will be lost! It’s up to you to save the day!

—description from the publisher

name: Listicle
description:
Players bid how many examples of a category they can think of and, whoever bids the highest, is challenged to do so.

Other players judge the acceptability of examples.

Alternatively, examples of a category are named, until another player can guess what is the category.

It's extremely casual, on purpose. That's the point.

—description from the designer

name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Dice Goal Promo Card
description:
You may include the Dice Goal Card when playing Periodic: A Game of the Elements.

This Goal Card is included as a 5th starting Goal, and is not refilled after it is completed (nor does this trigger the end of the game). Use 15-point Lab Tokens as substitute Goal Markers.

The player who completes this Goal takes this Goal Card (worth 13 points) and may immediately take 3 Energy Tokens from any Periodic Trend(s) on the board. (If fewer than 3 Energy Tokens are available, take as many as are available.) Any other player who had Research Cubes on the Goal Card receives a 3-point Lab Token for each of their Research Cubes on the Goal Card (this is an exception to the typical reward).

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

name: The Big Horse Race
description:
A HABA Minispiele key chain game simulating a horse race with two jumps. It contains 12 sticks, four circular tokens and two wooden horses.

The four circular tokens are blank on one side. On the reverse, three of them have a picture of a clover leaf and one has a picture of a jump. On their turn, the player places the tokens in the box, shakes the box and secretly looks at the tokens. They then declare which tokens are in the box, however, they can bluff. If unchallenged, the player moves according to the tokens they say they have (one space for each clover, and a jump required to clear each obstacle) and their turn is over. If challenged they display the contents of the box. If they were telling the truth they move accordingly and have another turn. If they were lying no movement occurs and their turn is over. First past the post wins.

name: Pick Pic
description:
Pick Pic is a game about picture associations and crazy funny photos.
You have to divide your photos so they fit the photos in front of each player as well as possible. If the other players recognize your photo as being placed there deliberately, both will score points. But they prefer a random photo to yours, none of you will get any points.

Gameplay

1. Reveal a card : every player draws a card and puts it face up in front of him.
2. Give cards : each player draws a few cards (regarding the number of players) and watches them secretly.
3. Each player has to look carefully at the face up cards of the other players, they must find a common feature between the cards they hold and the one which are in front of the players.
4. Once they finish finding a common feature, they have to give, face down, one card from their hand to every other player.
5. Rank cards : When all players have received exactly one card from each of the other players, they have to draw one random card from the deck and shuffle it into their stack of cards without revealing it.
6. Each player may look at the cards in front of him. They have to rank them face up, placing the card which has most in common with the first picture in first position, and so on.
7. Evaluate score : The players will score points regarding which rank are their cards.
8. End : The game ends when one or few players reach 20 points, if they don’t, they begin another round.

—description from the publisher

name: Trick Runaway
description:
What was sleeping in the deepest part of the dungeon was not a tiny gargoyle… but a dragon.

It's different from what I heard! Everyone, let's hurry and run away. If you keep complaining, you'll get burned to the ground. Huh? But this is probably enough for two people to eat. Wouldn't the dragon be satisfied too?

Trick Runaway is a trick-taking game where you try to survive by running away from a dragon by just the right distance.
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Dunsany's Chess
description:
Dunsany's Chess was developed by Irish author Lord Dunsany in 1942. It is an asymmetrical chess variant. One side has a standard chess army, while the other has 32 pawns. The side with a full army wins by capturing all opposing pawns. The side with the pawns wins by checkmating the King. Another variant known as Horde Chess adds four extra pawns to the side with only pawns.

In addition to offering a unique puzzle, Dunsany's Chess is good for teaching chess, since one player can observe the moves of the pieces while needing only to remember how to make pawn moves.

name: Battle Roll
description: Battle Roll is a 2 player dueling dice game! It's quick, addictive, portable, and loads of fun! It comes with eight beautiful precision engraved and painted dice with incredible detail. It only takes about 5-10 minutes to play, making this a great game to pull out in an airport, waiting room, or anywhere else! Because of the short game length it's also great for using in a tournament scenario with groups of people. Don't let the game length and portability fool you into thinking that there isn't a lot of depth or variety in playing Battle Roll. The outcomes are nearly endless! A game could range from a complete blow-out, to a neck-and-neck down to the last roll, sudden death victory! It all depends on how the dice fall! Battle Roll is really fun to play, but it also looks cool! The combination of custom polyhedral dice and acrylic life-stones are sure to attract attention and questions like "What are you playing?" It all fits nicely into a custom zippered pouch making it easy for Battle Rollers on the go to sneak in a quick game wherever they are.

name: Isla Tetra
description:
(now available as Isla Tetra 2 - please check BGG page)

The first game from Will Sargent's Solway Games uses a colourful new puzzle system to create essential inventory items which can be used to explore the mysterious island, ISLA TETRA.

The same colourful grids are built to earn Exploration, Health and Fishing actions, making for a puzzling castaway adventure of the like never seen before.

You might think you can get by simply walking the sun-kissed sands, soaking up the sun, but leave your island escape plan too late and you'll find events back home have taken a turn for the worse: As the months tick by, the search for your crashed plane is eventually called off, your job is readvertised, and your car has been sold to keep up with the bills. After two years of waiting, your family holds a memorial service and your partner is now returning to a social life as a single person. You might be a great survivor, but at what cost?

Each turn players can beachcomb for useful items such as rope, old bits of wire and driftwood. You might even find a pilot's hat or laminated crash instructions washed up from the azure, salty brine. These pieces of flotsam and jetsam are shown on 52 professionally printed cards and represented by brightly coloured, chunky 3D shapes which can be linked neatly together on your individual player mat to build items essential for survival.

Players must strike a balance between plundering the island’s resources for points while ensuring they’re not last off the island. Finish too low down on the time-track and you'll accrue penalty points which could rob you of victory.

It's all about strategy, and fun puzzle solving. Some of your inventory items can only be built using a single colour, while others allow two or all three. Also, some grids are larger than others, taking longer to build, some are small and awkward to fit all the available shapes into.

Upgrades can give you more playing power, such as extra card swaps and extra jokers; longer explore moves; greater fish catches. Which to go for first? It's up to you to try the many different combinations.

To start, you are only allowed to build two items at a time so think carefully... whittle away by the fire at base camp, or set out deep into the island in search of vines and timber to help strengthen your small raft, ready for the final ordeal across raging seas...

source: from publisher: Solway Games
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Peloponnes: Victoria Expansion
description:
A small expansion for Peloponnes, where every player starts with an extra token. This token is worth points at the end of the game, or can be used once during the game to acquire a tile that would otherwise be discarded.

This DIY kit was handed out at Essen Spiel 2015. The bagged kit consists of a German/English/French rules sheet and dual-sided printed card that contains the 8 Victoria Chits that must be cut out by the owner.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game

name: Entanglion
description:
The World’s First Open Source Quantum Board Game. Master New Galaxies in Your Quest to Construct a Quantum Computer!

Welcome to the Quantum Universe, Captain!

Congratulations, your captain has retired and left you in charge of his galactic shipping business! Now it’s time to make some upgrades as you embark on a journey to reconstruct a quantum computer developed by an ancient race.

Entanglion is a cooperative board game designed for two players. Learn about quantum computing as you work together with your teammate to navigate the three galaxies of the quantum universe, avoid detection by the defense mechanisms left behind by the ancients, and rebuild the quantum computer.

Think you’re up for the challenge?

Goal
Entanglion is a cooperative board game designed for two players. The goal is to reconstruct a quantum computer developed by an ancient race. Work together with your teammate to navigate the three galaxies of the quantum universe – Centarious, Superious, and Entanglion – in a quest to collect eight quantum computer components. Be careful to avoid detection by the planetary defense mechanisms guarding the components!

Game concepts
Entanglion was designed to expose players to several fundamental concepts in quantum computing:


Qubits are the building blocks of quantum computation.
Superposition is when a quantum system may exist in a probabilistic combination of multiple states at once.
Entanglement happens when the state of one qubit correlates with the state of another qubit.
Measurement is the process of observing the classical value of a qubit.
Error happens when random noise in the quantum system perturbs the measured value of a qubit.


Entanglion also exposes players to the different kinds of hardware and software components involved in building a real quantum computer.

Turn overview
Perform one of the following actions on your turn.
