Navigate. Play one engine card in engine control to navigate around the galaxy, and draw a replacement. You may only play engine cards for your own ship.
Exchange. Discard one engine card from your hand and draw a replacement..
Retrieve. Roll the Entanglion die to attempt to retrieve a quantum component if one is present.
Event. Play an event card from your hand (if you possess one).


Players may not pass their turns, they must perform one of the actions above.

Detection rate
The detection rate determines the difficulty of successfully evading planetary defenses. The detection rate token is used to keep track of the current detection rate. When a player’s spaceship has been detected by orbital defenses, or a player’s away team has been detected by ground defenses, the detection rate is increased, making it easier for each planet’s defenses to detect the player in the future. The game ends when the detection rate reaches the final level (designated with an X).

Orbital defenses
Planets in Entanglion are protected by orbital defenses that scan for ships looking to plunder the quantum components hidden there. It is possible to evade these defenses using your quantum engines. If you are detected, however, your navigation system will automatically take evasive maneuvers and jump to a random planet in the Centarious system. This jump triggers a quantum event.

Game end
Players immediately win the game when they have collected all eight components of the quantum computer. Players immediately lose the game when the detection rate reaches the end (X).

name: Nobody Is Perfect: Kompakt
description:
Nobody Is Perfect – Kompakt features the same game play as the original Nobody is Perfect – first released in 1996, then released in a new edition in 2009 – but with more than 450 new terms for players to puzzle over.

Game play is similar to Balderdash or the public domain "Dictionary" game with players being presented with an unusual word or image that they're unlikely to know. All players write down a definition for this word/image, then everyone votes on which definition they feel is the correct one. Vote correctly, and you score points; have others vote for your definition, and you'll score then, too.

name: To The Edge
description:
A dexterity game in a small footprint, where you push a card to the edge of the table and score based off of how many of the point locations are over the edge. Very simple and very addictive even when alone just trying to score higher and higher.


A one card dexterity game where players flick, push, or slide a card across a table to score points by having dots on the card hanging off the edge.

Differences between the first and second edition:

- Font, Colors, and Layout
- Inner circle of dots are worth two points


Second edition was also included in Button Shy's June 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Внутри Лапенко (Inside Lapenko)
description:
Imagine that all the main characters of "Inside Lapenko" were at your disposal.

In each round, you can become an Engineer, Shershnyaga, Igor Katamaranov and others. All characters have special properties that make them unique.

The goal of the game is to get as many Audience Points as possible.
And each hero does it differently.

While the players are making cunning plans and trying to predict the actions of their opponents in order to get ahead, a common danger looms over everyone - the Iron Sleeves organized crime group.

The bandits are hunting for the characters in order to rob them to the skin, and each rival is trying to make sure that it is you who fall into their criminal clutches.

Each turn, face down players choose a ploy card to create difficulty for the other players. And then a character card with a unique property. Audience points are scored based on the popularity of the character played (from 0 to 5) and the ability that triggers when the card is played.

The game consists of 6 rounds, in each round you play one character card. Each player has 10 character cards in their deck, which ensures good replayability.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points

name: Eminent Domain: Battlecruisers – Heavy Assault
description:
Includes five Heavy Assault cards, one per player.

Value: 24
Main effect: Take 3VP from each opponent
Clash effect: Discard 2 cards.

Originally included as an extra in the boardgame Bottlecap Vikings.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: People with Memory
description:
LONG DESCRIPTION

Everything or almost everything is possible in this game, based on the theme of World History figures from 13 important areas: governors, the military, astronomers, philosophers, scientists, explorers, mathematicians, pioneers, writers, painters, musicians, Nobel Prizes and Human Rights.

HOW TO PLAY
- EUREKA (GAME 1)

OBJECTIVE
It is played by two teams of two players. The aim of the game is to gather 4 people from one of the 13 sets: the military, astronomers, etc…
When the player gathers the 4 cards they secretly signal their partner who then says EUREKA.

Moving forward...

1. At the beginning of each round, turn 4 cards over (from the deck) on the table.
2. All together, players count up to 3.
3. After finishing the count, each player can switch the cards held in the hand with the ones on the table (he/she can switch as many cards as desired).
4. A round ends when players do not wish to exchange more cards.
5. The 4 cards on the table from the previous round are discarded. Turn 4 new cards over from the deck and repeat the procedures from step 2 forward.

- FAMILY GAME (GAME 2)

OBJECTIVE
Gather as many Families as possible. Each Family is composed of 4 characters. Each character is associated to a colour: green, red, yellow and blue.

Moving on…

Step 1

The first player asks another player for a card of his/ her choice. This request must respect the following rules:

the player already has a card of this Family;
the player must always say: first, the name of the Family to which the card belongs; then, the colour associated with the desired character: green, red, yellow or blue.


Step 2

One of the following options occurs:


if the player succeeds in getting the asked card: then, he/ she asks a player for a new card;
if the player cannot get the asked card: he/ she picks up a playing card from the deck placed on the centre of the table and stops playing. It is the next player’s turn.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Q.E.: Fifth Player Expansion
description:
This expansion allows Q.E. to be played with five players and includes an additional nation and an additional industry for that fifth player, along with new company tiles to cover these, as well as new "view winning bid" tokens which give players the option to see what the winning bid was in one auction of their choice during the game.

It also introduces a new scoring opportunity: "Globalization", which awards points for players investing in companies with nationalities other than their own.

name: Mountain Climber
description:
Mountain Climber is a "push-your-luck" dice game, but everyone is playing at all times with no boring waiting between turns. Each Mountain Climber is racing to be the first to the top. However, mountain climbing is tricky business -- taking risks is necessary to climb the mountain, but push it too far and you tumble backwards. The best balance of luck and risk wins the game.

Mountain Climber is for 2 to 6 players, ages 8 and older. To play the game you need only download the rules and the game parts (a player board and 3 decision cards per player) and gather 2 markers and 3 dice per player.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ei Noon
description:
In Ei Noon, you and your fellow players are apprentices to the Easter Bunny, and to prove yourself, you want to collect more eggs from the chickens than anyone else.

To set up the game, lay out the nest card on the table, then randomly place the two chickens and as many bunnies as the number of players on the four sides of this card. Place the matching bunny card on the table next to each wooden rabbit.

On a turn, deal each player a track card, then on the count of three, reveal these cards. Each track card shows a number of bunny footsteps (possibly zero) and a number of color-coded chicken footprints (again, possibly zero). Each player then races to grab the bunny card of their choice.

Once everyone has a card, the active player for that round counts the number of steps for each chicken, then advances them clockwise around the nest card. Each player then advances the rabbit token that matches their card a number of spaces equal to the number of footprints showing on their card. If you find your rabbit on a side of the chest that's not guarded by a chicken, you can now grab an egg! (This is symbolized by you turning your track card face down and keeping it.)

Play through the track card deck, and see who collects the most eggs!

name: Dingo's Dreams: Kickstarter Edition
description:
The kickstarter edition included exclusive content packaged inside the base game box - 5th player expansion and Dream Companions.

The dream companions are a few bonus tiles with rare animals on them for Dingo's Dreams. When playing with this variant, each player starts with one of these extra tiles in hand. To win the game, a player's dream companion tile must be in the center space of the dreamscape, in addition to all other normal goal requirements. This makes for a fun extra challenge!

About the base game:

Dingo and his friends have gotten lost on Walkabout! Visit their dreams to lead them home!

Dingo's Dreams is a delightful and clever family game for 2-4 players. Each player competes to be the first to successfully guide his animal through the dream world.

Each player starts with a grid of 25 tiles, set up at random in a 5x5 dreamscape. Each player also starts with one extra tile, with a picture of their animal on it. The opposite side of all dreamscape tiles also has a picture of the animal. Each turn, a random card is drawn, telling players which tile they should flip. When a player flips a tile, it means their animal is traveling through a part of the dreamscape. Each player's goal is to guide their animal through the dreamscape by positioning him in a specified pattern (which is different each game). After a card is drawn, a player takes their extra animal and slides him into the dreamscape, shifting one row or column of tiles until a new, different tile emerges from the opposite side. The player will use this tile to shift another column or row on the next turn, and so on, until one player's dreamscape tiles match the goal. The player then shouts their animal's name-- "Dingo!", for example, to win the round.

Advanced rules add Hazard Tokens which increase the challenge substantially: to complete the required dream pattern, the player may not have his animal in any of the Hazard spaces marked on the dream card.
mechanics: Bingo, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Shiloh: Grant Surprised
description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Blue & Gray classics are being updated with a slight change in scale to 352 yards per hex, an updated game system that treats unit differences more accurately, and a combat system that includes step losses.

There would never be a better chance to hit the Federals and inflict a decisive defeat on them than in April 1862. Two of the advancing Union armies in the Western Theater hadn't yet converged. The Confederates thus perceived a rare opportunity to concentrate against Grant's six divisions at Pittsburg Landing on the west bank of the Tennessee River. Organized into four corps, Gen. Albert Sidney Johnston marched his men 20 miles from Corinth, Mississippi, toward the Federal troops bivouacked along a skirmish line extending from the bank of the Tennessee River to the small "Shiloh" church inland.

Shiloh utilizes an all-new Musket & Saber combat system, which provides a simple yet accurate portrayal of warfare during the American Civil War. The combat system is intuitive, including all of the details that characterized battle during the Civil War, while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure the line of retreat.

A new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of the rifled musket . Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle. Supply lines forcing players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as understanding the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

Re-implements:

Shiloh: The Battle for Tennessee, 6-7 April, 1862
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Paper Pinball: Championship Boogerball
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Some Kind of Genius?
description:
A roll&write game in which we have to boost our brain so that we can extract the highest possible IQ number. Using a pool of dice we determine the parameters and connections between brain cells. A lot of dependencies forcing you to plan long term.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. Then we use them to reinforce individual cells. They come in 3 colors and are divided into two sets - the left and the right hemisphere of the brain. We use the dice in such a way as to fulfill the conditions of a given cell (e.g. insert numbers in ascending order or giving a specific sum). We have to insert active cells in such a way to get the highest sum of points and activate bonus points (e.g. a certain number of cells in a given color). After 7 rounds the game ends and the player who scored the highest number of IQ points wins.

-description from designer

name: Feenbalz
description:
In "Fairy Courtship" players represent young male fairies trying to win the favor of the most fairy females. But these rather mercantile ladies care nothing for personality or good looks, only bestowing their favor on the suitor presenting the collection of items of the most value to her (which is unknown until her identity is revealed).

Interesting features:
- there are a number of different ways to construct the most valuable collection
- play of a single card can draft several from the pool if multiple ones match one of the card's 3 characteristics

name: King of the Castle
description:
Build your army, conquer towers, and capture the Throne Room in this game of dueling, strategy, and domination.
Gather up potions, catapults, archers, warriors and much more to damage your enemies and strike them down on your way to victory.
Up to 6 players battle for the Throne in this intense fight to the finish. Construct your army and prepare for war as you make your way through the castle towards the Towers and Throne Room. Capture a Tower and you can capture the Throne Room. Take the Throne Room and the crown is yours! Brag to your friends, family, and anyone else who will listen.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Square Grid, Take That, Turn Order: Random

name: Schwarzmarkt
description:
From the website of the publisher:

Black Market is like Kogge a trading game without money. The game is played in rounds, each round the players produce goods which they try to exchange for goods produced by the other players. Only goods which have been exchanged this way can then be sold for victory points. The exchange value of goods depends from supply and demand and will change from round to round.

The game Black market has won the 3rd price at the Hippodice game designer contest 2003 as Merkantilismus. There are some small changes to this version.

Black Market will be published during the Essen convention 2008 as a small (110 copies) handmade game.

name: Lilo & Stitch's Island of Adventures
description: Players roll and move along a board, trying to collect different "experiments". The DVD is used for various mini-games along the way. There are a physical gameboard, 6 playing pieces, and 50 pogs.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Freight Yard
description: Similar to Alan Moon's Freight Train, Freight Yard has players building individual trains by collecting different types of cars out of the freight yard. The cars in completed trains are each worth different point values, and keeping trains to a particular company or type is worth bonus multipliers.

name: Friedland 1807
description:
The Game consists of the following components: a Ziploc "Baggie" for storage; a paper Coversheet with cardboard backing; a thick paper covered RULES Booklet; 2-thick paper Charts; a heavy paper 3-Color Mapsheet; 2-Sets of die-cut Cardboard Counters; & Players must provide their OWN (2)-[6]-sided DICE.

The Game Mapsheet is overall WHITE with BLUE water features, GREEN forests, and BROWN Lettering/Numbering, Village, Bridge, Road, Slope, Ravine Hexside, and Ford(crossing). The Game Counters are Dark BLUE with WHITE print for the FRENCH, and Dark GREEN with WHITE print for the RUSSIANS. The Game Charts are Light GREEN with BLACK print FRONT and BACK with one of them having the Terrain Effects/Combat Results while the other has the TURN Record Track/Initial-Set-Up/Unit-Types/Unit-Designations-&-Sizes; and the sturdy RULES Booklet Cover with overall Dark BLUE and WHITE/BLACK print at about (4)-FULL Page sheets within.

The RULES are paper sheets folded in half, per page, with small print on both sides while an extensive Introduction on the Battle and detailed Orders of Battle are also provided. There are some Game Charts/Tables in the RULES Booklet such as the Bridge Bombardment Table, Morale Check Table, and Range Effects Chart. The Game Scale is 400-yards across a HEX, EACH Turn represents 30-Minutes, and Units are Regiments/Brigades/Divisions with Headquarters for FRENCH Army Command(Napoleon), plus the (4)Corps Commanders under him and RUSSIAN Army Command(Benningsen), plus the (3)Corps Commanders under him.

The Game-Turn Sequence is as follows:-1.French Movement Phase & Reinforcement Entry; 2.French Combat Phase; 3.Russian Movement Phase & Reserve Forces Release die-rolls; 4.Russian Combat Phase; 5.Turn Record Track marker advance. The Game begins at 8-A.M. and lasts until 8-P.M. at the latest or when one side or the other is destroyed or resigns.

There are Special Rules for the Commanders & their Control(Command Range) over their Units, the Russian Reserves, Guard Units(BONUS 1-HEX additional RANGE) on both sides, Artillery RANGE(up to 5 hexes & DOUBLED Strength at 1-HEX distance), Bridges(can be Damaged/Unusable and Repaired later OR Destroyed), Demoralization-in this game BOTH sides can suffer from THIS, and Breakdown of Larger Units into several smaller ones. The Combat Results Table uses (2)-DICE and even includes a ROUT result(Units affected are Eliminated and Victorious Units can Advance their FULL movement) while ROUTED Units COUNT for Demoralization but NOT Victory Points determination, a SKIRMISH result which enables the DEFENDER to counter-attack at 1-1 OR RETREAT-1 & Attacker Advance-1 as well as others standard in a game such as this. The RAVINE hexsides incur a HUGE movement penalty in order to cross them PLUS Zones of Control do NOT extend across them. Overall, a very nice depiction of this Napoleonic Battle resulting from the pursuit of the Russians after the debacle at Eylau in that earlier encounter, and preventing them from linking up in full force, with the Prussians.

name: Run
description:
Run is one of Knizia's earliest abstract games.

Players move one cowboy and one cow each turn in an attempt to move their cows safely across the board. A cowboy can take an opponent's cow. The game ends when all the cows for both players have exited the board or have been captured by cowboys. Scores are tallied for each player by determining how many of their cows have exited the board. The player who has managed to get the most cows off of the board wins.

This game is part of the Abacus wood box series.

name: Princeps Machiavelli
description:
From the publisher's website...

Princeps Machiavelli is a new concept of strategy cards game. It’s a wargame inspired by The Prince of Niccolò Machiavelli. This game shows accurately Machiavelli's thoughts about War and Politic in the Renaissance World.

Live the fights between noble families and use diplomatic weapons to lead your Principality to glory!

name: Deadly Russian Roulette: Die or Be Rich
description:
"A new Russian roulette
More exciting, more interesting, and more deadly
Since the winner can make a fortune in a heart beat,
people come and challenge at this lethal game in a non-stoppable trend.
Do you gain advantage from bluffing and cunning manipulation, or do you win by carefully deployed strategy, or is mere luck your need to call yourself the king of roulette?" from back of box.
A fun quick push your luck game with foam bullets.

name: Express 01: Benelux Expansion
description:
from the rules:
"The game play is essentially the same as in the base game. Of cause, you can now build tracks that cross the border between the Benelux countries and Germany..."
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: JurassAttack!: Promo Pack
description: This promo packs adds new twists to JurassAttack! with the addition of 8 new cards including: Herbivores, Meteors, and Rotten Eggs.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Your Theme Park
description:
Have you always dreamed of building and managing an amusement park? Your Theme Park is for you! In this comic book of which you are the hero, build your park, make it evolve by improving your attractions, your shops and your decorations. Expand it by buying plots and unlocking hundreds of bonuses....

Your Theme Park is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
publishers: 999 Games, Ediciones MasQueOca, Graphic Novel Adventures, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: War Returns to Europe: Yugoslavia 1991
description:
War Returns to Europe: Yugoslavia 1991 (WRTE) is a simulation of the first engagements of the Yugoslav Wars of 1991-2001 that was published in Strategy & Tactics Issue #303. Game play begins in June 1991 when Slovenia and Croatia proclaimed independence from the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, and ends in early 1992.

There are two players in WRTE: The Federalist player and the Separatist player. The Federalist player assumes the role of the commander of the People’s Army of Yugoslavia (JNA), the only Federal institution still working in Yugoslavia in the early 1990s (the Federalist player must fight low morale, politicos, and the Separatists to keep Yugoslavia united, or at least to retain the largest possible tract of Serb-inhabited territory). The Separatist player represents the governments of the breakaway republics of Slovenia and Croatia fighting for independence and a free market economy.

name: Krazy Bee Rummy
description:
A set collecting, rummy card game played in multiple hands.

Players must collect 14 different card sets or "steps", one per hand, in a specific order, with an increasing level of difficulty. On a players turn they must draw a card, complete a step if possible or play off cards from their hand onto their own or other players steps if they have their target step "down", and discard a card to end their turn. If player discards a playable card, another player may call "rummy", play the card from the discard, and give the discarding player a card from their own hand. A hand of play ends when any player discards the last card from their hand.

Players score points for cards remaining in their hands at the end of each hand of play. After completing all 14 steps, the player with the lowest score wins.

Game includes 143 card deck (featuring unsuited number cards from 1 to 13 and "Wild Bee" wild cards), a set of four unique sliding windowed step counters that allow each player to keep track of which of the 14 steps he or she is trying to "get down" next, and a large pad of score sheets. Cards are linen finished and seem to be of high quality. Box top is sturdy. Inner box, with game rules printed on bottom, is somewhat flimsy.

name: Macross: City Fight
description:
Complexity level 2 on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

The game of City Fight in Macross

Ground-based hexagonal wargame based off the science-fiction anime TV show. As the name implies, fight other mechs in a city enviroment. Includes 3 maps and various scenarios.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Early Years
description:
From the box:

Early Years is a collection of four co-operative card games which encourage close observation, communication, imagination, and social and memory skills [Some of which were previously published as stand-alone games].

- Animal Train: Try to connect halves of animals to form a long train pulled by Teddy Bear's engine.
- Fuzzy Math: Form a long caterpillar of number and math signs.
- Alphabet Soup: Connect words domino style.
- Story Time: Become story tellers as you journey past challenges to find a lost treasure.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Word Game

name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The King Takes a Dare
description:
Midnight in the city of New York. It's raining. Three miles away from each other, two men make exactly the same decision at exactly the same time.

One is Daredevil, the red-costumed fighter for justice, who uses his uncanny senses to fight evil where he finds it.

The other is Kingpin, the pinstripe-clad warrior, who has followed his own code of ethics while fighting and clawing his way to the top of a criminal empire more powerful than many small nations.

Each has decided to eliminate the other in a duel to the death on the streets of New York.

One player is Daredevil. The other, Kingpin. Each has his own book of scenarios and choices in this 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks episode of the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure series.

name: Brandy Station: Clash of Cavalry
description:
A simulation of the Battle of Brandy Station between the newly reorganized Cavalry Corps of the Union Army and the battle hardened veterans of J.E.B Stuarts Confederate Cavalry Division. The Battle of Brandy Station was largest cavalry battle in history.

The mapboard is a TIME/SPACE GRID map consisting of sectors (squares) with movement numbers printed on the boundaries and corners of each square indicating movement cost. Each sector represents about 650 yards.

All Cavalry and Infantry units are Regiments, 500 men strong, All artillery units are Batteries of 4-6 guns. There are about 140 unit counters in the game and 180 in total.

No indication of how much time a turn encompasses. Game length is 12 turns.

Turn sequence is a modified IGO-UGO with each player-turn consisting of 7 phases:
Reinforcement Phase
Movement Phase
Enemy Mounted Cavalry Reaction Movement Phase
Fire Combat Phase
Melee Combat Phase
Friendly Mounted Cavalry Exploitation Phase
Disorganization Removal Phase

name: Seejeh
description: Game of capturing your opponent's pieces by first placing your pieces strategically and then moving them strategically.
mechanics: Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid
publishers: Klee, Leasure Learning Products, Orda Industries Ltd., Skye Marketing Corporation

name: Archers
description:
Originally published by GAMES Magazine in July 1985, Archers is a two-player abstract strategy game.

Each player controls nine "archers" on a 9 x 9 playing board. Each player gets two movements per turn with the option of attacking an opponent at the beginning of their turn.

The first player to move an archer onto the opponent's base area wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Gang War
description: In this Axis & Allies variant, players get to simulate gang wars in '80s and '90s Los Angeles between five rival gangs - Bloods, Crypts, Hell's Angels, Latin Kings, and the Mafia. Includes map, 1D10, over 270 unit counters, and 36 building counters.

name: HeroCard Galaxy Crab Expansion Deck
description:
From the back of the box:

Crab Expansion Deck

The Crab eliminates enemies using her overwhelming neutral voltage, rapid reflexes, and intense energy shields.

The Crab is a HeroCard Galaxy expansion deck , the battle for cosmic domination. The Crab can compete in any HeroCard game or be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contents
33 Character cards
1 Figure

Expands

HeroCard Galaxy
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Pirates' Plunder
description: The "cut-throat card game where players try to collect as much treasure as they can ... even if it means stealing it from other players". Players take turns to match a card from their hand with one on the table, claiming both for their treasure pile. Alternatively they may match the top card of an opponent's treasure pile and claim the whole pile. Wild "parrot" cards can be used to claim any card from the table.

name: Trivial Pursuit: 1996 Edition (German)
description: This edition of the TRIVIAL PURSUIT Year in Review Series contains questions about the highlights of the year 1996.

name: Rukshuk: Edition 2
description:
Rukshuk - the world's original game of rock-balancing is back with more edge-of-the-seat fun!

RUKSHUK - Edition 2 features all new Game Rocks and cool new RUKSHUK formations guaranteed to challenge and thrill!

Race against the clock to build the different Rukshuk formations and score as many points as you can. Skill, luck and strategy determine who will score the most points and win!

1 to 5 players draw 7 game rocks each then turn over a card to reveal a RUKSHUK formation. Regular and bonus points are scored by building as much of the formation as possible within the time limit. If a formation topples, it must be rebuilt before time runs out! Points are scored for the balanced rocks at the end of the time limit, with additional points for three-of-a-kind and completion. Choose to play some or all formations in a game, and the player with the highest points wins.

Re-implements:

Rukshuk

name: Petrodólar
description: Petrodólar is an abstract strategy game of conquest of countries and economic enrichment in the region of "Al Kaifar". Each player acts as a superpower and manages a group of heads of state, giving or removing the command of the countries of the region. But what is the objective behind these maneuvers there? "Al Kaifar" is a region rich in oil and every player aspires to be enriched through the possession of oil wells and ships for the transportation of oil. As you go playing it you understand that the first objective is to try to survive. Because in the troubled region of Al Kaifar survival is not easy. Each player moves to their heads of state according to its strategy and diceless.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Martian Miners
description:
Mars 2158. Since long this planet has been inhabited by humans, but only the light side. The dark side has always been considered too dangerous, because of the plundering Martians roaming these badlands. Two mining companies, however, have started a wager: who will be the ultimate Martian Miner?

This piecepack game is a port of CATAN. It uses:

Piecepack Game System
Icehouse Pieces

name: Azul y Rojo
description:
This is a naval wargame featuring naval battles of the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939).
Presented with 12 different scenarios, representing different sea battles of the Civil War, it simulates naval action including mines, naval aviation and torpedoes.
Each side deploys his units according to the rules of each scenario, playing on turns and applying the different special rules.
Each ship has an individual hit table, on which damage is recorded.
categories: Civil War, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: The Middle Kingdom Race
description:
This made-in-Singapore boardgame is produced by Pioneer Junior College.

The theme of the game: set in China. Players are trying to 'plan a route across China that would score the most number of points'.

In reality, the game can be thought of as a modified '10 days' game (with a scoring system, double-use cards as well as an 'interrupt' function).

The game: Players set up 12 cards on wooden card holders (similar to the 10 days, albeit bigger). The difference is that cards can be rearranged AT ANY TIME (making for a shorter game).

During a turn, the player draws a card and chooses to replace a card in their holder. The replaced card is put face up in the middle of the table. Subsequent cards are placed on the same pile.

Interrupts: if a discarded card allows them to complete a set of 3 connecting cards, a player can interrupt and take the card. A die roll resolves simultaneous interrupts. The set of 3 cards are revealed to other players and LOCKED from changes. Play continues to the left of the player who successfully interrupted play.

The game ends when a player connects up 12 cards (9 cards for a short game). Each player then tallies up VPs printed on cards, choosing between one of two cards in each link. Completing player gets 5 VPs bonus. Tranport cards = 0 vp. Multiples cards are -1 point for one after the main card.

The production values are high. The garish board is mounted, the rules and player aids are printed on thick laminated card, the wooden card holders add considerable heft to the box.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Antaire: Dungeons
description:
Explore the hidden dungeons of the land of Antaire. Fight your way through the dungeon, avoiding its traps, fighting monsters and most importantly collecting your gold.

Antaire: Dungeons is a competitive dungeon exploration game. Players compete against the dungeon and each other, trying to leave with the most gold.

The game is designed to allow infinite replay. All players start with one of eight characters (Knight, Barbarian, Archer, Thief, Mage, Healer, Druid, Necromancer) on a beginning tile. As the game progresses the dungeon is extended by adding tiles consisting of corridors, rooms, and importantly shops and most importantly the exit tile. Shops allow the player to buy new equipment for their character, increasing his or her abilities, or heal damage from the dangers of the dungeon. Players themselves add monsters, traps and treasure within the dungeon to either their advantage or opponents disadvantage, leaving everybody to play. Death in the game is only final if the exit appears, extending the overall player interaction to the last possible moment. And don't worry, if a character exits the dungeon, the player may still play, using the dungeon and its inhabitants to stop other players exiting and defeating them.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Epidemic Express
description:
Epidemic Express is a lightweight solitaire dice game, where you are battling severe outbreaks of five deadly diseases. Your goal is to contain the diseases while developing cures for each. Meanwhile, worldwide panic is increasing, so you must act quickly before civilization breaks down completely.

Epidemic Express attempts to capture some of the flavor of Pandemic (an excellent cooperative game). It is *not* related to the older 2003 card game named Epidemic

You can choose to fight only real-world diseases, or you can use the optional zombie plague.
categories: Dice, Environmental, Medical, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies

name: Word Bluff Table Top Game
description: This is a card game that is a bluffing word guessing game. Each card has three possible answers for each word on the card. Only one of them is correct, can you guess which one?

name: BattleTech Record Sheets: 3055 & 3058
description:
From the back of the book:

"The years since the Truce of Tukayyid have given rise to a new breed of war machines. The break in hostilities has allowed both the Inner Sphere and the Clans to expand their arsenals, creating bold new 'Mech designs tailored specifically to the enemy. When war resumes, these new machines will dominate the front lines in the struggle for the fate of humanity.

BattleTech Record Sheets 3055 & 3058 provides more than 250 filled-out record sheets for the BattleMechs, tanks, hovercraft and VTOLS described in BattleTech Technical Readouts 3055 and 3058, including variants and alternate configurations. As an added feature, the game information for the relevant weapons and equipment is printed on each record sheet for easy reference.

User comment:

One of the largest of the record sheet packs produced by FASA, this pack was square-bound - making it diffiult to photocopy any of the record sheets without breaking or removing the spine of the book. On the other hand, the sheets included the weapon information for each 'Mech, and the pack includes everything from the two Tech Readouts - not just 'Mechs.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: KWIKORD (Kwik Word)
description:
KWIKORD is a great word game that combines the fast-pace of Boggle with the crossword-like fun of Scrabble. There is no waiting for your turn and any number can play at once.

The Play: Each player receives a score sheet with three 7×8 grids on it. A dealer shuffles and turns over 5 consonants and 4 vowels, then starts the 4 minute countdown timer. All players use these letters to create words and write them on their grid in crossword fashion (across and down with all words connecting). Try to place as many words on the grid as possible and reach the 4 corner squares for bonus points).

After the beeper sounds, add up your total number of words (across and down) then exchange your sheet with an opponent to get bonus points for "improper words-spelling etc." When you get your sheet back, multiply your total by the number of corner squares you reached.

Choose a new dealer and repeat this 2 more times. The WINNER is the player with the highest score after the 3 rounds.
Received the Parents' Choice Award, the Toy Man Award and the Family Review Center Editor's Choice Award.

name: Doraemon Darake
description:
A balance game featuring everyone's favourite blue, earless robot cat.

Set up the wobbling time machine on a table or floor and then take it in turns to place one of 12 Doraemon figures onto it using the chopsticks provided. Make sure you balance carefully and don't let the Doraemons come tumbling off! Finally place the Minidora on top for victory!

The game is aimed at children but is challenging enough for daults to play, especially in lighthearted settings.

It comes with numerous play options and mini games and puzzles.

name: Steam Expansion: Isle of Wight
description:
Isle of Wight is a 2 player print-and-play map for Steam. The map incorporates a sixth goods colour (black) and ferry links that can be built in the same way as track tiles. The availability of goods cubes is very tight.

From the introduction:
The Isle of Wight, off the south coast of England, was popularised as a holiday destination by Queen Victoria, who regularly spent summers at Osborne House, near East Cowes. In order to handle the increasing numbers of visitors, the first railways on the island, between Cowes and Newport, and between Ryde and Shanklin, opened in the 1860s. By the turn of the century there were 55 miles of track on an island that measures little more than 20 miles by 12.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Battles of Carpiquet, France, July 3-5, 1944
description:
Scenario pack for Advanced Squad Leader. Tactical combat at the company level set during the Second World War, specifically the battles at Carpiquet airfield during Operation WINDSOR in July 1944. The scenarios were designed as part of a contest to see how diverse a collection of scenarios would be, given a common set of paramaters to work with. Fourteen entries by 12 authors were judged by well-known players and scenario designers in the ASL community at the gamesquad.com online community.

Scenarios include:

MWT1: Field of Fire
MWT2: Fourth of July
MWT3: Fifty Butchers
MWT4: Stalwart Sons
MWT5: Carpiquet Ballet
MWT6: Rifles Standing Where They Fell
MWT7: The Streets of Carpiquet
MWT8: The Hangers at Carpiquet
MWT9: Le Lande Leads
MWT10: Party Boys
MWT11: A Choice Morsel
MWT11.b: A Choice Morsel
MWT12.1: Tenacious Defense
MWT13: Prelude to Caen
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: World War II: Tank Combat
description:
Players command a squadron of tanks, German or Soviet, battling in Eastern Europe. Unit cards display the capabilities of each tank unit, and players mark their orders on their unit cards simultaneously and in secret.

Game components include six 1/100 tank models, four double-sided gameboards, terrain tiles, game cards, player aids, ten dice and two water-based markers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Balance
description: Balance is a dexterity game in which players take turn stacking irregularly shaped wooden blocks on an unstable platform until it tips over. The winner is who manage to position the last animal without making the others fall down. It is themed after the story of Noah's Ark, including two of each type of animal block.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Novel-based, Religious

name: Arf!
description:
You’re volunteers at an adoption fair trying to find the best homes for your shelter’s puppies! You will present each puppy with a set of cards which represent a home you’ve found. Each home offers different amounts of Food, Love, or Room in varying combinations.

Goal: The player who offers the best home gets to keep a record of that adoption in their portfolio. Score points by collecting cards with matching ranks, suits, and breeds. The player with the most points wins!

How to Play: On your turn, you may draw two cards and allow your opponents to draw one. OR you may offer a set of cards to a puppy that is available from the center of the table or in front of another player. Your offer must meet certain minimum requirements noted by the puppy's tag. If taking a puppy from an opponent, you must offer a *better* set of cards, again based on the puppy's tag. If you begin your turn with a puppy in front of you, then add that card to your portfolio where it will be scored at the end of the game.

name: Disney Planes Sky Race Action Game
description:
Fly your plane through the Wings Around the Globe Rally to win. But, watch out—flight conditions change and you’ll face surprising challenges. Toss with your eyes closed, between your legs, lying down, and more!

Players assembles their gliders, set Stage Markers (checkpoints) around the house at various locations, and randomly distribute Flight Control tiles at each Stage Marker. These tiles add to the game's variety as each new checkpoint presents new challenges to reach the next Stage Marker. "Toss your plane upside down", "Toss covering one eye" and "Toss over your head" are just a few of the possible twists.

Each player gets one toss to reach the next Stage Marker. The plane closest to that marker wins that stage and collects the Flight Control tile (each worth a random amount of points). After completing all stages, the player with the most points wins!

name: High Five
description: In High Five, players seek five words on a given theme on the card you have drawn and write the words on a sheet of paper. The more players have written identical words found on this card, the more points you get. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Twin Princes
description:
User summary
Twin Princes is 双子の王子 (Hutago no Ouji). Originally published in 2015, a new colour edition was made in 2016.

Long ago in a desert country, the Twin Princes decided to race for the right to the throne in a mutually agreeable method, in order not to cause a future struggle because of themselves.

Twin Princes is a card game for two players. There are six territory cards on the table, and players try to control them by placing influence cards on them. Each player also controls a Prince meeple, which move on the territories and affect the placement of cards.

A game consists of six round. Each round, five cards are drawn. One player (divider) split them into two groups, and the other (selector) takes one of these groups. The divider takes the rest. Then they take turns playing a card on a territory.

After sixth round, for each territory, count influence points each player has place on that territory. The player with highest influence controls the territory and scores victory points. The player with the highest total victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
テーマ
遠い昔砂漠の国。 双子の王子は 自分たちが原因で争いが起きないよう、お互いが納得できる形で 王位継承権を競ったのです。

遊び方
２人専用のゲームです。
分配者と選択者になります、分配者が５枚のカードを２つに分けて、選択者が選び、手札にします。残った方を分配者が手札にします。
分配者から順番にカードをプレイします。エリアとカードのマジョリティを競います
分配者を交代して６ラウンド行います。
終了時点で勝利点の多いプレイヤーが勝利します。

—description from bodoge-hoobby.net (translated)

A two-player card game in which players compete for the right to succeed to the throne as one of the twin princes.

Distribute cards → Arrange cards in 5 areas, complete 6 rounds and compete for the final score.

And the interesting part of this game is the distribution of cards.

The person who distributes draws 5 cards from the deck and reveals them. Divide these cards into two sets, such as 2 and 3, or 1 and 4, and add magic carpet cards to make a total of 4 cards.

The other player chooses one of the two decks of cards and proceeds to lay out the cards while revealing each other's hands.

If you make one card too strong, your opponent will naturally take that combination, so it is necessary to distribute it in a well-balanced manner. How to sort is very important.

Your hand information is always open to the public, so you'll have to think about which card to place in which area, and you'll be faced with a variety of choices when it comes to not only distributing cards but also placing them. This is the biggest attraction of this game.

The rules themselves are difficult enough for anyone to understand after playing it once, so if you have many opportunities to play board games with two people, this is a board game we recommend you play once!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, I Cut, You Choose

name: What Just Happened?
description:
What Just Happened is a competitive/cooperative storytelling game, similar to Cards Against Humanity, for 3-6 players that takes 30-45 minutes to play. Each player picks a character, plays an item on a character, and then tells the story that they feel transpired using the cards in play. The catch? You only have 60 seconds.

Each card has a points value that is based on how difficult the card is to use in a story with a little bias towards cards children can use. As each card is used, you "turn" it to denote that you have used that card in your story. At the end of your story you add up all the cards that you used correctly. The person with the most points each round wins the round. After you win 3 rounds you win the game!

name: Oh My Sheep!
description:
Oh My Sheep is a strategic card game set in a mythical world where hunger is prominent. In Oh My Sheep you get to choose one of the three races, fill your race’s stomachs with lamb, and sabotage other races.
In Oh My Sheep you play one of the three races, Orc, Goblin, or Cyclops and use your abilities to take cards from unsuspecting sheep in the main flock or you can also steal it from the other races. The player with the most amount of sheep wins.
Each race have their own specialty. The Goblin has numbers and cunning abilities, the Cyclops have brute strength, and the Orc are a balanced race with enough strength and intelligence to take sheep and hold their own.
What will you do to get the most sheep and satisfy your hunger? How will you do it? Find out in Oh, My Sheep!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Colossal Blob
description: Colossal Blob is a fun, 2 to 4 player pick-up-and-play card game for everyone! Playing as a Blob, players must collect growth cards to grow or play attack cards to shrink their opponents. The goal is to become the biggest, baddest, most COLOSSAL blob to win the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Princess Mina: Junior Rummy
description:
Description from the publisher :

Princess Mina has invited all her girlfriends to a relaxed afternoon at the castle. They want to try out Mina’s new card game. Many sparkling stars can be won for the princesses to decorate their crowns.
Who will be the first to decorate her headdress with three stars? An enchanting classic card game.

name: Orconomics
description:
Orconomics is a game for 2-5 players, competing against each other to establish Companies in ten industrial sectors. Companies
in each industrial sector generate income or losses, and grant players abilities that can be used during the game. As players build their business empire, they will also gain or lose Trophies depending on their presence in each sector and whether they dominate it.
When a player holds a set number of Trophies the game ends immediately, and that player is declared the winner.

During the game, each player found or raid companies in different sectors of Orcs industry: Tourism, Smuggling, Totemology etc.

The game board consists of 10 sectors that assembles randomly for each new game. That gives a good replay rating as sectors will have different value and will affect on each other.

Companies in different sectors provide a special ability of the sector. For example, a leader of a Totemology sector will get an ability to send a crisis to an opponents sector. That also gives a variety of tactic decisions.

Another important part of the game - Influence Cards. It is hard to get it, but these cards are really powerful and can destroy your opponents plans and becomes even more devastating in various combos with sector abilities.

Finally, the main concept of the game lays in the interaction of all player. It makes a player to be involved in the gaming process even during the opponent's turn.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board

name: Cha-cha-boo!!
description:
Cha Cha Boo is a card game that combines strategy, chance and balance. During their go, each player must decide how to distribute the different monsters that are dealt, among the players. They must place the cards, forming a steady row without any of them falling. The player that gets the most monsters is the winner, but don't forget that some monsters can also make you lose points.































Coloca en equilibrio las divertidas cartas de monstruos marchosos.

name: Animalix
description:
Animalix is a reflex game based on the animal’s diet, but also in the condition of tamed or wild animals.
This game will make you learn and being nimble to win.

Aim:

Winning more cards than the other players

Setting:

Cards are dealt face down at random and each player keeps their cards secret from the other players.
The 4 wooden tokens are placed in the center of the table, symbolizing wild, tame, herbivore, or carnivorous.

Game Play:
When the first player finishes the countdown (3,2,1), players simultaneously turn the top card of the deck over and put it in front of their deck.

At the same time, players can take either one or two wooden tokens form the center of the table, keeping in mind that only up to two tokens may be correct and using only one hand.

The cards which were played that roudn are awarded to those that took the correct tokens. If there is only one player with the correct tokens, that player takes all the cards played this round.

Taking the correct token:

Cards show a definite animal.
If in the round most of animals were herbivores, the herbivore token would be a winning token this time. Likewise with carnivorous. If there was a tie, neither herbivore nor carnivorous token would be winner.

Another winning token can be the tame (dog) / wild (crocodile) token, depending on the most of this condition among the cards played this round. If there was a tie, neither tame nor wild token would be winner.

In case a player takes a incorrect token, this player will lose two cards (if the player can).

Finishing the round:
All the tokens are returned in the middle of the table and another round is played. The countdown will be made by the next player (that one on the left from the before first player).

Finishing the game:
When there are no cards to play a round, the game ends.
That one who has more cards at the end of the game will win the game.

Components:
55 cards, 5 wooden tokens and rulebook.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Dwarf Team Card Pack
description:
This is a pack of 45 handy reference cards for a Dwarf Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


Reference cards for Blockers, Runners, Blitzers, Troll Slayers, and Deathrollers;
Reference cards for the following Star Players: Barik Farblast, Grim Ironjaw, Flint Churnblade, Boomer, Grombrindal The White Dwarf, and Morg 'N' Thorg;
The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 13 Blockers, 3 Runners, 3 Blitzers, 3 Troll Slayers, and 2 Deathrollers;
A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
4 Dirty Tricks cards: A Dwarf Wrote This Game You Know, Axe? What Axe?, Sports Almanac of Grudges, Undermining;
4 Magical Memorabilia cards: Grimnir's Gromril Boots, Oath Stone of the High Coach, Rune-forged Catcher's Mitt, Guild of Engineers Experimental Helm of Flight;
The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Yam's Junior
description:
A new kids’ version of the famous game of Yahtzee, by Djeco: three rolls of the dice to get the best combination of animals in three-of-a-kind, families, four-of-a-kind, and, best of all, yahtzee – just like in the grown-ups’ game!
—description from the publisher

Le célèbre jeu du Yam revisité par Djeco pour le plus petits : sur les dés des animaux à regrouper en 3 lancers pour former des brelans, des familles, des carrés et surtout le yams comme les grands !
—description from the publisher (French)

name: 라온 주사위 (Raon Dice)
description:
라온 주사위 (Raon Dice) is a game of rolling dice and making words by using vowels and consonants from the dice roll. In the process of combining the vowels and comparing the results, you can easily become familiar with Hangul (한글) while having fun.

라온 주사위 comes with four different ways to play using the components in the box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Cabbage!
description:
Two farmers compete for the largest cabbage field. The player who after 6 turns has the largest number of connected cabbages in their color wins the game.

Cabbage! is a quick to play game that presents a particularly colorful and tasty challenge. Optimize the cabbage field with only 6 moves (either flip, rotate or replace), outwit your opponent and become the glorious king or queen of cabbage!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Farming, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Order Counters, Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Square Grid, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind
description:
What if Word War II hadn’t ended in 1945…?
What if the Manhattan Project had been delayed…?

The historical end of the Japanese Empire occurred in August 1945, before the invasion of Japan. For over 60 years, historians have debated what could have happened if a number of events had ended differently. Kamikaze 1946 proceeds from a historical base to describe what could have happened if the war had continued another year. Now you can participate in historical or what-if missions and aerial combats of WWII.

Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind accurately recreates the speed and deadliness of air-to-air combat in a fast moving game system. Based on historical combat results, aircraft characteristics, and tactics of the aces, the simple rules are easy to follow. Most missions can be completed in 1-2 hours, with 2-8 players. Each player can easily control a dozen or more aircraft. The rules and data you need are contained within, along with information on painting 1/300th scale aircraft from Luftwaffe 1946 Miniatures. Can you alter the path of history?

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Pilgrims
description:
In Pilgrims, a trick-taking card game with a number of twists, players are collecting groups of villagers to go on pilgrimage together, but only the most impressive bands of pilgrims get to be commissioned by the bishop and gain prestige!

In each round, two (or sometimes one) sites of pilgrimage are on offer, and players try to build the most impressive band of pilgrims by playing cards of the same suit. Lower value cards may be used to provide relics or manuscripts to add to the prestige gained from visiting a particular holy site. You may even be able to go on pilgrimage on your own as the hermit!

When you go on pilgrimage, you receive a scoring card and discard all the cards you played. Players going home discard only one of the cards they played. Scoring cards give you 5-10 victory points, and there are chances to add to these using lower-value cards you play.

The more you go on pilgrimage, the smaller your band of followers becomes, making it more difficult to compete against your opponents, so you need to choose when to admit defeat and go home early in the hope of attracting more impressive followers to your cause.

The game is over when thirty pilgrimages have taken place, which typically means 16-20 rounds of play.

This game has been in development since 2004, and now is in final stages of refining the artwork.

-description from designer

name: Hex Marvel
description:
MARVEL GAME. Recover the gems and gain control of the universe in this challenging strategy game between Marvel heroes and villains. The object of the game is to be the first team to retrieve the infinity gems. Improve your strategy game.

FEATURES. The content is: 1 double view board in 6 pieces, 2 dice with sticker, 2 point dice, 4 boards and 24 gems. Position the tiles on the board and remove the obstacles by rolling the dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building

name: Hot-pota-toH! (Second Edition)
description:
Hot-Pota-toh! is a press your luck game where the deck has an exploding potato that players must avoid drawing, while trying to get the cards that have "Phew" points. The deck will be rotated among the players and each player will draw a card or play a card until someone draws the BOOM Card and explodes, losing the points accumulated, then a new round begins. The best part of the game are the power cards which cointain other press your luck and hot potato mechanics!

In this second edition you will see an improvement in the illustrations, and new cards with new powers, which allow you to play with 2 players.

Hot-Pota-toh! es un juego de presionar la suerte, en cuyo mazo hay una patata explosiva que los jugadores deben evitar sacar, al mismo tiempo que tratan de conseguir cartas que den puntos "Phew". El mazo se rota entre los jugadores y cada jugador puede, o sacar una carta del mazo, o jugar una carta de su mano (no las dos cosas) hasta que alguien saque la papa caliente y explote, perdiendo todos los puntos que había acumulado en la ronda. Luego comienza una nueva ronda. Lo mejor de juegos con los poderes de las cartas, que contienen más mecánicas de presión de suerte.

En esta segunda edición verás una mejora en las ilustraciones, y nuevas cartas con nuevos poderes, que te permiten jugar desde 2 jugadores.
mechanics: Hot Potato, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Don't Go Boom
description:
Your Mission? Don’t Go Boom! Get the lowest score in 3 rounds by totaling up the numbers on each player's minefield cards. Watch out for Big Bad Bomb cards, they’re worth 15 points each. Explosively fun card games by Inspiration Play. Inspired by the parlor card game, Golf.

Have a BLAST - Other kids games on the market move slowly and can’t keep attention. The Don’t Go Boom card games for kids keep you and your kids guessing down to the last card. Approx. 25 mins. (2 - 6 players)

Easy To Learn & Play Anywhere - Don’t Go Boom is easy to learn and is perfect for kids ages 7 and up. Action cards help players strategize the best moves and create a fun, engaging vacation, travel, car, recess, or classroom card game your family will love!

Explosive & Calculated Fun - Family card games are where it's at! Improve your kids counting and math skills while having fun and ditching virtual play. Our travel games for kids help teach your child social skills, math, and the art of kicking some serious butt.

Contains 104 cards & instructions.

name: Worte Querbeet: Lass Worte Wachsen!
description:
Whether in the big city or in the country, you'll find planting beds everywhere. What could be better than growing a plant from a letter, watching it grow, and then proudly looking at the words you've grown yourself?

Words Querbeet - the somewhat different dice game! Ideal for all those who love to fiddle with letters. Roll the three letter dice and enter at least one of the diced letters into your crossword grid. Whether vertically or horizontally - the goal is to put together as many valid words as possible. With a bit of luck, the joker is rolled and you have the free choice of letters.
Four exciting game variants are waiting to be discovered by you - and you can also garden alone. But now into the rubber boots and off into the bed!

The game principle:
The game is played with three letter cubes. In each round, at least one of the diced letters must be entered into the crossword grid on your own game sheet. Jokers allow tactical decisions. The player who assembles the most meaningful words vertically and horizontally wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Clomping Creatures
description: The snake cheerfully creeps over the intersection. But suddenly, tromp, tromp, tromp someone trudges down her back. Whose feet were those? Players mimic the animals' movements using their fingers and hands on the backs of the other players. Whoever guesses the most animals can cleverly imitate the animal's walking style wins the game.

name: Phase 10 Strategy
description:
Phase 10 Strategy is played over several rounds. Each round players take it in turn to move their counter around the board to decide on card combinations called "phases". Players need to plan their moves well, as they can only form a phase if their counter is in the appropriate space. In addition, a player may only make one phase per round. As in traditional Phase 10, players use cards to complete their chose phase. Once a player has completed a phase and got rid of his remaining cards, the round ends. Then all players get new cards and the next round begins. Whoever completes his tenth phase first and then gets rid of his remaining cards, wins! Each deck contains Joker cards which increase the suspense and help players escape a tricky situation.

—description from the publisher (Translated)

Phase 10 Strategy wird über mehrere Runden gespielt, in denen die Spieler reihum ihre Spielsteine so über das Spielbrett bewegen, dass sie Kartenkombinationen bilden können, die als „Phasen“ bezeichnet werden. Die Spieler müssen ihre Züge gut planen, da sie eine Phase nur dann bilden können, wenn ihr Spielstein sich auf dem entsprechenden Feld befindet. Außerdem darf ein Spieler pro Runde nur eine einzige Phase bilden. Sobald ein Spieler eine vollständige Phase ausgespielt hat und seine restlichen Karten losgeworden ist, endet die Runde. Dann erhalten alle Spieler neue Karten und die nächste Runde beginnt. Wer als Erster seine zehnte Phase abschließt und dann seine restlichen Karten loswird, gewinnt! Jedes Kartendeck enthält Joker-Karten, die die Spannung steigern und den Spielern helfen können, einer kniffligen Situation zu entkommen.

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Zombiaki: dodatkowe karty
description:
Promo cards for 10th anniversary of Zombiaki added to magazine Świat Gier Planszowych #28.
"Resorak" should be added to Zombies deck. If there is a card from Humans deck this zombie jumps over it.
"Ptasia grypa" should be added to Humans deck. Played on any zombie (not dog nor cat) change its strength to 1.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies

name: Flipop
description: The Flipop board consists of a 5x5 grid of spaces. In each of the 16 intersections between four spaces, there is a post holding a door that can swing around so that it blocks access between any adjacent two spaces of the four spaces around it. Each player has five balls on his side of the board. The object is to move the balls across the board, at which point they are removed from the game. To move, you must push a ball through a door. If there is a ball in the space beyond the door, it will be pushed -- this can cascade indefinitely. But a move is only legal as long as each ball lands either in an empty space or goes through another door -- balls cannot touch each other. The winner is either the first person to remove all his balls from the board, or the player with the fewest balls left when no legal moves remain.

name: The Peloponnesian War
description: "The Peloponnesian War" is a wargame simulation of the war waged between Athens and Sparta and their respective allies from 431 to 404 B.C. for control of the Hellenic world. The game is a strategic level simulation with each turn representing one year. The main infantry unit is a mora of hoplites and the main naval unit is a squadron of triremes.

name: Battle of Salamanca: Wellington Turns the Tide in the Peninsula, 1812
description: Low-to-medium complexity grand tactical treatment of Wellington's first offensive victory over the French under Marmont on 22 July 1812. Rules include facing and morale in a 10-page rulebook with a page of charts. Ground scale is 500 yards per hex, and troop scale is brigade. 120 playing counters and 120 markers; map 17x22", reminiscent of SPI. This is the sister game of Battle of Vittoria.

name: Jenga: Spider-Man
description: In this version of Jenga, each player moves their Spider-Man marker up the building to capture the Green Goblin before the Jenga tower falls. Use the spinner to determine how many spaces up the building your Spider-Man marker moves and how many Jenga blocks you remove to add to the top of the tower. Some of the Jenga blocks are “detective blocks” that have special instructions that impact your action such as “Superhuman Agility- Move up Three Additional Floors” or “Pumpkin Bomb- Drop instead of climb the amount of floors shown on the spinner.” If no one captures Green Goblin, the winner is determined by who is the closest to the top of the building when the Jenga tower falls.

name: Pea Ridge: St Louis, then Huzzah!
description:
A Union invasion of northern Arkansas ground to a halt in early 1862 due to logistical difficulties. The alarmed Confederates sent Earl Van Dorn to coordinate the fractious Southern forces to repel the Yankee invaders. Van Dorn, aggressive but careless, launched a quick offensive that nearly trapped Sam Curtis’ Union Army of the Southwest, until Curtis extricated his army and placed it in a well-entrenched position on the plateau of Pea Ridge. After their rapid march north, the Confederates were exhausted and out of supplies, but Van Dorn nevertheless set them on a grueling night march around Curtis’ position.

Pea Ridge uses the Musket & Saber system to accurately portray warfare during the American Civil War. All the primary facets of the muzzle-loading era are included. The combat system rewards intuitive play without the need for rifle-counting. There are substantial differences between infantry, artillery, and cavalry: Infantry, tough and resilient, bear the brunt of battle. Artillery can smash attacks or open holes in enemy lines, but is vulnerable and brittle. Cavalry is weak in stand-up combat, but crucial for pursuit and reconnaissance. All units are susceptible to rout when weakened, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time, so players must maintain reserves. Leaders provide an important supplement to unit capabilities, and armies must protect their headquarters and logistical tail or risk deterioration of their mobility and combat power.

Winning the battle depends upon deployment, thoughtful maneuver to concentrate at the key points, the proper coordination of arms, careful use of leaders and special units, and an understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of each army.

name: CheekZ
description:
A cheeky little card game of face-stuffing hamsters and double entendre for all the family (2-8 players).

CheekZ is a highly strategic hamster-powered version of Poker. Players take turns placing Battle, Attack and Defence cards until all Cheekz are empty. The winner then gets to spread the Cheekz of the other players and choose one to discard a Cheek. Players then Stash their Seed - but look out for Toxic and Exploding Seeds as players reveal a Dirty Cheek!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Children's Game, Humor, Math

name: TV Show
description:
Don't look at TV shows anymore, create them!

You are TV show writers and together, you'll create the new successful TV series.
To be crowned best scriptwriter, you'll have to know every details by heart.
Tell your TV plot by playing location, character and event cards and remember a maximum of details to win the game!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Monopoly: Disney Theme Park Edition III
description:
This version of Monopoly is the 3rd iteration of the Disney Theme Park Editions, featuring a pop-up Disney castle. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks. The famous rides and attractions are bought, sold, and traded by the players. Toontown buildings act as houses while Disney castles sub for hotels. It features 6 collectible player tokens modelled after Disney characters plus an exclusive partners statue to enhance the board. Once Upon A Time and Happily Ever After cards replace community chests and chance cards. It also features 60 minute speed play rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Sushi Royale
description:
寿しロワイヤル (Sushi Royale) is an action and bluffing game from Japan. Players are serving sushi, and trying to grab tea to win.

Welcome to our sushi restaurant! Make and serve popular sushi to your customers! Predict the popular sushi from remaining ingredients and make it!

In the case of a tie in the order, serve tea at once!

In this action game incorporating deduction elements, compete to be the best sushi chef!

Players each guess the sushi to be served by others and holds one of four types of sushi miniatures concealed in their hand. Then, at a shout, everyone reveals the miniatures. Your revealed sushi is served if it forms the (popular) majority. The served Sushi is placed on the plate. You get a cup of tea for every 2 sushi. The first player to get 2 cups of tea wins the game.

The tea is in the center of the play area. In the case of a tie in popularity of the sushi, players race to grab the tea at the shout of "Agari Icchou! (Here's your tea!)" Switch between different actions and move quickly!

へいらっしゃい！人気の寿司を握って、お客様に食べてもらおう！
残りのネタから人気の寿司を予想して、寿司を握れ！
注文が割れたなら、素早くお茶を出すのだ！
推理が絡んだ､アクションゲーム！君も寿司職人一番星を目指せ！
プレイヤーは他の人が出す寿司を推理して、4種の寿しのフィギュアから1つを選び
手に隠して出します。掛け声を合わせて全員で同時に公開します。多数派(人気)なら
1個上がりです。上がった寿司は盛り板の上に乗せます。2個上がったら
お茶を手に入れます。お茶を2個手に入れたら勝ちです。
お茶は場の中央に置かれています。もし寿司の人気が拮抗したなら「アガリ一丁！」の
掛け声とともに、お茶を奪い取ります。早い者勝ちです。切り替えて素早く動こう！

name: Sunrise Lane: Double Park
description:
Enjoy this promo for Sunrise Lane, a strategical game for 2 to 4 players where you pick the most prestigious plots of land and build beautiful houses… if you can beat your competitors to it!

Rules "Whenever you may build a House during your turn, you may discard this card to build 2 Park tiles in a row, following the regular construction rules."

This promo card was a bonus for preordering the game. It was also added to the spielbox magazine #5 2023 and could be found in Plato Magazine 163.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Gerda Gacker
description:
Farmer Eggbert just lovers fried eggs. Who can find the same number of chickens as eggs in the pan? Whoever collect the most fried eggs wins!

A memory game for 2-4 egged-on players.

name: Afterlife
description:
Afterlife is a narrative driven tabletop war gaming experience. The story of a near-future Earth torn apart by civil war after the collapse of the social order imposed by the Unity Council will be told over a number of separate volumes.

Earth burns as sprawling Mega Cities built for a world of prosperity become brutal war zones and the Unity Council’s authority crumbles away. Dozens of corporations, emergent governments and resistance movements form loose factions and alliances in battles for control of Earth’s resources and technology.

Each new Volume of Afterlife will expand on previously released Volumes, adding new miniatures and rules options, and continuing the narrative to its eventual dramatic conclusion.

The Afterlife Volumes will be player driven and interactive. Players will be able to report back the outcomes of battles and the tactical choices made during campaigns, and the information will be used to drive the next stage of the campaign or impact events in future Volumes.

The game will be skirmish level. The game play will be primarily statistics and D10 mechanics.

name: Masuria: Winter Battle 1915
description:
After the Tannenberg campaign of August-September 1914, East Prussia became a strategic backwater as both sides focused their efforts in Poland. But the Russian threat remained, and the following winter the Germans set about cleaning up their northern flank. A massive attack on the open right flank of the Russian Tenth Army sent it reeling; only the sacrifice of an entire corps in the Augustowo Forest enabled it to escape.

Masuria uses a modification of the Fire & Movement game system. Developed to portray the mechanized battlefields of a later generation, F&M stresses the use of rapidly-concentrated fire support to generate breakthroughs, followed by a rapid penetration by mobile reserves. In 1915, although railroads allowed the rapid shifting of forces on a large scale, no one moved faster than a man on foot on the battlefield, making exploitation ineffective. However, here both players have hidden movement, allowing them to concentrate in unexpected locations to surround and destroy isolated enemy units. The clumsy and inflexible fire support is represented by the artillery brigades available to division and corps commanders. It must be brought to the point of decision, then supplied to give it the firepower to affect the fighting.

The historical outcome at Masuria was the clearing of the East Prussian border. It might have gone differently; Russian reserves were available, and the German forces were a hodge-podge of units of widely varying quality. Both sides have a number of options to turn the fortunes of the campaign. The player who makes the better choices, and backs his strategy to the hilt, will emerge the victor.

Details:

Level: Brigade
Hex: 4 miles (6.5 km)

name: Mini BrilliAnts
description:
The long, hot summer is coming to an end, and the ant colonies in the quiet forest glade are increasing their efforts to prepare for the coming winter. Queens are hatching ants to grow their colony’s population, Farmers and hunters are scouring the area to stockpile food, and diggers are excavating tunnels to extend their colony’s territory. Will you be able to fulfill your colony’s harvesting objectives? Will you be able to beat enemy ants to the glade’s dwindling resources? Will you be able to avoid the dreaded predators? Will you lead your colony to victory? Will you be the most BrilliAnt?

On their turns, player either play an ant, play a predator, or hatch a new ant in order to be to most effective. Players battle over the same objectives, so be sure to look out on what your opponents are doing. The game ends when a player has completed their sixth objective or when there are no more resources to collect.
