Mini BrilliAnts is an ant-based card game playable in 15 minutes, a resource-collection game for 2 to 4 players in which the goal is to complete objectives to score the most victory points. The player whose objectives are worth the most points will win this small euro-style game!

—description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoth
description:
Complexity level 3 on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

Only released in Japan, this is a Star Wars themed hex-based wargame based not on the entire Empire Strikes Back movie, but just on the attack on Hoth. This game has no relation to West End Games' Assault on Hoth (other than being based off the same movie).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Medieval Battles: Legnano – 29 May 1176
description:
This free game is the first of a new series of fast furious wargames on Medieval Battles.
Legnano is one of the most famous battles of Italian medieval history, where the Lombards defeated the German Emperor, Barbarossa.
Easy to learn system, but with a lot of chrome in the optional rules.
It comes with a 2A4 full color map and around 120 counters

name: Kaki Lima
description:
A light strategy game inspired by walking around Penang's George Town, Kaki Lima is about pedestrians navigating their way through a grid of five-foot ways. Players gain victory points when their pedestrians reach places on their task lists and bonus exploration cards, when they clear blocked paths, and when they meet up with other pedestrians.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Trapped: The Carnival
description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 3
Difficulty level: EASY

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... In The Carnival, it's your lifelong dream to work alongside the fabled fortune teller and jaw-dropping performers of Muggins Carnival... Soon after you apply, The Ringmaster invites you to an interview you'll never forget!

Nothing's what it seems as you perform the admission tests: a series of baffling puzzles and mysteries. Race head-to-head with your friends and family to see who'll be crowned King or Queen of the Carnival.

Carnival is less an “escape” room, and more a series of puzzles that exist just for the fun of it. There is no clear progression of the game, with an end goal of escaping. But rather the goal is to solve the Ringmaster’s puzzles and be awarded points. How you choose to play, is up to you, however. You may choose to split into teams (or individuals) and solve all of the puzzles, competing for the best score.

-description from the publisher's website

name: Giant Game Board Book
description: Six giant games (26 x 19 inches when open for play) in one book. An electronic die roller lights up to indicate your 1-to-6 roll. Includes versions of Snakes and Ladders and Pachisi, plus four typical race-to-the-finish games.

name: Apocalypse
description:
Played on a 5×5 grid using chess pieces: 2 knights and 5 pawns for each player. The goal is to capture all the opponent's pawns. The pieces move according to the original chess rules. Each turn, the players' moves are revealed simultaneously.

The object is to capture all the opposing pawns. A pawn reaching the final row is promoted to a knight if possible and otherwise relocated.

name: Insyllium
description:
Twenty-four planets speckle the tiny galaxy of Insyllium. These planets have been jointly ruled for an eon by five appointed Viceroys. Each player has a new vision for the galaxy, and will manipulate the Viceroys and their Agents in attempts to conquer the planets of the galaxy using a variety of devious methods.
Insyllium is played over series of rounds, and each round is broken into several parts, or phases: Viceroy Phase, Agent Phase, and Cleanup Phase. During a round, players will draft a Viceroy and an Agent, and attempt to gain control of new planets through a variety of devious methods. Players score points based on the planets they control as well as any completed objectives.

name: King of the Jungle Card Game
description:
Every player is dealt one animal card, face down, and the goal of each player is to be the last surviving animal. There are 21 different animals, including "Man," and they range from the lowly mosquito to the mighty Lion.

The game is played in days and each day, players take turns either asking another player a "yes" or "no" question (in a quest to learn the identity of that player's animal) or attacking another player's animal (if they believe their animal is stronger that day). When an attack occurs, the player with the more powerful animal ON THAT DAY wins the attack and stays in the game. The losing animal is revealed to all and the player with the losing animal is out of the game. The game continues until only one player/animal remains and that player/animal is declared King of the Jungle.

Now, while each animal has a usual strength (i.e., the Frog (3), the Crocodile (12), the Lion (20)), each day comes with a different condition (i.e., flood, monsoon, Beautiful Day). The condition of a day can change the strength of some of the animals. So, no animal is always the stronger or the weaker every day of the game. For example, while the Lion (20) on most days is more powerful than most animals, during a flood, the strength of the Crocodile rises to 21 and will defeat the Lion this day. Learning which player has which animal, when to attack another player's animal, and how to keep your animal secret, are key components to becoming King.

To enhance the strategic element, you can play with Advantage Cards (included). There are six different advantage cards and each player is dealt one at the start of the game. Advantage Cards may increase your animal's strength when attacking, it could allow your animal to "Run Away" from an attack, among other things.

In addition, if you download the "King of the Jungle Companion App" from your favorite App Stores, you will have information in your hand pertaining to facts about the animals (helpful when asking or answering questions), rule variations, and Trivia (which can be used to incorporate a reincarnation rule or determining who starts the game). This information is also available on the game's website.
This fun and hilarious game of deception, deceit, and deduction will challenge a player's memory, teach one how to ask questions, and enhance your analytical processes. It is great fun for kids, adults, adults with kids, large groups, and family get togethers. It can be played with up to 21 players! Enjoy and good luck on becoming King!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Myth: Soulless Captain Pack
description:
From the publisher's webpage:
Soulless are the dreaded captains of the undead. Once powerful necromancers, these practitioners of the dark arts are able to bring the dead back to life. The Soulless have a deep hatred for the living, and channel that hate through their staff. This inflicts unbearable pain and curses those who succumb to the Darkness.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Gibraltar
description: The Spanish French army launches assault in 1782 against fortzaleza of Gibraltar that ended in failure during the American War of Independence. Game includes one 25 x 31 inch map.

name: Armies of the White Sun: Second Sino-Japanese War, 1937-43
description:
Armies of the White Sun is a solitaire wargame covering the fighting in China from the Marco Polo Bridge Incident through Pearl Harbor to the planned 1943 Operation Go-Go aimed at capturing Chongking and ending Chinese resistance at the national level. The single player actively commands the invading Japanese forces, while the rules system directs him in the deployment of the defending Chinese. The player wins by capturing key areas on the map. Throughout the game, the player selects units for an operational force, then maneuvers with that force to achieve objectives while fighting Chinese forces as they appear during operations.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

S&T 305 Jul-Aug 2017

name: Helppp Me
description:
Helppp Me is a hand management, draw and discard, resource control game for 2-4 players using actions and character ability to get the most resource and rescue creatures in the underworld.

In the game, there are 4 races of creatures: Vampire, Mummy, Zombie and Werewolf. Each race has 6 different identities, from baby, child … to the king. On the Player’s turn, there are two actions you can choose:1.) Play a card in his front to form a waiting rescue zone. 2.) Discard a card to help the player get 2 first aid kits tokens to rescue creatures, but be aware, the creature who gets discarded will curse your whole team with his race’s skill. Will you be able to save the most creatures in this difficult circumstance?

The game lasts until all the first aid kits tokens are taken. The winner is the player with the most points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: UNO: Shrek
description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Dream Works film Shrek 3.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Merlin Card' When you play this card you call out a color of your choice. All other players draw cards from the DRAW pile until each draws a card of that color. All of the cards that they draw are added to the cards in their hands.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Disney Stitch: Merry Mischief! Card Game
description:
Stitch is ready to celebrate Christmas but he can’t contain his excitement. With each uncontrollable outburst, Stitch unwraps more and more presents. Choose which presents to try to sneak past Stitch. Then roll to find out which gifts he unwraps. Save the most presents to win! Who can save the holiday from Stitch’s mischief?

Push your luck choosing which presents to play. Watch for naughty and nice Stitch faces that affect how often you roll the die and how likely Stitch is to unwrap your presents. Custom die and watercolor-style card illustrations bring this fanfavorite character to life on your table!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Aviation: The Aerial Tactics Game of Attack and Defence
description:
This game AVIATION is a L'Attaque variant and hence another predecessor of Stratego. Together with L'Attaque and Dover Patrol these games were sold by Gibsons along with a more complicated incorporation of all three, a game called Tri-Tactics. Together the games were marketed at the time as Series: The Big Four (Gibsons)

A later game called Battle of Britain (Gibsons English fifth edition) was introduced in the 1960s with a different board layout and updated pieces but similar game mechanics.

Re-implemented by:

Battle of Britain (Gibsons English fifth edition)


Similar to:

L'Attaque
Dover Patrol
Tri-Tactics
Stratego
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Line of Sight, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Turnier
description:
Quite similar to Checkers.

It is played with 4 sets of 18 pieces ("knights") on 8 boards (4 straight, 4 L-shaped) with 12 holes on each board. The goal is to hold three of the boards by removing the opponents' pieces from them.

Players take turns by moving one of their pieces either one hole horizontally or vertically, or jumping over their own or opponents' pieces. If an opponent's piece is found between two hostile "knights" or between one "knight" and the edge of the board, it is removed from play.

As soon as a player (or a team of 2) controls three boards (which are randomly placed - giving the game some diversity!) the game is over and the other player/s lose.

Alex Randolph: Unfortunately containing a fatal technical flaw (you might see it: the pawns tend to get stuck in the board, so when you try to move a pawn you often lift the board with it.
Moreso the small flags on the pawns break very quickly - Hermann Huth)

Reimplements:
Castile

Reimplemented by:
Claim

name: Cat vs. Mouse
description:
Cat vs. Mouse lets players "Recreate the classic cartoons you grew up with and pound on your friends at the same time!".

The game is for 2-4 players and each player gets a "team" of 1 cat and 2 mice. The main object of the game is to get 10 points, mostly by having your mice get food from the refrigerator back into the mouse-hole. The board is the layout of a house with the mouse-hole on one end and the refrigerator on the other end. Your mice try to get food and your cat tries to stop the other team's mice from doing so. There is a dog counter which can be moved each turn, and you use it to try to go after the opponent's cat. In terms of fighting, you can only fight an enemy (The mouse's enemy is the cat, the dog's enemy is the cat, and the cat's enemies are the mice and the dog). You can also pick up items throughout the house that you can use during combat to modify your strength. If you defeat one of your enemies in combat, it is considered "Clobbered" and cannot function until the next turn. Most items give a strength modifier but some items have special effects. In the basic game, you get 4 points for having your mice get a piece of food back to the mouse-hole, and 1 point when your cat clobbers an opponent's mouse. Optional rules include rules for variable points for the different types of food (cheese, drumstick, apple)

name: Bärenwald
description:
Each player sets up plastic trees in a 4x4 array, so their opponent can't see the reverse side. There are 2 of 6 different color trees, 3 bears and a wild. Players alternate rolling the die, which has each color on it, and attempting to reveal a tree of the same color on the opponent's side, or the wild. If they do, they remove the tree and get another turn, otherwise they replace the tree - hopefully remembering the color for when they next roll it. If a bear is revealed they simply lose thier turn.

The goal of the game is to make a path through the opponent's trees.

name: Land Lords
description:
From the publisher:

A card game in which players will find themselves fighting against each other, as powerful landlords of the middle ages, to expand their dominions. Your army may not be the only way to lead you to the victory, your skillful merchants and the loyalty of your townsfolk may be the key to achieve power. A difficult game for hard-core gamers.

From the designer:

It's a card game. It's more difficult (not for beginners!). The cards are Tarot-size. Each player is a Noble trying to take control of new territories. The Land cards have to be explored and each player must send Farmers, Merchants, Soldiers, Hunters and Artisans to have influence on the territory. Then, at the proper time, each Noble can try to take control of one of the territories provoking an Event (a War, a Market or so on). If he wins the Event he takes control of the territory and he scores points. When all territories have been controlled the game is over. It's more difficult. It requires good memory, good strategy and almost no luck.

name: Worldmaster
description:
An ingenious cross between Risk and Scrabble Junior. From the instructions:

"Worldmaster: A game of strategy for two or four players [in partnerships]. Build a CONNECTED EMPIRE, covering at least half the letters of each of its countries with letters of your colour -- Red or Blue. Numbered circles tell you how many letters you need to cover."

The board consists of a Risk-like simplified map of the world. Countries are labelled like words on a Scrabble Junior board; each letter is enclosed in a box the size of a Scrabble tile. Each country also has a numbered circle indicating half the length of the country’s name (rounded up; two circles for countries whose names have an even number of letters). Each player (or partnership) receives a bag of letter tiles, which contains just enough to cover all the letters on the map.

High-speed rules summary from the instructions:

RULE 1: In each turn place one or more letters, anywhere, or store up all of them. End the turn by drawing four, always.

RULE 2: Earn country "flags" -- coloured markers -- once you’ve covered as many letters as the circles show. (Only one flag of your colour in any country! The enemy may share countries with two circles, if you don’t prevent this.)

RULE 3: Flags on EIGHT connected countries wins -- or ELEVEN in games with the Airports rule. (Two extra letters earn an "airport ring" over the flag. Groups connect by air when each group has an airport.)

name: Mc Wiz 2000
description:
No board... no randomness!

A simple, easy, no-fuss, boardless trivia game aimed at French-Canadian people. There are five categories: Arts, Science, Poubelle (Trashcan), Temps & lieux (Time & places) and Sports.

name: Chessers
description:
This game bills itself as being "More simple than chess - More stimulating than checkers". Each player has an army of 10 pieces that are set up in opposite corners on a conventional chess/checker board. The King piece (shaped like a cross) moves like a regular King in chess and is placed in the dark square corner. Two Circle pieces, which move 1 or 2 spaces in any direction, are placed in front of the King. Three Triangle pieces, which can move 3 spaces or fewer along the dark diagonals, are placed in front of the circles. Four Squares, which move 4 spaces or fewer along a rank or file, are placed in front of the triangles.

Players alternate turns. No piece may jump over another piece except when capturing, and to make a capture a piece MUST travel its maximum movement range. To win you must either checkmate your opponent's King, or move your own King onto the corner space that your opponent's King starts the game on.
publishers: Heirloom Products, Independent Traders Ltd Wellington, Phillips Publishers, Inc., The Chessers Company

name: Barbie Dream Date
description:
From the box:

Every girl dreams of fantasy dates - and now girls can play Barbie Dream Date Game with Barbie and Ken! After picking out beautiful gifts for Barbie, Ken may take her horseback riding, snow skiing, or maybe even to a costume ball!

Players travel around the locket collecting gifts for Barbie, then move around the date board collecting snapshots of their dates. When the clock strikes midnight, the player with the most gift and date cards wins the game! Players turn their cards over to see what kind of gifts Ken really gave Barbie (a box of candy, perhaps?).
Every girl's a winner when she plays Barbie Dream Date Game!

name: El Dorado
description: Magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #10.

name: Final Twilight Customizable Card Game
description:
In the near future, on the western coast city of New Metropolis, an evil that has lain dormant for centuries is about to be awakened to the 21st century. Forces of darkness and magic strive to unleash a horror upon the Earth unlike any mankind can remember. The only forces capable of stopping it are rendered impotent by an age-old fear and hatred. Will humanity set aside their differences and stand as one against the darkness? Or will this be humanity's Final Twilight?

Final Twilight is a modern fantasy themed card game for two players.
Players each select a Major Character featured in the game's storyline and build a deck around that character; supporting characters, special action and spells, weapons and items, all ripped from the pages of the story come to life on the game board.
Using Location cards to build a small portion of the great city of New Metropolis, players move between sites and backdrops of the story, dueling other characters including fantastic creatures, horrors of the shadows, and helpful, though innocent, bystanders.
Magic is scarce and unusual in the world of Final Twilight. While hiring goons and allies from our normal world can be easy, summoning the vast forces of nature takes its toll; fantastic characters, spells, and magical abilities all require a small piece of the mage. To cast these spells players spend a portion of their life total, potentially granting them greater power but opening them up to easier defeat. Winning is balancing the quest for power against the will to survive!

Final Twilight is customizable and non-collectable, with each release featuring pre-constructed decks and expansion packs containing just the right cards for a character or an assortment of universal cards suitable for any character.

Revised Edition

April 2013 The Revised edition officially released! Title available through print-on-demands services DriveThruCards.com and TheGameCrafter.com
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Warp Skirmish
description:
"Warp Skirmish is an abstract Wargame system that utilizes a mix of board, card, dice and unit elements to create a system with chess-like strategy, fog-of-war uncertainty and module expandability."

"The modules contain the game setting, background, unit and card definitions and the rules that augment or change the Warp Skirmish engine."

Warp Skirmish was entered in the 2002 Microgame Design Contest. Two modules were included with the contest entry:

"Fix Bayonets is an abstract skirmish level game built on the Warp Skirmish Engine. It is balanced for 2 players. This module depicts man-to-man fighting in the Argonne Forest 1918. One player is the defending American Lost Battalion. The other player is the attacking German Stormtroopers."

"Martian Cloudships is an abstract skirmish level aerial combat game built on the Warp Skirmish Engine. It is balanced for 2 players. This module depicts ship-to-ship engagements between the floating armada of the British Expeditionary Forces and a Band of Martian Cloudships in an alternative universe setting around the time of the Victorian era. The ships achieve weightlessness by carrying quantities of distilled essence of ether."

The following games utilize the Warp Skirmish system:


40K Skirmish



AFV Skirmish
Alien Skirmish
Ancient Skirmish
Archon Skirmish
Army of Darkness Skirmish
Away Team Skirmish
Aztec Skirmish



Battle for Hoth
Battle for Naboo
BattleTech Skirmish
Berserker
Big Trouble in Little China: Skirmish
Biker Brawl
Bionicle Skirmish
Blown Away
Buccaneers
Bujutso



Carriers
Celtic Skirmish
City of Heroes Skirmish (12x12 hex board)
Cthulhu Skirmish
Custer's Last Stand



Daimyo
Dark Sun Skirmish
Deadlands Skirmish
Delta Skirmish
Dodge Ball
Dumbledore's Army



Earth Defense Force
Enders Game Third Formic War Skirmish Game



Fantasy Skirmish
Five Armies
Fix Bayonets
Fleets of the Imperium



Geonosis Arena Skirmish
Grognards
Ground War 3000
Gunslingers



He-Man Skirmish
Huscarl



Jedi Warp Duel (5x5 board)
Jungle Skirmish



Kilts & Claymores
Knight Hawk Skirmish



The Last Starfighter Skirmish
Legend of the Five Rings Skirmish



Martian Cloudships
Methuselah
Monster Brawl
Moria Skirmish
Musketeer Skirmish



Narnia Skirmish
Nightbreed Skirmish
Nutcracker Skirmish



Operation Blitzkrieg



Periplus
Phasers
Pixie Wars
Playground Skirmish



Resident Evil Skirmish
Robotech Skirmish
Russo-German War
Russo-Turkish War



Space Nazi Skirmish
Spelljammer Skirmish
Spice Raid
Star Command
Starship Troopers
StarWars DogFight



Tanker Skirmish
Tank Girl Skirmish
Terminator Skirmish
Thor Skirmish
Transformers Skirmish
Troopers



Wing Commander Fighters



X-Men Skirmish



Zoids
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I

name: The Hammer's Slammers Handbook
description:
Vehicle designs & technical specification plus an easy play gaming system. Approved by David Drake - author of the Hammer's Slammers books.

This little 7x9 soft cover color booklet combines two aspects often associated with more traditional miniature war games, detailed unit organizations and quick play miniature rules. 20 pages are devoted to technical details, vehicles, and uniform references. While the remaining 20 pages are quickly play set of 1:1 war game rules.

Forces are composed of "Tactical Units" graded on quality (elite, veteran, regular, or untrained). Each turn players receive a variable number of "Leadership Points" based on the quality of their commanders. Standard miniature movement rules and some unique combat mechanics based on a d6 complete the basics for these rules.

Suitable for play in any scale: 6mm, 10mm, 15mm, 25mm, or perhaps a variant to the Mayfair classic.

name: Astérix et la potion magique
description:
Astérix et la potion magique is a simple game in which players traverse Europe looking for ingredients for the magic potion.

At the start of the game each player chooses a personality and is given a gourd of magic potion by Getafix. On his or her turn a player moves one space in the direction of their choice. If the space contains a roman patrol then the player must take a swig of magic potion. Green and blue spaces enable the player to take an event card. Ingredients may be collected by landing on a town. The first player to collect all the ingredients in their cauldron and return to the village wins the game.

name: Trasimeno 217 a.c.
description: Battle of Lake Trasimene (217 BC) during the Second Punic war.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Street Fighter
description:
Street Fighter - An Auto-Combat Solo Module (#AV-1005)

8.5" x 11" book was the fifth AutoVentures Car Wars supplement by Aaron Allston. In 1985, Task Force Games took over publishing this line of supplements.

name: Long Shot
description: Your Don has no idea about horse racing, but he owns a horse. It´s your task to bring it in first. If you fail you have another option to make some money: Betting on the other horses and make a lot of money.

name: Pinguin-Parade
description:
A children's game for ages 3 and up in which the winner is the first player to bring all three of their penguins from the feeding grounds back to the nest.

The wooden board pieces are laid out in a trail leading from the feeding grounds to the penguin nest inland.

Players roll the die and move any one of their penguins based on the die results. Obstacles add difficulty, and whether or not a penguin moves depends on whether it is standing or lying down.

Game components:

12 wooden penguins in 4 colors
4 wooden obstacles (blue discs)
1 large wooden die with movement symbols
8 laminated wooden board pieces

name: Trezo
description: Using a game board of 27 spaces and 27 unique playing pieces, players try to form a group of three pieces with a like attribute (color, height, shape) or three pieces with no matching attribute. Each piece has one of three attributes in each of three categories - Color (red, green or yellow), Height (short, medium or tall) and Shape (square, triangle, circle).

name: Kalle Kringelwurm
description:
From the box:

There should be no garden without a compost heap and no compost heap without hard-working earthworms. But blackbirds, moles, shrews and the sun never cease to interrupt the diligent efforts of these little creatures. Is it posible for them to overcome these trouble-makers?

Artwork by Doris Matthäus.

name: Hattrick
description:
Hattrick is a fast-paced soccer card game with 89 cards:

- 60 team player cards (4 x 15 per team: England, Germany, Switzerland, Brazil)
- 6 all-star player cards
- 8 interrupt cards
- 5 punishment cards
- 3 special cards
- 5 goal cards
- 2 rule cards

The player cards are either goalkeepers, defenders, midfielders or attackers. The 4 teams have different numbers of each of these player card types.

The game is played with an imaginary ball on a imaginary soccer field with 4 parts: the goal room, the defense, the midfield and the attacking sector, assuming that the players always stay in their sector.

Every turn, a player can play 1 card more than his opponent has played in his previous turn, but these cards must be from the same team (all-stars are used as jokers). Anyway, the first card must always be a card that "stops" the ball.

A goal is scored, when an attacker can't be stopped with an appropriate card.

name: Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps
description:
Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps was edited to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the publication of the Diccionari general de la llengua catalana ("Catalan Language General Dictionary") in 1932 by the linguist and Catalan language reformer Pompeu Fabra, who modernized Catalan grammar and orthography. His dictionary is widely considered a milestone in the history of Catalan language, as for the first time modern linguistic ideas were introduced in the grammar.

In the game the players together rebuild Pompeu Fabra's life and works, as well as the various social, cultural and political events that took place during his life: from his birth in Barcelona in 1868 until his death in exile at Prada de Conflent (France) in 1948. Each year in the life of Pompeu Fabra is represented by a card, and the players try to fill in the holes in the chronology, which in the initial setup is formed only by four years. The filling rules are simple and the players receive points each time a grouping of three, six or nine cards is completed.

name: Journey to the North Pole
description:
From the back of the box:

"Imagine strolling down Christmas Tree Lane... Prancing through Reindeer Pass... Gliding down Bobsled Run... Taking a jaunt across Jingle Bell Boulevard. All this and more await you as you journey along the pathway to the North Pole!

Santa has sent his elves into town on last minute errands. Each player must help his elf return to the North Pole, while enjoying holiday activities and collecting gift tokens in his own red gift sack."

This is a roll and move game where the object of the game is to collect the most gift tokens while moving to the end of the board. You have Instructional Spaces (where you complete a task to get tokens), Pictured Spaces (where you get a token), Location Spaces (where you get tokens), and Blank Spaces (where nothing happens). The person who gets the most gift tokens wins the game, and in case of a tie, the person who reached the last space first wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: DVD Game
description:
Now play the popular game show with your DVD player.

Each person answers the same question with their answer card face down in order to move up the money tree. Players can also use their lifelines or walk away with their current amount. The richest player or correctly answering the $1,000,000 question wins.

Hosted by Meredith Vieira.

Contains 16 answer cards, 4 lifeline cards, and 4 walk away cards.

name: Gamma World the Card Game
description:
“Card Game based on the RPG Gamma World by TSR. You are a leader of a Gamma World Enclave. Recruit and equip your followers. Send your followers to capture ruins that will aid your cause. Victory: The game ends when all cards have been drawn from the deck. The player controlling the most location cards wins.”

The game uses a custom card deck composed of the following types of cards: Weapons, Armor, Vehicles, Steeds, Equipment, Events, Mutations, Foes, and Locations.

Each turn a player receives a base allocation of two Action Points. Some cards will provide additional Action Points. Action Points are spent to perform the following actions: recruit one Follower, draw one card from the deck, play an Item card, or attack a Location.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Teta Fuhu
description:
Two or more players draw a small base of circles in their corner of a paper. Each player stands their pencil on its end and slides it across the paper. A new circle is drawn where the line ended, but the previous circle stays in place.

If another player's circle is hit, then that circle is scribbled out. Then, the "shooting" player takes another turn. A player wins when all circles of other colors have been scribbled out.

Many variants allow for wall-like obstacles where circles stop or pits where if a line crosses it, that circle does not count.

name: Afrika Korps
description:
A wargame about the Battles of Tobruk.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions, one hex represents 1000m, one turn represents 8 hours.

name: War of Nations 1813
description:
This is a point to point wargame.
The map covers Hamburg to Prague.
The game is composed of 7 turns which do not have the same time period.

1 map 36cm x 52cm
60 counters

name: Bethump'd with Words: Voyager Edition
description:
From their website:
This can either be an expansion of Bethump'd with Words or as a stand alone travel edition.
This is a game for car, camp, yacht, and home.
A high impact classroom time-filler.
Supplemental Question Set for the board game versions of Bethump'd with words.

From the bottom of the box:
Questions are arranged in six levels of difficulty with each worth, respectively, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 points. Questions are read by an opponent.

Each player has a chance in each turn to answer one question from each of the six levels of difficulty, starting with Level 1, the easiest. If an answer is incorrect, however, the player's loses his or her turn and enters the score for his or her correct answers on the score pad.

A player who answers each of the six questions correctly earns, in addition to the questions' total (21 points) a grand slam bonus of 9 points for a total of 30 points for the round.

A single game takes four rounds of play. The player with the highest point total after four rounds wins the game.

Integrates with:

Bethump'd with Words

name: Die Lieben Sieben: Ab auf die Wippe!
description: The small mouse adds the least weight to the seesaw and the bear the most. The two players try to place the wooden blocks on the seesaw determined by dice in order to achieve the victory conditions. There are three rule versions, each aimed at different age groups of children. In the simplest form the player choose an animal block and then rolls the die, the player then places the animal on the colored square in the seesaw that corresponds to the color of the die. The player whose end of the seesaw goes down first wins. In the second version the players first roll a die and then decide which animal to take, thus they need to assess when to use the heavier animals and when to use the smaller. The third and most advanced rules state that the winning condition is for the other players seesaw to be the heaviest (ie. the lighter side wins), making the game more strategic and suitable for older children.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational

name: Slasher
description:
A fan of horror movies or slasher films? This free print and play is your chance to see how you measure up to the classic greats. Are you the next Jason? Or will the cops end your reign of terror before it begins?

With victims that can fight back, potential news media alerting even more cops to you, and house weapons that can either help or harm you, things won't be as simple as you think.

Gameplay:

Players will use a deck of cards for the game board, and dice and the rules to get things done. Options include cutting lights off in homes, cutting phone lines, trying to fight and kill the victims, as in any slasher film. Of course, when that doesn't go to plan, then you need to decide how to deal with the police, potential survivor types, and other issues. Will you spend a turn rolling to pick up a weapon to help you kill? Or try to rush in and dispatch foes? It's all up to you. This game allows for quite a bit of choice.

Also included are Evil Points, which you earn, and can use to pull off the sorts of narrow escapes, and horror movie classics like escaping unscathed from gunfire.

Lastly, like any good slasher, on a certain roll, you have rage. This unleashes the true horror of your character. You get to create your own within the rules and see how well, and how long you can survive.

-SLASHER KILLER CUT-

This edition is the culmination of 8 years of this game existing, trial and error, pruning rules, and basically gutting my own creation to rewrite it in a much clearer, more concise way. Along with new rules that streamline the game into a faster experience, with more to do. 2 player variants now also included in the rules, along with an Official Character Sheet and Tokens.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Scroungin' ASL News
description:
a 6 page magazine that is a reissue of some of the top articles and scenarios from ASL News. 11 of the 12 scenarios are European, both Eastern and Western fronts, spanning from 1940 to 1945, the 12 scenario is set in Burma, 1942.

Above the Prayers is a 4 scenario campaign game set in Belgium and is based on Kampfgruppe Peiper.

Close to the Edge uses the Red Barricades map.

Scenarios:

Above the Prayers - a 4 scenario campaign game set in Belgium and is based on Kampfgruppe Peiper.
Close to the Edge - Uses the Red Barricades map.
Just Another Bridge - End of the war street fighting in Berlin. Pits a Tiger II and a Panther against several T34/85s, SU-152s and IS-2s.
State Farm 41
Freedom Fighters
Plans Gone Astray
A Bush Across the Street
Not to Lose Face
Death and Ruins
Sauve Qui Peut
Time to Burn
Rolling Thunder - a large 6 map armored slugfest set during the German invasion of Belgium. May 1940.


Several of the Scenarios were later reprinted in Critical Hit's Retro Pack II.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Fifes & Drums
description:
A two-player game for the Decktet:

It is the last battle in the final campaign of a mad but brilliant general. Six companies of tired soldiers are all that stands between him and the advancing enemy. He doesn't realize it yet, but there is no way for him to win.

Fortunately, you are not playing the general in this game. Unfortunately, you're not the advancing army either.

Instead, you play a member of the general's staff. You were offered money by captains of a few of the remaining companies. Maneuver them off the field before the inevitable defeat, and they will pay you handsomely. So cue the fifes and drums! Jigger the retreat orders to put your cronies as far from danger as possible.

Of course, everybody else on the general's staff was bribed to put their cronies ahead of yours.

The game is played on a track, with the companies represented by six tokens corresponding to each of the Decktet suits. Each player starts with a secret goal card, telling them which units they want to have do well. Each turn, players draft from a pool of cards, moving the units that correspond to their card's suit a total distance corresponding to their card's rank.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Racing

name: Colonial Space Wars
description:
Colonial Space Wars (CSW) is a tactical game based on a futuristic universe of science fiction that recreates battles between two or more armies. Each army is composed of square game pieces measuring 1.2 x 1.2 inches which represent their units.

During the game, pieces move across a rectangular board divided into squares arranged in rows and columns. In a game of CSW, each player has a number of units in his army which is set depending on the faction they are playing. We call this set of units a “Combat Sword. Two basic Combat Swords (Union of Terra and Alpha Centauri Brotherhood) are available for an introductory game of CSW.

Game pieces represent the units, troops, and vehicles of a fighting force. The pieces have two sides, Front (Illustration and Health arrow) and Back (Name, Attributes and Skills). A player has some pieces with the skill Leader (X). While these pieces are on the board, they grant X command points at the beginning of each turn. Each side alternates turns, making one or more moves depending on the number of Command points available.

Each unit requires a number of command points to be used that turn; this is referred to as “Activating ” the unit. When all command points are spent, the opponent’s turn begins. Each unit, upon being activated, can move and act in any order. The possible actions are “Move”, “Embark/disembark”, “Attack” and “Use active skills”. A typical game is a Sudden Death match, where the winner is the player that eliminates the ir opponent’s ability to activate units.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Angry Birds: Mega Smash game
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

With the Angry Birds Mega Smash Board Game you can build, launch, and destroy with an exciting skill-and-action game based on the best-selling digital app Angry Birds. Players draw a mission card and build the structure shown before their opponents launch an Angry Bird in an attempt to knock it, and the pigs, down to win points. This larger version includes many of the pieces from 'Angry Birds Knock on Wood' and 'Angry Birds on Thin Ice' plus new characters and features, such as four sculpted pigs (including the mustachioed pig), the white bird and the blue bird. Exclusively at Toys R Us.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Goalsystem Delves
description:
Goalsystem Delves provides rules and adventures for playing character-driven skirmish games in fantasy worlds of mysteries, magic, and monsters. These rules harken back to the days of classic dungeon crawls and the world’s most popular fantasy RPG. Players take the roles of a group of hardened adventurers seeking treasure, glory, and the defeat of the festering evils that remain hidden in the darkest corners of forgotten dungeons.

Goalsystem Delves seamlessly blends RPG and tabletop miniature elements into a fast paced tabletop experience that provides the depth of an RPG with the fast paced action of a tactical miniatures game. Delves plays fast, allowing players to run a multi-encounter Adventure in a single session and epic campaigns over multiple sessions.

Using the proven and popular Goalsystem, Delves delivers character driven action that’s deep enough for RPG gamers and fast enough for miniature gamers.

Delves works with any 28mm or 15mm miniatures in your collection.

Delves features 6 character classes and 12 sub-classes that cover all of the major tropes of the dungeon fantasy genre. In addition to a dozen player character races, we also include more than 30 monsters, 30 spells, and lots of weapons and equipment that you can use to bring your adventures to life. But Delves is your game, and we provide the tools you need to run dungeon skirmishes your way. To this end the game also includes rules for creating your own races, classes, and creatures, making Delves the ultimate fantasy toolkit!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight

name: Zen Garden: Tea House and Tools
description:
Zen Garden Rules:

Each player begins the game with a Tea House and Tools tile.

The tile is placed using the same rules as a lantern tile. However, when you place it, you have a choice which side you want to place face up - Tea House or Tools.

A tea house is treated much like a lantern - it is wild, and it can still be a part of a pattern. However, it cannot be replaced like a lantern.

A tools tile can be replaced exactly like a lantern. However, it is a part of NO landscapes. It cannot be a part of any pattern.

name: Steamplanners
description:
An express game of urban planning for 2 to 5 players.

In Steamplanners, players build linear cities, bidding on contracts for factories, offices, train stations, churches and palaces to create thriving urban landscapes. A player may have their plan for civic glory thwarted however by the railroads of other players.

To Win:
There are a variety of urban building tiles in the game worth victory points:


Train Stations
Palaces
Churches
Factories
Corner Office Towers (left and right orientations)
Central Office Towers


Players must acquire needed Building tiles through contracts (auctions). To win the game a player must use the Building tiles to build the city worth the most victory points.

Each city may only have one Train Station and no more than one Palace. A city may, however, have one or more Churches, as well as one or more Factories and Central Office Towers. To score bonus victory points, a completed city requires both a left and right Corner Office Towers. Central Office Towers need not be present in a completed city, but they help keep your citizens from leaving on a train through the nearest railroad.

Additionally there are two other types of tiles:


Parks
Railroads


These are not worth victory points, but instead may help or hinder an opponent.

The game ends when one stack of Building tiles is exhausted.

This game is an express re-theme of Wettstreit der Baumeister.
categories: City Building, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: In the City: Harbor
description: In the City: Harbor is an expansion of In the City: Origins — a dynamic card-drafting game — that adds a new column of ships to increase the drafting options each turn. This new column is unique because it rotates each turn, always providing interesting options. Harbor also adds new creatures of each tier and new leaders!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Galaxy Conquest
description:
Galaxy Conquest is a free print and play two-player game.

OVERVIEW
Galaxy Conquest is a game where two player wage in a space war against each other. Compete to win planets. One of the players will take control of the Terran of Hammer Wing Faction and the other Kryak of Thunder Faction.

GOAL
The goal of Galaxy Conquest is to be the first to win 3 planets by smartly placing your unit tokens on the planets, and utilising the abilities you acquired.

SETUP
1. Each player chooses a faction (Hammer Wing (Blue) or Thunder Faction (Red)) and gathers all the unit tokens of the faction chosen near.
2. Shuffle the planet deck and place 4 cards in the middle of the table then place the planet deck faced down somewhere on the table.
3. Place the arrow tokens on the designated faction on the planets faction control (dotted faction means initial faction)
Determining the First Player
The player who has fewer faction controlled planet initially is the starting player. If there is tie, both players randomly choose who will be the starting player.

PLAYING THE GAME
Players will take turn to play one action each turn. A player can choose to play 1 of 4 actions available:

Gain 1 unit – Player takes 1 unit from own unit token pile and places it on any planet.
Remove 1 unit – Player removes any 1 unit from any planet.
Change faction control – Player changes the planet’s faction control on a chosen planet.
Use ability – Player uses 1 ability on any planet they control.


GAME END
The game ends when a player has won 3 planets. The player who won 3 planets wins the game and earns himself the title of Galaxy Conquest!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warage: Alchimista
description:
Expansion Set for Warage Starter Set.

This expansion expands the cards set and introduces a new game mechanic.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Quallop: A Fast-Paced Crisscross Card Game
description:
A Fast-paced Crisscross Card Game.

The goal of this game is to get 4 in a row. It is a 2 player game where each person draws a single card and places in onto a 4x4 grid style play area. The cards are shaped like a peanut and have two different symbols on them blue circle or a yellow square. The card symbols vary: all one color, both colors, one color and a blank, or all blank. When placing the cards you can only cover up colors if they are the same color, only blanks can cover up either color.

name: Covert Ops: Berlin
description:
Tabletop, 1-6 player spy game set in 1941 Berlin that combines classic mystery elements like Clue, but with a defector.
Setting. At the height of World War II, spies from around the world descended on Berlin, Germany to gain intelligence on military operations. Allied forces from countries including United States, England, and Russia engaged in dangerous clandestine operations, code breaking, and subterfuge. The secrets they obtained thwarted military advancements into Western and Eastern Europe. Now, you, the agent behind enemy lines in Berlin in the early 1940s, seek to decipher the enemy plans, avoid being caught by the Schutzstaffel, and uncover the double agent among your peers.

Gameplay. Operation Berlin is a mystery board game with a defector. The goal is to determine which military operation Nazi Germany is planning through process of elimination. Players move as spies through Berlin obtaining information and avoiding hindrances in the form of roadblocks, security guards, and Schutzstaffel. As an added challenge, players may be double agents trying to prevent the other agents from discovering the German plans. This game combines the mystery style of Clue with the player interaction of Resistance to create a unique and intriguing replaying of history.

Mystery Element: There are 9 possible missions characterized by the country of attack and type of attack. One of the missions is selected at random, unknown to the players, and placed aside as the actual secret mission. A tracking sheet assists players in eliminating possible missions when they find or trade information on what cards are not in the secret mission pile. First player to accurately guess the secret mission wins!

Defector: Based on the number of players there may be 1 or 2 double agents. By randomly drawing the agent and double agents cards at the beginning, no one knows what side the other players are on. This adds a covert element that will have players interacting, accusing, and defending until the truth is known. Double agents may choose at any point in the game to reveal their secret, allowing them to play as the German forces. If the double agent remains incognito, all players may accuse a person of being a double agent and force them to be uncovered. But if they guess wrong the game ends in a German victory!
categories: Murder/Mystery, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II

name: Gem Traders
description:
The gem traders bid on and purchase precious gems from the auction every round, then sell them on the market. However the gem market is always unpredictable. You don’t know how would your competitors bid and sell! Can you earn a place in this ever changing market?

洞悉先機，投資圖利
寶石商人每回合競投珍貴的寶石，然後於市場上
賣出。不過寶石市場瞬息萬變，其他玩家的出價
和賣貨數量完成無法預料! 你能在這波譎雲詭的
商場賺得一席之地嗎?

name: Night Terrors: The Sum of All Fears
description:
Timmy was haunted by nightmares ever since he moved into the new house. Tonight, the monsters in his closet have planned a full-scale assault. Every horrible creature that ever frightened the boy will arrive at midnight to tear apart his mind, body and soul. Timmy is ready to make a stand. He will defend himself with an arsenal of incredible weaponry.

It is now midnight. The closet doors swing open. Creatures begin to pour out. The battle is on!

Night Terrors: The Sum of all Fears is a one-player dice game. Cards representing monsters move from the top of the board down towards the player in waves. Between waves, the player selects weapons to destroy the advancing monsters. Weapons instruct the player to roll dice and place them on monster cards as damage, sometimes with additional effects. Players must choose the best weapon for each situation and roll well! Victory is achieved by surviving all waves of monsters.

name: Which?
description:
Which? is a game to get conversations going, get to know others and stepping into the minds of those you're playing with.

In Which? cards are drawn which have have a number of options as answers to a would-you-rather question. Two dice are rolled to select answers and then the active player secretly selects which option of the two they would pick. Players then take turns to vote which they think the active player has selected and then score points if they are right. First to ten points wins!

name: Q•bitz Jr.
description:
Description from the publisher:

Q-bitz Jr. is a fun way to introduce your child to pattern matching, spatial reasoning, problem solving, visualization and more. The engaging play is easy to learn and mastering it will give your child the visual intelligence needed for future math and STEM success. A complete parent guide offers more ways to play with Q-bitz cubes to foster additional learning and visual dexterity. Plus, it's so much fun, your child will want to play again and again! Game play is simple. Each player receives a set of for same-colored cubes and a sturdy wooden tray. When someone turns over a pattern card, it's off to the races as players simultaneously try to recreate the pattern with their set of cubes. The first player to match the card shouts "Q-bitz!" and wins the card. A round of rolling the cubes adds more luck and excitement. The player with the most cards after six rounds wins the game!

name: My Booty!
description:
My Booty! is a speed and dexterity game for 2 to 4 players.
Each round, a set of lookout cards is revealed, then players must try to be the first to push forward the appropriate pirate tokens in front of them and slap on the treasure chest tile to score points.

Different lookout cards call for different pirate tokens. Act quickly, but don't twist your brain!
Be the best and fastest pirate on the sea and enjoy some chaotic fun!

name: Världsregeringen
description:
Description from the designer:

After a devastating global financial crisis, the nations of the world are down on their knees. To the rescue comes nine political parties hell bent on majority and the transition to progressive democracy…since dictatorship has that bad ring to it.

In Världsregeringen all players take on the role as one of these nine omnipotent parties and commence in a “friendly” power struggle where everybody must go low, just not as low as their opponents, in the search for new voters that can be swayed.
The game is played for a predefined number of rounds and in each round the players will be able to execute two different actions before it is time for the parties to argue in debates. The actions available to choose from depend on the number of players and range from gathering campaign resources and get rid of skeletons in the closet to buy voters and politicians. And of course, you can also manipulate the media to get an edge before the debate starts…

After the actions have been executed each player will have the opportunity to play two arguments in the debate. The player who did the best job of convincing the public of his or her excellence is the winner of the debate which then earns the party a set of voters.

At the end of the game, the party with the most voters are announced the winner and in the aftermath all other parties will be terminated to spare the public from the hard work of voting ever again…
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Worker Placement

name: Die Kunst, aufzuräumen
description:
Title translates to "The Art of Cleaning Up".

The game is based on the art of Ursus Wehrli, in which he cleans up works of art, subway maps, and daily-life-scenes with an enormous sense of humour. In this game, the players must match a scene to its cleaned up counterpart. Players take turns to find matching cards and whoever got more pairs, wins the game. The game includes 72 cards as well as a leaflet about Ursus Wehrli.
It is a Memory game type B. The title is mentioned there, but not the version.

name: Le Tour de France
description:
Description from the publisher:

A strategic cycling parlor game for 2-4 players, 8 years and above and takes about 60 minutes to play.

Will your team win the tour?
Going for the yellow jersey or do you choose for the team? Climbing the hills or pushing it on a flat stage?
Keep in mind you’re not the only one cycling the road… A small steering error, misjudgment or a ‘cycling strategy’ can cause a sensational collision.
Let your cycling team ride as fast as possible and win the bike race!

Introduction
In this parlor game you play within the stages as a cycling team. A team consists of three riders and is played with 2 to 4 players. The duration of a one stage game with 4 players is 1 hour. The results of your team and players standings are recorded. A Tour consists of several stages, with the fastest rider over several stages wearing the yellow jersey. You decide for how long and which stages you want to play.
The game is played with cards. By placing a card on the table you decide how fast you are moving your riders on the trail. You try taking tactical moves and benefit from wind advantage by letting your opponent do the hard work. Cast or save your good cards to démarrage when you feel that your opponent cannot.

Side information
The Tour de France board game is published by Just Games but created by Hulst Games. The game is almost identical to the board game "Linkeballen" but had some minor adjustments to increase gameplay.

name: Tokyo Highway: Expansion
description:
3-4 Player expansion (Hello! Expansion Package) compatible with the 2nd Edition of Tokyo Highway.

Adds more components for the 3rd and 4th players and buildings that act as obstacles around which you must build your highways.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game

name: Doe een dier na
description:
Are you a star in depicting animals? Then play the funniest game 'Doe een dier na!'. Pull out all the stops to imitate the animal and be the fastest to guess which animal is being depicted. The game can be played in three different ways thus fun for everyone to play. Unleash your inner animal and take on the challenge with your friends and families!

Introduction
Challenge yourself to soundlessly imitate the animal drawn on the token. If someone is able to guess which animal you’re pretending to be then you earn points! The player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Ill-Tempered Tikis
description:
The natural forces in the South Pacific are out of alignment. The balance of power between the Tiki gods is in chaotic disorder. The Tiki families are at war with one another. Be the first player to collect a complete family (5 different Tikis of a single color) and bring peace and harmony back to the South Pacific.

You will have a three card hand. Each turn you will draw one card then play 1 card. The cards on the table in front of you are referred to as your tiki family. At the beginning of the game there are no cards in front of you so your first 5 turns are spent building your family. They do not need to match to have them in your tiki family. You just can't win until you have 5 different tikis with the same color.

name: Coinhole Touchdown
description:
Bounce coins on the tabletop in this miniature, football-themed version of Cornhole - Coinhole Touchdown!

There are three games you can play with this set - in every game you will be bouncing coins and trying to get them into the hole. Coins must first bounce off the playing surface in front of the board.

Bounce the coins lightly on the table about two inches from the front of the board, and win!

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Dark Elf Team Card Pack
description:
This is a pack of 44 handy reference cards for a Dark Elf Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


Reference cards for Linemen, Runners, Blitzers, Assassins and Witch Elves;
Reference cards for the following Star Players: Asperon Thorn, Mordrix Hex, Eldril Sidewinder, Elijah Doom, Horkon Heartripper, Hubris Rakarth, Kiroth Krakeneye, Roxanna Darknail, and Morg 'n' Thorg;
A special Golden Era Star Player card for using the legendary Jeremiah Kool in your games;
The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 7 Linemen, 3 Runners, 3 Assassins, 5 Blitzers, 3 Witch Elves;
A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
3 Benefits of Training cards: Boot Camp, Having a Nightmare, Lock-step;
3 Dirty Tricks cards: Sideline Interference, Press Manipulation, Flash Bang;
The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Resident Evil 7 (fan expansion for T.I.M.E. Stories)
description:
Cross over into the Resident Evil universe with this new fan expansion!

One of our best T.I.M.E. insertion teams has gone dark. Its fallen onto you to take a team back to the year 2017, find the missing agents, find out what is preventing them from reintegrating with the caisson transference, and then bring them back home safely. And if still active, prevent the trafficking of illegal bio-weapon material into the present day.

Theme: Screen captures from the Resident Evil 7 video game. Does not follow game story.
Game Length: Same amount of locations as Asylum, but takes longer due to larger locations.
Difficulty: Easy to Average

—description from the designer

Print 4 cards per page, double-sided.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: ボブジテンその３ (Bob Jiten 3)
description:
User summary
ボブジテンその３ (Bob Jiten 3) is a standalone expansion of Bob Jiten.

Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that new character George is introduced. While George is active, question master may not say hiragana words either. Virtually only nouns are allowed.

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Tainted Tincture
description:
Free RPG Day 2019 promo card.
Effect: -2 Fortitude
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: ワードスナイパー (Word Sniper)
description:
ワードスナイパー (Word Sniper) is a Japanese speed word game. A deck of cards shows the start or end letters of words, and on the other side a topic or theme. The deck is shuffled and placed showing the theme side face-up. Then two cards are dealt to the table, flipped to show the characters. One letter to start the word, one to end the word. Players race to identify a word that fits the topic, and starts and ends accordingly. The first to get it right collects cards and scores points.

The publisher states that the shuffling of the deck will produce a large variety of combinations, keeping the game fresh to play with very simple rules. The publisher also says you can play the game with more players than shown on the box.

There were three subsequent editions published with new themes.
ワードスナイパーファミリー (Word Sniper Family) - with softer themes aimed at age 5+
ワードスナイパー・イマジン (Word Sniper Imagine) - with more abstract themes to encourage imaginative answers
ワードスナイパーエクストリーム (Word Sniper Extreme) - an expansion deck that adds more context to the themes, and has more letter forms on the flip side.
user summary

「カードの裏表にお題と文字が書かれています。山札をめくって出た文字から始まり、山札の上に書かれているお題に合う言葉を答えるゲームです」
直感的で分かりやすい単純なルールなのでゲーム初心者でもすぐ始められます。
カードをシャッフルすればお題と文字の組み合わせが変わるのでリプレイ性も高いです。
プレイ時間も短く、推奨プレイ人数を超えた人数でもワイワイと遊ぶこともできる楽しいゲームです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Blasting Boxes
description:
A simple style euro game suitable for kids and families. Each player needs to get as many points as possible.

In the game, players assume the roles of warehouse workers, each of them needing to stack his/her shelf with as many boxes as possible without letting the boxes break. Whoever gets the most points becomes the new store manager.

There are some rules, bonus points, and special combo cards that allow you to tackle your opponents or increase your own score.

name: Supernogi Stonogi
description:
Even more legs! Roll the cubes and get shoes for your centipede. Supernogi stonogi is a continuation of the bestselling children's game Nogi stonogi("SchuhBidu"). It contains elements known from the first part and 4 extensions. The additions diversify the gameplay and allow the game to 6 people. You can enter them one by one or play with everyone at once!

Centipedes want to be as long as possible to stand out from their fellow 'pedes and in SchuhBidu players can help them grow and grow – but only if they have shoes to place on the centipede feet.

At the start of the game, each player takes a centipede "head" tile, while the feet tiles are placed in the center of the table. On a turn, the active player rolls all four dice, sets aside any he wishes, then rerolls up to two more times, with the option of rerolling dice set aside after the first throw. After his third roll (or earlier, if he wishes), he can take any one foot tile for which he has matching symbols on the dice (with suns counting as a wild symbol) and add it to his centipede

The game ends after all the feet tiles have been claimed, and the player with the longest centipede wins. The rules include a variant for older players in which you can steal shoes from an opponent.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Jeszcze więcej nóg! Rzuć kostkami i zdobądź buty dla swojej stonogi. "Supernogi stonogi” to kontynuacja bestsellerowej gry dla dzieci „Nogi stonogi”. Zawiera elementy znane z pierwszej części oraz 4 rozszerzenia. Dodatki urozmaicają rozgrywkę i umożliwiają grę nawet 6 osobom. Można je wprowadzać pojedynczo albo grać ze wszystkimi naraz!

W zestawie:
6 płytek z początkami stonóg
15 płytek z butami (po 3 z każdego koloru)
4 kostki 10 płytek z ogonkami
6 płytek ze złotym butem
6 płytek z bosą stopą
drugi zestaw 5 płytek z 4 butami (po 1 w każdym kolorze)

—description from the publisher

name: Quester's Keep
description:
Quester's Keep is a board game for 2 to 6 players. At the beginning of the game each player selects a character at random and is given 3 secret quest cards. These can be replenished at the Keep. The board is made up of hex tiles and the game starts at the Keep tile which is surrounded by 6 randomly chosen land tiles. Each land tile has the name of a location on it and players are looking for the ones that match their quest cards.

In the basic rules, on each player's turn they can move from one tile to an adjacent tile and draw a land tile if none exists in the direction they wish to move. Then they draw a wild encounter card and resolve it. Defeated wild encounters can be traded at the Keep for treasure or character improvements.

A player that moves on to a land card with a name that matches a quest card can reveal the card to draw from the Quest encounter deck instead of the wild encounter deck. If they defeat the encounter they have completed the quest, collect the treasure, and place the quest card face up in their play area so everyone can see how many quests they have completed. However, if they fail or flee the quest a red marker is placed on the location and the quest is now considered and open quest for anyone.

Only treasure that is safely deposited at the keep counts towards victory so you have to get it back to the keep safely. Once someone has completed three quests a 6 round endgame counter is started. At the end of the 6th round each player's banked treasure at the Keep is counted and the player with the most treasure wins.

—description from the designer

name: Elbűvölő Magyarország kvízjáték
description:
A game of amazing curiosities and essential knowledge that will build on the well-known Trivia board games. A variety of questions await the player!

What are the things everyone needs to know about their homeland? Put yourself to the test with the enchanting Hungary quiz game, which guides you through cultures, from the best-known traditions and sayings to the most interesting facts, if you go through different topics!

Topics:

History
Culture
Science and nature
Geography
Sports
Mixed
Plant the whole family for a new, shared experience where everyone can learn something.
How much are you in the picture?

Everyone plays at once, so no one gets bored!
Multiple choice puzzles to make fun for everyone!

name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: Ready, Steady, Worm!
description:
Ever wondered what the worms get up to in the Labyrinth?
Well wonder no more, as you join them for a very serious game of Ready, Steady, Worm!

Four worms enter… four worms leave. But only one worm can be the winner of this exciting race to the edge.

Get ready to collect gems, use goblin-tricks to tip the odds in your favour and remember, the Goblin King can twist everything in an instant by spinning the walls and changing the entire board.

Worm racing is one of the grand past-times of the Labyrinth, enjoyed by goblins of all ages. It is mostly used to settle debates such as: “Who gets the last Snæfbutle?”, “Which one of us gets to be called Smügle?” and “Did Pilch cheat last time we played Ready, Steady, Worm!?”

Optional Alexa expansion (app) can be accessed by saying "Alexa, ready Steady Worm".
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Best Minion Ever
description:
Defeat Captain Flynt and expand your collection of bandits with the Best Minion Ever bounty pack

Contains:

Captain Flynt miniature
4 Nomad miniatures
4 Bruiser miniatures
all game cards needed to play


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Humbug: das zweifelhafte Kartenspiel – Original Edition 1
description:
This "dubious" card game is a crazy-cheeky card game ideal for cheating, guessing, bluffing and betting!
It's perfect for fun, casual game nights with friends and family!

Guess if the player whose turn it is is either describing the picture on the card or making up a scenario. Unmask the swindler and collect points in the form of betting chips.

name: Zulu War 1879
description:
"Zulu War 1879" is a historical wargame simulation, included with Battleplan,No.7, of the first British invasion of Zululand, in January 1879

The opposing forces manoeuvre on a map of the terrain divided into 13.5 mile squares. The Zulu forces comprise impi (army) units represented on the map by named counters and comprising a variable number of ibutho (regimental) units. These latter, varying in strength from fifty to ten strength points, are kept concealed off-map in holding boxes corresponding to the various impis, until encountered by a British force. The British “ commander” is therefore somewhat uncertain as to what faces him. British forces manoeuvre as six columns (seven according an erratum) plus the static garrison at Rorke’s Drift .

Battles are resolved on a separate battle-board. The British always adopt a defensive posture, either in the open or behind field fortifications. The Zulus are always the attacking force! Losses are taken in strength points marked off the players’ charts.

The game continues until either player reaches a loss-limit or the British occupy Ulundi for two successive Zulu combat phases. Victory points are then awarded on the basis of the losses inflicted and by control of the squares containing the Zulu capital of Ulundi, Rorke’s Drift and Middle Drift.

Counters were printed on a section of the mapsheet.
Die-cut, mounted counters were included as a bonus with Far Seas, Strategy & Tactics magazine #125.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Square Grid

name: ゴモジン (GomoJin)
description:
User summary
□□◯◯◯ (Shikaku Shikaku Maru Maru Maru) literally means "Square Square Circle Circle Circle".

□□◯◯◯ is a Japanese-word quiz game.

One player is assigned as the Answerer (respondent). The other players see the answer word, which is written in either kanji (Japanese ideographic characters) only or katakana (Japanese syllabic characters) only. Then they reword the answer in combination of two kanji (□□) and three katakana (○○○), and write the □□○○○ down on their board secretly.

When all players except the Answerer have finished re-wording, one of them becomes the Caller and reads out the Caller's re-word. If the Answerer replies with correct answer, the Answerer and the Caller score points. Otherwise the next player becomes the Caller and does the same.

The order of Caller is determined by how many of their re-worded □□ and ○○○ are accepted as Japanese words. If both of a player's □□ and ○○○ are defined in Japaese dictionary or commonly used in Japan, that player has top priority to be the Caller. In the case of tie, the eariest finisher among tied player has the priority.

Repeat the game until all players become the Answerer once, and the highest scorer is the winner.

Publisher's summary
親にお題を伝えましょう。
使っていいのは、漢字2文字とカタカナ3文字だけ。
二字熟語やカタカナ言葉を使った美しい回答であれば点数獲得チャンスにより近づきます。
publishers: Jelly Jelly Games, 一年中未来 (Ichinen ju MIRAI)

name: Switch It
description:
A fun & challenging game with a messy room & chaos of night and day. Look out the window, is it sunny outside? Is your messy room full of lights and colors? If so, hurry up and find the COLOR that appears the most. But if it’s night then everything changes! The room is dark and full of shadows, no colors can be seen, only the shapes of the objects. This time try and spot the OBJECT that appearS the most. Hey! Pay attention! Two more objects might be hiding among your mess! a Flashlight and a curtain. They switch things around and turn day into night and night into day creating a FUN MESS OF A CHALLENGE!

How to play?
1The youngest player starts by flipping the first card of the deck and placing it next to it so that the objects side of the card is face up. Now there is the deck of cards with a window card on top and an objects card next to it. If the window card shows day then the players must try and spot the COLOR that appears the most on the card.
2If the window card shows night then the players must try and spot the object that appears the most on the card. Then another card is flipped from the pile by the next player and the game continues.

3
Beware! There are two special objects that change things around. When they appear it doesn’t matter whether its night or day in the window because they switch things around! The winner of the game is the player who collected the most cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: Advance Games Co., FlexiQ Games, FoxMind

name: 人労 (Jinrou)
description:
人労 (Jinrou) is a werewolf style game from Japan, set in a business company. The title 人労 means Human Labour (essentially the HR dept), and is a homonym of 人狼 (Jinrou) which means werewolf.

The game is played over six rounds and the players have different roles in the company, each with various skills needed to complete projects. Each role also has secret goals, and players are trying to achieve their goals by the end of the game to win, or to avoid goals and not lose!

In a round, the team leader chooses three players to work on a project. These players (could include the leader) submit two skill cards in secret, which are shuffled and played up. If the six cards show certain combinations, then a player might win or lose on the spot.

But if players can work out what role a person has, they can determine their goals, and play skill cards to make them fail, or make themselves win. By disguising their own roles, players have more chances to achieve their objectives and avoid being eliminated.

For example, the CEO does not want to be in four projects, because they will die of over work. The Lazybones wants the CEO to die, or wants the projects to fail so they don't have to work. The Secretary wants to find romance with anybody but the Lazybones. The Temps want to be in four projects so they get hired permanently, and so on. And everyone wants to fall in love with the Secretary.

Lazybones will win the game if the projects fail to complete, or if the diligent workers fail to take their vacations or miss out on romancing the Secretary.

The various goals and possible outcomes means winning the game depends on concealing roles and identifying others'.

The publisher says:

This is a game about hiding your identity. You are an employee of a company and you are involved in a secret project, hiding your true identity from each other. You have to achieve your goals while taking care of your paycheck and your love life!

Each player has a hand of cards that matches his or her abilities, and they all work together to move a single piece through the backgammon of event cards (i.e. projects) towards the goal.
There is also a lot of fun to be had in the squares where the pieces stop. Squatting, talking in gyaru-speak and other events will help you to win the game.

正体隠匿系のゲームです。あなたはとある企業の会社員として、互いの正体を隠したまま秘密プロジェクトに参加します。
有給消化、社内恋愛をこなしながら自分の目的を達成しましょう！
プレイヤーは各自能力に合わせた手札を持ちます。全員で協力して一つの駒をすごろく状にならんだイベントカード（＝プロジェクト）の上をゴールを目指して進めますが、中にはプロジェクト達成などどうでもいい人も・・・？
駒がとまったマス目にもお楽しみがいっぱい。スクワットやギャル語で会話などイベントをこなしながら、勝利を目指します。
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Self-Published), Team Oniyanma (チームおにやんま)

name: San Guo Sha: SP Characters 2011
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




This expansion is a collector's edition. It adds new character cards to the game. Some characters were already present in the base version of the game but have gotten new artwork and new abilities. These new character cards does not replace the old ones, since the abilities are different. The cards were released monthly in some issues of Zhuo You Zhi magazine as a free gift.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Civil War, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Outwageus
description:
From the Box -
